review_body: We are a military family leaving the island and stayed here for 10 nights. We loved our stay at Surfjack and the days went by too fast. The staff was so friendly and made our family feel right at home. Highly recommend staying here!

We've stayed at the Surfjack twice now and have enjoyed each stay. Because we live in Hawaii, we got free upgrades so each stay was in a suite instead of just a room. The decor is retro surf which makes it infinitely instagrammable and the bottom of the pool even looks like a retro postcard saying "Wish you were here!" The restaurant is truly a gem and you won't want to miss breakfast. There is an adobo pork egg dish that we had to get every morning and even at night, the food was amazing. The bartenders and staff are very helpful and attentive but not overbearing. Our friend booked one of the penthouses and let me tell you, THOSE are the rooms you want if you can afford it. The views were spectacular and frankly, I'd never leave the penthouse if we stayed there.

We went to 90’s night, One night, Then we went to oldies on a Saturday they have that every 1st Saturday of the month. We stayed at the hotel that night. The room was nice and roomy, good size bathroom. They have a restaurant/bar onsite the pizza is very good. The staff is very very friendly, nice and enjoyable. They do have valet parking. There is a lot of place’s in walking distance to go see and do. I would stay here again.

First time we visited the Surf Jack Hotel was for an event. We were pleasantly surprised by the atmosphere and staff. That experience promtped us to choose Surf Jack as our next "staycation" choice. The rooms are very clean, cozy and has an "at home" vibe. Overall ambience of the hotel is very relaxing. Being "local" I appreciate seeing the "Aloha" spirit shared with both visitors and kama'ainas. In walking distance to the beach, restaurants and shopping. It's been our home away from home ever since our first visit last year.

Hey everyone if you like to dance and hangout with friends or just want to relax come on down to the Surf Jack Hotel Fridays and get your grove on with DJ JAMES COLE make a reservation lots of fun and good entertainment hope you come down and join us. Don't forget to check out their website for more information.Thank you to all the staff and manager for giving us a place to unwind. Much Love and Aloha's Surf Jack Dancer

The rooms itself are okay, nice amenities but the staff are low classed, rude and uneducated. Spend your money elsewhere the pool closes at 4, the corridors and elevators are dingy and probably house the coronavirus.

We love the ambience of this well-located boutique hotel. We had a 2 bedroom suite which was of decent size for Honolulu. We loved the music drifting up at night. The hotel is very well located in walking distance to the best shopping and restaurants. My only knock is the parking fee, which can be mitigated by helpful staff giving tips for free local parking.

Thanks for the room upgrade! It's location A!!! Just a short walk to the beach, shopping and restaurants. The staff are great and willing to share their local knowledge. The food's good with happy hour at poolside. A shout out to Sai and Kai for your warm hearts and big smiles.

TLDR: Great location, and awesome staff/price point, but rooms can be noisy in between each other depending on who you get next to you.My husband and I stayed at the Surfjack for a week in March. We selected it because it seemed like for what you get, the price point was amazing. The location was also extremely walkable, and close enough to Waikiki beach.Everyone who works here is really friendly, so service is top notch. Loved getting to know Karissa and Hideki (2 of the bartenders) – and they made me some amazing off-menu cocktails when I needed them. Yes, Mahina & Suns can be a bit pricey, but pretty comparable for hotels in the area. The rooms are nice, and the bed comfortable. I loved the decor and vibe the hotel brought - and of course that pool is super insta-famous. My husband was able to work out of the couches/cabanas adjacent to the pool, and the free coffee in the morning was nice. Suggestions on other amenities that would add some extra vibes: bathrobes, body lotion (I never use it, but of course the one time I needed it), laundry machines/or laundry service. My ONLY real gripe was that our room was situated next to a corner suite on the 4th floor. You literally could hear every word that was coming out of someones mouth if they were the room next to the adjoining door. The 1st family next to us started their day at 4-5AM, had 2 young children who were constantly getting yelled a, and a noisy alarm. The next family had a very young baby, who cried every couple of hours. Oh....and there was a group of girls on the other side of us, who partied until 2am, and when someone called security, they knocked on OUR room, and I had to get out of bed to answer it and point them in the other direction. Then I spent the next hour trying to fall back asleep ... and the girls didn't even shut up :( I wear earplugs for all of these reasons, but they didn't help much because it's just the nature of the restored motel rooms.

We stayed on the 2nd floor here but spent a good deal of time at the beautiful pool. the staff were great and very attentive. Really enjoyed our stay from start to finish. Will absolutely stay here again...

My wife and I arrived on Feb. 10th and enjoyed the hospitality and kindness of the Surfjack hotel. Sai at the front desk was most professional and courteous. He made sure our stay was comfortable and was on top of everything. We especially loved the Olive and Oliver coffee shop, the pool and poolside happy hour, the pineapple water, the coffee service, Mahina and Sons restaurant, and the layout of the courtyard. Would definitely recommend to any wanting to stay somewhere fresh and hip in Honolulu.

I chose the Surfjack because I love mid century modern architecture and decor! Honolulu can be one of the best places in the world to see that old blue Hawaii feeling! The Surfjack did not disappoint in anyway. The staff were lovely the swimming pool fantastic the whole look and feel of the place is exactly what I was expecting! Be sure to rent the free bicycles and also take the mid century modern walking tour it is self guided but the map is great. This hotel is right in the mix of things downtown you were just a few minutes walk from Waikiki Beach! There is lots of great shopping and good food locations nearby. They also provide some great recommendations in the booklet in your room. I found the staff to be helpful and friendly. I wish the valet parking was explained better on the website that was a bit of a surprise. I think $35 a night for people who are staying there is a little steep. Loved the morning coffee and the café. We also really enjoyed the breakfast. I will definitely stay here again we come to Hawaii sometimes several times a year and this will be my Honolulu go to

We booked a 3 bed apartment which turned out to be a 2 bed with a 3rd interconnecting room. Tiny Bar fridge, no crockery or cutlery in room. Had to request glasses. No coffee machine. Room immaculately clean and presentable but not cosy.

We went for brunch - Excellent food and service. The pork fried rice was excellent The French toast is large enough to share. Everything was delicious Great little hidden gem glad we found it Give it try

My husband, myself and adult daughter just returned from 2 weeks at the Surfjack.We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. I chose to stay there based on their great TripAdvisor reviews and we were not disappointed.We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite on the 8th floor over looking the city.The lounge had a sofa bed, which our daughter slept on and it was comfortable enough for a sofa bed.There was a small fridge and safe in the cupboards.The aircon worked well and we had a ceiling fan in our bedroom as well.There was a TV in the lounge and bedroom with plenty of channels to choose from.We had a balcony with a small table and 2 chairs.Our bedroom was comfortable and the bathroom was a decent size with a large walk in shower and plenty of bench space for 3 of us.The pool was lovely, although a bit cool, never had trouble getting a lounge chair and enjoyed happy hour from 2-6pm plus the nightly entertainment around the pool.Morning coffee by the pool was enjoyable and the fresh water dispensers and sunscreen appreciated.All the staff were very helpful and friendly, Mahalo for all your help and making us feel welcome.IHOP is across the street, ABC store next door for any incidentals and it’s a short walk to the restaurants, beach and shops.The whole hotel was clean, well run and loved the retro surf vibe.I would definitely return and would not hesitate to recommend to anyone wanting a nice, clean, friendly place to stay in Waikiki in a good location.

We only stayed here one night as we had come off the Pride of America for a flight the next day but we wished we could have stayed longer.From the moment we checked in the service was amazing and room and facilities were awesome.Spoke to the new owners who where really making an effort to make everyone stay extra enjoyable.We will definitely stay here next time we come to Hawaii.

Everyone team member we interacted with was super friendly during our stay. This hotel is walking distance to the beach, restaurants, and shopping. We absolutely loved it and can not wait to go back!!

I was at the Surfjack by myself for 4 days since friends were across street at Marriott. It was so nice and relaxed. I ate several takeout meals in the cute lobby area. The food at the restaurant was surprisingly good but try to go for happy hour- much better deals. Morning coffee and sunscreen also very nice amenities.

I love the Surfjack and have often stayed here. Living on the north shore, I often want to do things in town and love the Surfjack for always making me feel at home. Despite being in a busy area, the hotel is always quiet at night and I get a great night's sleep. The restaurant is also terrific.

We thought about staying here. We didn’t. We went anyways and were very bummed out by our choice to not stay. The pool is so cute! Lots of lounge chairs and the coffee shop has the best coffee in Honolulu. Super bummed we didn’t stay here!

Great family accom in a great location. Close to shops & the beach. Friendly & helpful staff. Always something going on poolside whether its local jewellery designers selling their wares OR live entertainment by the bar. Definitely recommend.

I discovered this hotel through its fabulous lobby restaurant on a business trip last summer, when I made the mistake of booking an Airbnb nearby—many of them are in old high rises, outdated with challenging access. From the minute I walked into Surfjack, I wished we could have stayed there, and once I looked at my final Airbnb bill with all the charges, I realized that Surfjack would have cost the same or less. So, we booked our next business trip with Surfjack for three nights. Love the friendly staff, the pool courtyard, the shaded areas for informal meetings, the restaurant. Our rooms were on one of the top floors. Very large with a living room. Updated with a mid-century modern/island vibe. If you get an end room, there is a partial view of the mountains.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Surf Jack. The staff were very friendly, courteous, and very informative. The hotel has lots of charm and it’s location rocks. I will definitely be back. Also, the restaurant down stair’s food was delish and you beat the pizza and beer combo special.

We recently stayed at the Surfjack (our first time) after visiting the property several times for meals on prior visits to Honolulu. After reviewing the rooms on line, we opted for the penthouse. here is what we liked and what could improve:1. the lobby and the service of all of the amenities in the public spaces are exactly what we liked about the property. not overly crowded; plenty of nooks and hideaways in the surrounding lanai areas; wonderful food in the restaurant; live music; movies by the pool, etc. Our only negative about this part of the review was that the pool should be heated in the winter months. It was very chilly. 2. the penthouse was sized appropriately and the view from the over-sized terrace was terrific. However, we both felt that they need to do some maintenance here. the terrace wood slats are in need of replacement as they have weathered and broken in places. The two chaise lounges both are in need of replacement as they did not function well and were broken in their ability to recline properly. The room itself was decorated quite attractively - in the mid-century style of the property, but a couple of pieces of the furniture were in need of repair. The room was musty smelly, buy my spouse went and bought a candle at the ABC store on the corner and that helped out quite a bit.And, the bathroom sink would not drain without an extended period of time given, which was a challenge when you were brushing your teeth.However, in spite of the challenges with their maintenance and replacement of older pieces, the room was sized appropriately and furnished with enough amenities to be rated ok.There is a property amenity fee, but we felt that it was a reasonable price for what you received. However, my view on amenity fees is that they should go away and be incorporated into the room price. They are an annoyance that does not engender warm wishes. I would rather have a posted price $29 higher and know that whatever i needed to use from the resort was included. My opinion of this hotel is that it is charming in a bohemian, gypset way - especially the first floor public space, but that the room we stayed in had the feel of too many parties without the necessary refreshing of the space. It might be that our experiences in other types of properties around the world of similar design and vibe have skewed us here, but we enjoyed our stay even though we wished the room had inspired us more.

It was delightful to recuperate from an Oahu adventure during the day by Sitting on the balcony with a beer being serenaded by the poolside musical entertainment and the staff were delightful and exuded Aloha spirit

I really wanted to like this hotel as per all the reviews but unfortunately, I did not have the same experience as most of the guests. I did not feel the warmth and willingness to help from the staff. If anything, they seemed quite indifferent. We asked for recommendations a couple of times and the staff on duty could not come up with much. When we arrived, we were struggling to get our bags our of the car and the staff member just sat there and looked at us and did not offer to help. On many occasions, we would enter or leave the hotel without even a greeting for the exception of Sai. Thank you Sai for your warm welcome. The room was big enough for our family of 4 with plenty of storage. It was though extremely dusty. Not sure when our room was last dusted. We checked the same areas every day and the same dust balls were there .Quite alarming considering we were there for 10 days. The shower recess was disgusting. The glass needed a good clean and the floor inside the shower recess needed a good scrub. Also, quite concerning. It was mentioned to reception and it was cleaned once. The leaking tap on the sink was also mentioned to reception. Someone came up and tightened it but did not fix the leak which made a big mess on the sink every day.The location of the hotel is fantastic as it is within walking distance from the centre and a short walk to the beach. We ate at the restaurant once and the food was extremely delicious. Hotel management might want to install some soft closing fixtures on its doors as the doors to the rooms slam shut every time someone comes in or goes out. Not enjoyable when you are on holidays and might want the occasional sleep in. Please do something about that strong smell coming out of the bottom toilets. It is intoxicating in a bad way. The lemon water in the lobby was very enjoyable. The $25 per night resort fee (ex tax) is pure highway robbery. The only thing of value to this resort fee is the $10 per night restaurant credit, Everything else that they are offering for the $25, would be offered for free at other hotels. Overall, we were left disappointed.

⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️ to the incredible staff who were courteous, helpful, and kind. No questions asked when we requested to store our luggage as we had a late flight home. They were always helpful with suggestions and directions. All staff were truly amazing! ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️ for the premises and our room. The hotel is well located and within walking distance to shops and the beach. The Waikiki Trolley is also just around the corner. As it is a smaller hotel, it is not crowded and peaceful during the day. Lawn chairs by the pool are easy to obtain, while the pool itself gives everyone opportunity to swim laps or enjoy a dip.The view from our room was not the best as it overlooked a shabby building, but it was reasonably quiet. Some things to consider : 1. as numerous individuals have scent allergies, please remove outdoor deodorizer. It was somewhat overwhelming and unpleasant at times. 2. Clean bathroom walls as we had splatter, also clean bathroom shower area more thoroughly. The glass on the shower hadn’t seen windex in a long time as there were water stains everywhere. 3. Please install a full length mirror in bedroom area. Overall, had a pleasant stay. Once again, kudos to the staff for their excellent service!

Nice hotel with comfortable beds, very helpful and welcoming staff. Location is perfect - not close to crowded streets and at the same time close to every place - beach, shops, restaurants, buses, etc. Food in the restaurant of the hotel is tasty as well. Free lemon water all day, tea and coffee until the afternoon. One remark (not negative one) - the music in the lobby could be a little bit lower (not considering the party days) if you want to relax and read near the pool ;)

My cousin and I stayed at the Surfjackfor 7 nights and it was one of my favorite hotels of all time. Originally I had booked us at the Hyatt close by and I am so glad I cancelled it. The Surfjack has so much charm and uniqueness that the entire vibe enhances the already great vibe of being in paradise. The room with 2 double beds was a perfect size for 2 people. Lots of closet space and EXCELLENT bath products. And the pillows. What brand are they?! I need them. Incredible nights sleep except for some nights with crazy wind but no one can control that. The food in the restaurant was excellent and we got credited back $70 after the trip for eating there. The staff were very accommodating and kind- shout out to Sal and Whitney for the help throughout. They do not have a business center BUT if you email them what you need print outs if they will do it free of charge. The hotel also has cute littleAmenities throughout like sun block, infused water, coffee, etc. Highly recommend!!!

Lynette and Staff/Family. We had a wonderful time in Hawaii/Waikiki and at your fantastic boutique hotel. Everyone there was a joy to meet. The entertainment (i.e Kelly Boy, DJ Kyle Woods and others) were so entertaining. Everyone made you feel so at home. Your family and staff (i.e. Cheryl, Jordyn, Tiki, Sai and others) were so cool and accommodating. Everyone there seemed like family and we will certainly be back and stay at the SurfJack Hotel & Swim Club upon our return. Bless you all and have a happy new year in 2020 ll!

Great newly renovated boutique hotel, did the important things right and well! Visited with a group of friends and everyone found the experience to be awesome! Live music by the pool and the relaxing area was perfect for group to relax after a long day.

Everyone was so friendly and helpful. All that we needed was available in the hotel or near by. Loved all the common area to hang out. Felt like being in someone’s house. I do wish the restaurant was a bit more affordable, especially the continental breakfast. Everything was clean and always plenary of towels. Even with the heavy rain we could sit and play cards and enjoyed the downpour.

Nice staff but we won’t return- the room was just ok, and the bathroom by the elevators smells terrible of chemicals / fragrance. Need to get a door on that, as we felt completely sick every time we went past it.

We absolutely loved our stay at the Surfjack Hotel. If one isn't out and about, the central area around the pool has a place for everyone: the restaurant/bar, nice coffee shop, beautiful lanai area for relaxing... Lovely music in the evening, beautiful decorations -- and the friendliest staff! Also the location is great; a short walk to the beach and interesting shopping. We will definitely be back here on our next visit to Honolulu!

I love the Surfjack! Have stayed here three different times (November 17, May 19, and October 19) and would stay again!Little touches are the reasons why I keep coming back to this affordable gem. They include: - The fantastic pool - The amazing food at Mahina & Suns - The wonderful bikes you can use to explore Waikiki - Olive & OliverLove this hotel and cannot wait until my next visit!

Lots to like at the hotel . Decent little pool , free water , suncream and coffee (morning) . Decent reception staff and simple butclean rooms. Overall a good simple hotel a few blocks back from the beach but central to walk to most places . Not so impressed how the restaurant overcharged us then on the second attempt , just split the bill incorrect as added a full tip to everyone (. Nearly 50 dollar to one couple) not great did not use again. Apart from that really enjoyed he place .

A return visit to one of our favourites. In Lewers St just round the corner from Kuhio Ave, and a short walk down to Kalakaua Avenue which runs parallel to Waikiki beach behind the beachfront hotels.Young Crew, clean,comfy with funky art and decor. Live music by the pool. Pool, Bar, Coffee, Food all done with style.Mahalo again to Sai and the crew there who are all friendly and eager to please..Our fifth visit - still good. Hope we can be back sometime.

The hotel had a really laid back surfer vibe and the staff were all chilled, welcoming, friendly and super helpful. A special shout out to Sai on the front desk who made us feel extra welcome and gave us tips for not paying too much for a cab and other great advice. We splurged and booked a suite which had a separate living room which was fabulous and we would highly recommend this for some extra space. There is heaps of cupboard space and the bed was really comfortable. A favourite for us was the handy little garment steamer - so much better than an iron! The bathroom was retro and really nice with just enough lighting. Housekeeping (especially Charie) was lovely, leaving us little notes every day wishing us a good day. The poolside bar and restaurant was superb. We ate there one night and the Ahi dish and the pasta dish were both super yummy! The property is located a few streets back from the beach which was great as far as we were concerned as it was less busy. They let you take the pool towels with you when you go out each day which was handy. There is an ABC store (convenience store) on the corner and a bus stop across the road so it's really convenient. They have live music every evening, and a film night once a week using the big screen above the pool. The property is family friendly, but kids aren't allowed in the pool after 5:30pm when it becomes adults only which was nice. Overall we really liked this property and will definitely stay here when we go back to Oahu/Hawaii.One thing to note is the system where the daily amenities charge (a USA thing) is not charged at the time of booking, but put onto your credit card on arrival along with a pre-authorisation of $300 for incidentals. We were staying 7 nights so this totaled $550 which maxed out our debit card. Something to bear in mind for next time.

This hotel is one of few in the area that is pet friendly! As soon as we arrived, the staff immediately made us feel welcomed and helped us get our bags to our room. This hotel offers free valet for the first car during your stay and the valet staff was timely, friendly, and very polite! This hotel has a pool and live music M-F! The restraunt prepares delicious food and you can enjoy both your food and drinks poolside! In addition, housekeeping was great - our towels stayed stocked and they changed our sheets daily! It's a short walk to the beach and amazing restraunts like Ruth's Chris and Wolfgang! Def recommend!

Stayed here during our last night in Hawaii before flying back home early the next day.We found this hotel to be a great option in Waikiki as our room was spacious, modern & clean. The service was top notch from the greeting upon arrival, explanations about the hotel & surroundings until check-out.We also tried a cocktail at their bar which was delicious!Only thing is that if you're facing the pool it's probably a bit noisy as the doors don't hold back much noise and they're playing music there however that wasn't an issue for us given the location of the room.

Great stay in this mid Century modern property. Local flavor. Rooms very authentic. Great pool. Live music every night. Beds comfy. Steps to the ABC Store, beaches, public transit, etc. Not as big and impersonal as other Waikiki hotels and not as over priced. Free towels for beach and pool nice as are bikes with helmets plus free sunscreen. A funky fun hotel in a city of over priced high rise boxes. Your best choice. Only neaive is no coffee maker in room.

We enjoyed our stay in a suite here. The bed and sofa-bed were comfortable and it was nice to have a closet to stow some of our luggage. The bathroom was spacious with a huge walk in shower and plenty of extra towels for the three in our party. It was relaxing to sit in the lounge area near the pool. Staff is super friendly and helpful.

This hotel really made my recent trip to Oahu. Honolulu is not my favorite spot since the area is too touristy, BUT I would happily go back now that I know about the Surfjack. The rooms were modern and very comfortable will all the needed amenities including a mini fridge, free snacks, great water pressure in showers, super comfy beds, and very strong a/c. The location is also ideal for getting around and I was able to take the bus from there to beautiful hikes including koko head, hanauma bay, and makupuo lighthouse (took uber to lanikai). The common area is really nice- great spots by the pool, trendy little shop, and the restaurant is awesome. But, by far, the best part of this hotel is the staff. They were all so genuinely kind and helpful. I was there over Thanksgiving when could not get to family due to a snowstorm, but I felt so welcomed by the people there. They helped give advice for all the hikes, let me know great way to rent a car, and assigned me a perfect room. I was always greeted with smiles. Everyone there was great, but special thanks to Tiki, Whitney, Justine, Sai, and Kai. I am sorry if I missed anyone. Very grateful and can't wait to return.

We really like the vibe of the hotel. It’s not huge. Staff people are friendly. The lobby is open to the street, pool and bar area. The pool isn’t big but I hardly ever use the hotel pools - we are in Waikiki where the ocean is beautiful! The beach is a little bit of a stroll, maybe a 7 minute walk. I like that they have fresh brewed coffee in the bar area in the morning. You can sit near the pool or take it to your room. I am big in to saving the environment so really appreciate the big bottles of shampoo, conditioner and body soap in the bathrooms. I LOVE that the hotel provides reef safe sunscreen by the pool. I wish more places would do that. We were in a two bedroom unit. It is spacious but our bedroom has a door that can connect to the room next door to make it a three bedroom. The door is not thick enough to keep the noise out. We could hear all conversations, television, alarms going off, papers shuffling - everything. It sounds like it’s only one door. It needs two and maybe some sound damper in between. I spoke to the desk upon check out. They said they are working on sound dampening. Plus they said next time I could call directly to ask for the true two bedroom. This was our second stay here and I would definitely stay again.

Having travelled extensively throughout the states over the last couple of months, Surf Jack was our 15th hotel. Accordingly, we have received a variety of welcomes and stayed in many different rooms- some we would choose to go back to, others we couldn't wait to leave and then there was this place...The welcome we received from Tiki, the guy in reception, was genuinely warm. He was friendly, professional and the whole checking in process was slick. Our room is small, yet perfectly formed and chic, with all the amenities us seasoned travellers hope for. The food menu in the Mahina & Sun's, onsite restaurant, is again small, so not over-facing, yet it's packed with delicious and local fresh products. All of our meals have been gorgeous and the wait and bar staff are knowledgeable and laid back, in a good way.There are bikes for use whilst you're here- my husband borrowed one to get to a cross-fit class about 10 minutes away. Meanwhile, I chilled by the pool. We both wish we were staying for longer than the 2 nights planned and would highly recommend this place to anyone who prefers a cosier vibe rather than the many impersonal tower block hotels to choose from in Waikiki.

My husband and I stay here for a week at a time four times a year it is our absolute favorite place to stay and highly recommend. The food and the restaurant is amazing the staff is so friendly and welcoming. And I love all of the great smells!

We loved our stay at Surfjack! Everyone was amazingly friendly, helpful and full of Aloha! Comfortable, stylish, quiet rooms, super comfy bed & great food at Mahina & Suns. Local artists and musicians are featured everywhere, along with locally inspired food. Big Mahalos to Elan, Sai & Whitney and everyone else for making our getaway so fun and memorable. We will definitely be back!

We stayed here for 5 nights and had a great time. Centrally located funky hotel with just a 5 minute walk to the beach but just off the busy main street. Our room was large with lots of space. Live music every night but not intrusive. The pool was great and lots of space to either sunbake or read in the shade. They do their best to be eco friendly with complimentry sunscreen and cool water to refill your water bottles. They have bikes you can use use ( they only have 5 but probably should have a few more). Would definitely stay here again.

I can't begin to express how grateful I am for Krystle, Jordyn, and the rest of the guest services staff at The Surfjack hotel for accommodating a surprise proposal to my girlfriend of 7 years. Prior to our stay, Krystle was gracious enough to allow me to scout the perfect location in one of the rooftop lofts. Luckily, it was available for us to book for the weekend! Because it was a surprise accommodating a pretty decent-sized group of guests, it involved a bit of elaborate planning that Krystle was willing to collaborate and go along with, ensuring the staff was in on the surprise, extra keys were available for my accomplices...pretty much anything that you can imagine involving pulling off a surprise they were seriously so accommodating and open to doing whatever it took to in make sure it went smoothly. One of the reception girls in particular even greeted us upon check in and helped with the set-up pretend explaining to us that we were given a "compimentary upgrade" to the rooftop deck (my fiancee thought we were only staying in a regular room). What was apparent too was the staff's shared excitement for our special occasion. Upon checking out, we were showered with many congratulations from the staff, Krystle and Jordyn, including genuine follow-up texts asking how everything went. Overall, we just felt really taken care of by a staff went above and beyond what they normally do. Mahalo nui again to Krystle, Jordyn, and The Surfjack staff!

The Surfjack was truly a home away from home for us as we celebrated our anniversary during a recent four night stay. The front desk, Kyrstal and Sai are absolutely amazing and so accommodating and Michael at valet is a gem.All of the room and hotel amenities are thoughtful and well curated...so many small details are aesthetically pleasing and surprisingly functional for us as guests. Inviting and clean, with a fun family atmosphere that doesn't have the hustle and bustle of larger hotels. The hotel lobby and pool area is perfect for relaxing but also very comfortable for a few hours of working at a laptop with really good complimentary coffee and also citrus infused water for guests. There is also a very cute coffee shop connected to the lobby: Olive & Oliver. We had scrumptious meals at Mahina & Sun's each day; Elan and Jayda gave us wonderful service and recommendations on the menu. During our stay, we had the treat of hearing local musician Kelly Boy Delima performing. There is so much offered there that we were not able to try like yoga, Pilates and so many events that make this hotel just stand out for us. By far this is the best boutique hotel experience we have ever had and will always be our first choice in Waikiki. Thank you, Surfjack!

I don't have enough space to review how wonderful the Surfjack is.We were lucky enough to stay here for 2 weeks. By the time we left, we felt like family.The propery itself is well maintained, fresh and clean. Signature blended coffee and paper in the morning and icy cold lemon, lime or pineapply infused water on tap 24 hours a day. Just the thing for being in Oahu's humid climate!Location is perfect. Close to downtown Waikiki but tucked away enough to be quiet and relaxed. Heaps of shopping and restaurants within easy walking distance.The staff at Surfjack are absolutely wonderful. Everyone from reception to housekeeping to the maintenance crew were all friendly and relaxed but still highly professional.Our motel room was a 2 bedroom, with a queeen size fold out in the lounge, accommodating our family of 5. We had ample space and it was always a pleasure to come home after a big day out. Cool, crisp and comfortable. The room was big enough that we all had our own space.The beds were so comfortable - I've never slept better!I have to mention the beautiful pool that is the centrepiece of the Surfjack. While my kids were off shopping and swimming at the beach, my husband and I would take an afternoon swim - no sand in sight! I'm not normally a fan of hotel swimming pools, but we knew this pool was well maintained because we saw it being done on a daily basis.The onsite restaurant Mahina and Sun's has wonderful staff, food and atmosphere. It really suits the laidback feel at the Surfjack.All I can say is that the Surfjack looks after you and you definately feel like you are appreciated as a guest. Mahalo!

Stayed here for a week in early November. It’s a great place with friendly staff and a nice restaurant attached. I really appreciated the front desk staff in particular. My room was a little on the small side but very clean and comfortable - one small thing - I would have appreciated a full length mirror in the room. The Surfjack is close to all the action in Waikiki but doesn’t feel as impersonal as some other hotels. Would recommend!

Stayed here for 5 nights and it was an awesome experience. Conveniently located near plenty of shops, eateries, and of course Waikiki beach. The staff was very welcoming and showing true aloha spirit. I will be staying here next time; they have set the hotel staying bar Hawaii for the island of Oahu.

When coming to Hawaii this should be your only option! From check in to check out you will be in love with this place! Great food, great service, great rooms, great food, just a amazing great time. The place to be

My beautiful wife, myself and a few friends was staying in a different hotel that was not to our standards. So we were directed to The Surfjack and we was not disappointed. From the moment we pulled up the energy was felt. The customer service was like no other. They really treat you like you are family. Also being in a prime location was a plus. We stayed in a two bedroom that felt like Hawaii!!!! I highly recommend staying at the surf jack in you find yourself In Waikiki.

We booked a different hotel originally and when we arrived it was not what we expected. We reached out to Surfjack and they were able to accommodate our party at very short notice. The staff and very kind and helpful. The service exceeded our expectation and the rooms are a really nice size. Very clean and smells great! We are in a 2 bedroom suite. I definitely recommend this hotel.

Our ship arrived a day ahead of schedule in early morning . No problem and and got us into our room right away. So greatful to rest on high quality super comfortable queen beds.We loved our weeks'stay at The Surfjack. Local vibe with a retro style. Our large corner room at the back was peaceful. Two sliding doors and wrap around lanai. Amazing shower and lots of thick white fluffy towels. BYRD large size toilitries in shower were excellentAll staff were so very nice and helpful.High recommend & would definitely return. Wished we could have extended our stay.Thank you all for making our first visit to Hawaii just perfec
user_name:
Evelyn B
Sault Ste. Marie, Canada

review_body: After visiting the Surf Jack two years ago, I could not wait to return. The room was clean, the staff was very friendly and my overall experience was great. Fast forward to my recent stay, not impressed. My room had a leak under the sink, the hair dryer only blew cold air on a low setting, I cleaned the shower it was so dirty, the house keeper left her hair all over our room and the staff seem too busy to help with simple requests. Every time I approach a staff member, they were talking to each other and made me feel like I was a bother. I will definitely be returning to Waikiki but not to the Surf Jack. So disappointed!

Loved my stay...will come again. Please sent me any and all kamaaina offers. Also, I'd really be interested in an incentive program as I live on Maui and can just hop on a plane and come over and stay with you guys. This is my hotel of choice because of the safe, family old Hawaii vibe. But moreover the amazing friendly staff.

This is our second time staying at this hotel and the first time was great! This time was so DISAPPOINTING. before submitting this review I gave the hotel ample amount of time to respond to our experience.

Restaurant lady made me a lemon drink and said it was a pinacolada. Super expensive... I asked to change it and she was mad LOL. Old hotel and the pool is tiny. I would give it a 3 stars. Not super family friendly.

We were greeted so nicely on our visit,and very helpful.Sai was especially helpful and obliging.Close to everything without the hustle and bustle.We would certainly stay there again.B and G from Brisbane.

This unique hotel, provides nice rooms, clean ,and smells good and fresh in its all environment.Best location, best entertainment every day. Just exelent This unique hotel, provides nice rooms, clean snd smells good and fresh !Best location , good vibe, every day a diffent This unique hotel, provides nice rooms, clean snd smells good and fresh entertainment program

I really enjoyed my stay at The Surfjack. I am usually at the much larger hotels over by the beach, however I like this one better. A very cool, local vibe with a retro style, yet updated rooms and restaurant. Staff was very nice and helpful.

We stayed here for 2 nights before, and 1 night after, an NCL cruise from Waikiki. The rooms are very generous size, and we got lucky with upgrades to larger apartments. The pool is awesome, loved that it's child free zoned after 6 pm. The morning coffee and juice was nice and the cold iced/fruit water was always welcome. Also loved the complimentary zinc sunscreen, great to pop on the shoulders before heading into town. The staff were particularly helpful and friendly, special shout out to Kai who went out of his way to look after us. The location was an easy walk to local cafes and gift shops and the beach. We ate at the restaurant on our last night - very friendly staff here too and the silent disco made for an entertaining evening!

As a couple this was the perfect place to stay. Away from the hustle and bustle of beach front life our lovely room was quiet, clean and modern. There is a relaxed home away from home vibe which we really loved. The bed was so big and comfortable. Personally we would not choose The Surfjack if I we were staying with children - it has more of an adults only vibe.Loved the AC and ceiling fans, lots of power outlets including built in USB ports. The bathroom was very spacious with a huge shower. We requested a kettle and found this to be fantastic as we were able to enjoy a cuppa in our PJs. If you are a coffee or hot chocolate person then Olive and Oliver is the place to go. We were not fans of Mahina and Sun's - wait staff didn't really impress and a bit too high end for our liking. You do get a daily $10 dinner only credit for Mahina and Sun's. We saved ours up until the last night and had dinner for two at no charge.Laundry was a challenge. We used the iDo Laundry on Kaʻiulani Ave. A small drying rack in the room would have been so helpful.The hotel staff were lovely and housekeeping looked after us so well. We always left a tip if we had our room made up and in return got a lovely handwritten note of thanks. We would have found an envelope marked "For Housekeeping" helpful to leave a tip in as we had to write a note telling them the money was for them.The Surfjack was the icing on the cake as far as we were concerned and would not hesitate to recommend it to others.

Friendly welcoming staff, clean well presented rooms and awesome pool facilities. Morning coffee in the foyer gave a community feel. Great AC in the rooms. would highly recommend to anyone wanting to stay in Honolulu. Walking distance to Waikiki and many great eateries.

In our search for smaller boutique hotels, we made our choice for the Surfjack Hotel!Located about 1km from Waikiki beach, the hotel is situated in a quiet area in Honolulu.Although it has 9 floors, the hotel feels very small and the service of the staff makes the hotel Big!What else makes the Surfjack is a Big hotel?The service of the staff, very friendly and helpful. The room was very quiet, clean and had a good bed to rest our lazy bodies on. We also loved the 50's, relaxed atmosphere, although in a fully renovated setting. Rooms are very nice decorated!The breakfast served us well and put a solid layer for strolling around.If you are looking for an "old style hotel" with great atmosphere, fully renovated and with great rooms and friendly staff, this is the place!

I loved my stay at surfjack. I love the human dimension of the hotel made it cozy welcoming. It is extremely clean. Most of the staff extremely nice and efficient. the only thing they do not provide laundry service, otherwise a fantastic little jewel. I loved their shampoo, conditioner etc, SPA quality, including also the sun screen to protect reef It s a great hotel concept, using art from local artists, organic food at the restaurant, I felt aloha aini

Love this hotel, we saw Chris coming in and was so friendly and upgraded us to a suite, thanks Chris. Only there for a few days so did not appreciate all of they're extras. I will certainly see you next time : )

We had the best time here. We arrived mid morning, jet-lagged but the staff made sure we were comfortable and pampered while we waited for our room to become available which was earlier than expected.

We have stayed at the Surfjack multiple times as we are locals from the Big Island. We find the location of the hotel to be ideal right in town but further away from the craziness of Waikiki Beach. The price of the hotel is quite reasonable. The only issue I have with the hotel is that the housekeeping staff is SO loud. They are literally shouting at each other from across the halls. It’s just irritating if you want to rest quietly in your room. The one other downside is the waitress at the restaurant who needs a lesson on hospitality and service. We happen to get her as our waitress all the time and she is always without a snails, non friendly and is apparently that she rather be else where.

Not your standard hotel. Excellent staff and atmosphere. Pool in centre of reception area, live music in same area every night too. Great location, short walk to Waikiki beaches. We found all the staff helpful, friendly and knowledgeable. Liked the towels/coffee etc available for customers. Felt like an old fashioned character hotel that in fact is very modern and well run. Don’t let the laid back vibes fool you, this is a great place that was recommended to us- we’ll pass the recommendation on.

Stayed at the Surfjack with extended family. The welcome was nice and the rooms were nice and the customer service was great. Just a couple of things that put us off. They gave my in laws separate beds when we asked for 1 bed. They charged full price even though it was happy hour time. The main issue was the loud drunk people coming back to their rooms at 2 in the morning after a night out. It’s a nice hotel but would stay here if you like the nightlife and not really for older people and families.

Best boutique hotel in Waikiki. It’s easy to find. I stopped in the night before to make sure that everything was set for my fiancé’s visit. I always enjoy this place. I recommend for all visitors coming to Hawaii.

Loved everything about this hotel. The location was perfect. Great for solo travellers as there is so much going on at the hotel entertainment wise that it makes it easy to mingle and meet other guests. Live musicians every night. Loved the huge shower and overall bathroom set up. Great food, free tea/coffee every morning in the common area near the pool. Again a great opportunity to mingle with other guests. Two thing I would suggest needs improving are 1. the beds. My mattress was lumpy and way to soft for my liking. 2. No full length mirror which is a must for us girls :-)

Lovely hotel in a good location and the staff cant do enough for you I could not fault this hotel. The weather was hot and sunny with a few rain showers but we come from the UK so rain is something we know about!

This was the coolest hotel in Waikiki - each room is a beach theme, nicely renovated, the pool area is great, they have free bikes you can ride around town on, the cafe makes the best coffee in the whole of the USA, and trust me. im from Melbourne Australia and we know coffee ! the staff are fabulous, each day the cleaning staff would write a really ice little note on the pad by the door. The in house restaurant is excellent - Waikiki is a difficuklt place to find something that is really bespoke chef cooked as oppposed to the rubbish chain restaurants like the Chee cake factory which is just about quantity and really just an upmarket Mc DOnalds. At the SurfJack you can get a perfectly cooked risotto or seared Ahi Tuna fillet all fresh and not smothered in salt and butter. Each night they have a local musician playing by the pool and they have a big screen above the pool where they play classic old surf movies, you can sit there with a cocktail and watch Elvis surfing. I really cant say enough about how good it was at the end of the day to escape the crowds and just come back to this place and have a craft beer sitting by the pool.

The Surfjack was great - the hotel had a great laid-back vibe and was a short walk to restaurants, and the beach. The staff were all really friendly and helpful too.My room was lovely and very clean.I loved the beach chairs that you could borrow - they came in super handy!The coffee shop within the hotel did a great coffee and the team there was all lovely too.The only couple of very small things I didn't love were - no in-room tea or coffee. The staff would bring this up to my room but I prefer to have something in my room to make it myself as soon as I wake, rather than having to wait for it. There was no full-length mirror either, and lastly, the iron was a steam iron which was good however there wasn't anywhere to hang long clothes and I would prefer a standard iron. This aside I really enjoyed my stay.

Especially like the new colorful and vibrant beach surf design theme, cozy and feel like home. Was warming greeted upon arrival and after a short wait, refreshment drinks were served together with signing of hotel forms. Clear info on hotel facilities and services were provided at point. Room card keys with additional cards that allow leasing bicycles, towels handled to us before checking into our rooms.Rooms are simple, bright and cozy, but a little tight space for large persons. Each rooms have access to at least a balcony depending on room type. We booked a 3 bed room, which actually consist up of a 2 bedded room with sitting room plus an adjoining single room with 2 large beds. There is a mini fridge but without anything, a safe box, snacks for take or purchase. I like the lobby area, a reading relaxing area overlooking a dip pool, over a cup of coffee or refreshing lemon water. Evening time, live solo performances are made in a section of the lobby area as well as projected tv sports programs. The only down side of the hotel is that it is located slightly further but still within walking distances to waikiki beaches. Overall still a great place to stay in.

We had a wonderful time at the Surfjack Hotel! The room was very clean and had everything we need. The whole hotel had a great 60s design and vibe. We enjoyed the pool area as well as the Restaurant on site. The hotel is very close to Waikiki and all of its attractions. We would definitely recommend the hotel to our friends and families.

From the moment we walked in to when we left, friendly helpful service. Great Vibe. Good location. Fantastic food. Ambience is fun. Definitely recommend this place to family and friends away from the hustle of main streets

My husband, sister-in-law & myself stayed at surfjack for 6 nights. The staff at the front desk were amazing so friendly & helpful. The bar staff were also lovely.The rooms were clean & the beds were comfortable. As our flight was a late one they gave us a complimentary room to use. Loved the pool area. I would recommend this hotel to all my friend.

Haven't stayed here for two years and once again, this place seriously ROCKS. Stayed three nights on the front and back end of a week trip I love this spot from the moment I get here, the front desk is one of the most friendly I've dealt with, the pool is front and center, Mahina & Sons is delicious, the free coffee is nice, the free bikes are great, got an upgrade to a 1 bedroom which I loved. The overall laidback surfer style and the great event programming seals the deal. It's not right on the beach, but who cares, it's a few blocks away! I mean, I loved my room so much the first trip they put me in the exact same room on my request for my second stay... that's customer service.

Didn’t stay here but ate dinner here twice. The food is very good. The service is very good too. Will definitely be back. Live daily music and such a cool vibe. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

We stayed here for one week in September 18 and had a great stay. This is a modern place with great standard for the price in Waikiki (everything is expensive). Very nice staff and it feels very Hawaiian. Clean fun rooms with some elements of surfing. A smaller pool that we didn't use we always went to the beach that is just a short walk from the Hotel. Close to busses if you want to move around. Very close to shopping and restaurants. Remember that you will have to pay a tax when you check-out on all hotels around. This Hotel also had great live music almost every day, great food and drinks (also expensive) but again, everything is in Hawaii.

The Surfjack Hotel & Swim Club was the perfect escape for a much needed vacation! If you want a more laid back vibe and friendly atmosphere, this is the place. The staff are some of the best I have seen in their business. They make you feel like family as soon as you check in to the time you regretfully have to check out. With added perks of free coffee, sunscreen, beach bags to use during your stay and wonderful music by the pool each night, we couldn't have asked for a better time. The bed was so comfortable and the rooms were kept very clean. The restaurant food was very good. In fact, we ate there a couple of nights during our stay to enjoy the wonderful musicians. We are already looking forward to going back! Mahalo to all of the Surfjack Staff!

The open air of the central area is awesome. The front desk, restaurant, and pool are all in the same open-air area on the ground floor. We ate breakfast at the restaurant on back to back days because the food was so good. During the late afternoon, there is a good happy hour deal. Bed was comfortable, room was clean and nicely decorated. Highly recommend this hotel.

Mixed a little business with a few days of vacation. The room was great, food was excellent, the staff was responsive to anything we needed and went out of their way to make us feel at home. Great family atmosphere around the pool. Music every night with top tier musicians. Perfect place to get away. We will be back hopefully for many years to come. Lynette your staff are the best. Thank You

Great hotel in a central area with lots of cool perks added during our stay! Loved the pool, dinner credit, sunscreen and water in the lobby, as well as a cute beach bag that we could use. Would recommend to family and friends.

Great location, friendly staff, really cool place. We stayed in a one bedroom room on the end, which meant the stairs cut into the size of it. It was furnished beautifully.. But to have room to open up the sofa bed, and fit a portacot, we had to put an ottaman in the cupboard, and move a chair into the bedroom. My sisters room next door was a lot bigger, at the same price. Avoid the end rooms if you are a family. While the hotel insists its kid friendly.. Which it is, it kinda also isn't. Just a lack of facilities or particularly kid friendly food. No change table down by the pool. No cups or anything in the room. You can definitely make it work, and there are more pros than cons, namely the location and relaxed feel.

didn't use the services the coffee was so strong you couldn't drink it, sign in was right by the pool extremely loud when trying to check in. Didn't like the fact that we had to use valet parking. Don't think much of your review either won't let me sent unless it is long enough.

Staying at the Surfjack was the most pleasurable hotel experience we've ever had. Arriving from the Big Island for critical tests at Queen's hospital, we simply were hoping to find a hotel and get a little relief from stress of the hospital. Surfjack was so much more! The team at Surfjack went out of their way to make sure our experience there was special. We were upgraded to a suite, which was a beautiful surprise. The laid-back, cozy decor was perfect for relaxing. We deeply appreciated the high quality, amazing cuisine at Mahina and Sun's - much needed after long days at the hospital. The entire team truly cared about our experience with them. The Surfjack is simply the most comforting, kindest place filled with fun and aloha. Mahalo Nui Loa to the entire team! We will be back and we now have the Surfjack to look forward to when traveling to Honolulu for hospital visits.

The Surfjack is very conveniently located and the staff is super friendly! They remembered us from our previous trip which is always nice. The rooms are clean and well equipped. We had a one bedroom suite for the three of us and it was very comfortable. The restaurant food is fabulous. We've eaten breakfast and dinner and also had a pizza by the pool. All of it was delicious. The coffee shop is open early for some really good coffee, but there is also free coffee in the restaurant. The Waikiki shops are close by for some great shopping If the Surfjack restaurant doesn't appeal to your tastes, there are a multitude of eating options throughout Waikiki!We used Uber the whole time we were there and it worked out great and fast. The drivers were always there in a minute or two. If you rent a car, I think there is onsite parking by valet, but with Uber we were able to travel all over in style!

Great place to stay in Waikiki. Close to beach and restaurants. Very nice staff and polite and helpful! Great pool, and we even did the silent disco. Cool!Just one comment. The kids can only stay at the pool till 5.30 pm. Why is this? I really cant figure this out... Please guys, change this policy because its really no good advertisement for your lovely place..

The purpose of this trip was not fun -- flying from Maui to bring my dog to Oahu for major surgery, with a friend in tow for support. We needed an overnight, so I chose the Surfjack. It was perfect. Small, low-key yet hip with a fun personality that wasn't serious and pretentious, like some other recent Honolulu stays (I'm looking at you, Modern!) The Surfjack has a postcard perfect retro pool at the heart of its outdoor living room. This is not the mega-waterfall tiki-torched pools of big resort hotels but a friendly intimate hangout with cool music and a great happy hour menu from 2PM. The Surfjack isn't trying to wow you with expensive crazy over the top decor. The Surfjack inspires you to chill the heck out. We did, cancelling all plans in favor a relaxing day poolside, Ahhhh....will return.

Friendly staff, modern décor - we stayed twice at the beginning and at the end of our holiday - we were upgraded to an amazing suite the second time around and loved it. They also have complimentary sunscreen and a beach bag which you can use during your stay - original and very useful

Our stay at the Surfjack was phenomenal. The staff was amazing, every step of our trip was seamless and easy. The valet team was especially helpful, I really will miss them. They provided tips for where to go and what to do. Some of their suggestions ended up being the highlights of our days. We enjoyed the adjacent coffee shop and restaurant; the baristas and bartenders were quick and very friendly and the drinks were delicious.Overall, you can tell the hotel has old bones and is a bit creaky, but the recent renovations are really beautiful. You feel like you're in a trendy, tropical oasis, perfectly instagrammable in every way. The pool was clean, well-sized and never too crowded; we spent a lot of time there. We were lucky to get a balcony overlooking the pool and enjoyed nightly snacks and drinks there while people-watching—the silent disco was especially entertaining. Nightly local musicians really added a nice ambience to the evenings.Mahina & Suns had delicious fries and cocktails at very reasonable happy-hour prices and was conveniently located near the pool. Their dinner was expensive, but with our $10/night credits we got a good meal with some drool-worthy pizza and a tasty sampler of their more popular menu items. I definitely suggest the pizza...and the fries. I do wish we had tried brunch.Olive & Oliver is really trendy—those little illustrated coffee cups!!!—and I loved looking at all the beautiful things they sell. Everything was a bit too expensive for me, but fun to look at while waiting for my espresso to extract. The pastries at the coffee shop were amazing—the banana bread in particular. I did wish they had some Hawaiian-grown and roasted coffee on tap. Some gently suggested improvements (because overall we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and these were minor things we noticed that would have put our experien over the top):-Serve coffee earlier; ideally at 5:30 to get the early-risers trying to catch the sunrise.-Consider adding white noise machines? (Lots of stomping in the room above.)-Hangers / storage for wet towels, clothes, and sandy beach stuff outside-A full-length mirror in the room-Allow kids to swim later. We definitely would have enjoyed many drinks (and fries) by the pool in the evening while our daughter swam.-Recycling in the room / facility-Beach toys for rent (big plus for sustainability.)Lastly, if you meet the zebra dove with only one toe on each foot, his name is Deuce and he likes the fries.

We really enjoyed our stay at the Surfjack. Tiki at the front desk is so incredibly helpful and attuned to customer service. From our original booking on the telephone to check in for room selection to check out - Tiki was the kindest most helpful that we could have asked for. Our rooms were wonderful and the pool was lovely after a day of sightseeing.We had pizza and salads in the restaurant and it was very very good. We would stay here again when visiting Honolulu. Very pleasant experience in every way. Close enough to the beach and shopping but not in the craziness of Wikikki Beach - so very many people it was not relaxing. We enjoyed the laid back atmosphere at Surfjack -- just great!! Thank you for a wonderful stay!

Nice boutique hotel. They staff was friendly. Served you complementary refreshments while waiting to check in. Room was spacious and clean! Walk in shower. Great location, felt safe because it was close to busy traffic area.

We were really enjoyed to stay surfjack. We requested 'pool view and upper floor room' and we stay room 944, it was very nice.Morning coffee at pool side was very good. We hope we will visit again in near future.

We really enjoyed the casual and friendly feeling for our "stay-cation". The hotel is very trendy, recently updated for a classy mid-century feel. Many local artists contributed to the decor. There were always people having fun in the pool during the day. Mostly young families with children. Eating breakfast in the pool-side restaurant was lovely and convenient. Filtered lemon water dispensers in the cabana were convenient to fill our hydro-flasks every day. The room was quiet. Valet parking very convenient. Evening entertainment by the pool. Overall a great value.

The Surfjack is extremely cute and we'll maintained. It is clean and all the staff is friendly and go over and beyond for the guests. It is within walking distance to the beach, several restaurants and the zoo/aquarium. Couldn't recommend this hotel enough.

We stayed at Surfjack for 2 nights. We were lucky enough to have our room upgraded which was fantastic. The social area on the ground floor is excellent - the restaurant is excellent for brunch and dinner and the pool is great. The staff were friendly and the valet parking was quick and easy. Would absolutely stay there again.

I have stayed at the Surfjack multiple times. I enjoy the location being within walking distance of everything in Waikiki. I just take a Roberts Transport shuttle from HNL airport, and then walk around Waiiki, or take Uber to Honolulu if desired. It is more of a boutique hotel, and the rooms are always clean, and the staff has always been so polite and helpful. I judge hotels based on bed comfort, and the Surfjack has very comfortable beds.

If you don’t enjoy your stay, you’re probably too old. Staff is friendly helpful and happy. Accommodation and location are on point just of Waikiki away from the chaos, but within stumbling distance. Eco and ocean friendly, hut all the little details. If you don’t enjoy your stay; YOU are a bad person.

With our family we had an excellent at The Surfjack Hotel! Nice swimming pool and chill atmosphere. And also great service from the 3 brothers Tiki, Ken & Darian and their colleagues. Mahalo! See you next week

Stayed 2 nights. The room was sma,lish, but comfortable and clean. Nice pool, although not huge. Enough space for everyone. Great location - close to the main bus routes, and only about ten minute walk to the beach. Staff were just lovely and so helpful. The adjoining restaurant is wonderful - Mahina and Sun's. Excellent service and delicious fresh food. Breakfast is okay. Each night they have local entertainment.

For our family trip, we rented the 2 bedrooms suite and it was pretty for our family of family! Upon arrival, there were snacks and a sweet note to welcome us. Everything was clean and we definitely enjoy the hospitality. Highly recommended to all!

This great little hotel is just a few blocks away from Waikiki Beach. It has a funky vibe, clean and spacious rooms, accommodating staff and evening musical entertainment- plus a great restaurant- so when you want to get away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki this is the place to hang

I loved staying at this hotel. They have live music around the pool in the evenings, everyone was super nice and welcoming. The design of the place is so beautiful too. Highly recommend. I will definitely be staying here again.

Military family, with two dogs, in the middle of re-location. The crew at Surfjack immediately settled our nerves and made us feel welcome! Big shout out to the valet team, front desk, and the cleaning staff--all are attentive, pleasant, and easy-going. We were constantly nervous about making too much noise with our doggies, but truthfully, when we heard other dogs barking (next door!) it was a very quiet muffle. Very much a quiet, off the busy street, feeling--which is unique for Waikiki.I frequently traveled downstairs and relaxed in the lobby/poolside...a very relaxing place!

My stay at Surfjack was peaceful yet full of local charm.The hotel is exceptional. Clean, friendly, excellent food!The entire staff were courteous and helpful.The whole package!It was a memorable time.
Very nice spot to visit. We enjoyed our stay and the staff was great. Rooms were clean, pool was very nice and there was a lovely cafe with great coffee. Also a lovely hotel for kids.Would Come back!

This lovely little hotel is everything you could ask for and more! The vibe is very cool but in a relaxing, welcoming sort of way. The rooms are really clean, great bed linen and the bed is super comfortable. We had our two teenage daughters with us and they loved it too. The food at the restaurant was beautiful and the coffee at Olive and Oliver’s was the best coffee outside of New Zealand! We would love to return one day. Thanks SurfJacks

What a fabulous hotel!! Very quaint and full of atmosphere - not too bid - not too "touristy" - close to the beach and restaurants and nightlife - great location. Live music every night but never got too loud or too late!

Friendly service throughout, with the exception of the waitress who served at lunchtime. She was not right for hospitality. The pool is disappointingly small, with very little room for seating around it. We had two rooms - one had been done up and was much better than the one that hadn't. One of the rooms looked straight into a messy apartment block, while the other had quite a nice view. Friendly family atmosphere.

My wife and I started out our honeymoon in Hawaii with a couple nights at the Surfjack. The staff went way way out of their way to make this special for us.The staff is attentive, informative and down to earth. The hotel restaurant was great as well, serving some of the most perfectly cooked fish we had our whole trip.

We stayed here for a week in the 2 bedroom suite. If this hotel is going for the 70’s dirty look then you nailed it! The shower screen and black taps were so dirty we asked them to clean it again-wasn’t any better. There was an adjoining door to another room-we could hear everything and I mean everything and the light shone through it! The extra glass sliding door to the bathroom was annoying cause every time someone used it in the middle of the night the light shone through it and woke me up. There were stains on the curtains and water marks on the entertainment unit. The soap dish was made from wood and painted and was peeling! The taps would leak and the wooden bench. There was hardly any room to put clothes or luggage away! I did not like that you had to go downstairs to make a cup of coffee or tea either-most hotels have a kettle in the room! I don’t understand the reviews. Wished we’d stayed somewhere else!

Very good with unique spirit. Friendly for pets and enviroment. Well located with excellent restaurant. I recomend for everyone who like be a part of unique. We like it. Thanks to every staff member - they are the best.

Loved the hospitality and cozy atmosphere. Easy to get around to places on foot (15min to waikiki beach isn't bad at all!!) or by rented bicycle. Definitely recommended for relaxing days spent in Waikiki.

At first glance, it really doesn't look like much. The pictures online just don't do it justice, however. The service is ridiculously friendly, the live music every night (from 7-9 if I remember correctly....) is really nice, there's a bar/restaurant right inside next to the somewhat large swimming pool, and there are enough tables and chairs for a friendly gathering whenever you want! I'd love to stay here again...the staff made it worth it! It's about a 15-minute walk to the beach, but it's worth being a little out of the way for some peace and quiet. :)

Our 3rd stay, and Surfjack is as good today as it was for our first stay a few years ago. Great vibe, chilled and friendly. Location simply works, short walk to the beach and shops. Have recommended Surfjack to friends.
user_location: Westland National Park (Te Wahipounamu), New Zealand
user_name:
CraigF414
Westland National Park (Te Wahipounamu), New Zealand

review_body: This might be appealing to some and possibly even ourselves had we been on a couples holiday but we had our three children (12, 14, and 16) and would never have booked this place had we known that. To be told after a long hot day out that they weren’t allowed a swim was not a highlight of our holiday. Rooms are really small. Our “three bedroom apartment” was two adjoining rooms with a door between two bedrooms. In one room the main external door pretty much opened into the bathroom. Very limited facilities in the room for an “apartment”. No tea/coffee making facilities, no washing machine or iron. However this is not a place where you hang out in the room. They have a great area around the pool and bar with lots of different seating arrangements. Tea and coffee is available here each morning. Although they say it is free you do pay a $25 per night ammenities fee on top of your room rate which is just “money for jam” (my pet hate). They have live music here each night and the whole place has a good vibe. Staff are really friendly and the best thing about this place.

The tone for the entire stay was set upon arrival. The front desk clerk and the rest of staff greeted my husband, granddaughter and me as if we were family. In fact, each day we felt as though we were in the home of a hospitable, trendy aunt. The suite room we shared was thoughtfully and tastefully appointed. The open air lobby with beautiful and understated furnishings is a comfortable place to hang out. It was a very easy walk to the beach. I will miss the lobby morning coffee service for many days to come. And, the food and drinks at Mahina & Sun's is not to be missed.

The staff at the Surfjack Hotel were EXCELLENT - especially Whitney who went out of her way to help us. We appreciated that we were allowed to check in early - this was so good as we'd just come off a long overnight flight. The hotel is very clean and our rooms were beautifully cleaned each day.We had 2 separate stays here during our holiday. We initially stayed in a one room bungalow, then we later stayed in a one bedroom suite. The one room bungalow was very small with insufficient room to hang clothes and insufficient drawer space, but the one bedroom suite was much better.The $25US per night amenity fee was expensive - the hotel provides a list of items that this fee includes, however I feel all these items are things I would expect to be included in my basic room fee. The hotel is an easy 10 minute walk to the beach and there's an ABC store almost next door where supplies can be purchased.

Wonderful service and room. We stayed for 10 days for a PCS move and I had zero complaints. They upgraded our room to a larger one since we had so many bags. The house keepers were very attentive to our needs (including our dog). The valet parking were really fast and polite and it was included in the military TLA rate.

10-night stay as part of my permanent change of station with the Army. Our stay proved to be an awesome experience for our family. Great pool and yummy restaurant onsite. Very pet friendly and great staff.

Super swank, hip and retro vibe combined with 21st century comfort. Excellent breakfast and dinner menus. Great coffee in the mornings. It was our second visit and we hope to make it an annual family tradition.

Spent 4 days here over the July 4th weekend, and booked based on the Trip Advisor revues. I expected a hip-retro vibe and that’s what Surfjack delivers. Unfortunately, it’s only done fairly and some opportunities are missed along the way. The one bedroom suite is smaller than many standard hotel rooms. Frustratingly, the layout is so strange that the door to the closet doesn’t open all the way because it hits the day-bed.The bathroom is located in the bedroom, literally right next to the bed..awkward even for couples who are close. Service is a little indifferent -had to ask for help with 2 large suitcases. And our one trip to the bar determined that there’s no blender for a pina colada or similar. I guess they’re too hip.Small pool with only a few lounge chairs...so good luck there..for a place billed as a “swim club” we managed to never make it to the pool.Location is excellent and the value is superior. It really is a boutique hotel that seems to want to give off that retro-cool feeling.And the “resort fee” of $20 is super annoying. It isn’t a resort. There are no facilities to speak of. Dear management—please just add the ridiculous fee to the room rate so we know what we have to pay and do t feel nickel and dimes..OR provide some amenities to make it feel like there’s actually something received for said fee. It’s nkt fair to Surfjack—all hotels seem to do it, I just couldn’t figure out what it was for other than use of the pool which seems as though it should be included in the rate.Didn’t try the restaurant. No room service either although they’ll bring some continental thing to you on the morning.4stars for location, effort and value.

We've had the wonderful pleasure of staying 6 nights at Surfjack and we loved it! It's funky in decor and we were very comfortable the whole time. It's a pleasure to come back to a clean room and we even get daily notes from our cleaner. We love the fact that it's close by the main Waikiki areas within 5-10 minutes walk. We don't miss not being beach front and certainly don't miss paying the expensive nightly rates they charge. We love being able to grab a complimentary strong coffee before we head out for the day. If you're looking for a good hotel and not having to pay premium rates, choose Surfjack!

Great place to stay. Close enough to the beach however can escape the crowds when you want to. Good vibe and decor. Comfy beds, good food, small pool. Our room phone wasn’t working for local calls however the front desk helped us out. However when they say it’s slippery by the pool - believe it! I was walking behind the lounges near the restaurant and went sliding until landing you know where. Leaving with a twinge in my back but otherwise a lovely stay.

Great place to stay in Honolulu. Close to everything & a very nice place. Staff are very friendly & the pool is great.Rooms are good and also has a good restaurant and Bar attached,Would highly recommend

Found Surfjack 5 years ago and come back every year. Friendly and accommodating. The rooms feel Hawaiian, not typical hotel style. Don’t stay here if you want a big hotel feel, stay here because you want the Hawai’i feel.

We stayed at the Surfjack Hotel for 10 nights in June and I couldn’t be happier with the hotel and the staff. The hotel has a sick vibe with interesting artwork and a funky pool area. We stayed in a double queen room on level 3 and the room was clean, comfortable and the cleaners were super nice. The shower had a good waterfall-like spray and there was enough room for the two of us. When we got to the hotel, we were a bit early and the room wasn’t ready but the staff were very nice and it gave us a chance to wander around Waikiki for an hour. The Mahina and Sons restaurant was really great - expensive but the food was good quality. Meals are generally so much bigger than in Australia so I was happy to have the smaller meals at the restaurant some mornings and nights. The bar and wait staff were very lovely! And the Olive and Oliver cafe adjacent to the hotel had the best coffee in Honolulu! The hotel was a few streets back from the beaches and I think that’s a plus - there are interesting shops and restaurants around it and a convenient ABC Shop two doors down. There’s also a gay bar next door which was a cool surprise. The staff helped us rent a car, and the valet dude were also really nice and very quick. Thank you for a great trip.

Wouldn’t want to stay elsewhere in Waikiki. True paradise in between all those big chain hotels. Laid-back atmosphere, contemporary & funky decor and great location (a couple of blocks from the beach). Very friendly and helpful staff. There was free coffee available in the pool area which we enjoyed every morning. The only thing that was a bit pricey is the parking with $35/night (you can’t just park your car on the road, there are meters everywhere) and be aware that a $25/room amenity fee will be added to your daily room rate. Would 100% recommend staying here and hope to return one day.

myself and 3 friends stayed for 6 days at this very funky hotel..very chilled atmosphere.The rooms were of a decent size with a ok size balcony.Very comfy beds nice towls high quality amenities lovely gesture of the macadamia cookies also the beach bag.The lication ideal if you dont mind a ten minute walk too the beach.Overall a very pleasent stay and would recommand to anyone wishing to experience something funky cool and different.big shout out too all the friendly staff and sai what a nice guy he is...

This is a fresh review, checked out of the hotel in mid June.Had high hopes for this hotel as we stumbled on it during a trip to Waikiki last year and thought we would give it a go, we booked for three nights and wanted to leave the following morning, however we toughed it out.We booked a Bungalow and it was tiny, we aren’t large people by any stretch however the bed would be fit for a child under 10 not two adults, so if you’re keen on this place scale up.Items of note, very little storage for luggage, tiny bathroom, the hallway to the sleeping area would be less than a metre wide so it’s challenging to ingress and egress with any grace.The pool looks great and is very pleasant although it is also tiny, during our stay the hotel was full of families with small children which
