basically overran the area during the day, it does become an adults only pool after 6PM which makes for a nice pre dinner swim although it’s also fully shaded by then.On the 16th (fathers day) we decided to have breakfast within the hotel at Mahina & Suns, we didn’t book, as house guests we thought it wouldn’t be an issue.... wrong, the hostess paused, looked around an empty restaurant and said she could squeeze us in.. while we ate and drank not one other patron entered the restaurant.My main gripe is the noise, the hotel is old like many hotels within Waikiki but this place is full of hard surfaces so every knock, every time someone closes a door you hear it all, LNC.The Surfjack is also trying to be too many things in my opinion, just be a hotel or become a swim club.My positive for this place is the crew out the front that assist with car-parking/valet, these guys are accomodating and pleasant to deal with, hats off to these guys.Location is central, a little sketchy at night with a lot of people that appear to be homeless roaming around, very sad and it appears that’s it’s becoming a bigger issue issue each time we are in Honolulu.An ABC Store on the corner is also a positive.The highlight is the attached espresso bar Olive & Oliver, i’ll review this business separately as it’s a Waikiki highlight I’ll continue to frequent it in the future.

Absolutely LOVE this hotel! We stay here every time we come to Oahu! Room are spacious, amenities are amazing and the staff is PHENOMENAL!! From the housekeeping with Flora to the front desk with Whitney aka Whizzay all the way to the top of Management with Tasi ♥️ this place is HANDS DOWN the best spot to stay in Waikiki! ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ thank you again to Sai for always having that ALOHA spirit

My family and I stayed at this Hotel for nine nights. Lovely and chill atmosphere.Clean, decent size rooms with a balcony and view of the pool.The pool and pool area aren’t very big or very private. Not enough sun lounges. Free sunscreen and water.Also free coffee in the morning. Late one night we decided to go downstairs and chill in the couch area and drink our soft drinks , only to be told by a staff member that outside drinks are not allowed. The bar and restaurant were closed and we weren’t sitting near them either. This was disappointing.

My husband and I stayed here for 7 nights in early June. The Surfjack had been highly recommended to us by our travel agent so we were looking forward to our child-free holiday. We arrived first thing in the morning after a terrible night flight and were so grateful and happy when the front desk staff found us a room so we could get some sleep! Our room was clean and comfortable. Loved the fresh, modern feel of the rooms whilst still maintaining the charm and character of the building. Our bed was better than our one at home and so was the massive shower! The plus-ones really make this a special place to stay. The magazines, macadamia cookies, handwritten note, tote bag, lime infused cold water to refill your drink bottles, delicious smelling toiletries, all make you appreciate the effort made in making this feel like your home away from home. The restaurant on-site serves delicious fresh food that we struggled to find anything better. However it is in a great location of lots of local amenities. Would definitely recommend the Surfjack to anyone visiting Waikiki. Our only disappointment was that we didn’t meet Chris on reception until the morning we were leaving! It might be awhile until we are back, but we will be back.

A wonderful hotel, great vibe and staff. Not too far from shopping, restaurants, transport and beach. Ideal for families. Very clean at all times. Pool area was so much fun for both adults and children. Mahina & Suns restaurant food was

wonderful stuff,great hospitality and over all, the food were fantastic!!!restaurant had great food and any dish we had were amazing.had relaxing time swimming in the pool.free bicycle rent was helpful.

This hotel is close to everything in Waikiki but feels like it’s an oasis from the hoards. Modern (not cheesy) chic decorations and excellent customer service all the way from the front desk people (special shout out to Sai!) to the housekeeping staff. The one bedroom suite was roomy and my 12-year-old step-son described the couch he slept on as “surprisingly comfortable”. Our king sized bed was a bit softer then ideal. The room was quiet and the balcony was a comfortable place to hang out - though with the amazing pool area seating options we didn’t spend much time on the balcony. There was free coffee every morning, live music every night, and the restaurant food and cocktails are high quality and priced in line for the area. Highly recommended and we will definitely be back!!

The Surfjack Hotel was great! I had a one bedroom suite and it was very comfortable, quiet A/C, big screen TV's, nice towels, and high quality amenities. Drinks at the bar were fresh and tasty. the two meals I had were delicious. I had a late flight and they offered me a "hospitality Suite" where I could shower and change prior to heading to the airport at 5 pm. The only disappointments for me was the number of children. I expected it to be all adults from the advertising and promotional materials. The other was the condition of the loaner bikes, they didn't have any handlebar grips and seems fairly used. I would probably have rented from "biki those bikes looked in very good condition. I would highly recommend this hotel.

This hotel is clean, centrally located, the staff are friendly and helpful. My wife and kids loved the the place and I espically like their commitment to the environment by providing reef safe sunscreen, a station to fill water bottles and a cloth bag to use while you are there. We will definitely be back.

Just got back from a great stay at the Surfjack Hotel in Hawaii. It has a really chilled out atmosphere with it's contemporary & funky decor. It is smaller than most of the hotels in Waikiki but i think this is in it's favour as you don't just feel like another face in the crowd. Sai and the staff were terrific and very welcoming. Nothing was too much trouble for them. The rooms are very comfortable with everything you need from a hotel room and more with very comfy beds & pillows, plenty of towels and toiletries in our spacious bathroom. Overall a terrific stay and i would highly recommend to anyone wishing to experience something different. Thank you Sai and the fabulous staff at the Surfjack.

I have stayed at surfjack four or five times and I am impressed each time by the service, quality and style of the accommodations and eco friendly commitment. The location is not bad, just two blocks from the beach. Great swimming pool!

Our first stay at the Surfjack was nothing short of amazing. This is a hotel that treats Kama'aina right. The staff was absolutely amazing. From valet, to front desk, to Mahina & Sun's, maid service.... EVERYONE was so kind. When employees are this happy you just know that they are being taken care of too. The decor is awesome and such an oasis from Waikiki's hustle. It's low-key and chill. Everything was impeccable. My only thing and it's totally out of the hotel's ability to fix is that the walls of the rooms are very thin so you can hear everything going on next door (wink wink) but other than that it's amazeballs.

I chose this hotel as a travel agent because lots of clients stay here. I loved the location, staff & service, laid back vibe and presentation. It's fairly small I Hawaiian standards so has a communal feel about it. Open setting with check in, lounges, dining and pool. I liked this. My friends were travelling without their children and said they'd prefer somewhere less family orientated so do note children usually in the pool playing. Thanks so much and would highly recommend.

Upon reading previous Trip Advisor reviews we chose Surfjack. It did not disappoint and was everything we had hoped for as we were staying in Honolulu just 2 nights before leaving on our cruise.We were greeted by very friendly staff. We arrived early and our rooms were not ready but they graciously held our luggage so that we could make the most our of our time. The pictures don’t do this boutique hotel justice. It is nicely decorated, very clean and inviting. They had fresh fruit flavored water and filtered water available in the pool area at all times. The pool was very clean and refreshing anytime of day.The bar and restaurant area was very nice and offered great service.I regret not trying the highly rated restaurant and losing the nightly discount the hotel offered but there were so many places we wanted to visit during our short stay on the island we simply could not try them all.Our room was still not available at the 3 pm check-in. After waking at 3:30 am to catch our flight we were exhausted. They were kind and upgraded us to a 2 room suite overlooking the pool area. The extra space with all our luggage was nice.The room was very clean and the bed and pillows were awesome! The bathroom was nice, towels soft and the toiletries provided were very nice.I highly recommend Surfjack!

Our stay at The Surfjack was great from before we even arrived. We emailed the hotel direct and queried the best room and deal they could get us and they did not disappoint. Definitely recommend dealing with them direct! We arrived at the hotel very early in the morning after an overnight flight from Auckland looking very tired but excited, the team were amazing from then onward - letting us rest on their couch, getting us cookies and coffee, and sorting out an early check in. The stay was amazing, such a warm, friendly, relaxing environment. We loved the vibes from just the feel of the hotel, to the staff who were always so friendly and helpful, for example they always went out of their way to answer our queries or sort issues, our swipe key stopped working one day and it was no issue, had a new one in a few seconds. Housekeeping also left us a welcome note on our arrival and a goodbye and thank you note on our last day. The room was a perfect mixture of modern and vintage, I had heard stories before of some of the very old hotels in Honolulu looking alright outside but worn down inside with bad bathrooms. This is 100% not the case here, the rooms feel very modern with modern bathrooms and fittings. The downstairs restaurant and pool area was wonderful, with drinks and bar snacks that can be purchased in the pool area. For some people they might not like the pool being in such a public area (the restaurant, pool, lobby are all in one area and it is the ground floor which does have doors that open out onto the road) but I never even noticed or thought about it. I thought the whole layout was nice and a real cool vibe. The other highlights were the store and coffee shop Olive and Oliver, we went for drinks there almost every day the staff were friendly and the coffee good. There was also free coffee available in the pool area every morning that we enjoyed every morning. The location is great, a quick walk to the beach and loads of shops, restaurants and bars. We didn't want to leave! I would 100% recommend this spot for anyone young wanting a relaxed, unique hotel to stay at in Waikiki. It is definitely a boutique hotel, so don't go expecting one of those big massive chain hotels - expect amazing friendly staff, live music every night, great coffee, and the perfect location and pool for your instagram story.

Excellent hotel with great location close to the main drag, just 5-10 minutes walk to the beach. All staff were brilliant, totally friendly and were full of advice and tips about Waikiki entertainment, supermarkets, shops and restaurants/bars. The hub of The Surfjack Hotel is the pool and restaurant area (great pizza's and beer) at the front of the hotel. This area suits kids and adults and I would definitely recommend this hotel to everybody! It's a true sample of excellent Hawaiian hospitality where you can truly relax and a win for genuine service over big hotel sterility.

Me and my friends had a great time at the Surfjack. The staff there was unbelievably friendly and welcoming. One particular employee, Sai, was so helpful in suggestions and treated us as family. They are great with matching your schedule and they are always interested in your plans and day. The room was very comfortable and the lounge in unbelievably chill!

My favorite part about our stay was the service and all the workers. Everyone was so friendly and helpful! The location is perfect, quiet yet just a few steps away from the Waikiki madness. Perfect place to come back to relax after a long day at the beach. They also offer a lot of amenities that we used almost every day.

What a great place to stay! Accommodations were amazing, room was modern and stylish, all amenities were as promised. Staff was outstanding, valet service was friendly, and prompt always asking if we would need the car again and the time so they were prepared. Managers were cordial and entire experience was worth repeating! Definitely will be back.

Not your run of the gristmill hotel, the Surfjack is happily, a one-off in Honolulu. "Celebrate the differences.." Hotel staff are more pal-like than paid employees, "Sue, and "Elan' who serve up my bottomless coffees are both, beautiful keepers! We LUV them! Zaldy'' on the front desk, as well as the entire team help to embed the laid back,'cruis'in' feel to our visit. Perfect! I live at 35,000 feet, and in hotels. This venue is nothing like that, and I'm pleased with my choice. The location is pur-fecrt! I will, be back!.

I cannot say enough about the Surfjack. The building and location are great; really close to the beach, restaurants, and shopping. The rates for what the rooms are cannot be beat. If you sign up for their insider rewards, you save even more. What really makes this place stand above and beyond any other hotel we've ever stayed at (on the island and on the mainland) is the staff. They embody the spirit of aloha and are always there to help with a smile on their face.Sai at the front desk is the always the first smiling face we see when we visit. He's always helpful, efficient, and has the BEST cookies for our boys. No matter where we were in the lobby, Mahina & Suns or Olive & Oliver (amazing coffee), he never failed to say good morning. Tiki and Whitney also went out of their way to make sure that we got to stay in the same room when we decided to extend our stay for another night.This last stay really reinforced why we stay at the Surfjack. It was after this visit, we decided we will never stay in any other hotel in Waikiki; all in thanks to two valets: Keola and Michael. My husband parked our rental car on a street that was a tow zone for a block of three hours (he did not read any signage). When we walked to the car to start our day, we found it was missing. When we got back to the hotel, we asked if Keola knew the number to call, he expressed his genuine shock and sympathy to our situation. I was sitting in the lobby with my two boys (4 and 1) while my husband called the tow company. Keola came to find us and volunteered to bring us to the tow yard to retrieve our vehicle. And that is exactly what he did. Michael would have brought us, but I think it was his turn to man the valet counter. They did not have to offer such a kindness, nor do they do it for everyone. My family and I cannot express the gratitude that we have for Kealoha and Michael for saving our day and turning it into one of the best days we had in Hawaii.Thank you Surfjack for the amazing stay. Thank you Sai, Tiki and Whitney for your graciousness. Thank you Kealoha and Michael for your kindness and generosity. We will definitely be back.Mahalo nui loa!The Kousonsavaths

Feels like my second home. Great people that treat you like you incredibly respectful. Boutique accommodations with incredible sustainable restaurant. SurfJack approaches corporate responsibility through sustainability better than any hotel in Waikiki.

We really enjoyed our stay at Surfjacks. The staff were all super friendly and really helpful whenever we had any questions. Facilities really clean and tidy. Pool amazing! Room had a slight odour to it... maybe from air con? Decent toiletries in the way of shampoo, body wash etc replenished each day. They also supply free reef friendly sunscreen from onsite pumps which was a nice touch! Overall, good value for money accommodation.

This was our second stay at the Surfjack, just as enjoyable as the first. The 'vibe' of the place was wonderful. We enjoyed the music events - live performers and 'silent disco.' As before the in-house restaurant and bar was great. The staff at both the hotel and restaurant made us feel at home. The location is a few blocks away from the busiest areas of Waikiki so is just a little bit removed from the 'hubbub.'

Came to Oahu for our 11-day honeymoon. We don't naturally gravitate towards luxury, because in the end we prefer a space with good vibes amid equal parts interesting design and comfort. Oh and we are suckers for mid-century modern aesthetics. The Surfjack did not disappoint on any of those fronts. The room decor is impeccable. In some ways it is more like a old-school motel in its layout. However unlike a motel, the restaurant and poolside areas are true amenities. Mahina and Sons has a full breakfast/brunch menu, a menu for poolside bites, and a superb dinner menu. Everything we ordered was really good. We let the hotel staff know that we were on our honeymoon, and they generously upgraded our room to one with a huge balcony plus sent up a bottle of bubbly. No coffeemakers in the rooms, but the complimentary coffee by the pool was worth the trip down. Olive and Oliver is a cute boutique and coffee bar. Perfect for a high-end souvenirs. Lewers Street is quiet and doesn't get all the extreme foot traffic of Kuhio or Kalkaua, but plenty is within walking distance. On the rest of our trip we stayed at Turtle Bay on the North Shore and then at the Laylow once we were back in Waikiki. Those were great places, but the Surfjack is where we will stay whenever we are back in Honolulu.

Such a quaint place to make memories! Our group of nine friends loved staying at this property for a week. The service was impeccable and everyone was so friendly! They have paid attention to every detail. The location is convenient for exploring the island. I wish I could return (after I get over my jet lag)!

My wife and I stayed here for our anniversary/baby moon. It was great. The room was super clean and the decor out of sight. Not to mention the cookies. So good. Also the restaurant had a truly tasty brunch.

Our room had a distinct urine smell for the first 2 nights. I think either a child or pet urinated on the carpet which is made of natural fibers. At first I thought the scent was the "Surfjack scent" they talk about but realized the lobby smelled different from our room. The room is small, suitable for 2 people. The bathroom door is a pocket door so may have less noise muffling than some would want when using the toilet sometimes. The location is good, very walkable to restaurants and stores. Check in and check out were quick, staff if friendly and courteous. Pool was clean and maintained. There is free reef safe sunscreen by the pool. The amenity fee includes room snacks but they are not refilled, you only get one set of snacks on arrival. I like that they make an effort to be sustainable with glasses made from wine bottles, etc.
user_name:
jennifer721
New York City, New York

review_body: We visited for our honeymoon and were greeted by a beautiful rose petal set up and heart shape on our bed alongside a bottle of champagne - we found out at check out that a staff member came in on her day off to do this, thank you!Awesome location, great vibe - really relaxed and chilled with the wonderful pool. We liked that it wasn’t your typical resort crowded full of peopleThe restaurant here is also incredible, we were so fortunate to have this in our hotel.Highly recommend!

We love staying there and pre-book before we leave every time we are there at least four times a year! The staff is amazing I love the way everything smells the room designs are perfect and we love dining in the restaurant before and after a long day at work.

Excellent rooms with perfect size and outstanding cleanliness. Professional staff that raises the Waikiki service bar every day. Awesome swimming pool and restaurant. Smells great. Very close to the beach and shops, however, it is peaceful, friendly and filled with true Aloha!

My husband and I spent 3 nights at the Surfjack Hotel and really appreciated the small, boutique hotel environment over the large hotel options. The rooms are small but you have everything you need and its walking distance to the beach, shopping and a multitude of dining options.

I was so excited to stay here from the cute pictures online, but from check in, it was a bust. My husband took our son to grab some food, so I was left alone with out bags, and the staff didn't offer to bring bags up to our room, I had to ask for help. There was no staff to take orders, or clean anything up around the pool, so my salad bowl sat there for over 2 hours on the chair and no one ever came to clean the area up. The rooms are decorated in a cute manner, but it's very obvious that they polished an old run-down hotel, and wear and tear was really showing. There is no view of the ocean, and our room (which I paid for a 1 bedroom suite) was on an L shape, so looked directly into another room and we could 100% see each other, making it a drapes closed room for any bit of privacy at all. For the $425 per night price we paid, it was absolutely not worth the cost. It's fun and trendy if that's your bag, but even breakfast had poor service and they charged $2 extra to get regular syrup for the pancakes for my son, because he didn't want the butter/banana syrup. They also charged $3 for milk for his bowl of cereal on top of the $5 we paid for the actual bowl of cereal. Tacky.

We stayed at Surfjack for 2 nights after having stayed at another top hotel in Oahu for 4 nights. We were very happy with our first hotel. I wanted to stay at Surfjack to have a different experience and at a different part of the town. Surfjack is a perfectly fine hotel and my experience might have been much better given different circumstances. The review rating of this hotel is mainly a result of comparing with our first hotel.Surfjack's location is good, it's in a quiet neighbourhood of the town centre and easy to walk to Waikiki beach, restaurants and shops. I chose Surfjack because I wanted a more local Hawaiian and surfer's feel and I expected a cool, laid back, friendly vibe.When we checked in, the front desk person ran through the list of things point by point without much of a smile. That wasn't a good start. Overall during our 2 nights' stay I didn't feel much of the friendliness of the hotel staff. The best experience of service I had at Surfjack was the security guard which took care of the Saturday evening performance. I had a good chat with him, he explained how the music performance is conducted (it's not a regular setting of singing band or DJ, you'd have to see it for yourself) and why that came about. He was personable, friendly and always had a smile. He gave me a much better experience than anyone at the front desk.We stayed at a bungalow suite with a large balcony which was kind of nice.

Have just spent 8 nights in The SurfJack Hotel... couldn’t fault it. Reception staff were delightful, helpful, informative with fab customer service skills. Housekeeping efficient and discreet. Hotel location is perfect. Couldn’t rate this hotel any higher and will recommend and definitely will be back!

We were a family of four staying in a one bedroom suite at the Surfjack recently. Our stay was for 7 nights. We turned up very early morning off a red eye flight and the receptionist was most welcoming and got us into a room very quickly so we could get settled. Our room was a dream room overlooking that gorgeous pool! A one bedroom suite. Our two boys slept in the lounge area, the tallest on the sofa bed which was a double and the younger one on the couch end that you could put together and use as a bed. We just had to get some extra blankets as there were two lots of bedding.All the staff were so helpful when asked and we had a really relaxing stay. Our room was next to an elevator but we heard very little noise.The thing I love about this place is it's old star glamour. The pool area and rooms are just like the photos and we were not disappointed at all.It is close enough to walk to the beach and shops

We spent 7 nights as a family and had the most amazing time. Location was excellent, walking distance to the beaches and in the heart of Waikiki. Excellent hotel staff and the coffee is on point, and when you need a break from it all just grab a cocktail and lay by the pool.

I stayed at a competitor hotel for 2 nights before I stayed here for 3 nights this past week and there’s just no comparison in quality of service and hospitality. I wish I had spent my entire vacation here! I was hesitant about staying here because I really wanted to stay at any of the beachfront hotels on Waikiki beach but in the end I am so glad I chose the Surfjack.The staff here is beyond amazing. I was upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite which was just perfect for me and my significant other celebrating our 1 year anniversary. I had requested a microwave and iron/board to the room and they brought it up almost immediately. This hotel also offers beach chairs which were so convenient to have for our relaxing times at the beach after our long hikes.The actual rooms themselves were carefully thought out and decorated very nicely. The bathroom was very pleasant and the glass door shower had really good water pressure.The location was perfect just outside of all the action but not far off from Kuhio Ave which is where all the great restaurants are for foodies like myself. Because we had a rental car, I would actually choose this hotel over hotels on the beach since it was easy to get our car from valet. The valet staff was also so friendly. Not only did they have the car ready right away, but they opened the car doors and took care of our luggage without hesitation.I just can’t say enough good things about this hotel. The only thing I regret is not staying here the whole time as we explored Oahu for the first time. I would gladly stay here again. I wish I could remember all the names of the staff (I only remember Kai, Whitney, and Tiki) but I want to give a big shoutout to all of them including the guys who helped fix our remote and brought up the microwave and ironing board. Also, thank you to the housekeeping staff!Mahina and Sons was also great, make sure you get the award winning Adobo Fried Rice!Thank you Surfjack!!!

We had a wonderful stay with the Surfjack team. Our arrival got delay last minute due to a pilot strike. The staff were so sweet and welcoming when I phoned to let them know. They didn’t charge us but upgraded us to a larger suite than we had booked to make us more comfortable. (Five of us in the party including a four month old!) We were originally set to stay at a different hotel once we return to Honolulu at the end of our vacation. But because we felt so welcomed and at home we ended up canceling the other reservation and booked with The Surfjack again! We can’t wait to return!

This place is the perfect mix of comfort, attitude and environmental sustainability. The staff are genuinely happy and helpful. The food is excellent. The accommodations are welcoming, relaxed and super comfortable. I had delightful stay and won't look elsewhere for my next visit.

My partner and I loved our stay at the Surfjack. The room was large, comfortable, and well serviced. The pool and bar facilities were good for a relatively small hotel, and the cafe and store located adjacent reception served good coffee, and had a cool selection of clothing and homewares. The hotel is located a two-minute walk from the city centre, making it close to shops, restaurants, and the beach. Overall, compared to hotels of similar prices, the Surfjack is a standout in Honolulu.

The hotel is like a 3.4 stars. It's not new but it's cute and clean. The kids liked the pool even thought my 5 years old had just a small area to swim. Great customer service! Bad side: The only bad side was the bar lady. We requested a pina colada and she gave us a mint drink! It was $18 dollars! So I went very polite and nice to request if we couldn't change it to another option. She was very mad saying that this was the original recipe (I am 44 years old and I love pina colada... I never hear that it doesn't have pinapple and has mint instead). She was super rude and mad. I think they should fire her. She was never smiling or happy... bad energy.The other people was super kind and nice. But I wouldn't go back to this hotel.Better to pay a bit more and stay in a Hyatt or Hilton... if you are expending to have a great vacation, better to expend a bit more and have a great accommodation too.

This is a great hotel. Very boutique with an independent coffee shop and restaurant on the premises. The staff were really helpful and everything about the stay was great. Only thing to remember is you get charged an additional 25 dollars per day on top of your room rental, but it’s still totally worth it
user_name:
SteveD0911
Brighton and Hove, United Kingdom

review_body: I stay at Surfjack for 8 nights in a 1 bedroom suite and it was excellent. It was on the 7th floor with a fantastic view over the pool. The place has a cool and funky boutique vibe about it which was perfect. The pool isn't to big and the lounges fill up quick so get in early. The food at the restaurant was awesome. Staff were always happy and helpful

We (wife, 14yr old daughter and her friend) stayed for 7 nights at the Surfjack on the recommendation of some friends in NZ. We had been to Hawaii previously and stayed at a large resort, which we unfortunately had to move to for the last 2 nights for a family catch up. We just loooved the Surfjack and such a stark contrast to the resort. It just a cool vibe and is very calm and relaxing. Great focus on the environment, community and health. The pool is super clean and never too busy, staff so friendly and the restaurant food is excellent with great healthy options. You look forward to getting back to the Surfjack after a busy day of activities. All the small things count such as free coffee and iced water available etc. Would definitely recommend and we will definitely stay again. Andrew Scott.

I can see the charm of this hotel, but I think it is better suited to young adults. We were wanting a hotel just for one night’s sleep prior to our flight back home. Unfortunately we weren’t able to get to sleep until very late. There was a lot of noise from the central communal area surrounding the pool. They have live music until 9pm and then there is ongoing noise from people after that. Given it is an old hotel done up, we could hear noise from adjacent rooms to the extent you could hear exactly what they were saying and their TV. If something was dropped in the room above there was loud banging on your roof. The kids couldn’t get to sleep until very late because of all this noise. The room set up was good for a family. There were 2 separate bedrooms with large bed in each, so the kids shared a bed. Separate living area with a TV. The bathroom had a shower and toilet. The water in the shower was luke warm at its maximum. Probably perfectly fine for the weather in Honolulu but not for me who likes hot showers!

I stayed 4 days part of the time with a fly fishing expedition on our way to Christmas Island. Mahina and Sun served all 12 of us a truly memorable 'family feast' before our departure. It featured too many dishes to describe here and bags of fun. All the staff were caring and thoughtful. It was a great experience. I recommend Surfjack to those of you who enjoy good food and extremely nice people..

the hotel is located near everything you could want in Waikiki. restaurants and shopping are minutes away. the beach is a few blocks away. the hotel staff is great helpful friendly and cheerful. the restaurant downstairs is very good

The location of this hotel is great and close to the best restaurants, shopping malls and beach. The service in the bar and food is very good. Next time we travel to Oahu.... we will come back here for sure!!!!

This Boutique style hotel really ticks all the box's !! Just returned last week for a trip with a family of six and I have to say the place caters for everyone - 28 years since I have been to Honolulu and the Surfjack is a good reason to go back - whilst it is no Sheraton or beach front hotel - this is perfect for a family - not far from the tourist hot spots and gives the Big Kahuna of old feel - Restaurant food top shelf - and cafe got close to make a good cappuccino - ( Not there yet)

Kids are not allowed in the pool after 5:30 and its right at the front of the hotel so people can see from the street. Rooms are tiny and dated. Hotel is next door to a bar and was very noisy all night. We checked out 5 days early and went to another hotel staff were not surpised as they didn't question anything.

I live Hawai’i and have been longing to stay this large lanai room. It’s not ocean front but who can have this kind of room with this location and this price?! To me, everything is bit pricy but it all goes back to local, our community so that’s totally fine. I live your concept a lot. Stuff are friendly, amenity is cute. Every sight of view, I feel you want us to experience Aloha. Unfortunately I didn’t see local people staying much, maybe I just didn’t see?, but I really hope this hotel stay long to show Hawaii’s new style. Thank you very much and looking for the next opportunity. Mahalo and Aloha!

This little gem is only a few blocks away from the hurly burly of the main streets. The location is perfect for getting to the beach, shops, restaurants,and bus routes all within walking distance. There was a good mixture of guests and the vibe was calm and relaxing.. We dined in several times and the food was delicious - highly recommended. All of the hotel staff were friendly, helpful and the front desk staff always welcomed you back with a smile..

We were greeted by friendly smiles at the Valet and than by the reception. A welcome drink- choice of fresh juices or coffee. We opted for the iced coffee. It is a cute hotel a couple blocks from the main Waikiki drag. Seriously the location was perfect as it was far enough from the noise but within walking distance of the turquoise blue sea. We were lucky enough to receive a complimentary upgrade to a 2 bedroom suite ob the corner of the 3 rd floor. I felt like we had our own little apartment in the middle of honolulu. With a pool view, that the tile on the pool floor reads “ wish you were here” was beyond beautiful. We each had our own king size bed and were very comfortable. The balcony had chairs so we could sit and relax. It was my friends birthday which was noted when reservation was made that this thoughtful hotel delivered a bottle of champagne on ice, and a hand written note. We enjoyed Happy Hour in the bar and Lilly was super friendly and helpful. She was a great bartender. The Naked Pig Pizza was a perfect snack. They have complimentary coffee in the morning served poolside. A peaceful, laid back funky with character and a positive surfer vibe. We were satisfied and would return. You truly cant beat the price and location. Thank you to the SurfJack for starting our Hawaii adventure off in style!

The rooms were nice and the pool was good to have, but very expensive for what we got. We were also surprised by a $25/day facility fre upon check out. We ate in the restaurant for breakfast but they didn't have enough servers for all the tables which meant we had to order take out despite being in the restaurant. This meant we wasted a ton of packaging but also the food was cold when it arrived (again we were sitting in the restaurant waiting). We charged the bill to the room but upon paying found they had added a ln extra $15 to the meal, either automatically giving themselves a 33% tip for refusing to serve our table or miss charging. The front desk comped the meal, though it was only because I had literally just left the restaurant and had the receipt in hand.

The Surfjack Hotel and Swim Club was a beautiful place to stay in Honolulu. Rooms were amazing. The food and coffee was perfect and the staff were helpful and very kind, especially Sai.Great location, close to the shopping central area and the beach. Transportation via busses right outside the hotel. Amazing stay especially for the price point. Could not recommend this place anymore to friends and family!

SurfJack puts the chill into chillax! Rooms are inviting retro and coll. I loved our 1 bedroom with it's deck to the pool. You feel like a part of the community of travelers. The coffee available from 6.30am is pretty tasty and chilled water good. I think a reusable water bottle would go down a treat even if you had to purchase it. I wish we could have stayed longer it was a perfect way to end of our trip, whilst being so close to the action. We return.

This was a great place to stay in Waikiki. If we ever return I can't Imagine staying any place else. Lounge and restaurant were top notch, great drinks, great food, great vibe. We stayed here for a week in March . Every employee we came in contact with were friendly and welcoming. We didn't want to leave.

We spent a splendid day and night here at Surfacks recently. One final treat on our 16 night Hawaiian adventure. Not a planned stay but very glad for the change of flight to accommodate. The staff were all very friendly and helpful, we were able to check into our room at 10am. Nice welcome drinks on arrival too. The room was very clean, well appointed and stylish. We took the bicycles out for a spin to breakfast, spent an afternoon by the pool and enjoyed the live music in the evening. Would love to return!

Surfjack is a near-perfect hotel. It’s beautiful with great design touches and art all around, it’s comfortable, they have love music by the pool, the staff is great, and they supply you with reef-safe sunscreen, bicycles to use, and tote bags to carry around. Their restaurant and bar is probably the best restaurant on Waikiki beach, and their little cafe is definitely the best on Oahu, plus guests get free admission to the amazing Honolulu Art Museum. Their only real fault is that the walls are pretty thin so if the people staying in the adjacent rooms have kids or are the latenight party type you will definitely hear them. Despite that we’ll definitely be staying here again the next time we’re visiting Honolulu.

We couldn't have asked for a better experience for our trip to Honolulu. Recently renovated with a hip - chill - and nice vibe, great rooms and friendly staff. All resorts on Waikiki have a daily amenity fee, but Surfjack also includes $10 credit to their restaurant, enough for sharing lunch, breakfast, or dinner depending on your stay. Plus, the world's best coffee (meets Australian standards!) is located in-house at Olive & Oliver.Can't wait to be back. Great daily entertainment, a nice pool (just look at the photos)! and convenient to walk everywhere in Waikiki in a few minutes. Plus large rooms, soft beds, and a quiet place to sleep.

We enjoy each and every detail of this lovely and stylish hotel! The rooms were comfortable, the service impeccable and every corner is full of good taste and personality! If we get back to Waikiki we will return to the Surfjack without hesitation!

SurfJack is a great hotel just a few blocks from Waikiki Beach. It has a terrific Hawaiian vibe. The rooms are clean and spacious. The people at the front desk are friendly and helpful. There is also a great restaurant that served delicious breakfast. Hopefully, I will return to Oahu and stay again at the Surfjack!

The worst part of our stay was that it was only one night. Had I known we would love the hotel as much and that it had great food, great coffee, great amenities and activities, we would have stayed longer. Don’t do what we did and soak it up.

We love this place. It has a good atmosphere You get a lot of freebies like sunscreen, water with lemon or pinaple flavour. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The room was very clean and confortable. We definitely recommend this hotel to our friends.

The room was clean and nicely furbished, service was good.We liked the small size and the relaxed atmosphere as we prefer boutique hotels. The coffee at the little coffee shop was the best Latte I had during our trip.I can definitely recommend the hotel if you are looking for something small with a personal touch.

Surfjack crew is very friendly. Especially SAI was very kind for me. He remembered me and when I returned surfjack, he said "Welcome back!" with nice smile. Of course room, pool, and restrant is so cool. I love this hotel, I love surfjack!!! This hotel that should definitely be visited when you come to Hawaii.

We wanted to love this place. Its location is amazing, its design gorgeous. It gets a lot of the little details (free sunscreen!) right. But unfortunately, it gets a lot of the big things wrong. Our room wasn't all that clean when we checked in (hair in the corners that definitely wasn't ours), and it didn't ever get cleaned during the two nights we stayed there. The staff was, at best, indifferent. A call to guest services could ring 30 times without being answered. Surfjack had so much potential, but we won't be back.

First off, we stayed 2 nights at the Surfjack. I have to admit I was expecting more of an Ace Hotel style vibe (but obvi smaller & island style) ... just because of its mid century swank & instagramable cuteness! What we got was, I think, a pretty good value for a place in Waikiki, AMAZING STAFF (literally everyone was delightful!) and a few things I didn’t bargain for that I’m throwing out just in case they matter to you. 1. The room was small and the bed was too. Bed was full size, I believe and we could feel the springs in it. Room was decorated well and we had a great view of the pool! The small room and bed didn’t suck- but it wasn’t a wow either. 2. There are loads of families and kids. During our stay, it seems almost exclusively families and kids in the pool! Everyone was great and kiddos were fine. But I think I had expected a bit more of a chic adult vibe. 3. Parking is $35 a day and there is an additional $25 a day mandatory to use their bag, towels, and if you eat at their bar or restaurant - a $10 credit back. So, it’s $15 or $25... however you want to splice it. Whatever - it’s a resort fee! We brought our own beach towels and bags so their cute totes & towels felt less like an amenity and more like a non optional fee. We were on our babymoon and are also very laid back so none of this was a deal breaker AT ALL! The hotel is designed beautifully, truly ALL the staff was great and for a couple nights - it’s really worth it. I just wouldn’t advise a long stay if you’re looking for a grown & sexy vibe. It was a good experience but lacked for us in some key areas. I’d go back but I’d have different expectations for it.

Our entire family, including two usually brooding teenagers, had an unexpected "best trip ever" to Oahu last week. This was in large part to this super cool hotel, it's creative, independent vibe and the sweetheart staff. Rooms were large, clean and stylish. We got the one bedroom suite with balcony and it fit the whole fam just fine. The rates were killer compared to anything else in Waikiki and we easily walked to the beach each day with hotel provided chairs and towels. Sai and Ken were our daily send off buddies from the front desk and answered every question I could up with throughout the week. The daytime valet often gave us fantastic tips for our day trips. One day they led us to the coolest surf watching experience at Pipeline ever. Each day they have live music and interesting activities in their midcentury open air pool and lobby area. We can't wait to contact Krystle Carbajal to book our next trip to this hotel. We have traveled all over the world and always look for interesting and luxurious accommodations. This is one of the hippest and happiest places we have ever stayed.

We just completed our third stay at the Surfjack Hotel in the last year. Each subsequent stay has been better then the previous experience. The professionalism of the staff is only exceeded by their friendliness. You are treated as family during your entire stay. SAI and the front desk staff exemplify the aloha spirit for the entire crew at the hotel, from housekeeping to room service.Look forward to our next visit.Jim & Donna Byerlotzer

Super cute boutique hotel. We loved almost everything about it. What we loved about our stay:-Decor-Service was great with most hotel staff. -Good water pressure and we overall loved the rooms. -Sheets were nice on the beds. A few things that can be improved:-Sofa in living room is not very comfortable & beds are okay. -Pool water has too much chlorine and the area around the pool is very, very slippery. My husband slipped and had a sore knee and wrist for duration of stay and after. -They pool hours for kids should be extended to the same hours as adults. -Limited room service hours and menu. Also, I wish they used real plates and silverware and not take out containers and single use utensils. They did use eco friendly kind to their credit. We would definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel to others.

We live on Kauai and I have a business on Vancouver, so we are often transitioning through Honolulu. We found this lovely gem after staying at a not so great place close by, and walking by the Surfjack. It looked like everyone was having fun so we decided that we would stay there on our next visit. That was 2 years ago and we’ve never looked back! The staff is like family to us and our 3 year old now refers to Honolulu and Surfjack synonymously. The rooms are clean, spacious and comfortable, and the hotel offers a lot of activities for the whole family. We would be hard pressed to stay anywhere else! ♥️

This place is amazing. We will definitely recommend it to all our family and friends. The front desk staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. We loved the coffee bar right there at the front entrance. The food in the dining room was so good we ate there for quite a few of our meals

Note: would give this hotel a 4.5 rating if I could. The previous reviews and the title say it all. The check-in was smooth and effortless, and the staff were courteous and professional. Even though we arrived early (before 11), a room was available and we were promptly given the keys. We appreciated the one-on-one approach, where a staff member sat down with you to review all of the hotel's amenitities and the surrounding area. People staying at the hotel receive a $10 a day discount from the restaurant, which is a nice touch (more if you stay for 3 nights or more).Our room was comfortable. It was a decent size with a very cozy bed and pillows. We liked having the option to choose air conditioning, the ceiling fan, or opening the door to our lanai to ventilate and cool the room (it can get a bit noisy outside, making these options all the more important). The bathroom was clean, and the shower had great water pressure. The hotel uses high-quality shampoo, conditioner, and soap, and these little touches elevate the experience. WiFi worked well in the room and in the lobby. The location is excellent, where one can easily stroll along the canal, head towards the beaches, or shop at the many stores in the area. We did have dinner at Mahina & Suns, and a seperate review has been prepared for it. Upon checkout and if you're leaving for the airport, check the prices on Lyft and Uber first and then ask the representatives at the front desk if a cheaper option is available. We were able to get a taxi for a $29 flat rate, inclusive of gratuity/tip. The cheapest price on Uber was more than $32 before tip and this was early Saturday morning.

Surfjack was very convenient for us. It’s so close to everything we walked to the beach shops . Nice and quite place the rooms were very clean and spacious. Staff were very friendly and helpful will definitely go back there again

There are lots of nice things everywhere in the hotel. Especially rent-a-cycle was fun ridding very slowly. I absolutely think cool people can enjoy and relax in here! And we can get iconic T-shirt at olive&oliver is good!

Surfjack was conveniently located close to Waikiki without being close to the main hub. It was quiet and peaceful and staff were helpful and friendly. Rooms were clean and spacious. There was no view of the beach or water, but that didn't really matter. The pool was nice and nightly music and ambience cool. It was what I would call, a no fuss place to stay.

Pros - (1) amazing service, super friendly, nice and professional people at reception; (2) great central location; (3) value for money; (4) nice, newly updated rooms; (5) attention to details (freshly baked cookies in the room, free sunscreen at the swimming pool, free flow of coffee in the morning, hassle free valet parking...); (6) very nice restaurant (worth every penny); (7) laid-back cool atmosphere.Cons - no ocean view from our room (but we knew it)We stayed in Surfjack on a one night and two full day stopover from the South Pacifics back to Asia. We arrived in Honolulu very early in the morning. Since we planned to spend our time touring around the island, we first decided to drop off the bags at the hotel. I decided to try my luck and asked if there is any chance we can get in our room... There was one room available, so we got a very needed couple hours of sleep, amazing breakfast in restaurant and extra cookies on the road for our daughter from reception guys:-).The room was nice, clean ,modern and had everything one needs, very comfy beds. We didn't have 'the view', which we had in another hotel on a stop-over before our trip to the south, but it was double the price, and slightly lacked the personal touch we got in Surfjack...Our departure arrangements from hotel ended up in equally great experience, plus super nice dinner in the restaurant. Really nice place!

Our experience of the Surfjack was wonderful. From the people that work there, other hotel guests were happy and friendly and the rooms were just perfect for our needs. Got a suite which was great for times I needed to nap and the hubby was able to watch Tele in a seperate Lounge. We chose not to have a car this trip and it was great! Everything is so central from the hotel and was great to walk everywhere to explore. Would definitely stay again. Mahalo

There is so much to say. First the check in, when you arrive at the front desk you are NOT welcomed by a trained customer service robot, but by a bearded human with an intelligent sense of humor (Tiki). The room was spacey, clean and the beds just awesome. The hotel itself is so different from the general artificial hotel world, real amazing atmosphere, great service, even at late night. Besides all this I had huge trouble with the ALAMO car I rented (by far the worst experience ever I had with a car rental company) but the help and support especially from Kai was over the top. In 8 years of living in HI with numerous trips to Honolulu this was by far the best stay in a hotel.

At the Surfjack, you're going to get wonderful customer service, with lots of great smiles. I met Whitney upon checking in, and I tell you what, she's a total sweetheart. She went extra measures to make sure I was a happy customer. I enjoyed me view up in the high towers that allowed me to capture a great view of the area. The bed was comfy, I slept great each night. The restaurant area was another wonderful stop that I enjoyed at the hotel. Elan was wonderful and very personable. I asked her advice on where to visit while in town, and she took care of me with wonderful suggestions. I really enjoyed talking with her and some of the other staff. The food was great. Everyone was friendly and very helpful. These two ladies made this trip extra special...shout out to the other lady on the morning crew at the restaurant. She was also too.

Okay, first things first. We have stayed here several times and I always like to say that I am the oldest person on property, inclusive of guests and employees. But this time I saw a couple older than my wife and I, and felt slightly miffed that perhaps the secret has gotten out to the Baby Boomers. Alas my Gen X, Y, Z and Millenial traveler friends, you need not fret. Despite last weekend's influx of two Baby Boomer couples, The Surfjack remains an urban oasis of good vibes, great tunes, aromatic yumminess and a super chill retreat in the midst of buzzing Waikiki. Really nice cocktails and ono grinds, poolside lounges with a music playlist that encourages and induces dreamy alpha state power naps between plunges into the Instagrammable Wish You Were Here pool. Plenty of hotels talk the talk about their unique vibe and their experiential offerings, but few deliver. The Surfjack was well conceived, is well-run, and does what it does exceptionally. It eschews any notion of being cookie-cutter and has done a wonderful job of carving out a unique niche among the many choices one has in this market. Location is wonderful and easier to escape than the big box brands and some other locations. Walkable to everywhere you want to visit in Waikiki. We have stayed at Moana, Royal Hawaiian, Sheraton, Halekulani, Marriott, Lotus, Prince and The Modern to name just a few, and I can honestly say we prefer the cool and breezy super easy feel of the Surfjack. My wife loves the intimacy of the property in the midst of the bustle of the city, my kid digs the fact he doesn't feel like an alien if he walks in barefoot, wearing board shorts and looking surly, and I am partial to their tequila cocktails with just the right tunes for poolside unwinding. All good in the Surfjack 'hood. Keep up the great and fun work Lynette and team.

We found ourselves in Honolulu in unfortunate circumstances — my mother-in-law passed away on a cruise en route to Hawaii from San Diego. We needed a place to stay while the authorities processed the death and we could have her cremated before flying back to the mainland with her ashes.Under the circumstances, all we really wanted from a hotel was a clean place that would afford us privacy and from where we could make phone calls and such. I also thought it might be a good idea to be somewhat near a beach, in case we wanted to get some fresh air in the evenings, after what were bound to be long and trying days. Also, not knowing how long we might have to stay in Honolulu, we wanted a hotel that would be flexible in case we needed to check out a day or two early.So we found Surfjack Hotel, based on their reviews and rating on Yelp. Initially we booked two rooms, one for my father-in-law and one for my wife and me. We hoped to have the two rooms right next to each other, in case my wife or I needed to help my father-in-law with something. And we booked ourselves in for 4 nights, again not really sure how long the Honolulu authorities might take with my mother-in-law’s remains.At check-in, we mentioned our circumstances to the hotel staff. They were very kind and offered us water and coffee. They also immediately upgraded one of our rooms to a 2-bedroom suite! When we got to the suite, we realized that all three of us could stay in it and we didn’t really need the second room. So we called up the front desk and they were again very happy to accomodate our request to cancel the second room without any hassle.Of course, we realized that we had inadvertently shortchanged the hotel in the process so I went down to the front desk a couple hours later and offered to make up the difference — basically, we were happy to stay in just the suite, but we also wanted to make sure we were paying the hotel a fair price for it. Well, I spoke with three people there, and each of them told me the same thing: not to worry about it and just tell them if we needed anything from them — what incredible generosity!In a very difficult time for our family, Surfjack really went above and beyond in their hospitality. The room was well-equipped, the beds were very comfortable, and though we didn't use it, the pool setting looked very relaxing. The location was a short walk from the beach and the major Waikiki spots. And not only was the staff kind and generous, but they were also very responsive to our requests. If we ever find ourselves in Waikiki again, we know where we’ll be staying.
user_name:
Shaunak K
San Jose, California, United States

review_body: At the tail end of our trip, we decided to spend our last night on Oahu at the beautiful Surfjack Hotel. We were pleased to be met by friendly staff, a nice musician playing live music, and delicious cocktails to enjoy in the cool lounge area. The room was nice and shockingly filled with goodies and snacks with no charge.The room was perfect for our needs (wifi worked great, lovely bathroom, comfy beds, cute balcony).The only downside to our stay was it made the much more expensive "luxury" Fairmont Vancouver Airport hotel that we stayed at the next day seem like like a best western with a big bathtub.

We were able to have a very relaxing stay.The avenue is very convenient, but you can spend it veryvery quietly.The hospitality of the staff was also the best, and live at the poolside also got excited.

My husband and I stayed here for what was supposed to be 10 days before we moved off island for the military. Due to unforseen circumstances our 10 day stay turned into 29 days. The entire Surfjack staff took such great care of us during an extremely stressful time! 1. The hotel itself is super cute! As an interior designer visuals are a major thing for me. The mid-century modern vibe is great and the whole hotel is super instagrammable. I was a witness to several photo shoots while I was there. 2. The front desk staff was extremely helpful as we had to extend our reservation twice while we were there. There was a point in which they were almost booked up when we needed to extend and Crystal worked her magic so we wouldn't have to move to a different hotel.3.The valets are promp and super friendly! Several of them would greet my dog everyday after his walk. 4. When they say they're dog friendly they mean it! The entire staff constantly loved on my dog. The hotel is also located close to a nice park with a canal which is perfect for dog walking. 5. Mahina and Suns is the restaurant in the hotel. It's not only delicious, but again, the staff is amazing! The outdoors portion is dog friendly and sometines they'll even give your pup a little snack. Elan, Jayda, and Alison, amongst the rest of the staff were totally accommodating. I was often downstairs working by the cabanas and they would check on me and also make sure I had food if I wanted it. Overall I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to skip out on the huge resort experience and enjoy a more intimate experience. They truly treated us like family and I'll never forget our time there! Sry...long review, but they deserve it.

We had a quick stopover in Waikiki on our way home with our baby and toddler, and the two bedroom suite was perfect. Very spacious by urban hotel standards, clean, comfy beds and great design. The staff was also extremely helpful and patient with us and our two little ones.

My husband and I stayed at the Surfjack Hotel two weeks ago as part of my 40th birthday celebrations. We booked the Penthouse Suite and I have to say that it was absolutely incredible. We had 17 friends/family who came over for drinks and finger food at our Penthouse suite. We had the event catered by the local restaurant onsite Mahina & Sun's and it was truly a magnificent event. I loved the laid back vibe of the Suarfjack and the gorgeous pool and surrounds. It's the little things that made such a difference, like beach chairs, reef friendly sunscreen, chilled water in the lobby but most of all, the incredible customer service which make us highly recommend the Suarfjack. Highly recommend the one bedroom penthouse particularly if you are travelling with a few friends. It is just a wonderful place to stay. I would happily return.

I love this hotel it’s just off the main shopping/tourist strip of Honolulu (Kalakaua Ave) you can walk to Waikiki beach so super easy to get around down town without a car especially at night. The hotel itself is a amazing beautiful place, great great coffee, food, comfy clean quite and cool rooms. All the little extras made it feel so welcoming and relaxing: the filtered water, the sunscreen, being able to borrow quality beach towels, the cookies, cleaned rooms everyday and the best part of all is the lovely friendly staff who could answer any question you have, take your bags, open the car door, wish you a good day and then welcome you back! Also the fact that is an environmental conscious hotel which is a great thing to support! I literally miss it all and can’t wait for any chance to come back!

We loved our stay here, and were sad to leave! We had already stayed for a week on the North Shore at a B&B, with all beach time, so when we got to the Surfjack, we were happy to just chill by the pool (eating their complimentary mac nut cookies yumm!). The pool isn't huge, but it's a boutique hotel so it suits the vibe. The staff were amazing and accomodating. The rooms were super cute, clean, and not modern but up-to-date for most other Waikiki hotel standards. Waikiki is INSANELY busy and our family's food standards are quite high; we were so happy to stay in our little Surfjack oasis, away from the crowds, and eat at Mahina & Sun's. The steak dinner was the best food I've had in Waikiki, and our 8 year old loved their maple waffles for breakfast.

My friend and I stayed here over the weekend and it was PERFECT! The staff is awesome, the coffee shop and little store was awesome! Dinner at Mahina and Suns? Awesome! Location? Awesome! We won’t be staying any where else in Oahu!!!

If you're not hung up on being right on the beach front, the Surfjack is a great alternative. It has been cleverly designed to avoid the big hotel experience where you feel like you could be anywhere in the world once you go inside. The rooms are really comfortable but a bit quirky. The service is consistently good but not ingratiating. The location is super handy. The coffee from the bar at the front door is excellent. Would stay again, for sure.

On our trip to Oahu from The Big Island in February 2017, we stayed at this hotel and were very happy with everything- price, cleanliness, hospitality, etc. this past trip- February 2019 we thought we would stay here again because of how happy we were the first time. We were told we paid online prior to arriving but when we got there we were surprised to find out that we “hadn’t yet paid,” and that the price, which we were told was ~$270 a night, would actually be $400+ for the first night and then $270 a night after that (for what exactly? A view of other buildings or parking garages?!)!! At this point we were too tired to argue, so we grudgingly paid, got our keys, and went upstairs. When we got to our room there was dried (what looked like) vomit on the floor in the bedroom, a dirty shower, and urine on the tile around the toilet!!! All of this, ESPECIALLY for the price, was COMPLETELY UNACCEPTABLE. THEN when you leave they charge you an ADDITIONAL $40+ for parking- for 2 days!!!!!!! We stay in a beautiful place on The Big Island for $217 a night (which is two bedroom, 2 1/2 bathroom, full kitchen and a washer and dryer and free parking), and with staff that genuinely cares about your experience! We understand fully that Oahu is a completely different situation (limited space, etc) from The Big Island, but after going through all this we will never stay at The Surfjack, or recommend it to anyone, again.

The Surfjack is that kind of hotel you do not want to leave again. The people working there make such an effort to make everyone comfortable and at home. Such a nice vibe and charming hotel. We have travelled a lot and stayed at many hotels but The Surfjack is special and I would highly recommend it. Try the restaurant as well.

LOVED The Surfjack!- Great room: nice balcony looking down to the pool, sitting area with couch/tv- Free coffee in mornings which you can't underestimate, plus great coffee shop in lobby to buy morning treats- Super cool, instagram worthy pool. It was never too busy, we were able to easily grab chairs plus poolside drink/food service all day.- Live Music in lobby (I believe most?) nights - at least each night we were there- Service was good, not amazing... we had some wonky issues with our reservation and while it took a little while to figure out, they were able to get it cleared upHotel itself is a 10 or so minute walk down to Waikiki Beach. We loved being a bit away from the action, the hotel has a much more quiet/chill vibe which is exactly the combo we wanted. Plus it was a great price especially for size of room.We spend 2 weeks in Hawaii: Maui and Oahu - at a combo of big resorts, small hotels, small towns, Airbnbs and Surfjack was one of the highlights. Honolulu was an awesome city to explore with great restaurants, cool bars, lots of craft beer, art, and while the beach was also beautiful, we spend maybe a few hours on it given the other spots/resorts we stayed at. We chilled at the pool most mornings, found great brunches/lunches and explored the city in the afternoons. If you're looking for a combo like that, highly recommend The Surfjack!

We would recommend the Surfjack to anyone wanting a very relaxed experience, but also to those who want great in-house entertainment, and the best dining experience we have had anywhere. The food and service at the restaurant downstairs was enjoyed by us and our 2 teenage daughters. I will add a specific restaurant review on Trip Adviser also. We booked 2 double beds and were given a lovely sized corner room with a wrap around balcony. No ocean views, but we went to the beach for that! As the hotel is set back about a block from the main strip of Waikiki, it was certainly more quiet and peaceful than what we have experienced in the past at some of the major hotels. It was an easy walk to everywhere, including the beach (10 minutes walk). The towels and other facilities available for your use were great to have also (included in the facilities tax you pay at the end of your stay by the way - around USD$25 per day- that's the norm in Hawaii). As is the required tipping of at least 15% when dining out, on tours, drivers of cabs and transport etc. and the cleaning of your room in the US. Our room was cleaned beautifully when we requested it (as we were happy to reuse towels etc rather than have the room cleaned daily). We left USD $5.00 for the cleaner each time. Nice to do.The gorgeous staff made us feel so welcome, and nothing was ever a problem for them if we needed any assistance. They were great with local knowledge and advice.NOTE: Budget the tipping into your spending money as it is expected in the USA.I work for an Airline in Australia and have stayed at many hotels, and have been to Hawaii several times over the years, and this experience at the Surfjack was one of the absolute best! Accomodation in Hawaii is expensive, especially due to our AUD, so we also used some frequent flyer points to take a decent amount off our 10 night stay. Be careful when booking to read the reviews, as some older hotels have issue with their showers, hot water, cleaners not cleaning properly, bugs etc. You will find NONE of these issues at the Surfjack. In fact, the shower / water pressure/ bathroom was exceptional and the room cleanliness was fantastic (newer renovated helps too). The rooms have great soundproofing, as we did not hear any noise at all from surrounding rooms.The facilities and pool were great, and the free coffee downstairs at the bar area each morning was excellent (not the weak coffee I was expecting in the US thank goodness!). There was lemon/ lime/ pineapple ice water on tap (and sunscreen dispenser too) downstairs, as well as a HOT WATER dispenser for the occasional Noodle Cup or herbal tea to have in your room if you wanted. The ABC shop and Whalers general store on the corner were so handy too! We could keep a few items in our room fridge for easy snacks so as to save a little money on eating out. The I-Hop family restaurant was convenient for brekky, lunch, dinner or take-out and it was around the corner and inexpensive.We would certainly recommend this lovely little hotel to anyone staying in Hawaii, and thank the staff for making our stay such a fantastic experience. I can see why they receive a 4 1/2 star out of 5 average rating on Trip Adviser! We give them 5 stars!

We've been coming to Surfjack since a few months after they first opened. Our first visit was just to check out the rooms and facilities to see if we wanted to stay there in the future. We were immediately treated like family, shown multiple suites to see their variety, and learned about how the hotel had recently been renovated, their use of local artists and designers, all these things that make it a truly local boutique hotel. We travel from a neighboring island and come to Honolulu often. The only times we haven't stayed at the Surfjack is when we messed up and tried to book a room too late and they were full. The staff is super friendly and always remember us, they've been watching our son grow up and are like a little extended family. It really shows how well they treat their employees that we get to see the same familiar faces every time we go there. I almost hesitated to write this review as we don't want to blow up our favorite spot, but they deserve every good review they can get! Mahalo to our Surfjack Ohana! B, Y and Q!

To be fair, I arrived at 4am from an overnight flight (I paid for the full night, of course), but there was nobody at the 24-hour reception, aside from some drunk people arguing at the entrance. When the receptionist finally came about 10 minutes later, he didn't bother to say hello or apologize for the wait - just "ID and credit card." The room was small. The first day I stayed there I had a "wet paint" sign on my door and on the walls outside of my room, along with carts full of paints and supplies on either side of my door - and no notice that work was going to be done. Bathroom hardly had any room to put toiletries. The pool area is nice and the restaurant is good. In general, the hotel is more Instagram-friendly than it is functional.

We loved our stay at The Surfjack. Our 2bedroom was clean and spacious. The staff was great. We loved Olive & Oliver and all of the employees. Our favorite thing about the Surfjack was the mellow local vibe. This is something that’s getting harder to find in Waikiki. The Surfjack will now be our go to accommodations!

I stayed one night at the Surfjack during a business trip and the whole experience was fantastic!The staff was fantastic, really helpful with my last minute request and extra kind.The rooms were well decorated and comfortable with great little details such as complimentary pins. The bedding was great and the place was really quiet.Downstairs, the restaurant offers a great selection of fresh foods and the now-famous pool is a great place to unwind and enjoy the Hawaiian life!

We chose a one bed suite, which was exactly what we needed for a few days in Waikiki. This property is well designed, good staff and service with an organic on site restaurant and excellent coffee. I highly recommend a stay especially if you like that Palm Springs, mid century styling which is influencing our lives again. Live music every night, good beer and overall a nice place yourself in Waikiki.

Great location, has a great restaurant attached. Pool open till 10pm, free beach towels. Live acoustic music most evenings. Staff are really helpful with local knowledge. We had a one bed suite and I would highly recommend staying here. Can get local buses all over the city for $5.50 a day.

This was not just a hotel stay it was an experience. Great music, atmosphere, food, people, rooms. Very bright and inviting!Teke and Sai were very helpful. Always greeted us and very accommodating! The location is great! When you walk in - you walk into an Oasis...with the pool saying "wish you were here" (not photo-shopped!) hard to believe the hustle and bustle right outside the door. It is about a 2-3 block walk to the ocean however, you can do some great shopping and eating along the way! Or go the other way for a nice quiet jog or walk along the canal.Details - This place thought of many little details. Live music... even at breakfast! You can only use the elevator with your key card (great security), light switch at bed, Shower with optional hand held, automatic closet lights, USB ports, free bag to use for shopping, beach etc., free pool towels, free ocean friendly sunscreen around pool, free fruit flavor infused water. VERY Earth friendly mindset. Love it!***GREAT New Years Party!!*** We and our college aged kids had so much fun!We came from camping on the N. Shore and were embarrassed with our van loaded with camping STUFF. They were so down to earth... helped us unload everything and brought it to our room. Thanks Teke and Sai and the rest of the staff! We'll be back!Aloha!

From valet staff to front desk to service, it was a warm welcoming atmosphere!!! The one bedroom suite was so beautiful and romantic. Beautiful detailing throughout to really make it feel like home away from home!!! Well worth every penny and can’t wait to visit again and stay no where else except THE SURF JACK!!

My sister-in-law, sister and I thought it would be great to have a girls getaway. We chose Surfjacks because it had good reviews but was pretty cost-effective for a two bedroom suite (#635). One bedroom has a king bed, the other has a queen bed and the living room has a comfy couch that also has a fold-out bed.If you've gotten this far, you'll know that Surfjacks is not on the beach, and it is a walk to the beach. It's a very easy walk that takes 5-10 minutes. In the morning, we'd get coffee from Oliver + Oliver downstairs (although, there is free coffee at the restaurant, Mahina & Sun's, I prefer espresso) and bring it upstairs to the room to get ready. Walk down to Cheeseburgers for breakfast (e.g. fruitbowl, eggs on toast and mimosas - simple stuff) then head to the beach - easy.Surfjacks is also a "retro-fitted" motel - so all entrances to rooms are from the outside. The rooms are slightly tighter than I was expecting, but really, you don't spend a lot of time in the rooms - so they're great for sleeping, getting ready and unwinding. Each room is lent a canvas beach bag which is handy. Our room had two small private balconies, which was nice, but looked into the apartments across the way. However, we used this area to dry our flower crowns, bathing suits, etc as most of the time, we were either by the pool or out and about.The motel has a great, relaxed vibe. The entry is open air and goes freely into the pool area, cafe, restaurant and lounging areas. The pool is absolutely iconic. It is not heated so can be chilly if it's been in the shade. It's more refreshing than off-putting. On Saturday nights, they play movies above the pool which is great atmosphere for drinks and a chat. During other times, they have heaps of live music that sets the tone. These don't go too late as the bar closes at 9:30pm.The staff are super-friendly and helpful. They're awesome, and definitely infuse the aloha.The place is hip. There were plenty of beautiful people taking selfies, and insta photos - but not so hip that it's exclusive or uncomfortable.The only downside is the lack of amenities like a gym. They do lend you bikes (which we didn't use), and you can do wee laps in the pool. ;)

This small hotel seems very hip and stylish, with plenty of attractive areas for lounging. The building wraps around a courtyard, and once you enter the premises you are sheltered from the busy city. There's an interesting restaurant and bar on the premises as well as a coffee house and gift store, free fruit-infused water, reef-safe sunscreen, and mellow live music many nights. The pool is lovely and a great place to swim or lounge around in the heat of the day. The room itself was quiet and cool, with a small balcony where you can sit outside or dry your swimsuit. I especially appreciated the staff, who are genuinely friendly and personable as well as helpful. My only complaint would be that sometimes there were too many kids in the pool, splashing and screaming, which made adult lounging less pleasant. I wish there were an adults-only pool time during the day, as there is at night.

Perfect location with a Hawaiian vibe despite the commercial and crowded Waikiki. A delicious boutique hotel where everyone is embracing the Aloha spirit. Rooms are quite small but very nice designed. The shop, specialty coffee, and Mahina and Suns restaurant from inside are a plus.

This was my second time staying at the SurfJack and the experience was not like the first. The rug in the room smelled moldy and the bed was not as comfortable as I remembered. I was there on business which is typically the reason I stay in Waikiki and had a busy schedule otherwise I would have spent the time expressing my concerns to the staff. I love the location of the SurfJack and the overall style but I feel the rooms could be elevated more. The pool was really cold for January too.

From the friendly service to the location to the rooms, everything about this place was wonderful. The Surfjack staff truly embodies the Aloha lifestyle as everybody was so friendly and willing to help. My wife and I picked this place to celebrate our honeymoon after an awful AirBNB experience. We were very impressed with the champagne bottle waiting for us on our arrival.Olive and Oliver for your morning coffee and Mahina and Suns for your food. You never know what celebrity you'll run into at this place.The beach is minutes away, as well as the main strip. A 15 min walk will get you to any major attraction.We are definitely staying here on our next trip. Valet is the only parking available so expect about $35USD/Day.

We loved staying here! I'm hesitant to tell more people about it. Waikiki can feel overwhelming and touristy. This place is a reprieve from what is just outside. The cocktails are worth mentioning so yummy! I think this is best for couples but there were hip young families staying too!

I would definitely come back and stay at the Surfjack again. We started off with a bit of a hiccup with the room we were put in initially but the issue got resolved.The highlights of the property are the small design touches from the ‘wish you were here’ pool to some smaller pieces of art. Having the Olive & Oliver coffee shop of site is a real bonus too for some delicious espresso coffee.Our room was generously sized.
