It was nice having some complementary snacks in the room and things like free reef safe sunscreen available. While we didn’t make use of them, the free bikes are a nice touch.

My teenaged kids stayed here recently with their grandparents. They thoroughly enjoyed their stay at this updated hotel. The staff were so nice and helpful including when my mom hurt herself (far from the hotel) and needed assistance getting back to her room. Can't say enough about the warm welcome and excellent customer service at this hotel. We are definitely planning another stay there!

I love staying at the Surfjack for my business trips to Honolulu. Every time, everything about our stay is just PERFECT! From the moment we arrive, we are treated like family, are well taken care of, and are instantly comfortable. The absolutely DELISH food and drink at Mahina & Suns is the icing on the cake! Thank you!

Took a trip to Oahu with 2 other couples traveling with us. We all had a pleasant stay at the Surfjack - staff was readily available to help, rooms were quiet, and the hotel was walking distance to Waikiki hot spots. Free local drip coffee was available in the lobby each morning as well as free beach chair and towel rentals, which we took advantage of almost every day. The only downside was the lack of a gym, but the hotel offers bikes for rent or you can just do what we did and take a lovely jog along the beach. Special shout-out to Channy-Lyn!! My husband and I were celebrating a special occasion and she helped make it super memorable for us. It's the small, personable things that really stand out to us, and she really showed that she cared. Thanks again, Channy-Lyn!

We stayed at the Surfjack for six nights in a two bedroom suite with our two teenagers over the Christmas holiday. I am not a big fan of huge commercial hotels and this boutique hotel was a great fit for us. Thoughtful appointments in the rooms and common areas of the hotel - lounge areas behind front desk and around the pool, ice water with tropical fruit, reef friendly sunscreen, barista and souvenir shop, towels and chairs for the beach and bikes were all included in our stay. Bikes could use a little maintenance but served our purposes just fine. Staff were knowledgeable and friendly and very accommodating on every level. Great location right in downtown Waikiki, walking distance from beach and shops and food. Everything is expensive in Oahu this time of year so it wasn't cheap, but it was good value. Also liked the consciousness about minimizing waste and protecting the environment and they could do more by adding refillable dispensers in the showers for body wash, shampoo and conditioner. I also think they should give you the tote bag to take home as a keepsake and for marketing purposes. Would stay there again for sure.

The Surfjack was everything we wanted it to be and more. Great facilities, great staff and great coffee. I can’t recommend this place enough. We will be back to Waikiki and won’t consider anywhere else!Special shout out to Sai! He looked after us and gave so much love to my little boy Jude - pictured below. Thanks Sai, you made this a really memorable trip for my family! Nick.

The staff at the Surf jack was consistently warm, helpful, and fun! The rooms are on the small side, as is the pool, but there are some thoughtful details that you don't usually find at a mid-priced hotel here. I loved free bicycles, beach chairs, and canvas tote bags available to borrow. Lewers is a nice street -- off the hubbub of the main drags, and quiet at night, but an easy walk or bike to all of Waikiki. We were two adult friends sharing a room for four nights and we slept really well at the Surfjack. i would stay here again. It's a cute hotel and a great value.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Surfjack and would definitely stay there again. Great location and proximity to all we needed, yet quiet at night. Loved the beach chairs on offer and used them regularly as it's only a short walk to the Beach. The pool area is great, lovely vibe, relaxing cool music. We enjoyed their regular nightly entertainment from local singling artists to local artisan markets. Dined in house too and food was delicious and can easily vouch for the Aperol Spritz's we enjoyed daily...The staff were all very friendly and accommodating and added to the overall experience. Best coffee at Olive & Oliver coffee shop in the lobby!Will definitely be back!

The hotel was amazing. As soon as we arrived we could feel a warm sense of Aloha. From the valet, front desk clerks to the housekeepers, everyone we met was very nice and welcoming. Our room was very clean and we liked all the personal touches which made us feel like home. The pool is small but very inviting with the words “wish you were here” written across the bottom. We had breakfast in the restaurant twice, and had the same waiter each morning. When he found out we were returning Locals, he extended a special local rate. He was very friendly and the food was really good. The hotel is centrally located in Waikiki. Coffee shop right next door made it very convenient. We came back to Hawaii for a very special event. My moms 90th surprise birthday party. Staying at the Surfjack was a pleasant surprise. Would we come back to this hotel? Definitely!

Great hotel .Smaller budget type hotel but full of atmosphere and fun. Friendly staff made this hotel even more emjoyable. Excellently situated. Short walk to the main street of Waikiki with all its attractions. Great for couples and also families. Cannot say enough good about this hotel

This is a great hotel....very clean and staff very friendly and helpful. Within walking distance of beach and many restaurants and shops. They provide beach chairs for your use. There is entertainment by the pool every evening. Very good experience for our first visit to paradise!

From the minute we arrived, we received excellent service. We were seated for check-in and offered a speciality coffee or pineapple juice. Our bags were delivered to our room. The buildings surround a small pool, in an outdoor courtyard. There was musical entertainment every night. We ate dinner at the restaurant and it was delicious. They arranged shuttles for us to Pearl Harbour and the airport-much nicer and cheaper than a taxi. The staff definitely goes the extra mile. Great location, a few blocks from the beach. Close to ABC stores. Highly recommend this hotel!!

Best boutique hotel ever! I’m local n really enjoyed coming back n playing tourist! Great restaurant and love the local flair! I really wanted to listen to Hawaiian music n Friday Eve Jeff Rasmussen was my wish come true!

This is our second staycation, and we can't wait for our next chance to head on down to the Surfjack. The staff are all so kind, the daily music supports and showcases our local talent, Mahina and Son's is so 'ono, and there commitment to caring for our 'aina is consistent in so many ways. Mahalo nui!

I am not sure why this place gets such high ratings. I equate the quality to a freeway side Hotel 6. Staff were attentive and helpful but things fall down from there. I booked based on pix of the room with all the windows, massive outdoor deck and reviews. The one bedroom penthouse we got did not have the corner windows/sliders as in the pix- one slider with a narrow walkway to patio. Patio did deliver. Room was moldy/musty smelling (bringing back smelly Hotel 6 memories from my college days). Carpet in bedroom was wet so perhaps they had just shampooed, but add the poorly functioning ac and we decided within 15 mins we were moving. Credit to the staff who tried to fix ac right away and once we made our decision, made the cancellation of remaining 4 nights easy (we thought it was fair to stay one night, now I think we shoulda' just left).After picking up rental car called to inquire about parking and could barely hear because of blaring music. At arrival desk staff informed me they blast concert loud music in the pool every fricking day from 12-4. The front desk lady and I had to yell in each others' ears to hear each other during check in - cannot imagine how anyone finds this acceptable, including staff. It sounded like a frat party; surprisingly there were some 40+ folks hanging around so we thought there must be something more and agreed to go upstairs. Beware elevator does not go to penthouse floor, but staff will help, which of course costs a couple bucks for the tip. The pictures make this place look amazing. As we walked down the hallways and looked around a bit, I couldn't help but think this was a poorly executed flip done by some novice flippers. Done correctly with more $, they could have knocked it out of the park.  Note, I usually stay at the Trump (or like properties) so my bar may be too high for the surfjack. The Trump hotel is where I called and for $100 more a night I got a oceanfront view from the 23rd floor..with double the square footage, modern, clean and top notch service. If you have low expectations and can get rooms close to 200 or less a night, you may be satisfied. If you are a frequent traveler and appreciate Hyatt Place or higher standards you should avoid the surfjack.

I have been following this boutique hotel on social media for a few years and finally got the chance to stay in Nov 2018. It did not disappoint...from our gracious greeting by Chris upon our late arrival to the delicious cortado we had at Olive and Oliver before leaving, I am smitten. Okay, I am partial to thoughtfully designed, smallish hotels. Our room was terrific - spacious, bright, well appointed with terrific mid century modern touches and high quality bathroom amenities (shampoo, conditioner, etc.). We enjoyed sunset from our balcony. The complementary cookies were delicious. Seriously! Bed was large and comfortable (as was the fab sofa)...only small complaint I have is about the bed pillows. I feel like Goldilocks and the three bears: one pillow was too low/soft, one too artificially spudgy. I think a pillow menu might be too much to ask though! Breakfast at Mahina and Sun’s was tasty (avocado toast and poached egg) with attentive, friendly service. And a nice selection of local hot sauces. Complementary coffee in the morning from the lobby bar was a nice touch.Public spaces are unique and comfortable with lots of commissioned art including staff uniforms.I liked the location...it’s not on the beach nor main drag, so quiet but everything is accessible in 5 mins.I will return to this hotel if I return to Oahu.

Great location. Central to shops and restaurants. Less than a 10 minute walk to the beach! Pool has live entertainment daily. Sai, krystle and ken very accommodating for late flight! Highly recommend!

The location is excellent and the staff is great and personable. However, both remotes for the tv's didn't work and had to be changed out. Also, we were turned off when a roach crawled down the bathroom wall. Lastly the doors squeaked very loudly waking up the kids at night.

This was more than a place to stay, it’s an experience. It’s full retro Hawaii vibes. Best value for money right in the heart off Waikiki. Great rooms, very clean, pool A1, all staff amazing (thanks Chris). The live music on the weekends/weeknights an added bonus, the cafe (great coffee) and restaurant onsite were amazing. Great home base to explore the island and only a short stroll to the main Waikiki beach.

The staff offered excellent service. Car is available within minutes of request. Walking past the big chain hotels, queue for check in/ check out, valet parking looked very chaotic. Surfjack offered a really relaxed atmosphere. After checking out, they offered us a hospitality room where we can shower and rest before our late flight.The location is very convenient to all the shops and restaurants. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Came in town from Kealakekua, Big Island to meet up with some family. The place was cool, but not as cool as their ad photos (good for ad guy). I nicked my right shin on the bed board around the frame and got ended up with a bad case of Cellulitis. 3 nights in the Kona Community Hospital then my leg elevated for and additional 2 weeks. I really did not think about complaining until I received this solicitation from the them. I did not contact them while on Oahu because i did not think it was going to blow the way it did.

I think it was about 2 years ago when we came to this hotel and we've never looked back. The staff is amazing, the aesthetic of the hotel is seamless and the opposite of stuffy, and being from Kauai, we feel relaxed enough during our staycation without losing the 'home' vibe. Can't say enough, you won't be disappointed.

Just returned from an 8 day trip to Oahu and I must say the surfjack was our highlight of our trip. The location is great and you walk to anything around Waikiki. From the moment we arrived we were greeted by polite and friendly employees. Hands down the best part of the hotel was the live music every night! Few drinks from the bar and listening to live music we were in full relaxation mode.Cannot wait to return! They do need better sígnage outside for valet. We had to drive around the block a few times because we missed the small unmarked valet desk.

My wife and I booked a condominium from VRBO from the beautiful pictures they posted online. We arrived in Honolulu on our Anniversary late around 1030 due to our flight running behind. Therefore, everyone was gone for the night. I checked into our room and noticed the heat and major rust all over the frig! The tv’s look like monitors, our bed was sinking in the middle, the internet was so bad I had to shut off our WiFi on our phones and The room and blankets smelled terrible really old and stale. It was 74 degrees on the thermostat! I turned it as low as possible, no change! I call for help and I get “we are closed for the evening” please called back. My wife and I are from Alaska, 74degree is like a 100 to us! All night we were miserable no sleep at all and we cannot open the windows or curtains because our bed was facing the walkway to the elevator. I did not want anyone to see up sleeping and plus it was just as hot outside. Got up that Morning before nine to keep from getting my car towed (no parking). After leaving voicemails the night before we left the hotel and made a few calls, no answer so we made another call finally someone called us back and said they were going to send a maintenance guy he showed up two hours later still didn’t fix the problem then came while we were out and plugged in AAC portable unit . We returned and it was off so I turned it on and left again for another hour driving around enjoying the AC. Came back to the condominium and it was 73 degrees this time. I called the person listed again. Keep in mind I am speaking with different people each time. I said this is not what I paid for please refund me or prorate the room so I can find another hotel. The employee said let me check with management. Two hours go by so I send an email to the company asking the same thing. Couple of hours later I get an email reply back saying we are going to refund you for your entire stay, which was 14 days and I would have to wait 10 days. I then call the Surfjack Hotel and spoke with a remarkable young woman called Tasi. She was very helpful and quick! She understood our situation and provided my wife and me with an out. Therefore, we booked one of her beautiful rooms that had a large flat screen tv in the bed room and an even larger tv in the living room. The room was so cold that we felt like we were back home in Alaska. We did not want to leave the room it was so nice. Nevertheless, we did on occasion in order to enjoy the great food downstairs in the restaurant, great drinks at the bar downstairs and a dip in the pool located in the center of the hotel. Not to mention the valet and the front desk, greeted my wife and I every single time we came or left the hotel with a wonderful “aloha spirit”! I was so pleased with their superb customer service that I tipped the valet, bartenders, waiters, and the sweet woman who cleaned our room each morning “every time” I saw them. We love Surfjack hotel and now it is our new spot. As a matter fact, I will bring my three kids, my granddaughter and my wife in August for an important assembly. We’ll book one of their three bedrooms at that time so that our family that live in Hawaii can come and stay and we can enjoy each other’s company for the entire week that we are there. Mahalo “SurfJack” for giving the Gaines Couple an Awesome 21st Anniversary!!!

The service was excellent had no problem w service. The people at the hotel was very nice, service was excellent, housekeeping also was excellent, first time staying at this hotel. And I would stay at it again, yes service, people that work there the way they greet and treat the people is what draws them back, the rooms were superb the only thing my husband didn't like was the bed for him and me it was too hard had a back ache, but everything else was superb, thank you again to this hotel with an awesome staff being a local person, quality service is number 1 and that's what this hotel is i recommend it to everyone especially our locals this is the kind of service we want yes thank you. U all gave made my anniversary stay superb and also your pool people restaurants thank you. From : us pogi's

My family and I just stayed at the SurfJack hotel and it was one of the best hotel to stay on this island. Not only is it affordable but it has a beautiful decor with a really nice cozy pool that our kids enjoyed very much. Our room was fresh, clean, comfortable, beautiful, not to mention the view from the balcony, it was awesome. Everyone, all the staff there was amazing from the valet to the front desk to the housekeepers, everyone was so pleasant and helpful and caring. I fully recommend this hotel to everyone and we looking forward to our next staycation here. Thank the Surfjack hotel for making our staycation relaxing and memorable...

Such a great spot - loved the decor and style of the rooms and hotel. They had live music at night by the pool, bikes for us to use during the day. The pool is awesome, great food at the restaurant and coffee bar is a real treat! I can’t say enough good things! The staff were lovely - they treated us so well! Would love to go back asap! Thank you Surfjack!

Reasonably priced, friendly staff, great restaurant and things like a little cafe, live music, hotel bikes and activities to dip into. Nice to stay just away from the Waikiki strip. Families and kids descend on the hotel during the weekend so beware - kids and pools = screaming. My only gripe is the sickly “Surfrider Scent” that they pump throughout the lobby and wet towel smell so often found in beach hotels.

I have stayed at the Surfjack two time. Once for my bachelorette party in September 2017 and last weekend. I love everything about this hotel. The staff is incredibly friendly and accommodating. The rooms are adorably decorated. I recommend The Surfjack to anyone looking for a place to stay in Waikiki

Awesome service, location & atmosphere. My only problems were (we were in room 442) the bed & the pillows are not very comfortable, so we didn’t sleep very well. The water pressure from the main shower head is not great at all for such a beautiful shower, and it leaks of out of the bottom of the door around the toilet so we had to pile towels up to prevent it from flooding! Those are easy fixes and it wasn’t enough to turn our experience into a bad one. We will be back. Lovely housekeepers who are very thorough in their cleaning standards, thank you for a lovely first time in Hawaii.

We were very satisfied with this hotel. The location was close to the main shoppingstreet and the beach. Free coffe and tea all day, and calm and relaxing atmosphere at the pool. It was top service in the reseption and all employees were very serviceminded and helpful.

We just checked out after 2 nights at the SurfJack hotel and we loved it. It’s a very cute and ready boutique hotel in the middle of the Waikiki madness. The staff was very friendly and welcoming!! We had a couple of minor things happen, and they were very responsive and helpful!! We had a 2 bedroom and found it to be spacious and perfect for us. We were two couples traveling together. The restaurant, Mahina and Sons, is absolutely delicious!! We LOVED it!! The adobo fried rice at breakfast was so good!! The pool area was a super chill place to hang out! We we’re on Oahu for the Bruno Mars concert and we’re surprised when the hotel had a Bruno Mars Rum tasting event!!I LOVED all of the little details at this hotel!! The retro Hawaiian decor and the little extra touches make this the perfect place for me!! We will definitely be back!!!!

if you are looking for something more than your standard Waikiki hotel...you will find it right here. In a great spot...close to everything...retro rooms and pool area. But what makes it are the staff. They go out of their way to make sure you are having a great time.After an initial issue (twin beds on a honeymoon was never going to work!!) they couldn't have been nicer about it...and upgraded us for the remainder of our stay. Would definitely recommend to friends...and we will definitely return.

My husband and i stayed here for 3 nights. We had a great time! The staff was so friendly and willing to help us out with every need. We would definitely stay here again! Absolutely LOVED it here.yay!

Nice, quiet location. Kids get to swim until 5pm. Free surf safe sunscreen. Near a bus stop, 2 convenience stores. Great morning coffee, beach chair, beach towel. Pool is small. Decor feels like a beach-chalet.

A really easy and well positioned hotel for a family break. In the midst of it all but still small and personal. A great restaurant (but make sure you book as it’s really busy). Rooms well set out and staff very helpful.

Fabulous. Had a 3 bedroom suite, we requested a microwave and crib, got it. Crib was free of charge, whereas other hotels usually charge for it.Little things matter and made the stay so enjoyable. - free cold water in lobby to fill up your water bottle- free sunscreen in lobby- towels, tote bag, beach chairs included to take to beach - friendly staff all around: front desk, valets, cleaners- Best part: we had a late flight back home, they gave us a hospitality room after check out free of charge, which was so helpful, especially since we had a baby- great location- tea/ coffee in the morning- feels more personal than the other hotels The only downside: we found the parking a bit costly. Not sure how it compares to other hotels.

Love love love the Surfjack! Awesome retro boutique hotel in the heart of Waikiki. The vibe in the place is so cool. The staff are all so friendly and caring. The food at the restaurant is awesome. And the rooms are way cool.

The hotel is within easy walking distance of Waikiki beach and shops but it is a basic hotel. The pool isn't large and if you arrive before check-in you will need to change in toilets which pretty ordinary.There is also a service fee and if your not eating at the resturant onsite or grabbing a coffee $25.00 per day is steep just for WiFi access.

Stayed here for the first week of our holiday. Hotel is nice and small compared to the monsters Waikiki have. Reception staff and valet service were nice and attentive. Rooms are clean and modern. Limited storage space, bedrooms only have a bed and two side tables in it. Had to live out of our suitcases as there wasn’t enough space for the four of us sharing a two bedded suite. No coffee making facilities in the rooms, however unlimited coffee is available from the bar which was great. Pool area is small but clean. Restaurant served Hawaiian cuisine with a twist, it was very nice but the fussy eaters of the family struggled with the small menu. Hotel hosts daily evening entertainment, which can be heard from the bedrooms due to the layout of the hotel. It’s particularly noisy on the weekend, I’m not sure if it would be suitable if I was travelling with small people. Overall I am pleased to have stayed here, it was a good start to the holiday.

Firstly, this hotel is overpriced for the quality of service and facilities. The manager had the attitude of a dive bar bouncer rather than a hospitality manager. They also do not allow guests to take food or beverage out of their rooms so that they can force guests to patronize their bar at the hotel pool. Drinks were about $12 each which is fine for Waikiki but they are served in a small paper coffee cup that was no more that 10 oz. The room was not clean: there was rust and soap residue on the shower door, mildew in shower, and dried food particle caked to the sink counter. The hotel vibe is very hip and charming but management seems to be more in the business of running a bar than providing good guest experience. I would never stay at the Surfjack again and I would recommend that others choose a more modern hotel near the beach that is hospitality focused. For $250 a night, you can find much better.

We stayed two nights at Surfjack at the end of a 3 week holiday and I wish it had been longer! They've done a gorgeous refurb/fitout that gives the whole place a funky, relaxed vibe.We ate both breakfasts and one dinner at the semi-alfresco restaurant in the hotel (Mahina and Sun's) which was delicious food with really friendly and fun servers.Olive and Oliver is a gorgeous cafe / boutique just off reception and the coffee there is diviiine (I'm a Melbourne coffee snob).The pool area is like a little oasis and you feel far away from the hustle and bustle.It was nice to stay at a smaller place rather than the big chain skyscraper hotels, it definitely had more personality and I would go back in a heartbeat.

This small hotel has the most remarkable employees. Our 2nd stay was even more amazing with "ALOHA" practiced by each and every employee we came in contact with. I am dazed.... in a good way... that a place like this even exists within this price range. It is an easy drive from the hotel to the Queens Hospital. There is a nice Irish Bar within walking distance that has live music nightly.

This was a bit of a letdown, after having seen all the great reviews: To start off with the Elephant in the room, our room had a very strong moldy for smell in the living room area, making it a pain to remain there without opening the window; generally speaking, the hotel did not make a clean impression, there was a little bit of mold in the shower, and stains on the ceiling; also the bed was a bit too soft and the mattress quite worn; otherwise the room was actually quite alright: good equipment (good tv sets, usb chargers, safe, fridge), stylish design (although terribly lit), decent water pressure in the shower; the common areas are quite nice to look at, but the noise from the pool area resonates in the rooms (we were on an elevated floor); staff was very friendly and forthcoming, no complaints in that area; given we paid more than USD 200 per night, made me consider an even lower rating, since this is definitely not what I would have expected for this price category (a 2 felt too harsh but it is close, I would say 2 and a half); we tried another, cheaper hotel on our last night in Waikiki, which was way better; would certainly not return...

The hotel is so beautiful; like to be on a 70’s movie. Its open air but if you like it theres AC. The front desk girl it was so lovely. My room is so nice, the rest down stairs is delicious and you will be just 5min walking to the nicest shopping area. ABAOLUTLY LOVE THIS HOTEL

We arrived late at night and were warmly welcomed and congratulated about being on our honeymoon! And sent a bottle of champagne to the room for us enjoy. Everything was explained to us. The hotel has a resort fee but here you feel like are actually getting something for it. WiFi, beach towels/umbrellas, bike hireand sun protection and a bag. Free tea and coffee from the bar (as it’s not in the room) and a $10 credit for the restaurant for each night stay(that you can accumulate). The hotel is a short walk from the beach and posh shops in the center of town. So it’s very convenient. We walked to the Aloha Moana Mall (30Mins) and used their bikes to cycle to Diamond Head. We had a bungalow (odd description for a high rise room) which had a lounge and bedroom. I choose Surfjack because I didn’t want to stay as a generic hotel. The design of the hotel rooms and the rest of the hotel as so unique giving it great personality. The amenities where top quality and the room was spotless. I loved the signature scent. Such attention to details. The service doesn’t let it down either be it the staff serving breakfast who where fun and informative giving us ideas on what to do. Or the guy who issued us with our bikes to the chap that looked after our luggage. They were all so happy to help and so natural about it too. They are a credit to you. The hotel is part of the community which I do like (see their Facebook page) as we saw some yoga classes taking place, and live music by the pool. Which may put some guests off, as it’s not too big around the pool so can seem to take over. So if you are looking for a carefree stay in Honolulu with unique atmosphere and vibe stay here you won’t be disappointed. Thanks for making our stay such a memorable one. We hope to return one day.

My dad and I were travelling from New York City to Australia for work, and at the last minute we decided to do a 2 day layover in Honolulu to try to break up the trip and so we could arrive rested. I read about Surfjack in an article about now hotels in Hawaii and we booked it because it looked fun and wasn't too expensive. I was a little nervous, since my dad is a total snob, but I didn't want to spend a fortune on this layover. SURFJACK WAS THE HIGHLIGHT OF OUR ENTIRE TRIP! From the minute we stepped into the lobby we were overwhelmed by how great this place was. The lobby smelled amazing, the staff couldn't have been nicer, the design was fabulous, the rooms were ready when we arrived and everything made you smile. The food at the restaurant is delicious and at night they project old movies onto the wall over the pool. It's a magical place that we didn't want to leave. My dad was so obsessed with this place that he bought a Surfjack tote bag that he now uses every day :) In fact, after a week in Australia, we had a 4 hour layover in Hawaii on our way back... and we hopped in a cab to Surfjack so we could have lunch and go for a swim there. When we walked in, the whole staff remembered us (they even remembered our lunch orders!) and made us feel so welcomed and at home. All of our other hotels on this trip were proud to be "5 STAR LUXURY HOTELS"... but Surfjack was FAR AND AWAY our favorite hotel. It's quirky but fabulous.
user_name:
Tess M
New York City, New York

review_body: Rocked up here at half 9 off the cruise boat expecting to dump luggage but our room was ready which was a bonus. Unfortunately whilst waiting they gave us a drink, No milk for our coffee despite asking and then no stirrer for the sweeteners given so lacking detail a little. Our room /suite was good size and excellent air con. It did have a bit of a 'drainy' smell when we first checked in which we then didn't notice on subsequent days- perhaps there is a bit f a back flow problem if the sink and shower aren't being used daily?? The staff were helpful with advice for taxis and restaurants etc,There is a daily club charge for swim towels which we were told could be used against any purchase at the bar /restaurant- however when we cam to check out this then was not used against our purchase at the bar. As it was only $20 we didn't argue but perhaps that is the plan rather than another error???

This year our Ohana celebrated many milestones. My husband and celebrated our 35th Anniversary, his 60th, our son's 30th and our daughter's engagement. Since I once lived on the island many years ago I wanted my kids first experience on the island to be a memorable one. Choosing Surf Jack was the best decision we made! From the minute we pulled up the valet staff greeted us warmly each morning and evening. As did the front desk and Sai took excellent care of us giving us the best room and Robbie made sure we had everything we needed everyday. Our Imelda kept our room in excellent condition daily. The food was amazing in the restaurant, the entertainment they provide each night makes you want to stay in and never leave but best of all the love and warmth of the staff including Tiki, Darian, Marshall, Mahina and Krystle just to name a few all made us feel like Ohana. This is exactly what my kids got to experience what this island is all about true Ohana feeling at Surf Jack:). I call this hotel a "Gem" in Waikiki and I hated to leave but look forward to returning one day soon to my Surf Jack Ohana! Much Aloha!

The Surfjack is a great little boutique hotel with hip vibes, great style and excellent food and beverage service. All the employees are super friendly and the service is excellent throughout. The décor in the rooms is very cool and they're quite comfortable and very clean as well.

This hotel is located in the perfect area, with great service and friendly staff. Super cute design and fair pricing. Loved the restaurant and all of the programming. Lots of amenities and the room was clean.
user_name:
amydadi
New York City, New York

review_body: I just came back from 5 nights at The Surfjack celebrating a special birthday with 4 other friends. The hotel was fantastic, the decor was gorgeous, the little additional amenities appreciated and the staff so very friendly and helpful. It was the perfect base for us and the 3 bedroom suite was great. Highly recommend the restaurant and especially the Bloody Mary’s are the best we have ever tried. Nothing was too difficult for the staff and they were so helpful with advice, making bookings at other establishments and just always smiling. Very impressed with the management meeting we witnessed one morning with all staff looking genuinely happy to be there Would definetly stay again and would recommend to families, groups etc

We planned a happy hour event with the Surfjack hotel in October of 2018, and could not have had a better experience. We hosted 120-150 people in the outdoor area of the Surfjack, and in addition to the space, the hotel provided the food, drinks, and (amazing!) live music. All event attendees were absolutely abuzz with how incredible every element was - and this is truly because of the amazing work that Natalie, Jordyn, Ross, and the entire staff of the Surfjack did in planning and running the event. No detail was left uncovered, and their attentiveness before and during the event was unparalleled. Also, the vibe of this hotel is absolutely incredible. Highly recommended for an event, but I'm also dying to stay there myself!

We spent time in an old school experience Hawaii hotel, a private resort, a major chain resort and the Surfjack. Great vibe, service, food and location. if we hadn't been so focused on beach time we would choose this hotel for our main base camp.

初ハワイ3世代旅行の前半に4泊しました。街中の便利な場所にあり、どこへ行くにも便利でした。お部屋はリビングルームのついた部屋で夜みんなで団欒したり、ご飯を食べたりもしやすくまるで自宅のように過ごせました。センスの良い家具やファブリックが良かったです。何よりも到着した瞬間からホテルのスタッフさん達が温かく迎えてくださり、感動しました。ジョークを言ったり、子どもと遊んでくれたりして、2日目くらいからはSAIさんというスタッフさんは子どもの名前も覚えてくださっていて、出かける時や帰ってくる時に、いってらっしゃい〜的な感じで子どもを名前で呼んでくれました。初ハワイでの1番の印象は色々な場所で地元の方が優しくしてくださったことですが、このホテルのスタッフさんたちも皆さん良い方ばかりでした。後半はこちらのホテルと比較するとグレードの高いホテルに泊まりましたが、アットホームさやオシャレ感では負けていないと思います。特に自宅のように過ごしたい方はぜひこのホテルをおススメします。またいつかハワイに行く時は利用したいです。Thank you,Sai and Krystle!!I enjoyed staying at this hotel sooo much!See you again!

We stayed at Surfjack for our honeymoon in early October. We had a penthouse suite with a huge lanai looking over the city. Although the pool area was small, it was very comfortable and was not super busy. The restaurant attached had great food and the staff was very accommodating and seemed to thoroughly love their jobs! The location is very convenient to the beach and shopping as well. I would definitely recommend checking out this boutique hotel and would love to stay here again. Thank you Surfjack staff!

Everything about this place is great! The service is always so friendly & relaxed but still very attentive.The location is perfect for all beach and urban activities, that is if you feel the need to peel yourself away from the super comfy sun loungers, poolside service & perfect atmosphere! We love this place!

I went to a Summer Pool Party at the Surfjack and won a free night stay there. I paid for another night to make a weekend of it, and it was the best decision ever. My son and I live here----but don't ever get to stay in Waikiki!! The best part was that the Surfjack has dog friendly rooms, so we got to bring our puppy to stay with us there!!!! We had a blast----the dog friendly rooms are awesome with a full kitchen. True---they are on the side of the hotel near a bar----but could not really hear them with the AC on. We had a great time---and the puppy was even allowed to hang at the pool with us----he had a blast :). I love this hotel---they had great music playing by the pool both nights we were there. A great restaurant on property----and tons more in walking distance. They had room to store our surfboards so did not have to take them up to our room. Also, there was a parade in Waikiki on Saturday morning and the hotel gave us chairs to take down and watch----awesome. It was a Memory making weekend for my son and I for sure. Already planning to do it again.

The service at Surfjack was fantastic. Thank to Management & Staff for making our stay so wonderful they treated us like we were family.We were there for my daughter's 40th Birthday & thank you so much for her birthday cake what a surprise. My room was lovely clean & restaurant at Surfjack amazing food.I could go on forever about Surfjack just amazing boutique hotel.I would recommend Surfjack.

I was pleasantly surprised with the level of service we received at this establishment. We arrived on an early flight from Australia and as soon as we arrived they sat us the foyer couches and offered us some coffee while they were checking us in. After such a long flight i was afraid that they wouldn't be able to give us our room as it was too early but the girls at the reception managed to check us in promptly. We booked a 2 bedroom room with a large Lanai(balcony) and we would seat there at night and drink some weather. Ofcourse the weather would be divine at night. The rooms were clean and spacious for the 4 of us and they have a $10 credit per day to the Mahina and Sun lounge. Which was a great bonus. The food at that restaurant is divine. The hotel is also not too far from the beach and its about minutes walk to the main strip. We didn't need a car for the duration of the stay since it was a walking distance. Very good location. I will definitely be back. The staff is very friendly and amazing to talk too because they go above and beyond to make your stay comfortable.

It was awesome! The Surfjack upgraded our room and surprised us with champagne because it was our honeymoon. They accommodated an early check in. Cool vibe. Neat decor. Comfortable and clean. Staff were all very friendly. Manager Sai was all around great.

My husband and I came to Oahu for a week to celebrate my birthday and stayed at the Surfjack for 3 nights. The hotel was just as cute as it was in the pictures and I just fell in love with the style. There were so many amenities and each staff member was personable and genuine about helping you. We would definitely stay here again and highly recommend to anyone

My friend and I absolutely loved staying at the Surfjack. The room was amazing (we found out at the time of check-in that we had been upgraded - such a treat!), the staff was kind and attentive, the hotel was beautiful, the bed was comfortable... I could go on and on. For such a reasonable price, this was an amazing stay, and I will definitely book again next time I'm in Oahu.

This boutique hotel is a hawaiian getaway within Hawaii! The staff make you feel like you are apart of there family and they are supported by great leadership from management! They helped us celebrate my sisters 40th in style. It has made our holiday in Hawaii one of the best. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that needs somewhere to stay in Hawaii. I will definitely come back!!!

If we could give a you 10/10 we would! From the minute we walked through the door we have received first class service, which has been personal and made you feel like home. The food, rooms and activities are amazing and gives you a real flavor of Hawaii. The staff are incredible, always willing to help and happy to share their local tips and places to visit. We can’t wait to come back - Thank you Team Surfjack you’re the best!

Hotel is 2 blocks away from major tourist area. We had a room on the 8th floor which was pleasant and well equipped with shower only, Hotel charges 25usd per day amenity levy where $10 can be used against restaurant meals, We were there 3 nights and hence used against pizza and beer. Each night they have local entertainers playing.What was confusing was when and what was available during happy hour. There was nothing that I could see documented. If you want a clean hotel reasonably priced, within easy access of the main strip then would recommend.

My wife and I spent a week at Surfjack motel. The entire staff at the complex were the happiest and most friendly people you will ever find. Nothing was a problem and they went out of their way to help with everything from advice on all activities on the island plus providing beach chairs or bikes etc for our use. Every night there was live music in the very 60,s retro style lounge by the pool. This created a great relaxing environment which is just what we wanted. The location is only a block or two from the beach but in the vicinity there are great restaurants and hotels. If you want to relax away from the busy larger hotel chains this is a great choice. We will definitely be back.

The service at Surfjack was amazing. I had a unexpected change in itinerary they were able to accommodate.The room I had could have used some updates and it can be noisy at night. Overall, good time!!

We only stayed at the Surfjack for one night but we would stay again. It's a really cute motel remodel into a retro mini-swim resort. The staff was super friendly and the common areas are really nice to relax in. Loved the movie playing out by the pool, and the little coffee shop. Because it's an old motel building, the walls are thin so it's a bit noisy but otherwise all good.

We stayed here for a weekend during our honeymoon and it was the best part of our entire trip. From the check in process to picking up our car at valet on the way out, everyone we dealt with was extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel itself is incredibly well maintained and decorated. It is close enough to walk to the beach but far enough away from the congestion of the city. Our suite was roomy and extremely clean and comfortable. The pool, although small, was perfect to relax by at the end of the day. We dined at Mahina and Suns both nights of our stay and it delicious each time. I would not hesitate booking here. In a city full of chain hotels, The Surfjack stands alone as an achievement of modern luxury and customer service. We'll definitely be back.

Great room, really nice linens, amazing restaurant, lots of small nice touches that elevated the experience. Location isn't beach front but that is a no big deal. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend to family and friends.

This hotel exceeded expectations! Virginia the housekeeper was so nice!! She was terrific, super friendly and overall awesome. She said hello every day and made it a point to say goodbye and wish us well when we left. On top of the great staff, the hotel is super hip, clean and has great amenities. The nighty music was excellent and we really enjoyed staying in the lobby, drinking craft cocktails and watching the weird old surfer movies at night. Also, this hotel has the perfect location. 10/10 would stay here again!

We had a terrific stay at the Surfjack, starting with the upgrade to a suite (thanks A-List!). All the staff were friendly and helpful from start to finish. The decor and upgrades have a retro/surf vibe but they've included plenty of modern conveniences. There are tons of small but useful touches (reef safe sunscreen, infused water, music nightly and more). The espresso drinks at Olive and Olivier at worthy and Mahina & Suns food and cocktails were fabulous. All in all a wonderful place to stay in Waikiki!!

My friends and I had been meaning to stay at the Surfjack for a while now and we finally did it. We had really high expectations for this place and it did not disappoint. We loved every minute of it. The service was impeccable, the rooms were cleaned, the live music by the pool was just perfect for a nice evening swim! Everything had a little touch of that Hawaiian magic and we can't wait to go back! Asides from that, the staff were extremely friendly and always willingly to help! A big shoutout to Sai, Rob, Darian & Tiki who really made our trip memorable. You guys were awesome!!

First off if you are looking for a cookie cutter chain hotel this is not it. This hotel has charm by the bucket loads and is very modern inside. I had a two bedroom suite and was on the 9th floor with two Lanias. These were great to sit outside and read or just watch the city go by. Central location a few blocks from the beach. Pros: 1: The staff are awesome and were always on hand to help with anything you needed. Tiki was one of the funniest guys I have ever met and even when he wasn't working always chatted to me when I ran into him. Thanks also to Darian, Sai , Krys and Kai for help with different things. 2: I really liked the room and the furniture. Again it's a boutique style hotel so not your standard Marriot but there was charm to all the pieces. The AC was good, the bed was comfortable and the sheets crisp and clean. The outlets have USB ports as well as the lamps so no hassle charging all your gear. 3: I loved the shower in my room, the cobbled floor in the shower great water pressure and really loved the bath products. 4: The coffee is excellent and there are plenty of shared spaces by the pool to sit and work if you need or just read a book. Always had water on hand day and night if needed. Cons: 1: Elevators are a bit small sometimes you can be in there looking for your card and the door opens again. You can walk down the stairs but not up to them. 2: One of my bedrooms had a door to the adjoining room and someone from the other side tried it a few times in the middle of the night and it scared the bejesus out of me. The door didn't open and I'm sure it was a mistake on the other person's side but might be good to put a sign saying this is not your room and don't try the door. Overall great stay and would highly recommend
user_name:
Mossnyc
New York City, New York

review_body: We used Surfjack as our bookends to our holiday in the United States. Traveling as a family of five (Elderly parents and their 3 adult children). We checked in for the first time in late August when Island preparations for Hurricane Lane were in full swing. We were kept informed with regular printed updates of the storms location by the lovely staff. During breakfast the following day we voiced our concerns about our flights to depart for the mainland. Lynette reassured us that she felt we were going to be able to continue, but should our flights be canceled we had a safe place to stay for the duration of the storm. During this conversation we informed Lynette that we would be returning at the end of our vacation. After checking our return booking and noticing that we had reserved a different type of room due to unavailability she returned to tell us she had upgraded us as a room had become available through cancellation. When we returned to Surfjack in mid September on our way home we were treated by the staff as “Family”.I would return to stay at Surfjack in a heartbeat. It is a boutique hotel, clean and tidy with wonderful staff both at the front desk and in the restaurant. Mahalo for making our stay most enjoyable. Aloha

The front desk staff is very friendly and the rooms are decent... however, the elevators and hallways are rundown. Room service is way overpriced and super slow - use Uber Eats instead. It’s within walking distance to Waikiki beach, but the area is a little sketchy at night. The pool area is fairly small and located right behind the front desk and hotel restaurant, which makes it crowded and noisy, especially at night.

My wife and I decided to take a trip to Oahu, and so far we stayed Moana Surfrider by Westin, The Modern, and The Surf-jack. AND SO FAR THIS IS THE WORST. Here's reason why.1. Hallways smell like Clorox everywhere like a bad/old gym. Like YMCA. 2. We got one of the suite, one that has separate living room, and all the rooms here smell like bathroom. We're currently staying at 442.3. Room 442 is facing the parking lot and there are pigeons chirping right at your balcony. And its pretty annoying.3. We went our for a beach early this morning. And we came back realized no one cleaned up our room..4. I posted a photo of the shower inside of the bathroom which has really unclean mold. If one of the most expensive room has bathroom mold like this, I cant even imagine what's inside of standard rooms... Please please pleaseYour money and memory is way more important than this.Design is one thing.Keeping things clean is more important.Dont ruin your lovers/family vacation in here. Just remember, Surfjack = Old YMCA

My partner and I stayed here for 9 nights in a bungalow room after looking at lots of accomodation options. Everything else that was recommend to us was very expensive or daggy and outdated. We settled on the Surfjack for two reasons: the reviews on the beds (I really needed a comfy soft bed and it was pretty good!) and the photos and decor. We were not disappointed - it’s a very photogenic hotel and has the most laidback, coolest vibe. I loved the projected surf movies and the live music of an evening.The staff are really nice and chilled and were happy to answer our questions when we needed. Virginia in housekeeping was very friendly and efficient.In terms of location, it’s pretty good - about 10 mins walk to the heart of Waikiki and around 15 mins to the beach. It got a bit intense walking in the heat for lunch etc but at times I was grateful to be away from the hustle and bustle. The resort fee includes a beach towel, a loan of a beach bag, chairs around the pool (which we got easily and I liked not having to pay for those like at other hotels!) and a few other things like free sunscreen and ice for your room.Room for improvements would be the valet charge ($35 US per night, very expensive when I converted back into my home currency) and tea and coffee facilities in the room.The advertised free daily coffee is a bit misleading - in the photos it shows the coffee machine at the hotel’s gift store/shop, but the free coffee is actually more like instant coffee as opposed to a freshly made latte or cappuccino with frothed milk from a barista. Coming from Melbourne, Australia, I’m a bit of a coffee snob, so maybe my expectations were too high there. The instant blend is drinkable though and some days we did buy lattes from the store to give us our stronger caffeine kick. Overall, this is a great hotel and I’d recommend it and would probably stay here again. It’s authentic and has personality!

One never knows from electronic devices what you actually reserve in hotels. My HS Sr and I stayed 5 nites and slept so well here—days spent on bike rides, surf lessons, college tour, short car rental, bus, walked, swam, shopped. For certain will return. Happy and friendly bunch.

Booked this lovely hotel after reading the reviews and was not disappointed. friendly welcoming staff, a big thank you to Sai for his advice on traveling around the island and what to do, where to go. Great spot to walk into town, the beach, restaurants etc. Clean throughout, delightful pool. We loved our stay at Waikki.

We recently stayed at the Surfjack 2 times in August. The staff were incredibly helpful and really seemed to be enjoying their jobs. We have some small issues and the staff went out of their way to make sure they were resolved. Would go back again.

We tried this place for the first time and wasnt disappointed. Quirky, vibrant and quite a delightful place. We had a one bedroom place, lounge was roomy and comfortable to relax for a couple of days. Food was lovely and tasty. Loved the night entertainment, a solo male singer. Staff very friendly, helpful and attentive. A refreshing change indeed.

We just loved this place. We were greeted by friendly staff who were just great the whole time we were there. Nothing was too much trouble. The place has a really great feel and the pool area is inviting out in the open surrounded by comfy places to sit and have a drink or three! Plenty of iced water available and sunscreen. Our room was great and had a lovely beachy feel. Nice and close to heaps of restaurants and cafes, and the shopping.......don't get me started. About a 15 minute stroll to Waikiki beach which was divine. We would definitely come back here. Honolulu is fabulous and we had glorious weather. Well done!!

My family moved to Hawaii in early June. We decided to stay at The Surfjack Hotel until we found a house. As soon as we arrived, I felt so happy. The staff is very welcoming and accommodating to my family of four (2 adult & 2 kids). I prefer the relaxing and calm atmosphere of a small, boutique hotel vs. the commotion of a big, crowded hotel. We stayed in the 1-bedroom suite. One room, what you walk into, had a pull out bed, TV, small fridge and closet and the1-bedroom has the bathroom with a wonderful shower, TV, King bed and plenty of space to walk around. The coffee in the morning was my favorite part of the day. I woke early to walk downstairs and get coffee. Sometimes I sat by the calm pool and people-watched or just gathered my thoughts. The hotel is in a convenient location. Many restaurants are within walking distance. My one "con". The pool closes at 5:30p to all kids. This was tough for my two kids (9 & 6).

I had seen this hotel on social media from a friend and obsessed over it for nearly a year! When we arrived, I knew I would not be disappointed! The staff was so friendly. The layout was awesome. The vibes were PERFECT! We are not a couple who stay around the hotel much, but this trip, we hung around and swam and enjoyed Mahina & Sons. Housekeeping even left cute notes daily! Thank you SurfJack for an amazing experience & cant wait for our next stay!!

This hotel was such a great place to stay in, the pool was fantastic, spacious rooms and the food in the restaurant was fantastic also the staff were so helpful and friendly. Such a great vibe, we found it much more authentic and nicer than the big chain hotels like the Hilton etc. Walking distance to Waikiki and near bus stops to take you to Ala Moana shopping centre and Pearl Harbour. Will definiatly be back !!

We had a very nice stay, the rooms were clean, with nice bamboo accents and modern bungalow design, with large glass encased shower, giant sliding barn style bathroom door, fairly new furnishings and small sit down balcony. The hotel entry is part lobby , part pool area, and part restaurant all charmingly fused into one. If you love pool parties and lots of music this is the place for you as there is always something going on here. While we were there they had live bands, a DJ and some sort of Dog conference/pet accessories thing. I found it all to be a bit crowded during these events but it made for great people watching and the noise was not too bad in the rooms. The price was very reasonable and they do have some nice Kama'aina deals. They really try to think of everything you might need during your stay and have it there before you ask.

This is a little hidden gem tucked in Lewers Street near the main shopping precinct and good food options a short stroll away. The staff are friendly and attentive and the pizza at Mahina and Sons to die for the burritos down the road are also delicious. The rooms are nicely styled and the pool area inviting if not a little overcrowded with kids a lot of the time ie the size of the pool is a little small relative to guest numbers. Overall a great stay !

This hotel has a kitschy cool hipster vibe. The staff were friendly and the location was great. The rooms are good but a bit small. Not too small but certainly not roomy. The best part is the main floor which is set around the pool. Surrounding it is a few seating areas and the restaurant. A nice place to hang out. The location was in walking distance to everything you could want in central Waikiki. Near the beach and shopping and restaurants. The staff was friendly and we really enjoyed our short stay.

The service was awesome and the pool great !!! Second time to stay here and love it !!! Recommend for everyone . The price and staff really friendly. The restaurant in the hotel have good food and awesome pizza

We can only praise this accommodation and is done so in the main by the incredibly awesome friendly service by all of the staff. These guys go the extra mile for you. The accommodation is a little dated but the room we had (a twin room) was clean and tidy with a nice view over the pool area. We didn’t feel ripped off as sometimes can be the case and prices were pretty reasonable. We were unfortunately vacationing right in the middle of hurricane Lane that fortunately didn’t come to anything significant but the hotel was well prepared. We would recommend.

We spent a week in the hotel. First we got a regular room which was a bit small but with a very comfortable bed. Afterwards we were given an upgrade to one of the penthouses. That was amazing. Bigger, with a lovely saloon and a magnificent terrace.The staff was really helpful.Like most of the hotels in the zone, the breakfast was not included, but that was not a point as there are tons of options in the immediate nearby.Live music most of the nights at the restaurant.Another positive point is that they give you 10$ off in the restaurant bill (dinner) for every night you sleep there.The only point would be that the restaurant was a bit overpriced (at least the dinner we had: kale cesar salad+ 2 tuna with kinoa+ 1 glass of wine and 1 water).Overall a really cosy and recommendable hotel to stay in as well as enjoying of the facilities.

We spent a week here for our family vacation. There were some miscues but the lovely staff quickly fixed our problems and compensated us. The hotel is centrally located and within minutes of yummy food and the beach. There is only one small pool but it was good enough for the kids to play. The rooms are a little smaller than we had hoped but it was clean and well designed. Our shower was really really small, but others had bigger. If you are a bigger person, ask for a bigger shower. With a smaller shower, we got a bigger room. So it is a trade off. We loved that they provided sunscreen and refreshing water at the lobby. Good coffee was served every morning. The bus stop is just outside the hotel and it'll take you anywhere on the island. Mind you, it's a slow trek. The food at the restaurant was really good, but a bit on the pricey side.

A fabulous little hotel hidden away in the middle of Waikiki. Great rooms and good service. It could benefit from a fitness room but the free bikes are a great substitute. Don't miss the restaurant as the food and drinks are fabulous.

The lobby, artwork, restaurant, pool, and lounge areas were all amazing. I mean....how cool is the tile on that pool!?! I loved the nice touches like free sunscreen in lobby, beach chairs and bikes for loan and coffee in the morning. The location was perfect (an easy walk to shopping and Waikiki beach) and it was nice to be a couple of blocks off the strip. We got some great recommendations from desk staff for local restaurants that were a little less touristy (like Maguro's-which we loved!). I recommend the fried rice bowl for brunch from the restaurant...sooo yummy. My only complaint and its MINOR was that each night the bed literally came unmade while we slept so we were pretty much sleeping on the bare mattress by morning (which is a little gross in a hotel). We'll be back, though, for sure!

When we arrived at the hotel, they gave us a room different from the one we had booked. We are 4 of us, so I booked a 2 bedroom suite, but they said that it was overbooked, so they gave us 2 separate rooms for a night.Even though the manager explained why they gave us the different rooms and even though they gave us a refund for the first night, the fact that we were not able to stay in the reserved room disappointed us very much. We were able to move to the reserved room the next day, but it was a hassle for us to switch rooms. As for the hotel and the rooms, the hotel has no laundry service and no washer and dryer in the building. I found the young staff to be quite variable -- some were eager to serve the guests properly but others were looking at their iPhones and not serving their guests, especially those manning the valet parking desk. Since the size of the pool is small, it looked crowded. The noise level at times was high well into the late evening. This hotel appears to be popular with young families with small children but probably not appropriate for older guests. I booked this hotel because we needed large rooms, and their reputation on trip advisor is pretty good, but we were happy to move to another hotel in Waikiki after the three days.
user_name:
mimicoco7
New York City, New York

review_body: Everything about this hotel is awesome. My girlfriend had the best time here for her birthday. The staff is amazing and did everything possible to make sure we had a good time. I will be back and I highly recommend!

Amongst the myriad of high-rise, over-priced shoreline hotels - none of which have a beach to call their own (beaches are all public in Hawaii) & certainly offering few loungers/ shade, time to think a little laterally...Couple of blocks back is this stylish hotel, oozing class and fun the minute you step inside. Sure, it could have been a standard 3* concrete hotel block under any other guise, but someone clearly engineered an open plan design, with brilliant attention to detail around public and individual room areas for the surf theme and, voila! The coolest place to stay around Waikiki/ Honolulu!!By day, the central pool (love the 'wish you were here' logo, btw!), dominates, with children wonderfully welcomed. By evening, the downstairs transforms into a trendy bar, where we met the most interestingly of people, plus a few refugees from said- mentioned high rise block hotels. Very reasonable prices, great live music & it all switches off to allow guests to sleep. We had a suite on top floor - a bargain in Waikiki terms - 2 rooms, sitting room and bathroom. All pristine clean and following the surf theme. Loved it. And possibly the best bit? No, not the first reasonably priced breakfast we'd enjoyed in Hawaii, but the fact that when we arrived at 11am, our room was ready, another first, ... beat that Four Seasons! Surfjack, we loved your wonderful staff, your vibe and your setting - hope to come back one day from Blighty!

We were upgraded to a SUITE which we so enjoyed... but what truly distinguishes this hotel from the many others in which we have stayed in Waikiki... GUEST SERVICE!!! Everyone in every position was genuinely friendly and at your service!!! It was truly a treat!!! THANK YOU!!! Our compliments to a TEAM well trained in the art of PEOPLE!!!

Our family of eight stayed 6 wonderful nights in this hotel on 12 July this year. I chose this hotel from the outstanding reviews it had on line. We were traveling with a 4 month old baby and the service we had was terrific. The hotel is in a great position only 5 minutes from fantastic shopping and choice of restaurants. Walking with our granddaughter in the pram to beach was about 10 minutes and having a small child was no problem at all getting round Waikiki. We booked a three bedroom suite for our son and his family of 6 and we had a one bedroom studio room. The three bedroom suite was excellent for a large family consisting of separate lounge area where we could hang out together, 3 bedrooms and two bathrooms. The staff were so relaxed and friendly and a special mention to Sai who was so attentive and warm. The hotel was fully booked but never seemed crowded even the pool was never crowded like in most resort pools around Waikiki.I really liked the check in procedure which is not rushed and they made you feel so welcomed. I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends and I will definitely return to this hotel as I adore Hawaii it and was our 4th visit to this magnificent island. The only comment I could add where they could improve is I travel a lot and do like the convenience of being able to make a tea or coffee in your room when ever you feel like it but the Surfjack does not have a kettle or cups in your room for this. They do provide a service where you can get it from bar in hotel in the morning but it’s not always convenient to do that. I also thought for young families the menu in the hotel for breakfast was very limited for choice but just down the road there are plenty of other options which we enjoyed with our young family. The decor in the rooms and hotel is really refreshing and the beds very comfortable and I loved the cool music they played down by the pool. I can’t wait to come back!

Our stay at the Surfjack was as amazing as we anticipated. Worth the money. It felt more than just a hotel, it was home-y and comfortable. The staff was beyond friendly and welcoming during our entire stay.

Every single person that worked there was the ideal customer interaction. We checked in late, no problem. Got lucky with an upgrade. Got a late checkout and was offered the hospitality room while we had to wait for our ride out. On top of all that extra goodness, the Surfjack is a super cool vibe. Adult pool hours. Professional. Clean. Excellent location. Highly recommend and look forward to returning soon.

We read about this in a newspaper review a few months before and it was everything that review promised. Modern, funky, carefully thought out, great food, excellent music, good location and South Pacific on repeat in the evenings!

We loved our stay at Surfjack. It has a great vibe and very comfortable rooms. The only downside is that although it appears to be set up with a focus on adult guests (eg adults only swim time, no play area etc) the main clientele seem to be families, with kids running around everywhere, which wasn’t what we were looking for in a romantic getaway. The walls in the rooms are thin.

Really enjoyed my one night stay here. Room and bathroom were small but tastefully decorated. Staff was incredibly friendly even though I arrived around 9pm in the evening. Valet is tricky since it is on a narrow street and I had to loop around once because of traffic backing up behind me but otherwise I am looking forward to staying here again.

I stayed here for my second time and it was as excellent all the way around. Great staff and great food. I love the quality attention to the food, local sourcing and fresh healthy focus. Close to everything, Hip all the way around. I also apprecia

We really enjoyed our stay at Surfjack. This is a newer hotel with a fun vibe and great service. There is a $25 daily amenities fee which includes towels and beach chairs - we used these daily! It was great to have a beach chair. The shop is very nice. There is a sunscreen dispenser with reef-safe sunscreen. We filled up our bottles with their cold fruit water daily. No view but a great spot in Waikiki - central to everything.

We booked this hotel as we prefer boutique hotels and liked that we could book a penthouse with a separate room for our two young children, which is hard to find in most hotels. As we have been to Honolulu before, and were just there to shop and not hang at the beach as were travelling elsewhere in Hawaii, the distance from the beach was not an issue for us. If we were just visiting Waikiki then the location could be an issue with a 10 minute walk to the water. The pool was fine but deep so not great for young children not proficient in swimming (but children are not their target market anyway). When we arrived there was a large and loud pool party which was a bit of a shock but was over by 4pm. Staff were all friendly and the coffee shop has great coffee. Overall a good choice if trying to escape the chaos of Waikiki beach.

We LOVED our stay at the Surfjack Hotel. I was sceptical about being set back from the beach, but as soon as you step inside, you never want to leave.... The decor is a perfect balance of Hawaiian retro meets contemporary chic creating an environment that you don't want to leave. Add to this friendly attentive staff, with excellent coffee and cocktails - there really is no reason to venture out onto the busy streets of Waikiki.....

We were so impressed with our stay here! We had originally booked a studio but were upgraded to a one bedroom when we got there. The room was super spacious and really cute, with an adorable balcony. The pool area is right in the middle of the hotel and there is nightly (or at least while we were there) live music out there. Mahina & Suns restaurant was a little pricey but super tasty and the the cocktails were wonderful. On Thursdays they have a bunch of drinks on happy hour pricing all day though. You can rent bikes to use during your stay and there’s a little coffee shop next to the entrance. We are definitely planning on coming back!

Can not overstate how fabulous this little place is. Stayed at Airbnb’s and Sheraton but nothing compares to this spot. It’s got soul. Staff are friendly. It has that friendly Polynesian feeling like Fiji. Much aloha here. Rooms lovely. Coffee at little olive and Oliver’s the only good latte in Waikiki I found. If you want chilled boutique hotel with soul and touches of retro luxury this is the place.

We were originally booked into another hotel but I switched after reading about pushy timeshare sales people. This proved to be such a good thing. This hotel is staffed by friendly helpful people who go out of their way to make your stay brilliant. The bar/restaurant area is casual and fun but not too noisy for the rooms as they shut in good time. Reasonable price drinks and food in what is quite a central Honolulu location. The pool is within the courtyard area but again not too busy/ noisy to enjoy. The rooms are big and clean with fantastic AC. For the price this is a totally good choice compared to other hotels in the area. No downsides at all.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The staff were very welcoming and helpful (Benjamin and Tiki were great). Nice comfortable and clean room. Fantastic pool and relaxing areas around the pool including a restaurant. The hotel had a lovely relaxing feel about it with live entertainment most days in the pool area. We would stay at the Surfjack again.

We had a nice stay! Just nice size of hotel, the room was clean and I love the interior. Location is great. Can walk to everywhere. The Pool size is enough for my 5years. Also good iced mocha by Olive and Oliver.

Couldnt more highly recommend the surfjack hotel. If youre going to Honolulu this is the place you have to stay. The restaurant and coffeee shop is all local and fantastic. The staff is incredible. Even knows you by name. Great location. Close to everything.. And the best part.. the rooms.. every detail is thought about from the soaps and body wash to the interior decoration and design. Very high level, clean, and nice. Its so hip you'd like to take it all home with you.

everything is perfect! The staff greeted me kindly every day.We liked everything of interior of guest room, swimming pool, restaurant and so on. I want to visit again next time. Unfortunately, one kinds are, Walk to Waikiki Beach for about 10 minutes.

Stayed here two nights in July 2018. First, plan on valet parking and paying the high fee. There is no place to park. There is generally no place at first to leave the car for valet. So you end up driving around the block several times. The staff were generally too busy trying mingle with the young singles to help anyone else. There is one gentlemen who worked there, a bigger guy, who was very friendly and who deserves special attention. I wish I would have caught his name. Generally, though, the staff want little to do with guests except for receiving tips. The restaurant staff was the worst and they generally didn't even acknowledge people. The pool is small but nice. It was closed on one evening for a "pool party." Consisted with a band, speakers, and drinks. Ended right at 10 so no problem there. However, the nonguests who came for the party stayed very late, pulled the fire alarm, and generally made noise well into the next morning. The staff did nothing about this. The entire event made it uncomfortable to get to the rooms.The room was clean. Our "three bedroom" was really two different rooms. The setup was akward. No microwave, coffee pot, etc, in the room despite advertising that there was. We had a view of nothing. The hotel is surrounded by bigger buildings so don't expect much in that regard. The hotel is centrally located, which is nice. Generally, if you are young and looking to party it is a great place. If you are anyone else, probably want to stay elsewhere. The day after we checked out and traveled to Maui, we realized that the hotel put a charge onto our credit card for over a thousand dollars. The amount made no sense. We paid for the rooms as far back as October. I called three times, spoke to three different people, who did nothing to help. The charge went away after 5 days, but why does this place think it is ok to control over a grand of someone's else's money? No explanation was ever given. I always had to call back to speak the manager who apparently is never there.

Seemed good from the reviews. Almost booked,then stayed elsewhere. Stopped in for drinks anyway...curious.The Good:Staff The Bad:Unless you are in your 20s/early 30s and up, this is not the place for you or the place for families with young kids.It is what it is and the is, is a great place for young adult liberals. Probably akin to Mecca.If you're over 21 or conservative, even on the fence of being Conservative-stay away. It was clean though.

Visited for 6 nights and it was in a perfect spot, not in the middle of everything and not away outside of the main area. Lots of character and a lovely pool as you can see in the photograph. Close to lots of shops, bars and restaurants and only about 10 minutes walk to Waikiki beach! Would thoroughly recommend this hotel. X

Awesome and cute boutique hotel. Despite not being on the beach, I love this centrally located gem. Service is excellent. All staff are very welcoming and pleasant. Complimentary coffee, beach towels, and internet provided for the daily $25 resort fee. The rooms all have a mini-fridge and lockers to place your valuables.You have to try the on site delicious hotel, Mahina and Sun’s. I always get the naked pig pizza. It’s a must order.Can’t say enough about all the staff. What a wonderful way to experience Aloha! Cheers!

The staff there is so filled with Aloha... Sai and the others really made me feel at home they went out of the way for us. I never seen such hard working people they are not in the air condition they are out there in the heat because its not enclosed. we are talking about July in Hawaii when the trades sometimes blow in hot air. I don't know how they do it and stay nice. I was able to talk with their manager who is also so very nice . It was clean and comfortable and a very trendy place . It was a nice stay and near to a lot of places within a block of Kalakaua Ave with great little places to shop. Free coffee and water and the pool was fun for the kids. There is also a restaurant downstairs that you can place your order with while at the pool. There are little convenient stores close by that you are able to buy sandwiches, salads and fruit from which was godsend when you have a bunch of children to feed. I had the one bedroom suite which was nice and clean I wish though that there was a bar sink rather than using the bathroom sink to wash my child's Sippy cup. . Cant say enough about the staff who are great . . The valet parking is high too high that was the one drawback. the air condition in the room was great ...

We loved our stay at the Surfjack. Within walking distance of lots of restaurants, shopping, and Waikiki Beach. Highly recommend this hotels to couples or families. It has a very trendy pool area, great open air bar/restaurant in the lobby area, clean room, comfortable beds, and is located near great shopping, food, and Waikiki Beach, all within walking distance of the hotel.

We stayed at The Surfjack for a few days at the beginning of July before heading to a resort in Maui. The staff was friendly and whenever we left or returned, we were greeted with smiles. Robbie, Tiki and Jordan were quick to ask how we were doing and see if we needed anything. From the beach chairs, beach bags and bikes to borrow to the retro Hawaiian vibe, The Surfjack was a great first stop in Hawaii!

Stayed here for about a week. Room was great, super clean, comfortable bed, decent lounge room and the bathrooms were fitted out very well. Even the internet was nice and quick!Communal areas were extremely well maintained. Having the cafe and restaurant downstairs was definitely an added bonus. This place is kind of hard to explain, it's unlike any hotel I've stayed at. It's very youthful but still sophisticated. Great for all generations. I'd absolutely pick this out if I were to return to Waikiki.

We stayed six nights here with our two boys (14 and 11) in a room with two queen size beds. The room was very comfortable and beautifully styled and the food in the restaurant was the best we ate anywhere on the island. We particularly loved the shaded lounge areas around the pool and often lazed there st the end of the day with a cocktail. We were there for one of their Saturday afternoon pool parties, but was glad to have avoided the Saturday night one which was scheduled for the following weekend - things get hectic!

Location and service at this hotel was excellent. Family stay (10yr and 12yr old kids), booked a two bedroom suite. Room design and layout was excellent. Very comfortable accommodation and great to have balconies. Pool was very well maintained, and the bar and restaurant on site were very good. As mentioned in other reviews, what makes this a 5 Star is the customer service. Always pleasant and available to help. Would definitely return. Keep it up Surfjack.

My biggest hesitation was that we were traveling with our 10 and 11 year olds. I saw a note on their website that kids could not go in the pool after 5 pm.
