I thought this was ridiculous (since all kids want to do on vacation is swim in pools). But, we made it work. I can see now why the pool rule exists. The pool IS THE LOBBY. This area supports the bar and restaurant at night and it would be a bit distracting if their were a lot of kids in the pool. That being said, the staff and amenities more than made up for the pool restriction. The hotel really works hard to provide everything one would need for a beach vacation. There is a tote bag in each room that you can use during your stay. You can check out towels and camping style beach chairs when heading to the beach. They even have sunscreen dispensers in the lobby. The staff was very helpful. Jordan at the desk was great in helping us plan less touristy excursions. Julia in the restaurant was also extremely helpful. The rooms are small and there is no on site laundry (contrary to what I was told on a live chat). But I would still recommend this hotel. It is walking distance to all the shops, restaurants and the beach.

If you're looking for relaxed old school cool yet with all the amenities you could need, this is the place! Staff are super friendly and helpful, Mahina & Sons has outstanding food, bands playing local sounds most nights, and a pool you can literally walk off the street and jump into! We took 4 kids age range 9yrs to 24yrs and everyone was happy! We have already recommended the Surfjack to friends coming to Waikiki. Thanks to the team for an amazing visit to Hawaii. Jordyn checked us in (and was the perfect intro to the service we received) but everyone on staff were superb. We wouldn't stay anywhere else now.

This was the first time for most of the people in our group. Surfjack and team members were very hospitable and welcoming. I could not stay at a better hotel. aid I could give them more stars, I would. Thank you for taking care of us and all of our questions. This is the first time we were sad to leave a hotel because of the team members were awesome. Keep up the good work Surfjack!!

We unfortunately only got to stay at the Surfjack for one night but had an amazing stay. We got there very early but still were able to check in and store our things, get beach towels, etc while our room was getting ready. We were upgraded to one of the penthouses for some reason? Who cares why- it was such a cool room! Décor was fun and comfortable. Location is great and only about a 5-10 minute walk to the beach. Pool area was also lovely. I felt it was a great value for the cost and would recommend.

This was the first hotel of 3 that I stayed at in Waikiki. This is a great hotel, they took an old motel and updated into a great boutique hotel (actually is the same designer as the Bungalow in Santa Monica). It is a U shaped motel with a pool in the center. It offers a great bar/restaurant, a great coffee shop, and little boutique, rooms were nice. Would definitely stay here again.

We stayed for three nights at Surfjack before we boarded a Pride of America Cruise and absolutely loved it. We stayed in one of their larger corner rooms with a bungalow attached. There were five of us and we had plenty of room to spread out! It is particularly great for larger family or family with teen and older children. It allows privacy and two bathrooms. We loved the pool area and hotel location. I also enjoyed the old Hawaii retro feel. It was right in the middle of Waikiki activity and there were tons of things within easy walking distance. Everyone on staff was so kind and the breakfast was yummy. We actually were planning on trying another hotel after our cruise, but changed our final stop back to Surfjack! They are the best!

I must preface this review to say that had I not had an accident within the first hour of arrival, this review may have been a bit more positive.Firstly the positives : rooms were a good size , very clean and modern . Comfortable bed and great tv. Staff were all friendly. The food at Mahina and Suns is excellent and staff very helpful. The coffee at Olive and Oliver was the best we had in Honolulu. Now the negatives : Walls are very thin and corridors can be noisy at times. The pool area is great but when all lounge chairs are out there is not a lot of room to walk around the edge (where the concrete with grip is). The concrete is polished in the majority of areas and hence my title ‘accident waiting to happen’ . Upon our arrival our room was not ready so I chose to go for a swim in the pool whilst waiting. Upon getting out of the pool I chose to walk at a path behind the pool and unfortunately as I had wet feet I slipped on a ramp area , landing heavily and hitting my head. Staff and a guest did immediately rush to my aid and I was offered medical assistance. After about 10 minutes I did decide it would be best to seek medical advice as my head had hit the concrete quite heavily. An ambulance was called and I was taken to hospital. I was lucky nothing was broken and I am thankful that it was not worse, it has been a week today and I have a huge black bruise on my bottom that is getting bigger not smaller. I had multiple bruises come out on my arms , legs and toes. My head is still tender to touch. Even today I cannot walk without pain in my foot and I have pulled a muscle in one arm. The guest who was first to get to me commented that she had slipped in the same spot the day before but caught herself before falling. Accidents happen but it is annoying when they can be prevented. I have just read reviews on this site from over a year ago that warn the same thing . I am hugely disappointed that a simple fix has not been done to reduce the likelihood of these accidents happening . Grind the concrete and make a rough finish rather than polished. I am now on the second leg of my trip about to hop on a cruise and I won’t let these injuries stop me but it is frustrating that it is hampering my enjoyment of a trip I have been planning for quite some time. I am also disappointed that in the whole time I was in the hotel that nobody from management ever enquired how I was and in fact until I went to thank staff for their help no one even approached me to ask how I went at the hospital. It was also interesting that a cleaning lady asked my husband how I was a few days after the fall so all staff clearly knew about me.Just to add to my trip, on one of the last nights we were there we got take away from Mahina and Suns. About 2 hours later I got a call from someone in accounts saying they needed my credit card again and he knew the amount I had spent, my name and the time I was at the restaurant. I figured this to be a scam and reported it to the front desk and after they had a chance to investigate that night, I was offered to swap rooms the next day which I declined. After hearing no more, the next day I enquired what the result was and was assured that it was a scam that had been happening in the area and they were changing how they handled calls to the hotel. An unlucky coincidence that I was the one getting scammed.We had a late night flight out, so I enquired about a late checkout and mentioned I was happy to pay. As they were booked out we were offered a hospitality suite for the time we needed (5hrs) . The next day when I called to confirm I was told there was no record of that request even though I saw it written in their book. The girl noted it for me again and then when it came time for checkout we were told it was only available b/n 5 and 6pm. Don’t get me wrong,it was a courtesy I very much appreciated but why all the stories and added to the list of things that had happened to me that week it was another frustration.In closing would I recommend staying here? Yes, but be very careful around the pool area and indeed the concreted area as there is always areas with water from people getting out of the pool (even the lifts).

Smaller hotel in bustling Waikiki. Staff goes out of their way to make you feel welcome and will do their very best to try make your stay enjoyable. Retro hotel with Hawaiian beach motif. My wife and I stay at Surfjack whenever we hit the Islands, one or two times a year.

Spent 6 nights and enjoyed our stay. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Pool area is a great place to hang out day or night. Service was good. Great location in central Waikiki. Would definitely stay again. A couple of suggestions; add more hooks in the bathroom and put out a pot of Decaf in the morning, in addition to regular coffee.

We bookend our recent Hawaii trip with stays at the Surfjack. Had a great laid back beach vibe which was a welcome relief from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. Super good vibes. Will definitely be back for a longer stay next time!

Small, cozy hotel. Very well decorated, albeit small. Excellent service. Very good restaurant/food service.location is very convenient within walking distance to Waikiki beach and fun, albeit expensive, shopping.

This is one of the best hotels we have ever stayed at. And we stayed in much more expensive places. But this place has something most other hotels don't have: a soul.From the moment we checked in, we were hooked. The staff is exceptionally friendly and outstandingly professional. The rooms are spacious and very comfortable. All amenities are of great quality. We had a One Bedroom Suite facing the pool. Perfect!Get up in the morning and grab a free coffee. Get an amazing Loco Moco for breakfast. Chill at the pool and listen to the great soundtrack. Enjoy live music in the evening.Hell, I would go work for them immediately if the opportunity arose. One afternoon, we witnessed a team meeting of the hotel staff. After it was over, everyone hugged each other. It all seemed so sincere. It was touching. And you can feel that spirit whenever you talk to staff.We spent another night at the hotel while transiting to San Francisco. This time, we had a room facing out of the back of the hotel. Obviously, if you can grab a room that faces the pool, you'll have the better experience. Seriously: Go stay at this hotel. Look at the reviews. It's hard to say why exactly, but this place touches something within people. Go experience it for yourself.

We loved our stay. The rooms were comfortable, the beds were wonderful. Free coffee in the morning was a nice touch, and the coffee was delicious. The restaurant also offered the most delicious scones. Very yummy. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. We would definitely stay here again.

We recently spent 6 nights in a three bedroom suite at The Surfjack Hotel & Swim Club with our 2 adult children and their partners. We had an absolutely lovely experience here and would come back to stay in a heart-beat.All the staff at this establishment are friendly, helpful and happy - they make the place!! A big congratulations to management for obviously doing the right thing by their staff. This made such a huge positive impact on our stay.The 3 bedroom suite is actually a 2 bedroom suite with a 1 bedroom room (and bathroom). This meant that the 2nd bedroom was a bit of a thoroughfare but that wasn't a deal breaker. The rooms were quite spacious and had good sound-proofing. We had 3 lanais so it was nice.If we ever go back to Oahu, we will definitely stay here again.Thanks Surfjack for helping us have such a great holiday.

We had breakfast at the restaurant. It was delicious. We tried the adobo fried rice, which was a winning recipe submitted by one of their housekeepers. The service was excellent; staff courteous and friendly.

My family and I had major issues with our original accomodation that forced us to leave after one day. Being peak season Surfjack Hotel were extremely accommodating and of great assistance to our needs, definitely leads the pack against the competition. If you're looking for excellent facilities that is truly accommodating and feels like home look no where else. A shout out to and a huge thank you to Chris and Sai, true gentleman. Hope to see you guys soon.De Guzman family

I just spent a week at Surfjack and couldn’t be more happy with my stay! After one day I was treated like ohana (family). The room was just redone, small, very nice, but all I needed. The pool area was very homey and was a great place to hang out with friends and family. The in-house restaurant, Mahina and sons was quality Honolulu cuisine. If you want cheap go elsewhere. The food was excellent and reasonably priced for Hawaii... I will return here next time I am in Hawaii. Any one who complains about the staff, was way off base!

We normally don't stay in Waikiki anymore but wanted to take our (adult) kids there for their first time. I was skeptical I guess because this isn't one of the "big name" hotels. We were delightfully surprised at the wonderful atmosphere and well done eclectic design. This place is special because the people and service are just amazing. There's always something fun going on and we really liked the live music every evening! Well done Surfjack you guys rock!!

We have just returned from a family holiday and stayed at the Surfjack for 7 nights. The staff are fantastic and are always happy to help. The location is great that it keeps you away from the crowds but only a 5 minute walk to the main street. There are nearby convenient stores and some great food spots. It is surely worth the savings in accommodation for those who would rather spend their money on shopping or having a great holiday. Thank you Surfjack for making our holiday a memorable one ☺

People-people- people. We travel all over the world and I can say bar none, this hotel across the board has the nicest, most courteous yet professional employees we have ever experienced. Congratulations to management for hiring and training the BEST people in hospitality. Every interaction we has was a pleasure! When you interact with Surfjack employees you can tell that they truly care- they look you in the eye, they listen and they respond helpfully and with a smile. We will stay here every time we go to Waikiki. My only issue is the basic rooms are very small-so we will definitely pay extra to stay in a larger room on our next visit. In closing- an amazing place to stay- you will love it there!Thank you Surfjack owners and employees- you are doing a phenomenal job!

We stayed at the Surfjack for 2 nights over Memorial Day weekend with our 21-month old toddler. We love this gem of a hotel and can’t wait to come back. I was very skeptical of the hotel before arriving – how could this little boutique hotel several blocks from the beach be either the #1 or #2 hotel on TripAdvisor? Soon after arriving, it all made sense. In a city full of anonymous mega-hotels, the Surfjack manages to create a personal experience with strong attention to detail. It’s an experience unlike any other in Honolulu. What the hotel does right:- Service. They’re genuine, gracious, welcoming, caring, warm…the best comparison is Four Seasons level of service. My wife and I have stayed at nearly all the major Honolulu hotels, and nearly all of them have terrible service. The only hotel with comparable service is the Kahala, but it’s an old-school hotel for old rich people. The doormen went out of their way for us, and almost seemed surprised when we tipped them. The waitresses at Mahina & Sun’s were hard-working and incredibly hospitable. My wife and I are very uncool mid-30s parents with a rambunctious toddler in tow – we aren’t nearly as cool as many of the young pretty people staying here, yet the hotel still treated us like VIPs. - Awesome design. It’s trendy, timeless, cool and comfortable. It feels like staying at a very stylish friend’s beach house. There are several other new “boutique” hotels in Waikiki that are all trying to achieve a similar vibe, but they all feel corporate and lack the authentic ambiance of the Surfjack. The strong design point of view is carried through with a high attention to detail throughout the hotel. This will never be confused for a 5-star luxury hotel, but we still appreciated the high-quality materials in the bathroom, the extremely comfortable and stylish sofa in the 1-bedroom suites, the unique lighting fixtures, and interesting art. Everything feels very purposeful.- Mahina & Sun’s. We really liked the restaurant. This is the sort of food-focused restaurant that you always want in your hotel. In our experience, Waikiki hotels generally have bad food options, so we really appreciated this restaurant. Folks who complained about the price have clearly never eaten in Hawaii – we think it’s very well priced for the quality. We enjoyed everything we ate, and with the exception of one bar-tender on a busy Saturday night, everyone couldn’t have been any friendlier to us. Good to know:- This is not a high-end luxury hotel, nor is it trying to be one. Rather, it’s a genuinely comfortable boutique hotel that focuses on the basics and gets them all right. The elevator is not exactly shiny and polished, and all the corridors are open-air. Half the hotel looks onto some “urban” views of surrounding high-rises….but even with all that, it’s a super comfortable and enjoyable place to stay. - Location. We were initially a little put off with being several blocks from the beach and Kalakaua, but we quickly grew to appreciate the location. The location isn’t nearly as congested as Kalakaua and Kuhio, yet everything you need or want is generally only a 5-10 minute walk away. There’s an ABC store 20 steps away. And if you’re going to the beach, it’s super convenient to walk to Fort Derussy Beach, which is a better beach than Waikiki. Bottom Line: The Surfjack is our new go-to home away from home in Waikiki. We’ve stayed at the Kahala, Hyatt, Moana Surfrider, Hilton Hawaiian Village and many others, but no other hotel in Waikiki provides the total experience like the Surfjack.

I booked one night here prior to catching a cruise and I was very impressed (like others have mentioned). After a long flight, we seem to have been given an upgrade (originally booked a bungalow with two beds and were upgraded to a room with two bedrooms!) The room itself was very nice and spacious. The bathroom was large as well (minus the shower- it was very small). I loved the pool, although didn’t have a chance to go in it. Liked all the small details like the free sunblock, water etc. Had breakfast at Mahina & Sons and it was excellent (highly recommend!). The front desk was very accommodating too. Location wise, right around the corner was an ABC convenience store, there were some bars in the area and about a block away you hit the main strip, starting with Louis Vuitton. The beach was a little bit further but totally walkable.All in all, my time at the Surfjack was short-lived but I enjoyed myself. If I’m being honest, I ended up staying at one of the chain hotels right on Waikiki Beach after my cruise and I enjoyed being beachfront more BUT from a monetary perspective, Surfjack when I booked it was a great deal so if you are staying for an extended period, it might make sense to stay here.

The customer service at Surfjack is amazing. I have stayed at Surfjack on two separate occasions (Oct 2017 and May 2018). On our second stay - they gave us a free upgrade to a 2 bedroom suite because they recognised we were repeat customers. Having the extra space made our trip even more comfortable. Staff are very friendly and always willing to help.The amenities are also outstanding - they are an environmentally conscious resort and provide free towel service, bike hire, sunscreen, daily (good) coffee and water to guests.Rooms are well appointed and live up to their vision of ‘modern aloha’. Overall, Surfjack has a great island vibe and is the perfect base in Waikiki.

Travelers to Honolulu have their pick of hotels, ranging from the luxiourious to the budget conscious. Skyscrapers, restaurants, and tchotchke shops line Waikiki Beach. It reminds me more of New York City or Miami than the remote port towns and resort communities that line the beaches of Maui or The Big Island. The Surfjack Hotel & Swim Club is a welcomed reprieve from the hustling Honolulu.The boutique hotel recently opened (formerly the Hokele Suites) and greets guests with a 1960s retro beach vibe. Think Elvis' Blue Hawaii meets Don Draper. It's hard not to feel effortlessly cool and relaxed upon walking into the main atrium where guests casually sunbathe by the iconic "Wish You Were Here" pool or share a meal outside of the Mahina & Sun's. Bloggers and Instagrammers aren't hard to find. Between the iconic pool, local art, and coffee/botique Olive & Oliver, the property is highly #instagrammable. The PenthouseAfter a few days in an Airbnb on The Big Island, I knew my family and I would prefer to have a little wiggle room for our two days in Oahu. Most hotels offer a two double/queen bed suite with a mini fridge and a couch for $400-$550 a night (avg. Waikiki weekend rates). Compare this to our private, 2BD/2BR Kona condo costing $275 a night! We landed on The Surfjack, because of the non-traditional hotel experience it promised. For $400 a night, we stayed in a one bedroom suite penthouse at The Surfjack, and the experience didn't disappoint. We had a private, oversized lanai that wrapped around the corner of the room. The lanai had a table, two chaise lounges, and great views of the city center (A.K.A people's apartments and offices next door). It was so comfortable, in fact, that I fell asleep on the lanai after a filling meal at Roy's Waikiki. The one-bedroom penthouse featured a main living room with ample closet and drawer storage. There was a wet-bar with a safe and mini-fridge. The living room sofa was very comfortable, and converted into a pull out bed. Both the living room and the master bedroom had access to the wrap around lanai. And I can't forget to mention the bathroom. The shower was divine with a pressurized rain shower and a black stone floor. The bath products were locally sourced and smelled...like Hawaii.The AmenitiesThere's a $25.00 a day fee that includes a $10 dinner credit at Mahina & Sun’s, a beach cruiser bicycle rental for up to 4 hours, Morning Surfjack blend coffee at Mahina & Sun’s, daily local newspaper, local snack basket, usage of a Swim Club Tote, Towels, Beach Chairs to use during stay, and WiFi. If you fall in love with you Swim Club tote (like I did) you can purchase yours for $25.00 at the front desk.The ExperienceThe Surfjack has a calendar of events each month that range from yoga, pop-up shops, live music, etc. I personally loved that they featured movies by the pool each night.The Location412 Lewers St. is an easy walk to the beach. Along the way you'll find lots of cute boutiques to slip into for a novelty t-shirt or pair of pineapple sunglasses. While some travelers might overlook The Surfjack because it's not directly on the beach, I found this to be one of the best reasons to stay here. It's effortlessly quiet, chic, and super cool, without the bustle of nearby Waikiki. AB

Arrived off a long flight at 8.30am and not only was our room ready but we were upgraded to a two bedroom suite with super comfortable beds and a lovely bathroom with high quality toiletries. The check in process was welcoming and relaxing involving sitting by the pool being brought tea and chatting with Dexter the lovely hotel manager. The Surfjack has a lovely vibe, very relaxing and nice touches such as the cucumber water dispensers and sunblock by the pool. Enjoyed lounging by and swimming in the pool and the little boutique coffee shop was great to get a proper coffee . I've noted that other reviewers have mentioned that the regular rooms are small and our suite experience has probably influenced my gushing review but regardless the Surfjack was a friendly welcoming little haven. Dexter hugged us goodbye! Only moan was that an ironing board requested several times was never brought up. Its not that I love ironing but I had a pair of damp and creased shorts that needed attention.

This hotel has character and style. The staff are wonderful and everything is of an extremely high standard. The restaurant, Mahina & Suns, is a must do.It is a short walk to a lovely shopping area and to the beach.We walked to Ala Moana mall too, pleasant 15min walk

I almost don't want too many people to find out about this place. GREAT location, great services, lovely rooms- wish we'd stayed longer. The pool was so perfect, great pool side services from the restaurant located adjacent to the pool. The coffee shop was great and we loved the complimentary coffee brought to the room. Very laid back feeling to this place, open and airy.

The room my daughter and I had was a share twin with two Queen beds. Not huge, but spacious enough for two. The shower water pressure was very good and the beds were amazingly comfortable!Staff were very friendly and helpful, they had good local knowledge. Great vibes throughout the hotel and a very “happening” place to stay. Live entertainment, great bar and restaurant right near the beautiful swimming pool. Handy coffee shop there too! Surfjack Hotel is very close to all ammenities and a short walk to the beachfront. I’d definitely stay there again!Dorothy Burgess, Taupo New Zealand

Really enjoyed our short stay at The Surfjack. Dinner at Mahina & Suns was the highlight. The risotto and ahi palaha were excellent. The friendly and knowledgeable staff make up for the basic facilities at the hotel. Highly recommended!

We had the best experience. The staff was so friendly and greeted us with a smile and warm welcome everyday. A huge shout out to Crystal and Tiki. The accommodations were great and I loved the cozy atmosphere and the music in the evenings. The location location was perfect as we adventured all over the island. I will most definitely return.

Fell in love with this place, from its style to its super friendly team we felt totally relaxed here. Rooms are really clean with a great decor and a good size bathroom with fab smelling toiletries. We were lucky to get a room with a balcony over looking the pool. Nice notes from our cleaner everyday was a nice touch. Free coffee and water in the mornings and great food in their restaurant. Trying all the cocktails is a must. They have regular activities from brunch and pool parties to yoga and nightly music. Hotel is in a great location and parking is available if you need it. We used Uber for pretty much everything but did hire a car for the day to see he whole Island. WiFi connection is really good. The people who work here defiantly make it extra special, so friendly and kind. Would love to come back one day. Thanks for a great stay Surfjack!

This Hotel is soo cool. The atmosphere is great, staff is so kind and helpful, it’s the perfect place for your visit to Waikiki. Clean, Modern and excellent location. You can go shopping only 2 blocks away, and beach is about 5 blocks. You got free bike ride, excellent swimming pool, and great food. I will totally recommend this to many friends as I can.

Thank you for a great experience!! Extremely happy we could borrow lounge chairs for the beach! The bikes were also a plus!! Great location to stay since it was so close to all the spots I wanted to go to. I’d love to come back!!

I was in Honolulu for my daughter’s graduation from UH. I arrived and started at a different hotel. My daughter loves the Surfjack and has done some events there such as Yoga on the roof. So as I was walking I went to take a look. I instantly felt at home. After speaking with Dexter, Guest Services Manager, I knew this was the place for me. I felt right at home immediately and changed hotels. My stay there was amazing. The place is clean and the decor is outstanding. But the people who work there are what really make this boutique hotel stand out. Chatting with Sai throughout the day and Julia in the morning while getting coffee. The restaurant, Mahina and Suns was terrific. The coffee shop, Olive and Oliver was also convenient and delicious. From this point on the Surfjack is my go to place and Dexter is my go to guy when in Waikiki. The hotel is fantastic but the people is what sends it over the top.

I’ve stayed at this hotel a couple of times now and I still can’t get enough of it. I booked a one bed bungalow and was upgraded to a suite. I then inquired about touring the penthouse for my next stay and managed to upgrade to it for a nominal fee. The one bedroom penthouse is the place to be. It has beautiful views of the area and features a private lanai and spacious living area. If the penthouse isn’t in your budget, the standard rooms are a treat as well. The entire hotel is an urban oasis shielded from the crowds of Waikiki. The lounge areas downstairs and the pool area are the perfect places to meet friends for friendly banter or just relax and read a book. There is so much attention to detail in the design of the hotel, it’s a work of art. What keeps me coming back is the uniqueness of the hotel and the friendly faces of the employees. I travel to Honolulu often and this is the place to stay.

loved the vibe of this hotel. I would definitely stay again as they acted on problems really quickly when I had some issues at the beginning. I think that really shows how service orientated this hotel prides itself on and I would highly recommend it to all travellers. The location was within walking distance to central Waikiki as well as popular food joints.

Right off the bat the front desk was very warm, friendly and helpful re the property and area. They offered free delicious coffee & cookies; plenty of cool things are included with your $25 hospitality fee. There is a pool right in the middle of hotel entrance which was different/strange, but seems like it’s squeezing too much into a tiny property. There is an overload of trendy interior decorating it gets tacky, but could be used to detract from the inexpensive build out of the hotel. Menu is overpriced , breakfast service is very slow, and arrived cold. But they took care of the situation very well. The bartender & drinks were nice. Cool assortment of drinks. Location is great right in the middle of Waikiki so you’re in walking distance to all things. We got a basic room and it was tiny, enough room to walk around the bed, it’s real tight, but you get a balcony and you’re not there to party in the room anyway. All was clean and decent. Shower corner edge did have mold. If you want a place to drop your bags and head out to eat, shop & adventure this works.
user_name:
lisa f
New York City, New York

review_body: The staff were great and the hotel is kept clean. Love the décor!When we called the Maintenance staff to help us with personal stuff-they helped out right away more than once. The front desk staff were very friendly and welcoming. Always smiling 

I stayed here for 3 nights during a recent trip to Honolulu. The Surfjack is a great alternative for those that don''t want the big resort style hotels of Waikiki. The hotel is very comfortable and I loved the decor. It is located just away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki but close enough to easily walk to anything. The best part was sitting at the bar in the evenings. The menu has some different style cocktails which were all amazing and made using local ingredients. We even planned our day around making time for a couple cocktails at this bar. My only negative would be that there was a very loud party happening at the pool (which is right in the lobby) for cinco de mayo when we checked in. It made it very hard to hear the check in staff and I panicked a bit that we had unknowingly picked a party style hotel (I was there with my mom and partner). However the party was finished by 4pm and it was the only of its kind while during our stay. I still highly recommend the Surfjack.

I came to Hawaii for work / vacation, and chose to stay at the Surfjack after finding it on Instagram and being attracted to the vibe and style.Everything about the Surfjack's style is ON POINT. Local Hawaiian artists were brought in to design everything from the logo, the wallpapers, even the lettering in the pool tile. My husband and I are not big nightlife people (instead we were up and out early), so we enjoyed getting a cocktail from Mahina and Sun's and sitting by the pool at night to watch old movies (like South Pacific) on the big screen.The overall vibe of the Surfjack fit in with what we look for in a hotel: the rooms are clean, the amenities are useful, and the decor is themed and attractive (as a photographer, I find this important!). The Surfjack staff is super friendly - shoutout to my fellow Disney lovers at the front desk! - and we always felt the aloha spirit every time we came back from a day out. Definitely make use of the bikes while you're there. You can use them for 3 hours at a time, which is enough time to cycle out around Diamond Head and grab breakfast along the way. The beach chairs, towels, and tote bag were also helpful to have for beach days so that we didn't have to pack our own.We definitely plan to return to Hawaii and the Surfjack. Thanks for an amazing time! #738

Our travel agent recommended this hotel for a recent 3 day stay in Honolulu. It was quite expensive and our room was charming and comfortable. (Although the booked “bungalow” was not available?) The in house cafe - well not so good. The food was very average and the wait staff wouldn’t leave us alone and kept asking if we were enjoying our meals. One would have been ok but three was a little excessive. They were all friendly & chatty. Perhaps we Australians are a little more reserved than Americans. The pool was fine but situated right at the front of the property so you were swimming/lounging a couple of metres front the footpath. Strange. Our room was quiet, but the hotel had functions on every night we were there so we had to push our way through milling crowds in order to get to the lift to our room. A tip to wait staff - many people don’t want loud & insistent recommendations about shopping etc. Maybe, wait to be asked. Sorry to sound like a grump. Overall the hotel was fine but quite pricey. We will look more carefully at our travel agent’s recommendations in future.

Surfjack is a renovated hotel that is pretty trendy. The main floor has a nice lounge area, pool, coffee shop and restaurant. Despite having many rooms it never really felt overly crowded in this area. The rooms were fairly spacious and had a small balcony. We appreciated that it had a more boutique feel compared to many of the other chain or resort hotels in the area. One other perk was a free cup of coffee every morning so you dont have to leave the hotel just to get coffee before breakfast.While my wife loved the trendy feel, I thought the location was perfect. Its slightly off the main area so its not overly loud or busy out front. But its still just a short 5 minute walk to all the food, and about 10 minutes to Waikiki Beach. There is even a small convenience store on the corner for grabbing a 6 pack on your way home from the beach.

If you are visiting Hawaii with your family the surf jack is the place to stay.AMAZING hospitality, friendly staff who are ALWAYS ever so helpful and always smiling. Very clean rooms and stylish plus only a short walk to Waikiki Beach!We'll be coming back!

We stayed with our two young children for 4 nights in April. We had a bungalow room with 2 double beds. The room was comfortable, well decorated and clean and the hotel itself is beautiful. There was a lot going on when we were there so at night it was busy and one night due to Earth Day we couldn’t even get into our hotel without weaving through masses of people. The gorgeous seating area near the pool is used for meetings and events and it was quite busy with different functions and meetings going on so it makes it hard for guests to use if you just wanted to relax. Staff are friendly and location is good but for families look elsewhere. We would recommend this hotel for hipster couples or singles, you will love it.

This is a wonderful, smallish hotel, located a little off the beaten path but an easy walk to everything in Waikiki, plus an easy drive to/from the main roads away from Honolulu. Our room was nice, bright, and clean. We were able to get a room with a balcony overlooking the pool and Waikiki, which was excellent and much quieter than I thought it might be. Also, although the hotel pool was smaller than I expected, it was very pretty and didn't appear to get overcrowded while I was there.The staff is outstanding -- friendly, welcoming, knowledgeable, and patient. Mahina & Sons, the in-house restaurant, was very good, with flavorful, creative dishes. And the hotel store, Olive & Oliver, was small, but had a number of creative things; it was a little pricey, but no more than the norm in Waikiki.I look forward to staying here again!

Stayed 4 nights last week. Really friendly and helpful staff. All parts of hotel very clean. We loved being in a smaller hotel off the main drag - very much a local atmosphere and quieter. Very popular with young families but OK for us as an older couple. The suite had big bedroom, very large sitting room, lots,of storage, good bathroom, fridge and amenity area.

So glad we found this hotel! Our one bedroom suite was comfortable and cozy. Special thanks to Sai and Tiki for taking such good care of all four of us! We leave tomorrow with such great memories of our stay ❤. If we're able to come to O'ahu again, this is where we'll be! Much love from the Hammers!

Friendly and very helpful staff members! Great location and the hotel was very clean. We had breakfast and dinner at the hotel and the food was delicious and the server was very helpful and knowledgeable.

We stayed here for two nights to do some shopping before heading to Maui. Early arrival and our room was ready to drop bags, have breakfast and head out. Caught the pink shopping trolley for $2pp. Recommend Ross Outlet Shop - labelled clothes at fab price.Hotel location perfect for wondering around between ocean and river. Recommended hotel for newbies to Waikiki. If you have been outlet shopping before (US or Aussy) Waikele Premium Outlets will be disappointing. Go to Ross! There is one in Ala Moana and also one within walking distance of the hotel.
user_name:
Rachel N
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: We spent a week and couldn't wish for the better place to stay and this was our first time in Hawaii! Loved the location, which a few blocks away from Waikiki beach and so a little bit away from busy Waikiki shopping area, it felt more local ....We stayed in their suite and liked the way they decorated rooms, very cosy, using some local art pieces. Bathroom nice size with walk in shower. The only thing we missed in room was water cooker as we like to make our morning coffee ourselves but then again as as guest of this property you get free coffee in the morning, so going down and picking up coffee in the morning worked well for us.We had dinner once at their restaurant and food was good thought they had not enough staff on Saturday night when we were having dinner, so service was on the slow side though still friendly.Great vibe, helpful staff and nice amenities... Can't wait to come back someday again...

オープンな入り口を入ると、サーフボードにフィンをあしらった天井からアーティスティックな壁紙にソファーでテンションが上がります。ホテル内のアロマの香りでリラックスできます。When entering the open entrance, the tension rises from the ceiling which treated the fins on the surfboard to the artistic wallpaper with the sofa. Guests can relax with the scent of aroma in the hotel.

The Surfjack is a trendy hotel in central Waikiki (just a few blocks back from the beach). Family of five booked into a two bedroom unit which had plenty of room for us all. Kids loved pool. Great spacious deck overlooking pool which worked well as they had a movie for #earthday and we could watch from our deck. Restaurant was amazing with fresh seasonal food catering for all ages and brunch fantastic! Great team, great pool, great sounds - will come again!

Swingin' sixties décor throughout the hotel. Be sure to take a take a photo of the pool area at night; we found that the best place was from the third floor balcony. There is an SPF dispenser at the pool, which is a thoughtful touch, as are the individual canopies on each lounger. I don't think that the pool is heated, though. The gift shop has beautiful clothes and accessories, not your average tchotchkes. They offer guests the use of umbrellas during their stay.The fun starts with the check-in area. You rest on retro couches while they get you set up. Luggage will be delivered to your room.We reserved a bungalow - don't be mislead, it's a regular room, albeit with a sitting area, bedroom and bathroom. Each room has a balcony. The sitting area has a fridge and clothes closet. Fun snacks await on top of the fridge.The toiletries are fantastic, especially the bar soap. The rooms could use manuals to explain how things work such as the lights, the fan and the alarm clock. Noise insulation is fine. Safes in each room. Coffee and wifi are included as part of the $25/day resort fee (it's a shame that they charge a resort fee on top of the room rate). The bed was very comfortable. Curtains provide sufficient darkening of the room.The bathroom design is in keeping with the funky vibe. And it has hooks! I repeat, women need hooks. Plenty of hot water.The restaurant didn't offer much that I could eat (allergies) but the food looked quite good and it was always busy. Drinks are discounted during happy hour. Live entertainment nightly.Your room key gets you free admission to the Bishop Museum and the Honolulu Museum of Art. Fair warning, the Bishop is a $30 cab ride away. You'll be better off taking one of the trolleys which goes directly there.Great, welcoming staff who went out of the way to make guests comfortable. I would happily return.

We spent a beautiful Honolulu week with this place! We arrived only to find our reservation was occupied by someone in the military. (Fair warning Honolulu bows to their military) They were quick to come up with an ulturnitive plan for our large group and it worked better for us anyway. (And they sweetened the end costs for good measure)Rooms were lovely and clean and comfortable with a safe and fridge. Coffees not in your room but downstairs at the bar starting around 6 each morning. I'd stumble down in my jammies and grab a couple to-go cups and go back up to our balcony. Don't fret, it's goooood coffee worth the stumble!The staff are second to none! They were warm and friendly and most accommodating! They would load up towles and chairs,they provide,when the valets brought our vehicle up. My fondest memory was walking back from supper one evening and the front counter guys jumped up waving and called out 'HELLO FAMILY' from 1/2 a block away, like they were truly excited for our return and then listened to our days stories with excitement! The pool was awesome to float in after a long day and shed the heat, and the nightly music was a pleasant accompaniment.The restraunt downstairs was yummy$$$ and my somewhat picky western Canadian family managed to eat a supper and two breakfasts there. But your in the heart of vacation land there so there's tons of places to eat around there too, as well as the ABC convenience stores that are everywhere.Come checkout time they stowed our bags for the day and opened a hospitality room for us to use before our evening flight back to the snowy north. Wonderfully accommodating and I miss them!!

1960s Cool retro theme boutique hotel. Room designs are fabulous and chic.Spotlessly clean appointed rooms and bathrooms, Housekeeping are so friendly and amazing.Fabulous pool, coffee shop on premises. Walking distance of everything. Dexter is the Guest Services manager very approachable, courteous and professional.

My family of 5 (including 3 children) stayed here for 4 nights, in April. The hotel has a great vibe about it. Staff were very helpful, my son had left a bag on the side with all our (brand new) flip flops- they had found them and they were waiting for us on our return-what a relief, you can’t go around Hawaii without flip flops!. The food at the hotel restaurant was so yummy, we had breakfast everyday and dinner once-the breakfast was great to set you up for the day. The location is just perfect, easy 5 min walk to nearby restaurants and shops. We Would defiantly stay here again if we ever go back to Waikiki. Thank you Suarfjack! Big thank you to the valet team, what lovely people and so helpful!

The staff made the stay. A wonderfully friendly and helpful staff. Within easy walking distance to beach and shops. Great coffee at Oliver & Oliver in the foyer. An awesome boutique hotel. We will be back

Our stay at Surfjack was phenomenal. The staff, room, and overall vibe was next level. We also loved the local food and live music every night at Mahinas. Would HIGHLY recommend to anyone staying in Waikiki.

Great boutique hotel right in Waikiki. Only stayed one night before heading to Maui but wish it was longer. The rooms were comfortable, the restaurant and bar were very good. The hotel staff was friendly. The only option for parking is valet which is charged for. Limited street parking.

Couldnt be happier with my experience. Staff and property is amazing. Room was clean and comfortable, we had the 1 bedroom suite. Restaurant was great, love the poke bowl and the octopus salad! I highly recommend.

We loved the Surfjack. Really nice laid back vibes with super friendly staff. Rooms are all that you need and nicely decorated! Walking distance to everywhere :) couldn’t recommend more. We will be back!

Jordyn the manager is amazing...her front desk staff stepped up when I made an amateur boo boo and booked the wrong date. Not only did she get me in, but upgraded my room and sent up a bottle since it was my birthday!The peanut butter scone in the Am was hot and fresh out of the oven, the free coffee was delicious and flowing, and the cafe attached to the hotel had yummy cortados.Since I was taking a red eye on my last day, Jordyn hooked me up with a hospitality suite for a few hours in the afternoon so I could nap and shower, and it was complimentary. That is UNHEARD OF!!!Valet was friendly and quick too

This property draws you in from the moment you hit the curb. With activity swirling around a central pool, you’ll feel like you’ve joined a country club for the jet set. Where to go first? The espresso bar? Or Mahina and Suns poolside cafe with frequent soulful music crooning front the corner? Or, perhaps Olive and Oliver, one of the most eclectic and locally oriented boutiques on the island. Rooms are nicely appointed with curated suggestions for those who want to explore beyond the hotel. While you can’t see the beach, shopping and dining along Kuhio is only steps away.

Surfjack is a small and quirky offering in Waikiki that provides and combines friendly and efficient customer service with opportunity to experience modern Hawaiian art and its people. Terrific staff!

Everyone is super friendly. No really super friendly. Great vibe to the hotel. Our room was great but the view of the parking garage could be a major downer to some people. I just liked having a large one bedroom suite to spread out in. Restaurant was good but a little expensive. For those arriving from the east coast it's a six hour difference so you'll probably get up early that first day or two. Problem is there is no coffee in the room and none available until about seven AM. My one problem was a big one. On our day of departure there was a big event nearby that had roads closed around the hotel. There should have been some big signs up or emails to anyone departing that day that valet would be greatly impacted. Cars are not kept nearby. We had to wait over half an our for valet to get our car and we almost missed our flight. Management should have known valet would be impacted and warned guests the day before. Oh there's a marathon ha ha you have to wait!An otherwise great stay was almost a catastrophe due to valet cars being trapped somewhere from road closures. The valet guys and the front desk people didn't seem to care. At least after a half hour they could have offered free valet or something but it wasn't a concern. No apologies, nada. So no 5 stars from me.

My husband and I stayed at The Surfjack for 4 nights in March 2018 to celebrate our one year wedding anniversary. From the minute we pulled up to the front of the hotel we felt so welcomed. Check in was super smooth and we went right up into our room. The rooms are so tastefully decorated. I do wish there was a large mirror somewhere. But over all 4 nights felt like they went by so fast and we wished we were able to spend some more time at the Surfjack. It’s just a few minute walk from the Main Street and beach I mean what more can you ask for. Would absolutely recommend.

Great, hip hotel just far enough from the bustle of Waikiki beach and its many shops. We spent 8 nights here, more than any time ever spent in one place on vacation, and really enjoyed it for the most part. Staff was super friendly, and there’s a great restaurant and coffee shop within the grounds. The pool area is nice to relax and order a drink and snacks or BYO. Often live music playing. Our only real complaints were with the room’s location. We had a sliding door and small balcony facing an ugly parking garage, where people getting their cars could see into our room. It was also noisy in the mornings. There were a couple small issues inside the room as well, like a broken blind. Overall though, terrific hotel for the value.
user_name:
ngray30
New York City, New York

review_body: We rented a three bedroom suite at the Surfjack for six people. The decor is nice, the staff is friendly, and the restaurant is great. This is a boutique hotel, so don't expect a palatial entrance. But the rooms are stylish and location is great.

We loved everything about this boutique hotel - from the smell in the reception area to the cool decor! And the pool, very Instagram friendly :) It is in Waikiki but not in the middle of all the craziness. Rooms are small but well appointed, and staff are super friendly. We had breakfast in the restaurant which was good but the service was super slow. It has a small coffee shop that also sell clothes in conjunction with the hotel.

This is a small boutique hotel I stayed at while in Honolulu for a wedding. My room type was described as a bungalow. It was small but comfortable, meant for 1 or 2 people. I have stayed in smaller hotel rooms. I only had three complaints about my accommodations. I found the bed too soft for my taste and the room description stated that there was a desk in the room, which there wasn't. Had to use the dresser top to do any writing or computer work. Also I wish there was a larger mirror in the room. Had to use my reflection on the tv to get ready for the wedding. If going to the beach is important, it should be noted that the hotel is about 3-4 blocks away from the beach. I used The Bus to get around the city for the most part and having the bus stop just across the street from the hotel was convenient. Otherwise I used Uber. Service at the hotel was very good. I found the staff to be very accommodating. I had dinner at the hotel restaurant three times and each time the food was very good. They also had a well stocked bar. People come to Hawaii and want a hotel on the beach with a large pool. That is not the Surfjack. But if all you want is a comfortable place to stay, with excellent service, and you are not afraid to walk, you might consider this hotel.

Love love love this hotel! Not only is it well designed, it was cozy and clean. Bed was soft and comfortable, staff was friendly and helpful. Walking distance to waikiki beach and shops. Definitely staying here again.

Our recent stay at the Surfjack was just what we wanted: relaxing, easy, and comfortable. Check-in was smooth, the room was surprisingly large, and despite what was likely an older building with a former life, the decor and furnishings all felt cool and modern. It's the rare place where a resort fee was not only reasonably priced, but included things you'd actually use, like towels, use of a beach bag, sunscreen, and discounts at the bar. We had reservations about the walk to the beach, but it was even easier than expected.Overall, this is not just a "great hotel for the price" but a also just "great hotel." Would definitely stay here again.

After following Surfjack on social media we were really excited to stay here but after checking in we were quickly disappointed. I will say the staff here was very friendly but the rooms felt like an old apartment that got a quick coat of paint and some new trendy decor. One of the main things I didn't expect was the window A/C units and windows that had shutters / didn't close completely. This made for a very loud and warm night which was the last thing we wanted after a long day of travel. As we went to sleep we tried to turn on the TV (which you can't see the picture from the bed) to drown out some of the noise but that didn't even help. We'll be coming back to Honolulu but with all of the other options won't be staying here.

We stayed for a week for our belated honeymoon and loved every aspect. We stayed in the one bedroom suite, and it was great to have the living room space and small deck for lounging. Speaking of lounging, the several outdoor spaces around the center pool made it feel really cozy when enjoying the island breeze. The Surfjack is only a couple of blocks from the main drag -- so it's quiet and convenient. We had breakfast here every day and everything on the brekkie menu (granola, local fruit and yogurt; breakfast burrito; homemade scones; and best of all, pork adobo fried rice) was delicious. They serve free coffee until 11:30 and for our afternoon jolt, the connected Olive and Oliver makes great Americanos.If you're looking for a low-key modern-vibe in the heart of the Waikiki, stay at the Surfjack.

We wanted a hotel that wasn’t an enormous, de-personalised hotel and instead wanted somewhere with more character. This was the perfect place. The hotel has around 50 rooms and is a boutique beach-inspired small hotel. From the moment we arrived until we checked out a week later, we enjoyed the hotel very much. The hotel is on Lewers St, so its only a few minutes’ walk to some great restaurants and to Waikiki Beach.On arrival, we instantly felt relaxed with the beach-vibe. We were offered a welcome drink on the outdoor sofa area overlooking the pool, where we were told about the hotel and what is on. We were taken to our room by one of the porters and were happy that we had booked a one-bedroom suite. I can’t comment on the other rooms but the one-bedroom suite has a separate living room and it was ideal for us with two children.The living room has a small fridge, which is restocked with water daily. The sofa converts into a double bed, which we used for our children. The hotel can provide an additional fold-down bed and a baby cot but they charge USD 25 each, which I think is a bit much. There is a large tv in the living room and bedroom with a good selection of channels. Both the living room and bedroom have direct access to a long balcony with a table and 2 chairs.The bedroom was a good size with two double wardrobes for storage. The bed was very comfortable.The shower room is off the living room and we liked the toiletries. Natural products, and again they were restocked daily.Downstairs, we ate at the restaurant a few times and really enjoyed it. Staff were very friendly and accommodating with the children. Breakfast was fantastic. Try the “egg sammie” – the best egg, bacon and avocado sandwich I’ve ever had. It was around USD 15, while coffee is free until 10.30am as part of the USD 25 per day, per room resort fee. Dinner was also very good. Sunday breakfast was the best for us – they had a singer and guitar player playing really good, relaxed music. Perfect beach-style.The pool is just outside the restaurant on the ground floor. While its not big, it does have a few loungers around it and towels are provided by the hotel. The poolt gets sun until around 4 or 5pm. As the hotel isn’t huge, I think it would be easy enough to get a lounger.As part of our room booking, car hire was included, which was good value even with the extras that we had to pay for the hire. We used the valet parking daily at USD 25 (or maybe 35), which seems like a typical fee for hotels.Every member of staff was very friendly and very good with our children too. I would happily stay there again and would recommend it for those looking for a more personal touch than some of the mega-hotels overlooking the beach.

I wish we had stayed at this hotel longer as it had such a fun vibe. We had a great two bedroom apartment on the top floor which made staying with 4 friends much more comfortable. You had pool views from the balcony. A coffee shop also available at reception. Short walk to the Esplanade also.

I've stayed here for business travel. The rooms are fine. We generally prefer to stay in 5 star properties when traveling as a family and this isn't that, but i think it's fine on my own. Also, I am in Hawaii a fair bit for business and don't really like staying in Waikiki. However, the real gem about this hotel, and the reason I'll deal with the neighborhood to be here, is Mahina & Sun's, which is amazing. I'd get two whole fish, one fried, one Chinese style. Both are great. And, to be clear, for first time HI travelers who want to be in Waikiki the location is good. Not on the beach but convenient to it.

The Surfjack looked too good to be true online, but turned out even better than it looked. The hotel was beautifully and tastefully designed, from the lobby to the rooms to the music and the scent. The location was convenient, but didn't feel overrun by tourists. And the staff was extremely competent, gracious, and warm (especially Channy, whose food and sightseeing recommendations ended up being a big part of our trip). We loved every minute of our five days here, and look forward to coming back for another visit!

Trendy, but fun, comfortable vibe. Very nice and accommodating staff. Great farm to table restaurant and excellent morning coffee. Center pool and courtyard interesting and picturesque. Bikes to ride around. Will stay again if we are that way.

This hotel would have been perfect if I wasn’t woken up in the middle of the night by the couple next door. There was a locked door from our suite that lead into theirs, and let’s just say I heard everything. Super awkward and not pleasant! Everything else was excellent.

If you have the means, I highly recommend the penthouse suite (studio).There are two and we got the studio only for the huge lanai (patio).Apparently this is the room/patio that is used for the yoga during the week.It's pretty awesome! The other one bedroom penthouse suite has a smaller deck but it's a one bedroom and sleeps less. We could fit 5 comfortably in the suite (king bed, queen fold out and another couch). Outside on the roof deck patio you have a round table, 4 chairs, bar cart, 2 loungers, and another 2-3 lounge sofas/chairs and a coffee table. Even had some awesome overhead string lights out there! About 1/3 of the patio is covered if in case it rains which in our case it did. But we didn't mind, it was quite an oasis up there. Room came with fridge, wet bar, and cookies and snacks. Bathroom amenities were the bomb- loved the lavender soap.The clock radio/music system was nice and we connected our iphones to play the music but wished it went higher. To be honest, the outdoor deck is the really the show stopper for this room. It was fun to have drinks and pupus out there; even invited some last minute friends to come check out. It would be well worth it just to rent the room to have a party up top. Great view of their signature pool and the Waikiki noise was minimal since the Surjack is a bit set back. The only cons to the room is that there is no coffee maker (you do get complimentary coffee in the morning down at the bar) but since the penthouse are walkups, it's a bit of a pain to hike down then come back up. It would be nice to just make a few cups as you get up in the morning on the lanai. Also the ice machine is down at the pool area-same thing, might be nice to have one closer to the penthouse (maybe even on that floor!)But it was an awesome stay at the iconic Surfjack! Try to spring for the penthouse suite with huge patio - you won't regret it!

Best place to stay in Waikiki. Cool mid century vibe. Friendly staff and comfortable rooms. Location is close to everything and they even have bikes that you can use to explore the neighbor hood even further. I will be back the next time I'm in town.

Stayed two nights at the Surfjack in February. The hotel decor is just what you’d expect on your Hawaiian vacation. It looks and smells sunny! The valet staff was great, even early in the morning. The bed was comfy, the shower was good, and the in room toiletries were very nice. We did not try the restaurant. The location is not far from the beach, shops and restaurants of Waikiki. The area seemed safe and quiet. Only wish the coffee was available earlier...

We loved our stay at the surfjack! We arrived really early in the day, they checked our bags, got a room ready earlier than standard check in time, upgraded us to a beautiful suite because it was our honeymoon and made our stay so pleasant. The staff are super friendly, helpful and do everything they can to make sure you have a great stay. We loved the location - especially to the most amazing poke joint, right across the road.We'll definitely be back, and I'd recommend the surf jack to anyone!

We were greeted with the true Aloha service throughout our five day stay at Surf Jack. The staff were so friendly and accommodated all our needs—from great recommendations for resturants and directions—to cookies for our grandchild. It is truly a family friendly hotel with space for family gatherings around the pool and resturants. The location is easy walking distance to the beach and resturants. The beds and amenities are great. The only complaint is outside noise—we were on the street side—and limited luggage/closet space. We had a two bedroom so we used the living area and floor of bedroom for luggage. Overall great stay—very clean and attractive decor—and again all staff members—maintenance, bellmen, front desk, etc—were the friendliest of any hotel we have stayed in— and we travel often. Amenities in snacks, beach towels, chairs, bikes, umbrellas, etc made for a most pleasant stay.

Stayed at Surfjack Hotel & Swim Club in February 2018 for a week with family and friends, my first visit to Hawaii. What a wonderful intro to Hawaii, this hotel is fantastic. It is an original 60s surf hotel, renovated in a way that retains the iconic look and feel of a surf hotel. Team members at the hotel were efficient, friendly and welcoming. There is a beautiful pool and cabana area that was perfect for our group. Mahina & Suns bar and restaurant is next to the pool area and served very good quality, farm to table, local food. Really loved this hotel and about to book for another visit in September.
user_name:
Nelle M
New South Wales, Australia

review_body: Very Friendly staff, check-in was nice offered coffee, tea to drink. They took the bags to the room while we were checking in.The room was small but very clean, the room had a small fridge with 2 bottles of water that they would replenish every day (part of the resort fee) the TV was a nice big 55' flat screen a nice patio (view of the buildings) bed was comfy and the bathroom was nice with a big shower.The Hotel has a feeling of a retro hotel which was nice and had great places just to relax around the pool and plan out your day or just hang.The hotel is just blocks away from all the Waikiki shops which was nice but its not close to the beach. The onsite resturant was nice and nice to have an onsite bar. I wish the bar would have a blender so I could have a nice pina colada relaxing old school by the pool.Overall I like the vibe of this hotel, if I could recommed an idea it would be to get a electric shuttle cart to get people to the beach.

Okay, even though I kind of want to keep this hotel for myself, I really feel like everyone deserves to stay at such a nice place. From food to location, from rooms to employees, everything is amazing!

We stayed here with our 3 boys aged 9,8 &4 yrs old...and they loved it. Very kid friendly, all the staff were super helpful especially the lovely Jordan ,Benjamin and sai on front desk. Giving us useful information about what to do and where to go with our children..great location, only a short walk to the main beach..Our rooms were very clean..the free coffee every morning was a plus, and the food in the restaurant was amazing. Would highly recommend the surfjack to any family looking for a funky chilled atmosphere. There’s beautiful Music playing every night. The kids really enjoyed it and that’s always got to say something. Thank you surfjack we hope to come visit you again soon. Love the Long family xx

The staff including Tiki and Sai at the front desk, and Robert and Kim in the bar are above and beyond the finest of any hotel I’ve stayed at in years. I travel frequently. Love the property locations, amenities, and price. Food is casual and excellent. Very comfortable stay! Thank you to you all for being so accommodating! Our entire family enjoyed kicking back around the pool. Sorry if we took over a little but we had so much fun!

Fantastically warm service, great bar snacks and drinks, and good location if you’re saving your beach time for Hawaii’s more legit beaches than Waikiki! Looks and smells like home for those of us used to hipster vibes of Brooklyn or the West Village.
user_name:
NellDD
New York City, New York

review_body: Absolutely loved this hotel, from the time we checked in with Benjamin to when we checked out. The staff make this place special, Jordan was fantastic on reception along with Benjamin. Actually every staff member greeted us by name when we came and went which is pretty special. The rooms are well decorated with lovely bathrooms, and good showers. Super comfy beds and the housekeeping staff were top notch, our room was always spotless! Complimentary snacks and daily water bottles is another treat. Loved the vibe around the pool and bar area, and the fact that the pool was cold and refreshing. The live music was fab every night.Having a good coffee shop on site is a treat too. A short walk to the beach and all the good restaurants and bars. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough, we will definitely be back!

Great stay and couldn't have asked for anything more. Staff are all super friendly and go out of their way to help. Free coffee was perfect for early mornings before the family was awake, and the cafe was another highlight.

This unique hotel is in a great location and offers little extras like free coffee in the morning and a cold water bottle each day. Our room was small and a little dark but we had a very comfortable bed and a balcony to enjoy being outdoors. The pool was perfect. There is a daily resort fee and valet parking is available.

A month later and I'm still dreaming about my stay at the Surfjack Hotel. I had initially been staying at the Royal Hawaiian but decided it was too touristy for me and switched over to the Surfjack- best decision I've made. The vibe is cool, hip, laidback, and welcoming. My room was spacious and beautifully retro-chic, it felt like a home away from home. Excellent attention to truly makes a difference- the furniture, bluetooth speakers, towel and tote rental, coffee brought to your room. The staff at the front desk were extremely friendly and charming (shout out to the guy who looks like Maui from Moana!) and took great care of me and my luggage even after check out and I had a few hours left to kill. They even sent me off with extra snacks as I checked out! The restaurant- Mahina & Suns- is excellent; make sure you use your dining credit included with your stay. I ate here three times for brunch/dinner, and everything was fresh, inventive, and delicious. It's truly a gem in the heart of Waikiki and only minutes away from the main shops and beach. Excellent service, vibes, and accommodations- can't wait to go back again.

Property is top notch. Vibe is way cool. Yet, none of the attitude associated with super trendy places. Staff is incredibly welcoming, eager to help, and everyone is welcome-solo traveler, young families with kids, couples seeking a getaway. And I've got to admit, the good folks @ Surfjack pull it off. Kudos to you all-we'll be back!

The style of the hotel is unique and cool, it's laidback with attentive staff and a great restaurant. The rooms are on the larger side although they're pretty inside and lighting isn't great. bathrooms are clean, modern and have great products. The pool area is nice and great for pictures, but for use, it only accommodates about 15 people total, so you'll need to get there early to reserve a spot. It seems like a great spot if you're travelling for business or perhaps a writer, otherwise if you were looking to lay around and relax, you'll need to venture off to the beach each day instead. Overall quite satisfied, but it could still use a few additional updates and renovations to score that perfect 5 rating.

We loved this hotel. It has a cool beach vibe and is close to all the action of Waikiki. The rooms are comfortable and I loved the decor. Staff are friendly and helpful. The restaurant is excellent and better than any other we tried out of the hotel. The only thing I would say is the pool area is very slippery for kids. Polished concrete was perhaps not the best choice surrounding the pool area considering it gets so wet.

Overall great experience! Such a unique property with excellent service/amenities! I only have a two complaints. The pool was often too crowded to swim in and sometimes dirty as well. The sheets as well were no exactly the cleanest. When we first arrived the sheets appeared clean but when opened there was a small blood mark on it. We waited to see if they would change the sheets but they did not until we requested it. Minor issues. Overall wonderful experience. The staff was exceptional. Also, great kamaaina rates (room/valet).

The energy and vibe of the Surfjack simply makes you smile! Love the vintage feels. The goodies in the room, who can complain about dried mango, popcorn, and cookies? However, it is the staff that keeps me returning. I frequent hotels in Waikiki EVERY week for business. This has been my go to. I have the option of choosing any hotel, and from time to time I try to explore what others have to offer. Each time I have I think, "should've just stayed at Surfjack." Though I wish it has a hot tub and more sun in the pool area - it's the staff, particularly Sy, that keeps me coming back. It's a small boutique hotel that appreciates it's guest and pays attention to detail. For people living out of a suitcase, it's a home away from home.

Love the location. Love the green approach Restaurant is great. Staff is very friendly.Views arent great but its ok. If you want a fabulous view then this hotel is not for you.Live entertainment is great. Amenities are also wonderful.

Only stayed one night but excellent location and fantastic service. Being able to check in and go straight to our room at 10 am was an added bonus. Cookies & water on our arrival was greatly appreciated. Loved the pool but a little too cold for me. Good size rooms and a lovely vibe. Would definitely stay again

We really enjoyed our stay at the Surfjack. We had a bungalow room that looked away from the pool. The room was quiet and small with two Queen beds. It did feel a little dark at times. The furnishings are Instagram worthy as other reviews have mentioned.The pool was a great centre piece and almost on the cold side at times. If you like a hotel to relax in communal spaces then this is the place for you. The staff make the Surfjack, they are warm and accommodating at all times.I would recommend anyone to stay here although people with children may want to be closer to the beach.Only one thing I would change is the painted mural by the elevators. The art work is a little unresolved and in places has been damaged by suitcases?.....it is the only piece of styling in the whole establishment that looks out of place. Perhaps wallpapering with the birds of paradise in the restrooms could be an idea? Thanks

16 reviews5.0 star rating 1/19/2018BEST BOUTIQUE HOTEL EVER. Waikiki is a hot crowded touristy mess and this affordable boutique hotel is the antidote. BEST OF ALL are the staff and hospitality. Warm welcoming friendly Sai who works front desk/valet is the best. Everyone else, just as awesome and attentive and personable. During this stay, we asked for a late check out and when we explained that our flight wasn't until 7:30 PM, they offered us a wonderful one-bedroom suite as a hospitality room to use until we depart. This is way cool and even cooler is that my other stays here have been just as comfy and delightful. Also very important, the mattresses are firm, the pillows plump, and the bedding crisp and comfy. The hip design is 60's and the look from wallpaper to furniture delivers kitsch without being gauche.They have adults-only pool hours and an exciting list of nightly events ranging from wine tastings to bossa nova to print block workshops. There's plenty of little luxuries that come with one's stay including nice soaps, free bottled water, great lighting and window dressings, etc. This place is super special.

Amazing location and amazing decor. Rooms are beautiful and very comfortable, staff was above expectations and restaurant food and drinks were delicious. Definitely worth the price. Location is right in the heart of all Waikiki has to offer.

great place to stay; top quality customer service and great location. The staff were friendly, curteous and helpful. They provided us great advise on tours and getting around. Other hotels could learn from what the Surfjack is doing

We absolutely Love this Hotel is such a beautiful boutique hotel in the right location close to walking to everything!! The Staff the food and the ambiance keeps us coming back!!! This is our 2nd stay and can’t wait to return!!

The hotel is a little small but the kindness and friendliness of your staff makes up for it. All of the staff were very accommodating and professional. The criticism I have is that the bathroom, upon check in, smelled like mildew, there was not TV remote, and the internet wasn't working.

Fine experience and reasonable price. Very comfortable room, but outside street/construction noise started early (luckily, I'm a super early bird). Signature scent overpowering, and honestly didn't use enough amenities to warrant the resort fee (don't drink coffee, didn't need beach towels or bikes, etc.) Front desk staff stared at me blankly when I asked where to do a quick afternoon hike. 2/3 of the bartenders were friendly. Hella good ginger beer/whiskey. Meh beer. Pizza okay, needed more cheese.

I stayed here for 5 nights in November 2017 and was told at check in that they would hold $1000 on my credit card for the entire stay. This severely put a dent in my spending while on vacation, and no, I wasn't told before hand, only when I checked in. Not happy about that. I told my travel agent and she was disgusted and said she wouldn't be recommending the Surfjack again.The rooms are nice enough, everything was clean and in good working order, but the resort fee add on each day is ridiculous for what you get.The food is okay, but overpriced and soooooooo pretentious. Honestly feels like they are trying WAY too hard to be hipster.Also, don't try and organise transport through the front desk. I was sent on a $260 taxi ride and later found out that there was a $25 bus...And the lifts stink. Like, really bad.

We had a 1 night stay at The Surfjack and it was one of the best nights of my life. From the moment we stepped foot onto the property, I felt like we were the most important people staying there. Check in was so simple and the staff was friendly. They immediately brought us both a glass of water and cookies. We were already amazed by the customer service that we couldn't wait to see what our room was like. We got a One Bedroom Suite which was an excellent choice. It comes with a living room in addition to a separated bedroom and bathroom. The TV was much larger then most in other hotel rooms in the living room. All of the lights are dimmable, even the ones in the bathroom which is a great feature. One thing we loved was that there are two entrances to the bathroom. One from the living room with a normal door and another from the bedroom with a sliding door that also locks. This way, we could easily use the bathroom without having to walk all the way into the living room. The shower is one to die for! We also really enjoyed the complimentary toiletries they provide. The location is great as you're not in the craziness of the strip, but you're close enough to everything that it makes it amazing. It's almost like you're escaping the busy Waikiki Strip even through you're only a few blocks away.As i've said before, the best thing about this hotel is the customer service. Especially if you're from Hawaii, you'll love the staff. It seemed like everyone was local and you'd find them at your next party. Sometimes I feel disconnected from hotel staff when they're Japanese as many are in Waikiki because of the large Japanese tourist population. The only downfall of the hotel is that their pool is not heated which makes morning and nighttime swimming pretty difficult unless you like swimming in freeing cold water. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a fun, welcoming, and contemporary vacation!

Started off our honeymoon with 2 nights here. What a nice little hotel- cute, trendy, friendly staff, and the BEST location. It is only 3 minute walk to the beach, and beach walk area full of resturants and shops. Thank you Surf Jack!

Very nice boutique hotel in TOP location in Waikiki with TOP people and good service! The hotel staff is very good young Team , specialy thanks for Jordan she is very nice person. The hotel rooms is comfofortable with good bed and nice bathroom and balcony. The restaurant was very good with good service.The little coffe shop is nice idea. Thanks for all over we had nice days and we come back sure!

Very nice boutique hotel in TOP location with TOP people and very good service! The hotel staff young and very good team,Jordan was nice person ! The restaurant was very good with good service. Lttle coffe shop was good idea. Thanks for all over we had nice days an we come bag sure!

Surfjack is essentially a 1980s motel that's been modestly upgraded with Instagram-friendly touches (eg cute pool lettering, ceiling-mounted surfboards, great cafe). Check-in was rather odd, with staff aggressively grasping my bags and shepherding me to an odd set of sofas where I was abandoned until they returned with keys and paperwork. I'm sure someone thought this was a quaint approach but it was just bewildering. Rooms are tiny and while reasonably well-appointed bathroom-wise, they offer little to no view. For the price, you're better off at the Modern or Laylow. The restaurant and happy hour vibe, on the other hand, are wonderful.
user_name:
alyvalli
