New York City, New York

review_body: Great hotel in downtown. Everyone was helpful and friendly, couldn’t ask for more. My wife didn’t want to leave when our house became available. We’ll be back, but this time to vacation from the other side of the island.

This hotel is a great antidote for the commoditised and sometimes bland resort hotels which dominate Hawaiian tourism. It was part funky, part retro - defining a style which reminded you that holidays are for fun and that "Aloha" is a personal greeting not a tourist slogan. Our 2 bedroom room had great sunny aspect, comfortable furnishing - and with a bathroom you would love to have in your house (provided that you do not take your style from Versace). While not waterfront the beach was a 5 minute walk away - with the hotel providing towers and a bag - so no big deal. The breakfast was a treat. Some minor points - the internal connecting door in the second bedroom to the unit next door unit leaked both light and sound - luckily our neighbors turned in early, and the shower tap did not have a locking nut in place. But overall - for daring to be different and by presenting an alternative style close to my own taste - I was impressed.

I real enjoyed staying here at this modern hotel.This great location just off the main drag. wonder staff, amazing rooms, clean and very comfortable with good wifi. love the swim club offered with great extras.

Spent 4 nights here with friends and couldn't have asked for a nicer, quiet, more centrally located hotel. The staff were extremely friendly, the entrance area was very welcoming and said come in and relax by the pool. There is restaurant as part of the facility which is were we ate breakfast, there are relaxing semi private areas to sit in and chat, at night until 10'ish they often have a entertainer but this does not disturb you if you are in the rooms. The room which was recorded as a bungalow is really a queen bedded room if you are from Australia, not a bungalow as we know it, but still very comfortable and large. The Surfjack is located only a few minutes walk from the beach, surrounded by restaurants and shops. Would stay here again in a heart beat.

Our family of 4 including 2 teens have just stayed at this awesome boutique hotel during New Years Eve period. The staff were very professional and very friendly, and made us feel right at home. We had the 1 bedroom suite and our teens slept on the fold out sofa which was a large double bed size and very comfortable . The Suite room 347- was a very good size for us as we needed the separate lounge space. We had 2 very large TV’s, a large balcony over the pool. Decor was very trendy and stylish. The hotel has a very funky pool and bar/ restaurant area. On New Years Eve, the hotel held a party and our friends joined us for a fun night, thanks to Benjamin organising it all. The hotel was about 3 blocks away from the beach but it’s only a quick 5 min walk. Everything is very close by. We even hired bicycles from the hotel and rode to Diamond Head ( a very long ride).Thank you to all the wonderful staff for our stay, we would definitely return here if we come back to Waikiki.

Stayed in town for their NYE event which, unfortunately wasn't as well tailored as last years. Love the style of the hotel but we found ourselves struggling with some of the basics (the lighting is weird and they don't have a fridge in any of the rooms we rented).

Very nice hotel,convenient location, spacious rooms, lovely pool area and coffeeshop . Valet parking is very useful. All hotel employees are willing to help. Walking distance to all main areas of Waikiki,

Thank you for your hospitality, especially for Mr.Benjamin! Our holiday was very pleasant thanks to your lovely smile.We would like to come back soon. The only regrettable thing is that the bed is not comfortable enough. But we are satified in all. We hope see you soon.

We stayed at the Surfjack over the Christmas Holidays. This is a great hotel with a great staff. From checking in, the property, staff, and location we can't say enough good things. We would stay here again in a heartbeat.

The Surfjack is a modern motel experience with adorable, instagramable, and thoughtful details. Their original art deco architecture, mixed with stylish wallpaper, tiles, and to-go cups, makes staying here an absolute pleasure. It's fun, original vibes are a nice change from the touristy chain restaurants and hotels that are found elsewhere in Waikiki. We also enjoyed their cocktails, central location, and DIY walking tour. The 'Wish You Were Here' pool will leave you thinking just that :) The only reason I didn't rate this hotel "Excellent" is because they did not have the room we booked online available, so they made us pay for an upgrade. That's not cool.

What a great stay! From check-in to check-out the staff was very friendly and always smiling. Great central location to Waikiki beach. The hotel was clean and well managed with very comfortable rooms and great amenities at your fingertips.

Okay, the Surfjack Hotel now goes the the top of our all time faves list. We got snow stuck in Vancouver and missed our first night of three at the Surfjack, but when I phoned to let them know they told us they usually waive the hotel room cost as long as we proved we couldn't get there due to weather. Amazing! I have never had a hotel do that before. When we did arrive a day later, we instantly knew we had picked the right hotel. Quirky cool and very friendly reception. An outdoor pool beautifully done was right in front of us and the restaurant was to the right. Not a big place, but it felt very roomy. Great location only about a ten minute walk to the beach. Our family of five stayed in a two bedroom suite and again, not big but very cool and functional. I would describe the style as Hawaii meets art deco meets mid century modern. There were some nice Hawaiian snacks, free of charge-a lovely touch. We were tired from the trip so ended up eating at the hotel. It was so good we came back for lunch and breakfast over the next two days. The staff had a real family culture going on and it showed with exceptional laid back personable service. We can't wait to go back! Thanks again to Robbie the manager who kindly waived our "snow-show" first night.

The Surfjack Hotel & Swim Club is truly a gem of Waikīkī. My recent stay over the 2017 Christmas / New Years holiday was an absolute pleasure - I am so glad I found this hotel. The other reviews are spot-on.The Surfjack is an incredible escape nestled within the bustling city-life of Waikīkī and allows for a unique blend of Hawaiian spirit, chill / relaxing vibes, amazing location, great food, friendly staff, awesome amenities, and clean, updated rooms.Some of the particulars, I'll try not to spoil everything:- The pool is as fun as it looks - it is the center point of the main floor and very easy to access. It was never crowded, nor empty, seemingly always having a perfect blend of young and old, families and couples. All having a great time.- The daily dose of Caffe Luxxe Surfjack Blend every morning was an incredible surprise and made for an easy morning routine combined with a run down the breezy Canal (1 block north) - bonus points as Caffe Luxxe this is one of our local boutique coffee breweries back home in LA.- There is all-natural Zinc Oxide sunscreen provided on the main floor which was a subtle but nice convenience. Trying to travel with large bottles of sunscreen in carry-on baggage is annoying and it's clear they are aware of this. - Ed Kenney's Mahina & Sun's restaurant was a huge hit. As of the time of this writing, the Surfjack bundles a little extra restaurant-bucks into your stay to spend at Mahina & Sun's. The morning pastries, which are made in-house, are particularly delicious; Especially the cardamom mango breakfast bread.- The Surfjack sits on Lewers St., one of the most exciting streets in Waikīkī. It is perfectly located 1 block from all the madness which is just far enough for some peace & quiet but close enough to walk only a few minutes to literally everything downtown Waikīkī has to offer. As a first-timer to O'ahu, this was a special privilege! I can't remember wanting to walk this much on any other trip I've ever been on outside NYC.- While the hotel rooms themselves are not large, they are kept clean, well-stocked (alongside Davines MOMO accoutrements), and full of nicely-appointed Hawaiian decor. The beds are very comfortable and I enjoyed the large sofa in the Suite. The balcony offered large sliding glass sound-proof doors which made it easy to catch the O'ahu breeze.I am excited to book another trip at the Surfjack. The staff made my vacation effortless and their politeness and willingness to help was noticed and greatly appreciated.

My family stayed 4 nights at the Surfjack and couldn’t be any happier. This hotel is exactly as stylish as described online and the staff were extremely welcoming and friendly, especially Sai and Benjamin. Valet is quick and convenient. Location is solid, everything is a short walk from here. Overall vibe I’d say is vintage Hawaiian contemporary. We would have loved to stay longer and would definitely recommend anyone wanting to stay in Waikiki and don’t want a generic hotel to book at this boutique style hotel. We will surely miss it here.

The Surfjack is a great hotel. We loved the authentic design on the room (we had a 'suite') and it felt like a great retreat in busy Waikiki. A great hotel to set out and explore Honolulu. Good food is all around (incl. on-site top restaurant).

Had a 3 bedroom suite with 2 bathrooms which was spacious. Pros: friendly staff, good location (3 blocks to beach), had towels and beach chairs for us, spacious rooms and nice bathrooms, very good restaurant and areas outside to sit to enjoy a drink and listen to their good music. Cons: it’s an old 1960’s (?) hotel that’s been fully renovated so pool is smaller and layout is different but overall it looks great.

Team members are very friendly, the rooms are very clean. I will select the Surfjack & Swim Club again when I visit Honpulling next time. If the information that valley parking costs 35 dollar per day was up everything is perfect.

We loved our stay here! We were welcomed for our honeymoon with a room upgrade and bottle of bubbly. The staff were warm, welcoming and helpful. Even the restaurant was great and we ate here three times. We would stay here again and highly recommend. Short walk to the beach and they even have bikes you can use for free. We rode to Diamond Head to walk up.

Surfjack is simply different from any hotels in Waikiki.We went during Christmas time and I'm so glad that I chose Surfjack Hotel. We felt really relaxing in the hotel with the refreshing design and friendly staff, yet stepping out of the hotel we would enjoy the beach and the shopping/dining. We had Christmas dinner at the hotel's restaurant, and the food were amazing!

Though expensive, nice location and helpful staff. Should provide room service for breakfast and lunch. Would appreciate free continental breakfast to add value to the price customer pays. Live music and free coffee were much appreciated though.

Came here with our 1 year old. The hotel is walkable to everything on Wakiki and if you rent a car it is a great home base. Staff was so nice and the little touches they did were wonderful, such as complementary Hawaiian snacks, cute notes on the pillows and the simple simple and Aloha from everyone. Mahalo for a wonderful trip!

Had a great time at the Surfjack! Second time staying there. Cool vibs really relaxing atmosphere and quirky decor. The bed was too hard for me that that’s the only bad thing I have to say. Staff for the most part was great. Lots of aloha felt during my stay :)

We stayed just one night at the end of our first trip to Oahu and I would book this hotel again in a heartbeat. The junior suite was awesome- Nice king sized bed with great linens and a sitting area with a comfy sectional couch that turned into a comfy second bed. Doors created privacy or open flow through with bathroom access to both sleeping areas. Fun free snacks were a nice touch. We ate a threee meals at the restaurant and all were exceptional. For drinks, th Uncle’s Punch is noteworthy.

What a great find the Surfjack Hotel & Swim Club has been. We usually stay at another hotel every winter when we come to Oahu to visit family; but for a number of reasons that usual plan didn’t work out for this year so we sought an alternate. Wow - we really scored booking here at The Surfjack!The hotel is smaller, and in a refreshed Art Deco/ Moderne Building off the Waikiki strip a few blocks. This location is actually a big plus, at nights it’s quieter for sleep and avoids much of the Waikiki traffic as you drive in and out. The staff is professional, friendly, helpful, and genuinely warm. Our room is great, good sized, well furnished, very comfortable bed, and decorated with local art; all with a retro beach flair - quite fun and attractive. Easy to recharge electronic devices, even the lamps and clock have USB ports - fantastic planning! The bathroom is large with a walk in shower, wonderful bath products provided, even a good quality hair dryer. Water bottles and local snacks are provided as a welcome. The public areas of the hotel are attractive and welcoming, a great place to relax, read, or catch up on correspondence.Another plus, there are lots of small local restaurants and shops right outside; and the house restaurant, Mahina and Suns, is one of Ed Kenney’s places (others include Town, Kaimuki Superette, and Mud Hen Water). He’s an innovative chef, combining the best of local ingredients into delectable dishes. The hotel provides free bicycle use, towels, live music in the evenings, really good coffee, and lots of other good options; we are enjoying ourselves and are thinking The Surfjack may be our regular Hotel in the future when we visit Honolulu.

I travel to Honolulu often and have stayed at many hotels there. I think I have found my home away from home at The Surfjack Hotel. Between their amazing customer service and the oasis-style ambiance, there's no reason not to stay here.The check-in process was smooth and the staff was very friendly. The check in and lounge area is decorated very nicely and very clean. The entire hotel is decorated exquisitely with such attention to detail. It's truly a work of art.The room was very spacious and laid out very nice. In most chain hotels your room is just one cramped boring room. However, my room had a separate living room and bedroom. It felt as if I was home. The bathroom was also very nice with Davines-brand shampoo and body wash, which was a huge plus. The pool area was beautiful and smelled divine. Later I found that you could purchase their signature scent sticks for a fee. There were reading areas around the pool which created a relaxing environment to rewind from a day of exploring Oahu. I was very impressed with the high level of simple customer service the staff gives at this hotel. They allowed me to check out late and even relax around the lobby and pool area until I was ready to leave to the airport. They greeted me and bid me farewell as if they had known me as a friend and made me not want to leave. I really feel the spirit of aloha at this hotel and that is the most important thing I look for in a place to stay. The Surfjack is now my go-to hotel for my stays to Honolulu. Well done.

Love this hotel. People and service were great. The rooms were clean and spacious. Well decorated! Love the cute shop by the front desk! Will definitely be back. Jordan, Ben from front desk and Tiki he bell man were awesome!! Perfect place for a getWay at a decent price! Thank you Surfjack Hotel!!

I can't recommend the Surfjack Hotel enough. Great location; wonderfully welcoming and helpful staff; small enough in size to make the experience feel really personal; great vibes in the open air ground floor, which is part lobby / pool grounds / restaurant / bar / lounge. Room was stylish and impeccably clean. Great amenities. Adjoining Mahina & Sons has good food and nightly live music that elevates the whole experience.

Coolest hotel vibe ever. Walk in to lots of youthful aloha. Pool is feature in lobby, sounds odd but it totally works. Lots of open welcoming sitting areas. Millennial vision deco, favoring a mix of mid-centry modern and reclaimed and recycled stuff cleverly used. Lots of local artists used. Excellent use of space in rooms. The rooms are not cookie cutter. Some have barn door style bath door using a recycled French frosted glass door. Top 3 favorite things: 1. Clean! 2. I felt safe. 3. Best free hotel coffee served in lobby from 6:30 am.Top 3 least favorite things: 1. Signature scent wafting through hotel. 2. The $35 resort fee (but they give you water, snacks and hotel credit which kind of makes up for it) 3. No water view.Bonus: best hole in the wall poke, sashimi and cooked fish right across st. "Maguro Brothers" Bonus: rental bikes right outside hotel, lots of bike lanes. Get the app "biki"Bonus: free local musician, sit by pool at night and you automatically decompressIt's not for fancy folks, it's for the chill crowd. Lots of cool stuff I didn't mention so you can explore and be surprised. Enjoy!

We really enjoyed our stay at The Surfjack. From the welcome at check-in, right through to the check-out, we were treated warmly by all. The room was clean and the amenities were nice. Housekeeping was friendly, and we had no issues. The toiletries were of good quality. The pool being in the middle of the hotel was interesting, but we both got over any issues we had with anyone passing being able to see us swim, and we enjoyed our time at the pool. The live music played each night was really enjoyable. Even when we weren't down at the pool and restaurant area, we opened our room sliding doors and enjoyed listening to the performers.Overall, it was a nice hotel in a good location. Walking distance to everything, and quiet too. It made us feel good coming back to the hotel each night as we were assured a warm welcome. Thanks guys, we really appreciated the effort in making our stay the best!

I can’t say enough good things about the staff and my overall experience here. Without giving too much away, let’s just say that I had a last minute request and the hotel accommodated without any questions asked, even though my request was financially detrimental to the hotel. I travel often and have never received that level of service - they truly care about you having a good time and doing everything they can to make your stay enjoyable.My only two gripes would probably be that valet parking is a tad expensive, and the surrounding streets can get pretty shady late at night (like after 11p), but honestly, the former is just the going rate for Honolulu and the latter isn’t the hotel’s fault. That’s not to say or can’t have fun or stay safe late at night in the area, just keep your eyes and ears open and don’t be an idiot. In fact, as long as you’re smart, you’ll have a great time.The room was nice, super clean and well maintained. 3.5 stars is about right, with 5-Star service.Definitely try the restaurant - the drinks and food are fantastic (I’m vegetarian and the vegetarian options were superb). Also get some coffee at the cafe, the latte was probably the best that I had throughout my Hawaiian getaway!The staff just “gets it” and they’ll work with you to have a great stay whether you’re with your family, with friends, or just running solo (as I was).Thanks for everything, guys!

If you're looking for a clean, cool boutique hotel in Honolulu? This is it - a stones throw from the beach this hotel offers everything you could possibly want - uber friendly staff, amazingly comfortable beds and surprisingly comfortable pillows(I usually bring my own when traveling) breakfast was yummy, fresh tasty coffee, stylish bikes and beach towels..great experience.

This hotel is FANTASTIC! We were traveling with 10 people ,3 of them children and this hotel has TRUE 2 bedroom hotel rooms. The staff is very accommodating, friendly and helpful and the hotel was super convenient to food, shopping and the beach without being in an overly 'resort' or tourist area. We highly recommend.

Stayed at the surfjack with high expectations from recommendations from friends, but left disappointed. Valet service was terrible. Check-in staff was “so-so”- meaning just going through the motions. Pool was way too cold, there were a couple of other families with children and all of us were not willing to let our kids swim. Pool staff completely ignored us. We waited to order food and he didn’t even acknowledge us or say “hello, I will be right with you!” We really wanted to try the kale salad and poke bowl, but decided to take our money elsewhere since we weren’t getting any kind of service. Valet service was terrible and unprofessional. They were too busy engaging in their own conversations to know what was going on. We were told to call valet 15min prior for our car. So we did exactly that, and not once was our car ready. We waited 10-15min downstairs with our two young children for our car to finally arrive. And to top it off they even forgot that we called for our car and we waited even longer. I was even more annoyed that my husband kept “tipping” them because he’s such a kind and generous man. On the bright side the rooms were nice, spacious and comfortable. But we probably won’t ever stay here again or recommend this hotel to anyone. We would much rather stay at “The Laylow”

We really enjoyed the vibe of the hotel, which I think comes from attention to detail. Where it goes for the casual vintage Hawaiian look, the hotel has obviously invested heavily in a high spec refurb, with great design features, right down to the drains in the shower. The morning coffee was very communally welcoming and despite eating at most of the iconic Waikiki restaurants I think the best meal we actually had was at the Surfjack itself.The only draw back is it's a 5 to 10 min walk to the beach, but we actually enjoyed the area and compared to Australia, the beach is nothing to write home about anyway (no offence to Honolulu). All in all would definitely choose Surfjack again, which is the real test. It has recently been taken over by a Japanese hotel chain though, so let's hope they don't change anything, as there are already enough Japanese style run hotels in Waikiki (boooring!) Finally, all staff deserve a pat on the back for the great attitude and service.

My husband and I just returned to Maryland, from our 10 day vacation-honeymoon to the island of Oahu. For our first two nights we stayed at The Surfjack Hotel & Swim Club. We had such a fantastic time at this hotel, it was an awesome way to start our vacation! Before we even began our stay, I had contacted the hotel to inquire about a price for a bottle of champagne to surprise my husband on our first night. They promptly sent me a reply stating congratulations and how they were honored that we chose their hotel for the first couple nights of our trip. They gave us a complimentary bottle of champagne and upgraded us to a suite!! . The valet parking was very accommodating the the check-in was informative and quick, which was wonderful as we had just spent an entire day travelling and were exhausted. We ate at the restaurant both mornings for breakfast which was seriously the best decision!! We even ventured out in Wakiki one morning, as we thought it would be nice to try another spot for breakfast-only venturing right back to Mahini and Suns to have another delicious breakfast. Their complimentary coffee is great and YOU MUST TRY THE BANANA BREAD!!!!. Seriously the best banana bread I have ever tasted. The staff at both the restaurant and the front desk/valet were extremely helpful with giving us fun ideas for our night out to dinner and area attractions. I have never met staff that was so eager to help and enthusiastic about the adventures we were about to embark on. Our one server during Breakfast was so sweet, she kept stopping by our table each time she thought of a new activity/ area to explore!! She genuinely wanted us to have an amazing first day!The hotel decor is spot-on and is so inviting and cozy, and of course the pool is fantastic!!! That was the main reason I had chosen the property was for the pool!!My husband and I are usually not the type that like to "hang and relax" in our hotel room or by a hotel pool but something about this property led us to be so attracted to just hanging out in the atmosphere they have created, it really is a one of a kind experience! My only regret, is that I did not spend one extra night at this property, we ran out of time to try out the bikes.I just have two questions...where do we go to purchase one of those awesome alarm clocks that were in the room and where do we find the Christmas tree that was in the lobby!? We absolutely adored that tree and want to purchase one for our house!!!Thanks again for an amazing time and warm hospitality, we hope to return again one day!!!

Highly recommend this hotel. Great location, great design and well priced. The bikes are a great option to get around Honolulu and it’s just a short ride to the water front or Ala Moana shopping center. We loved it so much we extended our stay

super cool design and nice hotel. love it will come back for sure as we had a lovely stay rooms are very well designed. food was great. Service was cool and staff friendly. Love the pool and decoration

I am not paid to write this. I am just in a really good mood because of your hotel! I am beyond impressed - blown away to be honest with the hospitality and every detail of this hotel. I have previously worked at the St.Regis Princeville Resort on Kaua’i and felt hotel stays would always disappoint after being in the industry. First I have to say thank you to the GM or reservations department, whoever allowed the rate to be low insanely low for a one night treat I would never normally be able to afford. ($90 on Expedia, $116 -$138 Kama'aina Rate) You’re hotel has surpassed my expectations. From the friendly Valet, the adorable check-in agent (Crystal I believe); How she had me have a seat and made our interaction personal as she explained everything at check-in. The room credit, although a small fee behind the scenes went a long way. I felt like I was getting something free and that always feels great to anyone. The lobby vibe itself seemed boutique-is and trendy at the same time. I felt comfortable and loved the live music. Although traveling alone I didn’t feel alone. I felt like I could hang out at the bar or by the pool and be very comfortable. I added security feature to get up the elevator is a feature was SUCH a positive- especially as a young single woman traveling alone.The details: The snacks in the room, (I mean really, what hotel anymore has COMPLIMENTARY local snacks?) just took it up a notch even more. The cold water in the fridge and the and amenities (love the bar soap and all of the custom toiletries) made me feel like I was at a high end hotel (which I am).I did something I told myself I wouldn’t do and extended my stay another night. I don’t think I have ever spent over $200 a night on just myself knowing I have a place just an hour away on the north and I don’t know if I will ever again anywhere else but I have to say I splurged, I extended my stay until tomorrow and couldn’t be happier. I let housekeeping know (room 744, ps thank you for the amazing upgrade even though its just me, I made sure not to touch the second bedroom so they wouldn’t have to clean it for no reason tomorrow) that I was fine and my room didn’t need service and she loaded me up on water and a refill of lotion and thanked me for telling her. She was beyond kind. I am blown away that this hotel doesn’t just ‘look cute and trendy’ on instagram but it also made me feel the way I feel. As someone who checked in people for years and sometimes swore hotel stays would forever be tainted -I truly never thought a Waikiki experience would exceed all of my expectations. Keep up everything you are doing! I absolutely love this place. And thank you again for having these pop-up deals come up on Expedia and your Kama’aina rates. I am going to enjoy my complimentary coffee, work down by the pool and listen to the live music tonight.

This place oozes cool it is so good the feature is of course the pool which is in the centre of everything , the bar restaurant , the retail, the movie screen the little alcoves with couches the nostalgia the music the staff the rooms everything was superb, much more personal than the big resorts and only a short walk to the city or beach We loved Surfjack and will be back

Great boutique hotel. Easy walk to beach, chairs and towels available. Our room did not have a view, but we enjoyed the decor. Finally a hotel room with great lighting options.$10 credit for dinner from $25 resort fee. Enjoyed interesting meals, local brews, live light jazz, old beach movie at restaurant.There was a room available after checkout to shower before our late flight.

I loved the Surfjack. Just a few blocks from the glitzy, luxury towers this old funky hotel that has been transformed into a lovey welcoming place to enjoy on vacation. The open courtyard that surrounds the pool has been transformed into a hub of social activity. The restaurant, open cabanas, and places to sit and relax were a nice mix. The other guests were a mix of everything from aging punks, families, foreigners, young couples, and retired folks.The staff was friendly and helpful, the food was great. This place really added to our enjoyment of a vacation in Hawaii.

Funky place with great music. Super clean and comfortable. Awesome staff. Lots of thoughtful little 'extras' to make you feel pampered. Fantastic restaurant on site. Location is great; picked it because it was closer to airport, but also an easy short walk to shopping, beach, and canal walk. Loved it.

Really hip place. A great and fun place to be. Staff could be friendlier, but the place is clean. I heard great things about the restaurant, but it was very disappointing. I would recommend staying here! It's a good location and has a fun vibe.

The Surfjack was the perfect place to accommodate us while on a week long girls trip. 5 of us fit comfortably into a 2 bedroom apartment with a quaint balcony over looking the fabulous pool. The room was perfect for what we needed it for, housekeeping staff were fantastic (5 girls = a lot of stuff- everywhere!) Location wise, we loved our 2 minute stroll to the main strip of Waikiki, it gave us a chance to get away from the hustle and bustle. The staff of the hotel went above and beyond, even after checkout we were offered a hospitality suite as we had a red eye flight home. A special shout-out to Tiki and the valet guys who‘s service and character added to the fun of our stay. Mahalo & Aloha to the Surfjack Hotel - we will be back!

People who work here are friendly, and the restaurant is better than any other hotel-restaurant around Oahu. Add the fact that it's easy to avoid most of the Waikiki traffic to get in and out of there makes this my go-to hotel choice every time I'm on Oahu.

What a cool hotel! Benjamin at the front desk was a legend and made our stay unforgettable. Our room was brand spanking new, clean and the beds were comfy. Wifi was great. Location = top notch - just a few blocks from the beach - and heaps of places to eat nearby otherwise the restaurant downstairs has great pizzas. I give surfjack 10 out of 10 and would 100% recommend this hotel to anyone heading to Honolulu.

very pleasant place to stay, slightly expensive, but comfortable. We were there very early in the morning and were treated extremely well, a hospitality room provided until ours was ready. Nice place, close to all shopping. Walk to beach was maybe 5 minutes.

Such a delightful, central spot to stay! The layout with central pool and restaurant and lounges is perfect and the atmosphere relaxing. The welcome at reception one of the best I've ever received. We stayed in a two bedroom unit which was very comfortable. Restaurant food delicious and staff very friendly. I can't ever imagine returning to Waikiki without staying at Surfjack.

A friend of ours on Kauai told us to stay at the Surfjack the next time we visited Honolulu. This was our first time there. I was planning to book a 2 bedroom for my family, but the rate for the penthouse was not much more for the night. Upon our arrival, a manager came to the desk to check us in and very politely told us there was a mistake and we would not be able to get a penthouse. As compensation for their error, they comped us our stay for the night in a 2 bedroom, plus they provided us with a $100 food voucher. This was beyond necessary, but a fantastic gesture upon their part. We enjoyed our lovely room, did a lot of shopping and eating, and will definitely be back again soon!

We loved everything here, our room, the pool area, restaurant, staff, atmosphere, decors. Very clean and chic hotel, very well maintained. Close to shopping and beach, super convenient and actually quiet and cozy.

Very cool and relaxing atmosphere. We liked the pool area and the great food at the restaurant. The room was big, very comfortable and we loved all the details and nice Furniture. We definitely come back.

Surfjack is a great place to stay, hangout and dine at. Our room was beautiful with adequate balcony. The pool and lounge area is beautiful and the food at Mahina & suns is gorgeous. Highly recommend a visit!

Excellent location Nice cozy hotel confortable rooms Nice common areas very enjoyablePersonnel very helpful and friendly Very close to the beach and central shopping area in Honolulu .No need for a car

From the moment we walked on to the property, we were greeted with outstanding customer service... a lounge area, a coffee, bag service, AND a bottle of champagne to greet us! It was great. And the room was wonderful, the bed very comfortable. They offer adult swim times, which I always love. And the location can't be beat... a few blocks from the beach, near great restaurants and bars (those frequented by tourists and those locals love), easy access to other activities. Very convenient at a great price. And the onsite restaurant Mahina & Sun's is great for dinner or brunch, and we loved the live music.Only cons: the room lighting was somewhat dim; the stairway door was locked sometimes so we had to take the elevator from the second floor (though I get the security reasons); the pool was pretty cold.

Beautiful and stylish hotel just off the main strip. Wonderful staff with lots of aloha and knowledgeable of the area. The room was clean and very modern with great decor and a beautiful lanai and very comfortable bedding. The pool is picture perfect and the property restaurant has delicious, healthy very well priced food and drinks. Highly recommend staying here.

It was very comfortable place to stay.Easy to go to the beach and also to the shopping area.The staff there were so polite and kind. They helped me a lot during my stay.I wish I could visit there again someday.

What a magnificent find - the interior design was a standout. Every person brought a welcome with comfort to our stay. The bed and pillows were beaut. Great avo on toast, lots of gluten free food, cosy for couples. Definitely the place to stay in Waikiki ( v handy) for a smile and a bit of soul....

I work in hospitality and, currently, with large corporate groups at resorts and boutique properties in San Diego. So, I hope, there's a little bit of credibility in this review.The Surfjack is easily the best boutique hotel I've ever visited. The team is amazing: incredibly warm--they knew my entire party by name before we arrived (we were 3 rooms and 5 guests); they were incredible on the phone; and genuinely seemed stoked that we'd be staying with them. Over the course of my 7 days, I found myself drifting to the front desk just to talk for a minute. I feel bad that I haven't called to say hello, or sent a card. They are really that good. All of our rooms were immaculate, and returned to that state every day. And, even more, they look exactly like the photos on their website. Beds are comfortable, bathrooms are spacious, and the rooms just feel lovely. We stayed in suites and loved them. I, for one, loved my time in O'ahu, and largely account that to our time at The Surfjack. I often find myself sighing and thinking "I want to go back home to the Surfjack".Waikiki is lovely, and it is the easiest gateway to beautiful O'ahu, but it is also flush with tourists like Florence in August. The Surfjack is positioned beautifully in Waikiki: you can be in the middle of it with a 5 minute walk, yet easily escape to the big city of Honolulu and the reset of the island. It is a place to take a breath and enjoy your vacation.Marina & Sun's is great: essential dining in Waikiki right downstairs. I ate 2/3 of my meals with them. Not a touch of regret: they were consistently the best meals of my trip. One night I walked around for 2 hours looking for a quiet and civilized place for a cocktail. I returned back to the hotel to realize that I'd been walking around looking for Mahina & Sun's--this is no hyperbole. The cocktail program is great, the team at M&S treated us like old friends, and always seemed legitimately happy to see us. And this is really what makes the Surfjack so great: the entire place is open to you. The entire team wants you there: not just some guest, not your money--You. They want you to be there. They want to host you, and greet you. This is embodied in the openness of the hotel's design; the cabanas that don't need reservations; the blurring between inside & outside; the seamless flow between lobby, pool, cocktail area and restaurant; the onsite/offsite programs; the dining & art recommendations that extend beyond the tourist monster that is Waikiki; and the $10.00 per day dining credit. The entire hotel welcomes you to participate in the swell little happening that is the Surfjack. And you should.

My partner and I stayed at the Surfjack for a few nights in November for a holiday in Hawaii and loved it. The hotel room was very clean, spacious and well decorated. The hotel restaurant is awesome and has great food (breakfast, lunch and dinner) and serves nice cocktails as well. All staff are very friendly and helpful.The pool is great, there are quite a few sun chairs for the Surfjack guests and we were always able to get a couple throughout the day. It’s a few mins to walk to the beach but still very close to all of Waikiki’s restaurants, bars etc.Would absolutely stay there again.

The hotel (except parking) and the staff are very good. However, the valet parking is possibly the worst experience of my life as they lost my car key 2 hrs before my flight. As per their records it was as though I had not given them the keys the night before. Additionally they showed zero concern and was doing very little about the situation until I got hotel employees involved. Finally they found the car but without the key so they asked whether we wanted them to break into the car for the things we had left in the car the night before (would break my insurance or if any claims made by rental company). Eventually when I was at the airport and about to board I was informed that they found the keys and would return the car to the rental, the guy on the phone also assured that he would mail the stuff I left in the car - never mailed anything. End of story - if you have a rental car the park somewhere else - DO NOT USE THE HOTEL’S parking

We went to Honolulu as two couples to experience the delights of Hawaii and ended up in the Surfjack as recommended by of holiday supplier and what a good choice it turned out to be.When we arrived late evening we were greeted by Chris at reception who couldn’t do enough to help us. We knew there was not a kettle or microwave in the rooms so we asked if we could have the same, he said most certainly and they would be with us in five mins - at no extra cost! Wow that was a surprise as in the US you are normally charge for any "extra".The rooms were clean and fit for purpose, everything worked and the rooms were serviced every day.Downstairs there was a swimming pool, bar, coffee shop and restaurant which all worked well.There was a $25 per day amenities charge which was new to us as being English, apparently this is custom and practice in this part of the world. So for the $25 you get Wifi, pool towels and $10 per day towards your restaurant bill.Adjacent to the hotel entrance there are stores that you can get almost anything day or night such as food and drink. turn left as you come out of the hotel you have the 123 store 30 seconds away, take care you can easily walk straight past it and if you turn right you have the ABC again less the a minuet away.The bus service is excellent and not too expensive, you can get 24 hour hop on hop off tickets, for example if you’re going to Pearl Harbour it works well.In conclusion it is a very friendly quiet and well place hotel and I would recommend it to one and all. Thanks to the staff for making our stay happy and memorable.

Very nice small, intimate boutique hotel with great customer service. The one bed suite on 5th floor we had was clean and renovated; Music around pool and evenings is very good.We found the hotel's restaurant to be excellent; had lunch and a dinner. Pork adobo bowl for lunch was well prepared. For dinner the Opah was outstanding. They use fresh sourced local ingredients. Hotel is suitable for families with small children; but be careful the pool is slippery; also great place for single couples.While not on the beach the hotel is close to almost everything.The $10 per day credit on the resort fee is nice touch. I would come back to avoid the crowds and tourists at the larger hotels.

I was there for business but I enjoyed the Surfjack! Wonderful service from front desk, housekeeping, and valet! Loved the amenities. The unit was perfect! The bed was very comfortable! Loved the small steamer in the unit!!! Enjoyed the welcome note from housekeeping! Thank you very much for the wonderful service!

Loved our stay at the Surfjack! The rooms are very comfortable, the pool area was nice and the restaurant serves amazing cocktail, breakfast and happy hour specials! They have an artist perform every day and a dj to set the atmosphere! They also lend you beach towels and beach chairs! I would definitely recommend it !

Great property, I love the attention and care that goes behind every little detail. The bathroom amenities were great quality. The one bedroom suite was spacious and airy and clean. Comfy bed, spacious shower, upgraded fixtures and complimentary water and snacks. Love the different spaces like the cabanas and lounge seating as well as the coffee place was a hit. The lavender latte was delicious. The staff are friendly, energetic, enthusiastic and add to the overall experience. I highly recommend this property to Hawaii visitors or local residents (they offer Kama'aina too).

This is a really good smaller hotel for when you don't need all the usual trappings of a big Waikiki resort. Delicious restaurant, warm friendly front desk, great location without getting overburdened by being too touristy or too crowded.

Comfortable atmosphere with daily live music performance and fashionable room interiors. The staff was kind enough to find us in Olive and Oliver boutique shop and let us know that the room would be available earlier than initially instructed at the timing of checking in. We would visit again and join daily event of the hotel next time.

The hotel is greatly located, just off the main strip of Waikiki, and easy to get to. check in was easy. We were only staying one night, to accommodate flights back to Australia. at midday we were lucky and our room was available. the Receptionist staff very helpful and explained everything.We had booked a two bedroom suite and the suite was great. the main bedroom was located right next door to the ensuite. 544 was a corner room, with 2 Lanai's. they were small but big enough for a small table and chairs.The pool area is really cool, with a bar very close (they serve beer in plastic cups so you can sit by the pool) There is a restaurant on site.Would recommend staying here, and will again on our next trip.My only criticism - on the TripAdvisor entry it says free internet....there is a $25 daily amenities fee, that includes the internet, and the use of the pool. you get a card to exchange for a towel, and must return the towel to get the card back. As we were checking out early, we didnt get the free morning coffee or newspaper. A great atmosphere, and a lovely place to stay in Honolulu.

Our first trip to Honolulu will be remembered primarily for the top notch stay at Surfjack. The energy, vibe, food and room were so perfectly timed with the sunny weather and our activities. We will return.

The Surfjack is an awesome hotel. This boutique hotel is nice awesome and fabulous. They paid great attention to detail in their furniture, art and lighting. This hotel is so awesome. I highly recommended this hotel.

The hotel is wonderful. Nice team. Great room and vintage decoration. Have all the facilities to enjoy Honolulu. Good price vs value. Todo me encanto. Los detalles en cada cosa y el restaurante es muy bueno.

Awesome experience. I would highly recommend anyone who wants a relaxing vacation to stay here. We loved the hip modern vibe of the hotel and staff. Our son had so much fun in the pool as well as there were floaties that he could use.

Stayed here for me and my husband's wedding anniversary trip. We loved the location, the room was perfect and comfortable. Most importantly the staff was amazing. Everyone was so warm and friendly. What really makes this hotel unique is the thoughtful and stylish decor and live music and movies that are poolside.

Love the vibe at this hotel. The penthouse roof top was perfect for hosting a get together with friends. The pool area is relaxing, not too crowded, not too hot. Mahina and Suns had amazing pizza, and our favorite drinks served by the best bartender Nehu, ask for his special mezcal cocktail! Theres another one he makes thats also very good, forgot what its called, but it was perfect for lounging by the pool.

We stayed at the Surfjack for our honeymoon! Was beyond amazing, all the staff are so friendly not just when you arrive every time you walk past one another! It’s such a hip/modern place, the rooms are tidy & so beautiful.. we will 100% be staying here again when we return... Mahalo Surfjack

My husband and I stayed at the Surfjack Hotel & Swim Club for the first three days of our honeymoon and were both absolutely in love with everything about it. The employees are all so friendly and offer such a great level of customer service that we were reluctant to leave for our next destination. The hotel itself has a retro/vintage vibe which lends itself to a wonderful overall ambiance, we will definitely be staying here again on any return trips to Honolulu.

Great place perfectly located near everything in Honolulu. The efficient valet parking came in handy. Food and drinks left nothing to complain about. Complimentary coffee and super staff to really good care of all of us. Loved the ambiance. Will for sure stay there again if we come back to Honolulu. Aloha Surfjack!

Our five night stay here was fabulous. Surfjack is a small, intimate hotel with the friendliest staff there to serve and assist guests in every way, from directions to restaurant suggestions. Our standard room was upgraded to a spacious suite at no additional cost. The beds were comfortable, the linens fresh and the bathroom large. Surfjack is conveniently located within walking distance to Waikiki beaches, the luxury Kalakaua and other shopping districts, restaurants and bus stops. The hotel provides beach chairs and towels. I wouldn't hesitate to stay at Surfjack again.

The service @ this place was always so pleasant and professional, the team were genuinely friendly and there was always a great atmosphere. This place is incredible, and the service is second to none. Highly recommend this place to anyone staying in Waikiki, its retro/coastal feel takes you away from the bustle in the city yet its location is so close to everything. Shout out to Sai who made our stay comfortable, so welcoming, and the fam just felt at home while he was around. Sai your a true professional bro, and an asset to the team @Surfjack. Our absolute first option when we go back and #1 recommendation to our friends. Thanks for having us Surfjack!

We are just on our way home to the East Coast after our Hawaiian honeymoon, it was fantastic! We started with three nights at the surf jack hotel and swim club. The hotel is very cute, has a nice pool, they upgraded our room for free because it was our honeymoon and our balcony faced the pool! The restaurant that is attached to the hotel was fabulous, we ate breakfast there every morning and the service staff was incredibly helpful, giving us ideas of what to do during the day in Oahu and then what to do on our next adventure taking the Norwegian cruise to Maui, the big Island, and Kauai. We took a lot of their advice to heart and rented cars on each island, the food was fantastic and the service was incredible. The hotel is a few blocks away from the beach, but not a difficult walk. On your walk to the beach you will see lots of shops and restaurants. There are also other great places to eat around the hotel. We are especially grateful the the restaurant's manager, Julia. Her tips and kindness were so appreciated! Aloha!

Stayed here for 4 nights after a week on the North Shore. The Surfjack was everything we wanted it to be. 1. Great location right in Waikiki.2. Super cool staff. Everyone I interacted with was so chill and went out of their way to make our time there perfect. 3. Fab decor. This is the most grammable hotel in Waikiki (make sure you get a pool shot) 4. The onsite restaurant is delish.

The pictures on the website and description lead me to believe I was going to an oasis. The truth is this multi story hotel has no bungalows and is in a Back street area. A little misleading. However, it’s not a bad location with the airport bus 2 minutes walk, lots of good restaurants, great coffee shop co-located, a restaurant in house with great food, and bike hire. The bungalows are small (where can I open my case?), the pool is adequate, the wifi works well and beds are comfy. Staff are fun and informative. A boutique hotel, the daily amenity fee had some inclusions like snack basket - but to have anything refilled you needed to ask. The restuarant served delicious food, but we ordered entree and main and whilst eating the entree portion the main arrived so we had to hold the entree plates in our hands to eat it so the main could be sat on the table to go cold, shame really as it was my birthday dinner. Overall it was a good experience but could have been great.

My 13 year old daughter & I stayed her for 6 nights last week. The staff were lovely, with Crystal upgrading us to a better room at a reduced rate. All of the staff were fantastic and really seem to enjoy their jobs!Great location in the centre of Waikiki with restaurants & shopping all around & a short walk to the beach. We utilised the free pushbike hire and concierge were flexible with return times. Snacks in the room were yummy and we spent a few evenings at the bar enjoying the boiled peanuts and a fantastic pizza.

We stayed at this lovely hotel last week as part of our honeymoon. I just wanted to give my complements to all the staff there especially the front staff and Dexter. Dexter was so friendly and awesome for hooking us up with an upgrade for part of our stay. From the moment he helped us check in, he was so helpful in suggesting things to do and made us feel so welcomed. It made our trip so much more special. We appreciate everything he did and wanted to thank him in person but missed him on our last day when we checked out. My husband (Shannon) actually just left you guys a great review but mistakenly referred to Dexter as Daniel, I think. So I just wanted to leave this review here with you guys to make sure that Dexter gets the recognition and thanks he deserves! Mahalo and much love from Toronto, Canada.

Our room was stylish, just the right size and well decorated. It was just the right place for the night. Also enjoyed the $10 restaurant credit for a great breakfast at the restaurant.Great location in the heart of Waikiki, within walking distance of all important places, but quite a walk to the beach.

Every member of staff we met was very nice. The pool is cute, the coffee is good (and free every morning!) and the room was cute. We only ate breakfast at the restaurant, and I thought that it was a little bit overpriced (avocado toast) for what I'm used to in Montreal. We had a great time!

My partner and I are visiting Hawaii and everyone at Surfjack was so friendly and cool. Our waiter Elliot from dinner the first night we got there was so kind and genuine. Housekeeping staff were super friendly. Sai was really helpful in figuring out the optimal time to leave for the airport. We had an amazing breakfast and our waitress was awesome but I forget her name. It was very accommodating and laid-back. Pool was awesome. Very clean and well-designed. Sweet coffee place attached and I got a tasty cortado. Room was beautiful. We will stay here again and you should too!

My husband and I arrived via Speedy Shuttle service ~ 20 mins from airport, $15 per person. Uber quoted $45. Quick and friendly check in. As our room was on the 10th floor and the elevator only goes to the 9th, we had to walk up one flight of stairs. No biggie but it would have been if we had our 3 kids. City view room with a king size bed ~ nicely decorated with retro modern beach vibe. Super comfy bed, crisp linen and fluffy pillows. Great size shower with good pressure. Love the cute bath products! Pool in the centre of the open aired lobby, comfy and casual sitting area, flanked by the restaurant and snack bar/gift shop. Good location: walking distance to shopping, eats and transportation! Love the beach vibe of this hotel! Definitely will return as they have room options to accommodate my big family.

This hotel was an amazing part of our stay in Oahu. We enjoyed the kind hospitality and the rooms were spectacular. My boyfriend and I work in a resort and we enjoyed this to the max. Very clean and many things to do. Fresh towels all the time! Olive and Oliver was very nice. Ben was the most helpful! As was Sai, and Ken. If we ever stay in Honolulu again this will be our hotel!

We have just returned home to New Zealand after 8 nights at the Surfjack. Missing it already. Our friends referred us to this great little hotel - they had a great stay too. The staff were friendly and nothing was too much bother for them. They have really good local knowledge and could answer any query we had about travel, buses, shops etc. The hotel rooms are clean, beds are comfortable, shower and bathroom great and we really liked the design features in the room. The hotel is just off the main strip in Honolulu but walking distance to shops, restaurants and beach. We really rate it as a top boutique hotel and we will be returning on our next trip to Oahu.

My family were recommended this hotel by two seperate groups of people, and their recommendation was spot on. The service was the backbone of this hotel; from the valet, to the bells boys, to customer service agents, every single staff member was friendly, hospitable, and most importantly efficient. Originally we were only booked into The Surfjack for a few nights and then were moving to another hotel, but we quickly changed this and stayed at The Surfjack the entire time. The aesthetics of the hotel was what first struck us when walking in, it was so funky and modern with some well thought out spots for guests to relax around the pool. The location was also awesome, only a few steps to Kuhio Ave where you could catch a bus to basically anywhere on Oahu. It was also a brief walk to get to the beach and the shops! I would recommend this hotel to anyone! Young adults, families, couples, anyone!

Just completed a great 6 nights with the family at The Surfjack Hotel & swim club.We had a one bedroom suite overlooking the pool are. It was perfect for 3 people with two rooms and the pull out couch. The decor was lovely and the bed very comfortable. The hotel itself had a great vibe. We loved the live music at night and also the music by the pool area during the day. Although the pool area is small, we always managed to get a sun lounge when we arrived. We ate breakfast most mornings at Mahina and Suns. It was a really pleasant atmosphere and the food and service was great. We particularly enjoyed the coffee at Olive and Oliver too!The location of the Surfjack was terrific. An easy stroll to the beach and shops, yet far enough away that you are not overrun by other tourists. The location really is great!Easy to recommend based on price, location and friendly service from all staff.

Hello,I booked the Surfjack via a website when i had to re-plan my honeymoon at very short notice. We were really lucky to find ourselves at this place and have been really happy with our stay. The hotel is a cross between very upmarket youth hostel, hipster boutique hotel and funky bar and restaurant. The staff are super friendly and helpful. The reception staff volunteered to send my postcards when they saw me writing them at the pool. They also apologised that the bar had closed when we arrived late at night but immediately suggested how to find a cosy nightcap. I was a little surprised by the "Resort Charge" (a mandatory additional charge levied by almost all hotels on the island to cover, pool towels, etc) when we arrived, but over the course of our stay the $25 dollar a night charge turned out to be by far the best value on the island covering lots more stuff than the other hotels do. At the Surfjack it includes:Wi-Fi.Pool towels (as many as wanted).Towels to take to the beech.Use of the super cool hipster push bikes (with locks and helmets).Snacks in your room.Daily bottles of water.Bottomless amounts of the really good Surfjack coffee all morning.Most relevant a $10 REBATE daily on any food and drink purchases (which is a round of drinks or a homemade scones and banana cakes breakfast for two). The rebate on daily food charges encouraged us to try the food at the hotel which we might not have otherwise done. It was some of the best food we tried in wakiki and reasonably priced in comparison to other hotel food. the poached egg and avocado breakfast is delicious and the salads offered at lunch are really good too.The bar staff are great and a bad influence! I can recommend at afternoon sipping cocktails poolside, as long as you aren't busy later on!It was our honeymoon and the staff upgraded us to a small suite which was very clean, well appointed, well decorated in a slightly hipster/surf style with 2 cable TV's and very effective air-con. Like many local hotel rooms it had what is called a "city view", in our case we faced the multi storey car park next door. Initially this was a shock but we quickly realised it meant a really quiet, not over looked, room and patio. With the windows open you could take a lazy afternoon nap and not hear a squeek from the road or the weekend DJ playing in the pool area. The Surfjack is partnered with a close by hotel for tour and concierge service, William arranged a hire car upgrade and discount for us, very friendly. This hotel also has a self service laundry. Located on the top end of Lewer street several bars are in striking distance it was a 5 minute walk to the main strip. Turn left at the end of the street for cheaper eats including a really great noodle bar (the permanent line is worth the ten min wait) and some good Mexican food. For a really fun time off the strip (much cheaper eats and drinks) try Tiki bar Cookoo Coconut 333 Royal Hawaiian Ave.It looks a bit 80's and run down from the street but it's really friendly and fun. You don't find a lot of bars offering cocktails in hollowed out pineapples and coconuts served by German guys with a dry wit.  The surfjack represented really good value for money in the area, the rooms are very nice but the value is mostly realised in the mellow vibes of the pool area with its great food, drink and superb friendly service. If your looking for a hotel in waikiki look no father. If you are on a budget trip and are looking to treat yourself for a night or two this is a great choice. If you have gotten this far down the review thanks for sticking with me. I hope you have a great time where ever you visit.

If you're looking for a resort-style full service mega hotel, this is NOT the hotel for you. This is a small boutique hotel with big style and personality. This hotel is very unique to Waikiki. While other larger chain hotels try to mimic the sort of surfer beach cottage vintage feel infused with modern finesse, the Surfjack hits it on the mark. As soon as you walk through the entry way you are transported to what feels like 1950s Hawaii, not that I was in Hawaii in the 1950s...but this hotel has beautiful mid-century elements along with Hawaiian vintage inspired themes. I love it all!All of the staff we encountered during our stay showed us so much aloha, specifically Tiki the bellman and I think his name was Johnathan at the front desk. Our room was a 1 bedroom suite with a king bed and sofa bed. Spacious enough for the two of us, but could have probably fit another 2 people in living room area. The structure was an existing hotel that had been heavily renovated. The renovation was beautifully done. Given the location, we didn't expect much for the view. Our room was facing "mauka" (towards the mountains) and was surprising quiet for Waikiki. We didn't encounter any issues with the room during our stay. The restaurant downstairs, Mahina and Suns is one of my favorite, so naturally, there are no complaints here. Staff was always pleasant and we never had to wait for a table. If I did have to point out any downsides to this hotel it is that they didn't have a laundry room available, but they do offer laundry service. There is a pool in the center of the lobby which is really interesting and falls into the "swim club" theme, but they do not have a Jacuzzi unfortunately and the pool does close quite early, but I can imagine that's is so the noise doesn't affect guests in the rooms facing the pool. Lastly, the hotel only offers valet parking, which is pretty standard throughout Waikiki. Only the larger hotel properties offer guest self-parking.This is the type of hotel I sought out and the experience had far exceeded my expectations. The Surfjack hotel is my number one choice for hotels in Waikiki.

I travelled here with my best friend and we loved our stay at the Surfjack staying in a one bedroom room on the 4th level overlooking the building next door. The rooms have been doing very nicely with room living room and bathroom. The bedroom was simple but luxurious and great place to have as a home base.The amenities although limited are enough for those who are spending all their time exploring the beach and the city. The pool is great but be warned only a few lounges they will fill up quickly! The pool is also in the lobby area so don't be shy about people seeing you swimming from the street! Would have loved a bit more choice in food but then again just head outside and you have so much choice! Very chilled grabbing a free coffee in the morning but definitely try the coffee from Olive and Oliver. There is limited kitchen facilities in the room making it hard to do anything for yourself but they were quick to bring us cutlery and plates when we brought our own food from the local shops.

The Surfjack Hotel & Swim Club, centrally located in Waikiki and one of Oahu’s trendiest hotels at the moment. With mid-century furniture interspersed, along with artwork curated from local artists and designers, the hotel is intentional in its retro Hawaiian décor with historic flair. The most Instagrammed hotel in Hawai’i lives at the Surfjack. Four little words at the bottom of the pool, “Wish You Were Here.” 10 Minute walk from Waikiki Beach. You can use the Surfjacks’ bikes for 3 hours and they provide locks you can utilize. ABC store on the corner, one block from the Surfjack. Incredible gay bar two doors down, Bacchus Waikiki. Within 5 Blocks of the Hyatt Centric and Laylow if you want nightlife later in the evening. Benji at the front desk is incredible and should get a raise. Reason for a 4-Star: Very slow wait time at Mahina & Suns for drinks. I understand it was the weekend and all bars are busy but there is no reason to wait 15 minutes to pay your tab. I would recommend having more than two bartenders on staff for a Saturday Evening.Room: I stayed in the One Bedroom Suite and it can comfortably fit Two Adults and 2 Children. The sofa bed is very comfortable and no child would complain about sleeping on it. Sliding door for the bathroom and large balcony. Make sure you look at the list of artists that contributed to the hotel in their Hotel Book on the table or TV stand. Included in the Resort Fee is complimentary 3-Hour Access to their bikes, admission to the Honolulu Museum of Art, and a daily $10 Food and Beverage Hotel Credit. Also included is use of a beach/tote bag during your stay. AND coffee in the morning, even if it’s not Hawaiian.Food/Dining: Mahina & Suns is their restaurant and bar. High quality food run by Honolulu chef Ed Kenney. Elevated home cooking featuring produce and ingredients from local farms and markets. Shout out to Kuala Ranch for the Oysters. I dined here for Brunch and Dinner, cannot say anything but great things. The Malted Waffle was incredible and a Bloody Mary with okra, how could you go wrong? On the weekend, expect longer waits for drinks. Con: No coffee from Hawaii at the coffee shop? For supporting local artists and Hawai’i, I would’ve hoped you served local coffee as well. Especially since it’s the only state in the U.S. that can grow coffee commercially. The coffee shop is a third party and technically not related to the hotel.Tip: Stay in tuned with the Events that they host at the Surfjack. They’re not always included for being a guest but they’re always fascinating and innovative. Yoga on the Penthouse Lanai occurs semi-regularly. You don’t want to miss the views of the Waikiki skyline from up there.

Pros: - clean and very comfortable- great retro decor- very friendly staff, willing to lend a hand with everything we required- excellent restaurant serving outstanding breakfasts and dinners (restaurant staff again very friendly) - lovely pool, if a little small, but this is Waikiki. - you actually feel as though you’re getting something for your resort fees, which at $25 per night are already modest for Hawaii, but in return you get two waters per day, $10 restaurant credit per day, welcome snacks and free morning coffee. Cons:- street noise: an issue not unique to this hotel, as this is a very busy and touristic area and this hotel is right in the middle of the action (in a good way). We probably didn’t get a full nights sleep in the 4 nights we stayed - but I strongly doubt that would have been any different at other Waikiki hotels.

We are a family of 4 (2 Adults, 2 teens). Staying in a 1 bedroom (2 double bed). There was room enough for the four of us, it was clean and decorated nicely with a relaxed feel. The shower looked great and had two shower heads (a fixed one up top and a handheld one) which was great. The pool area was really cool. I felt the hotel would be best suited to 20 - 35 year olds, with the laid back atmosphere. Though I didn't feel uncomfortable being there. If you took small children you could feel like you should keep them quiet as to not disturb the other guests. I was annoyed when a bar staff forgot the pizza I ordered then offered me a glass of wine to make up for the inconvenience only to forget that as well (I did get the pizza eventually but I never got the wine). The staff at reception were fantastic, my son left his cell phone in a cab and the girl on the desk did all she could to try to retrieve it. I loved the open entry and the old movie playing by the pool at night. Surfjack has a feeling of yesteryear and if I'm ever back in Waikiki I will stay there again.

Its hard to describe this place but it has a cool retro vibe. We stayed in a one bedroom and it was a great stay. I enjoyed the free morning paper and coffee. They also have free water all day long at the pool. Location is within walking distance to all the places you want to be near on Lewers. DJ and cabanas surrounding the pool is a plus. The toiletries are of high quality, the type you don't mind using or taking home. They only have valet parking but all the staff are attentive and courteous. my only gripe was that the bathroom a/c fan was a little loud during sleep hours but not a deal breaker.

We stayed here one night and it was such a cool place to stay. The room was clean, large and with a comfortable bed. The air condition worked great. Superfriendly staff who was very helpful and also let us come by for a hospitality room after check out due to our late flight. This service was free of charge. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

When I read the reviews I thought this sounded like a great place and I wasn't disappointed. The Surfjack is exceptional in every way.I had to stay alone on business and would thoroughly recommend this Hotel to anyone. The staff at the Surfjack were amazing. I was uncomfortable as a woman traveling by myself but it was really like having a family around so I never felt alone. The live music was wonderful, great singers and stops at 9pm so you can still sleep. The pool area was buzzing with people and music but never crowded. The staff at Mahinas were lovely and made great food and drinks. The car valets were professional but relaxed and always said hello when I got back each day. This place juggles tourists, business people, young travelers and families and creates a great experience for everyone.In short, I just loved it and wouldn't stay anywhere else now. Lovely small resort feel, relaxed vibe, quality everything. Will definitely be back.

We really didn't know what to expect when we booked the Surfjack - it had great reviews, but looked like it might be aimed at a 20-30's demographic, not a family with 4-year-old twins. We had nothing to worry about. From the relaxed check-in (you can hang out in the lounge while they get the paperwork together) to the hip but comfortable rooms (complete with balcony overlooking the pool - the kids never got tired of being out there), to the delicious Mahina and Sun's restaurant, everything was relaxed and welcoming. Everyone at the Surfjack seemed willing to go out of their way to be helpful and make your vacation as easy as possible. In a rush to head out in the morning? Sure, they can pull the car around early while you go and wrangle the kids. Oh, and don't forget the beach towels - just drop them back off when you get back in the evening. Hot and tired at the end of a fun day? There are cold lemon and lime water dispensers (not once empty in the week we were there) waiting to welcome you back.And the live music by the pool? Great - and easy to hear from the balcony if you wanted to hang out and listen, but with the balcony door closed - no sounds from down below - completely silent and restful. We had a great stay at the Surfjack and will definitely be back!

Fessing up to just how epic this hotel is, will only make it harder to get reservations when I want to go back- but its too great not to share. The staff is AMAZING!!! They learn your name, remember little things, and really try to deliver on a great experience all without a corporate script.The property is really nice, pool/restaurant/room all are the right scale- have nice island style/mixed with mid-century modern.The balconies are great for coffee in the morning- Its a short walk to shops and beach. The food was super tasty as are the drinks! Super happy hour specials. ITS ALL GOOD. Looking forward to sending friends and family to check it out, and most of all looking to come back in Dec.

An interesting find in Waikiki.Dont be put off by first impressions as this was a well located, chilled out hotel with friendly and helpful staff.Excellent morning coffee and when we ate there in the evening- great food.

We needed a place to stay in Honolulu whilst we looked at the UH with our youngest daughter. I'm so glad I found the suarfjack!!!! We were looking for a place that didn't feel like a crazy tourist hotel and we found it! The vibe at the Surffjack is warm and friendly from the front door to the housekeeping and from everyone in between. This old hotel has been refurbished to a mid-century jewel. Our room was a standard two bedroom. Not to much to say but it was clean and a decent size. The pool is small but cool and lots of people spent time hanging there. On our day off from "business" we walked 4 blocks to the beach. Easy peasy when the Suarfjack supplies the clean towels and beach bag. We also walked to dinner and shopping from this great location. I noticed that lots of places have music in the evenings. I was impressed that the Suarfjack seemed to have the best local talent. Others not so much ;) The night we ate at the hotel our waitress said "the UH is full of Aloha". But I say "The Surffjack is full of Aloha"!

I can't say enough good things about this place. We stayed 3 nights after our 5 night stay at Turtle Bay resort on the North Shore....and the service and friendly attitude of the staff at this hotel have them beat hands down. Every staff member we met knew who we were and seemed to genuinely care that we were enjoying our stay and offered to help us in anyway required. Thanks for a great stay!

Great small hotel, close to everything in Waikiki, great pool and bar. Staff were so friendly and helpful. Loved the live music every night. Great place to relax. Rooms were clean and tidy. Would recommend especially for couples.

We stayed in the Surfjack hotel for one week in early September. Our first impressions were that it was a unique and compact hotel with staff that were genuinely pleased to see you. The pool was visible right away and people were relaxing around it. You can get an idea of the size from photos on this site. The bar and restaurant were just a few steps away too. We registered with the friendly guys on reception and then went to our room. Our cases were there already, waiting for us. The room was of a decent size with two large beds and all the usual hotel room stuff. There was a balcony that overlooked the pool where music was playing. Each evening, they played an old movie on an outdoor screen (no sound) which reflected the surfing era years ago. It all added to the atmosphere and vibe around the place.The hotel is a short walk from the beach and we were very happy with the location. There are ABC food stores nearby.The bathroom was compact and had everything required. The hair drier was robust and worked well. The towels were of a decent quality.There was a small empty fridge for our use which contained two bottles of water which were replenished each day. There were three packs of snacks also. Dried Mango, butter popcorn and some savoury nibbles. These were a welcome complimentary gesture.Virginia, our housekeeper was a delight with her little notes wishing us a good day. She carried out her duties with a smile and great efficiency, making sure everything was perfect.The aircon was efficient.We ate in the restaurant twice and both meals were extremely good. The waitresses were knowledgeable about the dishes and explained anything that was not clear. The complimentary coffee which you could collect from the restaurant on a morning was welcome.The resort tax of $25 included the water in the fridge each day, beach towels to take out, bikes to ride if desired, Wi-Fi (excellent signal) and $10 against the restaurant for food and drink.We enjoyed having drinks at the bar and the staff treated us as friends with their easy chat.Whenever we came back from a day out, it felt like coming home – always a genuine smile and welcome.One day I fell over at the pool (no, not in an alcoholic stupor). I think a bather may have spilt some sun cream. Within seconds there were at least three members of staff there to help me. They got there before my hubby even. They looked after me and Dexter was particularly concerned and kind.What was apparent to us is that these people really care about their guests and the services they offer and this is not something you often get in the larger impersonal hotels.Unfortunately, when we travelled on to our next holiday destination, we discovered that we had left two of our wallets containing a considerable amount of cash on the bed in the hotel room in the hustle and bustle of preparing to leave. It was late evening in Oahu. We phoned the hotel from San Francisco and they confirmed that they had the wallets and they sent them to us immediately via UPS and we received them two days later every dollar accounted for. At no point were we worried that there would be cash missing. There are not many hotels where you would have that service and honesty. Thank you Virginia. You are a star.To summarise, this is a fantastic hotel with lovely people and I have no hesitation to recommend it. If you want a hotel that is big, impersonal, without character and could be anywhere in the world because of its blandness, then this is not the one for you.

Surfjack is a fabulous hotel located right in centre of Waikiki. Very hip and modern, with fantastic pool, bar and restaurant. We had a three-bedroom suite for 5 of us. Rest of family had a one bedroom suite. Was perfect for all of us - an all-age family group from Sydney (50 year olds, 20 year olds and one toddler) in Honolulu for a family wedding. Rooms were great; well-appointed, cleaned and made up daily. Staff were really friendly and hospitable, providing great service. The restaurant on site had a wide-ranging menu full of fresh salads and healthy options. On Friday afternoon, and Saturday, there was a DJ at the pool - we had such fun floating around, then lazing with some cocktails listening to the groove poolside! It was also great swimming around with toddler granddaughter, who also had great fun!Best thing about Surfjack is that it channels a modern, hip vibe, with a cool poolside atmosphere that is not about 100s of people trying to get a lounge and trying to look good. It's smaller, packs a punch and really enables the Waikiki holiday we were after. Would highly recommend it!

Every corner of this hotel is instagram ready. Rooms were modern, clean and a perfect for unwinding after days exploring everything Honolulu has to offer which a lot of are right outside of your door step.
