The mandatory resort fee includes amenity and wi-fi access, $10 food/beverage credit for each night you stay, complimentary coffee at the restaurant and snacks in your room, two bottles of cold water waiting for you in the fridge each day and free admission to a local museum. We stayed at the Moana Surfrider for three nights before transferring to the Surfjack for two nights and regretted not staying at the Surfjack the whole time instead. We've stayed in 5 star and boutique hotels around the world and the service here is one of the best we've experienced.

My mom and I came to Hawaii for a long weekend to plan for my wedding next year. We stayed at the SurfJack and LOVED it. The pool, atmosphere, and room were so trendy and hip but it was the service that blew us away. I wanted to give a shout out to Channy, she was working the front desk. When my mom told her that we were from Texas and my sister lives in Houston, Channy had such genuine sympathy and care towards my mother. My mom came back to the room in tears, she was so moved by how nice Channy was.If you stay in Honolulu, you must stay at the SurfJack. And make sure you talk to the staff, they feel like old friends you have known for a long time :)

My daughter who was turning 21 and I went to Waikiki for a week and we didn't want the glitzy or busy large hotel experience. From the moment we walked in to the time we left 7 days later, we were buzzing with delight at our accomodation. The hotel restaurant had a small but delightful menu, the rooms were clean and modern, the pool while small (not quite enough sun loungers) was adequate and all that we needed. While all the staff were great, a big shout out to Jordyn at reception area who was just superb and really got what we wanted in terms of activities and food places to try. Everything she recommended was spot on. Also to Benjamin who again was really engaged, helpful and on my daughters actual birthday a complimentary bottle of champagne turned up. Great place if you like a smaller, casual but very friendly place.

Robbie (Robert) was the best person I've ever had taking care of us. He handled everything we needed and even got his dad to drive us around the entire island. This was a truly amazing experience, and without him it just wouldn't be the same.

What a vibrant, happy, easy place to stay. Staff in all areas - restaurant, front reception, housekeeping - are the best - helpful and super friendly. Our one bedroom suite on the 6th floor was clean, roomy and quiet - a minor gripe is no coffee/tea making facility in our room, but it did not spoil the stay. We did not use the pool, but certainly made use of the poolside lounge area and Mahina & Sons for drinks, breakfast and dinner - we lazed and enjoyed the music! For us the location was perfect - just a block or so away from the main shopping and the high rise of the beach. A perfect place to stop off on our way back to Western Australia from eastern Canada.

We stayed at the Surfjack Hotel on a one night stop over heading back to Australia.The hotel was a great find. Staff all had great customer service skills. We did not swim but the pool did look very inviting. Room was well thought out.We will recommend this hotel to friends and would book again.

The hotel is super cute - very boutique-y and stylish. Great vibe immediately upon entering the front and checking in. The staff are super friendly and kind. We enjoyed the comfortable, unpretentious pool, lobby and restaurant area. The room was well equipped, with comfy beds, plenty of room and a charming decor. I was a bit concerned that being in Waikiki, the night activity would be loud - but not at all! We had a very restful, quiet sleep! This was a stay-cation, and I will definitely return!

My wife & I stayed @ SurfJack for our first 3 nights in Oahu before heading to Maui. Benjamin at the front desk & the entire staff was world class. After our reservation was mixed up for two double beds, Ben upgraded us to the King Suite with no additional charge. Who does that?! The atmosphere @ SurfJack made us feel welcome & was the true island vibe we were looking for. Walking distance from Waikiki, but a nice separation from the downtown hustle. We would HIGHLY recommend this spot, & would visit again in a heartbeat.

Stayed at Surfjack for 10 and had a great time. Nice, friendly staff were always willing to help and sort us out in regards to beach towels, chairs, bikes to hire and anything else in between. The restaurant at the hotel was a 10/10 and was probably the best dinner we had for the 10 nights we were there. On one Saturday, Surfjack hosted a pool party and it was great fun. The rooms were cleaned and serviced every single day, so we were provided with fresh towels and fresh sheets each day. Highly recommend this to anyone travelling to Waikiki

Good vibe, perfect hotel for family, great location, walking distance to the beach and shopping area.Very helpfull and friendly personel, especially Jordyn and Krystal, and all bellmen.We would definitely stay here again.

The hotel staff are absolutely amazing! I truely couldn't just name one as they all went above and beyond to ensure that our first family holiday was an enjoyable one. The intimate pool area allowed for us to mingle with other holiday makers in a fresh and funky atmosphere while enjoying the most delish food from Mahina and Suns.

I had heard great things about this hotel, it exceeded our expectations. Staff were cruisey, friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean, well furnished and a great size. We had the 2 bedroom. My only complaint was there wasn't enough hooks for towels, but does not take anything away from the hotel. The pool had a great vibe, great music playing, attentive staff. The location is also really good. An easy walk to restaurants, shops bars etc. The decor is awesome, so many cool art pieces to look at. I would highly recommend staying here.

My all time favourite hotel , amazing staff , especially Krystal who is lovely , fantastic rooms , great vibe and and the decour is retro kitsch classic. My home from home in Hawaii and can't wait to go back

I was intrigued by the HIGH reviews while searching for a place to stay for the family during the summer. THEY did it again. Five stars from us also! The rooms are immaculate yes, and the property is by no means new. So what is it that separates this gem from the ordinary or worse? IT'S THE SERVICE with the Aloha Spirit. Obviously management chooses employees carefully and trains with a high degree on customer care. Our stay was very relaxing and supportive...thanks mainly to a great staff all around. Thank you. All this for an affordable rate....just amazing.

Stayed for three nights before visiting the big island and came back for one night pre flying to LAGreat boutique hotelNot on the beach but a ten minute walk awayVery friendly staffLovely roomsGreat laid back vibeGood valueWould definitely come backHighly recommended Keep up the good work Wishing you all the success you deserve

Stayed here Summer 2017 with a friend. The room was on the small side, but functional, with a closet, dresser, hooks, plenty of outlets and a balcony. The bathroom was clean and well appointed. They designers of the Surfjack took care to ensure everything was done with style and purpose. It's not a luxury property, but a fun one. We ate breakfast at the hotel every morning and we loved the waitstaff there. They made recommendations and helped us plan our stops all over Oahu. The location is a few blocks from the main drag of Waikiki, which we liked. Waikiki is like any main shopping street in any big American city, very busy. Pros - overall style, helpful staff, location, restaurant. Cons - smaller rooms, small pool area.

True Hawaiian hospitality with welcoming touches throughout this local gem of a hotel. Loved the swim club lobby and surrounding terrace. Easy to spend a few hours chilling by the pool soaking up the cool DJ sounds and savouring Mahina & Sun's local cuisine.

The staff was great at the surfjack. The housekeeping left notes each day for us in the room and the desk staff was great in accommodating us with our strange check in and out times. The hotel has been fantastically renovated. The pool is adorable. Amazing outdoor space for relaxing. Only downside is I did find the location to be just a smidge too far for my liking. I usually stay right in the center of Waikiki, and this was a little more west than I'd prefer. It was just a bit too far for walking back and forth to the main beaches. But the hotel provides towels and a cute tote bag for your use while you're there to help with your trek.

This is a great fun hotel. It has a great friendly atmosphere from the moment you are met. All of the staff are welcoming and helpful. The central pool area is well laid out with beds and tables, bar staff are on hand to bring drinks. Great fun afternoons with visiting DJ's for pool parties that were never intrusive to the rooms and never went on too late. Rooms were lovely, but this is another room without coffee and tea making facilities. Always clean and well presented. I have to give a shout out to Robert at the bar and Channy and Crystal on the desk who were so helpful during our stay and when leaving. Also Tiki the baggage handler. What a character. This is one that I would recommend without hesitation.

This hotel is a little treasure. Conveniently located within a few minutes of the beach or restaurants, but far enough away that it is a quite hideaway. The hotel staff was incredibly hospitable, patiently answering questions for restaurants, directions, and taxis. And, the room is warm and cozy. Not to mention the beautiful, iconic, pool. All in all, one of our favorite hotels to date and would highly recommend if you venture to Honolulu. Enjoy!

I have never written a review before however this is the first time I feel that a hotel didn't live up to it's trip advisor reviews. My first impression of this hotel was soured when my partner and I were given a room with two double beds instead of one queen. When we went to the desk to query this we were told that we needed to request one bed, however at no point was that indicated throughout the booking process (be aware that you need to request this in the notes). We were offered to pay to upgrade however chose not to as we had chosen this hotel partly based on the price, otherwise we would have stayed closer to the beach, which I will do next time we visit. The next day we were informed that our room had been upgraded which was lovely and much appreciated as two double beds really doesn't have the same feel for a couple. The next thing that effected the stay was the cleaners vacuuming the halls at 8:30am, if you like to sleep in this may also effect you. One of the cleaners actually walked into our room at 9am when we were in the bed. This was unusual to me as I have stayed in many hotels and nothing like this has never happened before. The final thing that made me decide to write a review was the service at the front desk. We asked for some tips on where to go as we had hired a car for the day. The girl at the desk seemed completely uninterested in offering any tips on where good beaches were or where we could snorkel. She acted as though she knew nothing about the island which to me isn't really acceptable if you work at the front desk of a hotel! This completely contrasted the reviews about wonderful staff as this was the worst service experienced in my whole time in Hawaii. The positives are that the hotel design is cute, the artwork and furniture is lovely and the live music was fantastic, however I wouldn't stay here again based on the above.

Great hotel really good atmosphere , the rooms are very clean and modern, we had a two rooms with a large bathroom lovely big shower , comfy beds and good decor. From start to finish the staff are really happy friendly and helpful. It had a pool not a lot of beds though first come first served . Location is good walking distance to town loads of shops eateries bars etc. If we came back we would stay here. Thanks for making our stay great guys

Amazing hotel!!! We stayed with them for four days. The staff was super friendly and gave us vouchers to use at the beach when they were fixing their pool. Excellent location. Would love to stay with them again!
user_name:
Josh W
New York City, New York

review_body: The Surfjack hotel was great, The room was great everyone was super friendly and accommodating, The only thing that I thought was a bit of an inconvenience was the pool was only family friendly till 5 then it went to adult only, That being said I highly recommend Surfjack,Mark

We had such a fantastic stay at the Surfjack highlighted by the amazing staff! From check in to check out I was constantly impressed with every staff member I encountered. Specifically Jordyn and Tiki at the front desk and bartender Carter were absolutely wonderful! While the hotel itself (decor, location, cleanliness, style) is worth a stay, the hospitality truly puts this place at the top of my list. Will definitely be staying here again and will highly recommend to anyone traveling to Waikiki. Mahalo nui loa!

We had a fabulous stay at the Surfjack Hotel and Swim Club. We stayed in Waikiki for 8 nights and the hotel was perfect for our needs. Located approx 500m from the beach, it's a funky modern hotel with a relaxed vibe. The staff were excellent, friendly, knowledgeable and were happy to have a chat and get to know their guests. The room (suite) was clean, neat and tidy and had all the modern functions one would need. Large bathroom and shower, seperate lounge room to the bedroom. During our stay they had local musical guests come to play in their lobby / restaurant area and it provided a great atmosphere. I believe this is something they do on a regular basis. The pool area is small and there aren't a lot off day beds etc. however we preferred to spend our time by the beach. Great location and walking distance from the main strip, restaurants, shopping and beach.

First thing I notice was the beautiful island scent that fills the hotel front desk area. It is so welcoming. The Surfjack's guest service is exceptional - all the staff were so kind & go above and beyond to make sure our needs were met during our 10 day stay (7/25-8/3) there. They always greeted us with "Welcome back family!" when we returned to the hotel after a long day at the beach or shopping. It made us happy and put a smile on our face. They took their time to explain whatever we needed or made sure our stay is pleasant. They made us feel like part of their family. Thank you!Hotel amenities were fabulous as well - they are from Davine's and We enjoyed Momo shampoo and conditioner. I was going to bring my own but I'm glad I listened to my husband - anyone who is planning to stay at the Surfjack, don't pack shampoo, conditioner, lotion and soap - you won't need it! The hotel got you covered!Groovy chill music and island music play all day long while you enjoy delicious food by the pool. Live music during dinner time - simply a great atmosphere and we enjoyed every minute of it. We would like to thank Dexter and Robbie, the guest managers who made our stay possible and pleasurable. And the crew - Jordyn, Philip, Krystle, Ken, Ben, Channy, Sai and Tiki- thank you so much for being so wonderful and helpful. Your smile and kindness made our children happy and we felt welcomed every time we stepped into the hotel. We appreciate each one of you for treating us with respect and love. For this reason, we will come back to this hotel because there's no other place like it. We were so sad to say goodbyes.We highly recommend this hotel because of the hospitality that you can't get anywhere else. Looking forward to next summer!

Traveling the Hawaiian islands for 3 weeks with our 3 kids aged 11, 9 and 9... had a great time but wanted a short stop in famous Waikiki after lots of beaches, mountains/volcano hiking, tropical forest ... lovely hip atmosphere with music and pool/bar at reception was the right setting with awesome service and comfortable room - in bang Centre on Waikiki just few mins walk to shopping restaurants and beach! Good cocktails and beer as well as cool lunch selection - try poco loco (but ask them to not overcook the meat!) and Must do is Mahina's bowl with spicy Ahi - delicious!!

Lovely hotel, great convenient location. They treat locals like family and make you feel right at home. I've stayed here multiple times in the last month and each time is phenomenal. My new favorite home away from away. I will say some of the staffs professionalism hasn't been my favorite but that doesn't account for the rest of the staff! Looking forward to my next visit already!

We wanted a smaller hotel, close to the beach, easy access to everything and we found it. We loved the laid back, welcoming atmosphere, the staff were very friendly and helpful. The food was great! We ate breakfast and lunch here. We booked a two bedroom room and it was spacious for two adults and two teens (one teen had the second bedroom, the other had the living room with pull out). We appreciated the beach chairs for our beach days, the fresh towels for beach and pool and the great service. We only had to walk to the corner street for some snack and refreshments we wanted and it was a 7-10 minutes walk to the beach, and what a beach, so blue, soft sand, just beautiful.The hotel pool is great, we all enjoyed it! Might want to consider staying open for kids and teens to at least 7pm. Would recommend for families and couples. Really nice lounging area around the pool to relax!

We are regulars to Hawaii and normally stay on the beach front, however, we thought we would try somewhere a little off the beaten path... and we found a gem! The staff, the rooms, the food, the pool are all of the highest quality and are a credit to the management. My family and I had a wonderful time and can't wait to return. Thank you, Surf Jack!

We arrived at the Surfjack with high expectation after reading the wonderful reviews and we were not disappointed. We arrived at 7.00am and were fortunate enough to be given immediate access to our room which was very lucky and for which we were very grateful after an overnight 10 hour flight from Melbourne. The check in was quick and efficient. Jordyn was a delight to deal with. Our immediate first impressions were exactly what we expected - a warm, inviting, funky hotel with a calm but vibrant vibe. The scent throughout the lobby which is their signature scent was divine. I couldn't get enough of that smell the whole 12 days we were there. The decor, new and stylish in a mid century relaxed styling which I immersed myself into easily. I loved the decor and the furniture and everything about it. The room (we were again very lucky to be upgraded from a bungalow to a 1 bedroom) was beautiful in its decor and styling and a great size. There was loads of storage which was great. A lot more than we have seem in many hotels. The linen was beautiful. Our two girls, 13 and 8 said the sofa bed was the most comfortable they have ever slept in - ever. Our bed was also very comfortable and we slept very well. The view of the pool was gorgeous. The bathroom was stylish and a good size. The bathroom amenities were MOMO - very high quality. The free coffee in the morning was appreciated by all although I chose to have the coffee at the coffee shop on site which was delicious. The restaraunt Mahina and Sons on site was top quality serving amazing quality food. I thoroughly enjoyed the food and the kids loved the waffles in the morning. The pizza was as good as you get in Italy. The spicy tuna poke bowl delicious. The service was fantastic and the decor and open air style was gorgeous. The pool was a great temperature where I could stay in for ages and not get cold. I loved the music which the played during the day and LOVED the on site DJ on weekends. The music was fantastic. We enjoyed the low rise nature of the building and the fact that everything was within quick and easy reach - the elevators, the room, the pool, the restaraunt, the coffee shop and the street. I'm not sure how people say its 5 minutes walk to main street - we found it to be 2 minutes to walk to Kalakau and another minutes or so to the beach. The location is brilliant. We have never stayed at a property which isn't beach front but we found the location of Surfjack to be just as good albeit the tiniest bit longer to get to the water. We stayed for 5 nights at the Sheraton after the Surfjack to give kids access to the multiple pools etc. All of us, including the kids preferred the Surfjack by a mile. The Sheraton was huge, dated, and it took a long long while to get anywhere due to its sheer size. There were huge amount of people at lifts and it took minutes to walk from the lifts to our room, from lifts to street etc. But mostly it was impersonal. We were merely a number. Anoynomous. Noone knew us. Noone really cared about us and that's OK but having come from the Surfjack where we hugged and kissed the staff when we left and felt immediate sadness on departure - it was very noticeable how much the big hotels such as the Sheraton are lacking in this area. I cannot speak highly enough of ALL the staff at the Surfjack, the day staff, the night staff, reception, the porters, the bell boys. All were BEAUTIFUL kind souls. They became and now are our friends for life. They were helpful with directions and advice and always happy to have a chat but not to the point of encroaching on our space. Even the cleaner would leave us notes every day saying hello and wishing us a good day. The beautiful grace and nature of the Surfjack staff was genuine (even though they have to do it every day) and heart warming. We thank each and every one of them from the bottom of our hearts for an amazing stay. We loved it and we adored you all. In hindsight we wish we hadn't gone to the Sheraton for the last portion of our trip (5 nights there cost us more than 11 nights at the Surfjack). But we wont do that again. Whilst I like to try different places if I return to a destination, I would not consider this with Waikiki.; We would 100% return to the Surfjack. My youngest made me walk her to the Surjack after we left to go to the Sheraton, to show Jordyn her hair braids. That is what made this holiday special - the people at the Surjack. It also didn't hurt that the place is gorgeous! Mahalo Surfjack - we miss you so much! Until next time. Love Mary, Michael, Maddy and Jaime Spanos xxx

Its my first time to stay at this hotel in Honolulu. It's very impressive place and comfortable place just like home. The location is very convenient to go to main shopping and food street as well as the waikiki beach. The hotel is not that big but not crowded at all even though pool is full. And I love every single of design and interior of hotel. Its not like huge resort but the furnitures, wall design, other accessorizes are very fashionable. You will like it if you are interested in interior. Room size and quality is perfect for us and very quite.All staffs are super kind and friendly. Especially, 'Sai' who helped me a lot whenever I need something while I was staying was very kind and smile to us. He offered very touching service to us. Thanks again!I'm strongly recommend you to stay here.

It's a snazzy boutique hotel that was converted from an old hotel a year ago. Perfect for a hipster. We got a top floor (8th) room, AWAY from the pool side. The pool side has an active bar scene, with a very good restaurant, but once we got to our room and shut the door; silence, which was important to me. The pool really does have "Wish You Were Here" painted on it. Smallish pool, but you are three blocks from the beach! There is a good breakfast joint (Heavenly) two blocks away. It was ideal.

The Surfjack hotel is a wonderful boutique hotel that lived up to all expectations and deserves its trip advisor rating. The accommodation is central, clean, modern and well appointed whilst at the same time maintaining its small and intimate boutique nature. However If you are looking for a hotel or resort on the beach or with sea views then this is not the hotel for you. But if like me you are looking for a special hotel away from the hussle and bustle and offering a customised and bespoke experience then i cannot recommend this hidden gem enough. Whilst all the staff were amazing, a special thanks to Dexter, Robbie, Jordyn and Benjamin for outstanding service above and beyond. Hope to be back soon (provided the hotel remains special and not too many people find out about it ). Darron.

We loved the Surfjack from the moment we stepped foot on property. We arrived early not expecting to check in and Jordyn said we can proceed to our room. A wonderful and welcome surprise! Sai graciously helped us to our 2 bedroom suite. Fantastic staff, super warm and friendly. We stayed 3 nights and felt like family upon leaving. The small boutique atmosphere was an awesome change from the huge poolside experiences at other large hotels. We never had any trouble finding a comfy spot around the pool for all 4 of us. When faced with, what I consider a big issue (the one and only reason this is not a 5 star review), Dexter accommodated us perfectly and made our issue become a small deal. Upon check out Dexter and Channy surprised us with one more gesture of kindness and made our goodbye a perfect one. Dining at Mahina & Sun's was enjoyed by all. We especially loved our dinner experience on 7/19. One of our best meals on the island. Hope to be back one day.The Mullins

Spent four days here. A few minor blemishes: doors slam, sharp bed frame corners catch unwary shins, must climb stairs to reach 10th floor suites. But the warm sweet character of this place reminds me of my youth when I would visit a dear old aunt in Honolulu from time to time. This place is more than a hotel and the people here are more than courteous and helpful. The Aloha spirit lives at the Surfjack. Can't wait to return.

We spent four days here in the past week and loved the hotel. The service is cheerful and helpful at all times, the rooms are spacious and well-appointed, and the location is near the center of Waikiki restaurants and attractions. Who could ask for much more? We had a family suite, which comfortably slept our group of five travelers. Compared with other hotels we considered prior to our visit, this was a really good bargain. If/when we travel to Oahu again, we will be certain to consider this hotel.

The hotel is really lovely. Everything is so well thought out, the smell of the hotel, the friendliness of the staff and the decor. Very surfer vibe - which i loved!We started out at a bungalow but moved to a one bedroom suite, which was a good move, it is bigger and with a young child gave more space to move around. The hotel has a great family atmosphere and we were lucky to be able to celebrate with their one year birthday - mini luau. I loved the location, it allowed us to explore the area and it is only a 10 minute walk to Waikiki beach. I need to stress that everyone at the hotel is great, especially those at front desk. They always had a smile on their face and were very helpful.One of the best hotel experiences I have ever had!

Fantastic hotel with a wonderful greeting. The hotel is located within easy walking distance of everything. Staff are very friendly. They have beach chairs and towels available to borrow at any time. They also have bicycles available if you want. Highly recommended

I'm a travel agent and this was, by far, my favourite hotel of our two week trip to Hawaii. Staff are friendly and very helpful, the rooms are modern with a great Hawaiian vintage vibe to them, short walk to the beach and the pool area is super cute. The advantage of staying in a boutique hotel in Waikiki is not having to walk 20 mins to get to the lobby (!!), less crowded, no wait for the elevators and the service is personalised. Would definitely stay here again and recommend to clients. Excellent value for money given the cost of the beachfront properties on Waikiki. Probably not suited to families with young children as the pool area is small and it's not a resort-style property so there wouldn't be much for them do to. Perfect for couples, friends and solo travelers. Best and most healthy breakfast in Waikiki - much like a typically Aussie cafe breakfast.

I grew up in Hawaii and my parents still live on Oahu. My husband and I always liked to spend a night in Waikiki and play tourist. Our usual go to hotel was asking $600 per night. So I choose Surf Jack due to its cute pool and the restaurant Mahina & Suns in the hotel.The hotel is tucked away in Lewer's street. As we drove up we gave our car to the valet. Nothing really special to the entrance, but when you walked in it opened up to this secret mid century oasis. The reception guys quickly greeted us. There were ppl a head of us at check in so Robbie lead us to the sitting area. We admired the thought out decor. He came back quickly and checked us in while we comfortably sat in the lobby. He was super nice and I seriously felt like I was VIP! We got the 1 bedroom. The room was super adorable! Mid century feel, great tile work in the bathroom, carefully chosen decor and art work. In the room is a folder that gave you ideas on places to eat and drink, beaches to visit, etc... They even gave credit to all the artist and collaborators that help make Surf Jack so amazing! The pool is just adorable. We were greeted with a warm smile every time we saw hotel staff. We didn't even leave the hotel during our stay. Now for the restaurant... For lunch we had the pork pizza. Add arugula on it. Paired with a beer at pool side. So good! Dinner: make reservations ahead of time. We met up with some friends. My husband and I split the shrimp and grits and the rib eye. Paired with wine. Both dishes were amazing! I love their farm to table concept. I wished they had more wines from west coast rather then European wines. Breakfast: My only restaurant regret was asking for bailey's for my coffee. $10 a shot. I ordered the adobo pork fried rice. Yes! It was magical.Surf Jack was one of my favorite hotel stays. I will definitely be back again! It's my new Waikiki go to. If you want a more intimate place and feel like your in a special members only club. This is it!

Thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Close to but not in the middle of the Waikiki congestion. Decor funky vibe. Room and common areas immaculate. All staff very friendly and helpful. Shout out to Benjamin great restaurant suggestions and directions and hug upon our departure. Sorry we were going to miss your one year anniversary celebration today. Mahalo for everything! Highly recommend this place.

THANK YOU to the Surfjack employees for making our stay so wonderful! The 3 bedroom suite fit my family of 8 (7 adults & 1 infant) perfectly. Everyone was so friendly from the second we arrived, from the check-in staff... the valet...housekeeping..and the manager (who my parents had a chance to chat with). The hotel was very modern and the night entertainment was just perfect. It was a 2bedroom suite attached to a one bedroom bungalow. The 2 bedroom suite had a king bed and queen bed plus a pullout sofa in the living room. The bedrooms were not very big but manageable. The one bedroom bungalow had two beds. We had a small refrigerator in the suite and bungalow so that came in handy. The bathrooms are a good size and the shampoo/conditioners smell great! Housekeeping cleaned daily and we got bottled water every time. ABC store is a few steps away and the beach was a short walk. The pool was under renovation at the time. My family absolutely loved this hotel & if we ever go back, we'll definitely stay here. Keep up the great work Surfjack! Mahalo for making our family trip so wonderful!

Cannot recommend Surf Jacks highly enough, everything about it was first class !!! The service from all the front desk staff, Sai, Channey and Jordyn to name just a few was exceptional and you never felt that you were asking inane questions......they were all so professional and friendly. Our room was superb and we just loved the vibe and hum of the whole establishment. I have placed this feedback to my travel broker and hope that she will follow up with more bookings with her clients travelling to Honolulu.I know I will be back for sure. Mahalo !!!!!

Being the Top No.1 popular reviewers in TripAdvisor and over 20's travel experience. I will say "hotel service" is part of my purpose to travel all around the world, it is because is just like your home and the service is just like your family members and friendships during your travel. My purpose to write is especially want to honor my best hotel service staff "Robbie", he is the supervisor of the team and u will find how great he is, i have some problem about the account issue and invoice charge within my bills and when i try to invite Robbie to talk to him about the problem, he is very respective to come to me and seat down to listen of my problem , also he is super super smart to make me feel comfortable and happy to offer me an special VIP service , upgrade the room , offer the restaurant the coupon etc, i know this is not because of his offer, but the person will immediate come to you and try to solve all your pronlem is very important to me to choice the hotel service is Top No.1 The team like Philip Crystal and all the staff chat warmly to the guest. Me and my brother is really enjoy of our stay in the hotel and the room charge i find is very good price compare to all the Waikiki area price is very high, but u will find SurfJack is definite u get more then you pay , they also create some activities each months so it make the hotel become very popular and have fun, once u step on the hotel u will see all the decor is design by the local designer so u will find the decor is very local Hawaiian feel no just like the Star hotel and this is the way i like boutique hotel always u will find there love , care, talk service all around you. Once again thank you for all the nice staff and my dear friends Robbie. U are worth to be Rank in top No.1 in TripAdvisor.

I happened to read one of my Hawaii travel agent magazines and saw the 50 new hottest hotels in Hawaii this one captured my attention by its name then once I looked at their website I saw it's also a aqua aston property hands down it was a must see for me. I just checked in today and from the looks of what I read online I knew I was in for a awesome experience ! Greeted with friendly faces and a cool drink the staff and I sat down together to go over the hotel credits so what they hold you get back in food drink credits so that's pretty amazing My room, well let's say it's more like a apartment from the chic awesome ceiling, floors, walls, floor coverings furniture and over the top bathroom tiles every little detail shines here and it's from the moment you enter their door and follows you around. For me it's like being in a amazing store but you get to relax unwind and I actually found myself in my suite 3 hours later I had to finally go grab food and that was avocado tacos and a green salad here on site at their own cafe while listening to some wonderful local music Now the pool and outside is adorable You will feel like you are relaxed and just a few minutes walk from the crowds and shops of course Waikiki beach

I stayed here with my daughter for two nights before heading to the North Shore. It was the first trip to Hawaii for both of us and what a first impression the Surfjack made. It is so cruisy and relaxed, the staff are truly awesome. Nothing is too much bother and they are so happy and welcoming. We were upgraded when we arrived and were given a room over looking the pool on the fourth floor. It was perfect. We had lunch at the hotel restaurant and it was fabulous. All in all a wonderful introduction to beautiful Hawaii. Mahalo.

We read the reviews which encouraged us to book a 5 night stay at the SurfJack. Fabulous retro decor, two bedroom suite large enough for a family of 5, spotlessly clean rooms, small pool but more than sufficient, good location in Waikiki - less than 10 minute walk to the beach, very helpful staff, Mahina and Sun's restaurant is sensational.

We had a quick stay here due to a delayed flight and our condo not being available for a day after our arrival. We wished we could have stayed longer here! The two bedroom suite was adorable, the room amenities were were great and the service staff top notch! The pool, bar and restaurant area you could relax at all day! We will absolutely be back!

I have stayed in Waikiki on three previous occasions and have stayed at a different hotel each time. They were so close to the beach so was a little nervous about the location of the Surf Jack Hotel in relation to the beach and the main 'strip'. I had read fantastic reviews prior to booking so I knew that this hotel had to offer something great. It certainly lived up to the reviews and my expectations. If you want a room in a concrete block then this hotel is not for you. It has such a great vibe about it that you just loved being there. It is away from the beach by about a block and a half - about a 7 to 10 minute walk away depending on how quick you are. But it is in fact in a fantastic location close to everything. I was travelling with family and we loved it. The hotel doesn't look much from the outside but once you get in, it is lovely. From the lounge room area that forms part of the reception and flows out to the pool it is just a cool place. The pool is a good size. If I was being picky, I would say that the pool area is on the small side, but it seemed to cope well with the volume of people. I would also suggest perhaps having a few more umbrellas or shade cloths being made available as it could get very hot under the sun. There is also music playing by the pool a lot of the time. They in fact have a DJ a couple of afternoons a week which made it quite a loud place to be, definitely not a place if you want to have a snooze by the pool. We loved it but it may not be for everyone. The hotel rooms are lovely and plenty of room for what we required. We spent very little time in the actual room but they were very comfortable. The bathroom is small, but adequate. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Nothing seems too much trouble. We booked one tour and it was done efficiently without any hassle.We ate in the restaurant only once for dinner and it was very lovely.My only real gripe is the resort fee which is $25 per day plus text and that annoys me somewhat but it seems to be part of the set up in Hawaii. It is not enough though of a gripe for me not to stay here again! Loved every minute of it and would definitely stay here again!

I'm not usually the kind of person to leave a review for a hotel but after staying here i feel compelled to..i honestly can't thank the lovely staff at the surfjack enough for their, professional and friendly service, it is rare to get this kind of customer service anywhere!staying here felt like an extended stay at a good friends house more than a hotel. i am sad to be leaving!!the food was excellent and the rooms are very clean and tidy, the interior design is amazing!!!the amenities are ample, it's not a mega resort in that regard but the pool is picturesque and the bike hire is pretty handy too.. pretty much all you need for a "beach" holiday! after walking around waikiki for a few days it's easy to say this hotel is a breath of fresh air to the stale and standard "buffet hotels" that line the main street!special thanks to robbie the concierge for looking after us so well.i hope to return to the surfjack soon!

Although we only spent one afternoon and night at the Surfjack Hotel & Swim Club, we were thrilled with the wonderful upgrade and excellent attention by the hotel staff. The location is close to the beach walk and the hotel fee of $25 includes beach chairs and towels. Thanks for a great stay.

From the moment we checked in, to the moment we checked out, we enjoyed everything about the Surfjack. The staff Chris, Sai, Jordyn and Krystal to name a few, made us feel welcomed and at home. They made us feel like we where old friends even the maids left really special notes daily !! Killer Restaraunt sorry, I forgot their names but so nice & helpful ! Even the DJ at the pool mixed our wedding song it made my wife cry tears of joy. Again can't say enough about this place and the staff. I very rarely write reviews but this place deserves it !!! Do yourself a favor and stay at the coolest place in Hawaii!!MahaloTed & Shay Stevens

I don't even know how to express in words how much we loved this hotel. Sai, Jordyn, and Robbie made our stay feel extra special, but the entire staff were extremely friendly and hospitable without exception. We loved the atmosphere; the design and attention to detail are fabulous throughout the property. Definitely have a meal or two at Mahina & Suns during your stay, and grab a shave ice from Lemona across the street. This will be our new home away from home; I can't imagine staying anywhere else. Mahalo!

First let me compliment the great service! Nice live music at night and good location Now the cons...our room backs to parking lot/alley. VERY LOUD Awakened at 5am daily due to trash trucks etc. But also frequent sirens etc all thru the night. Beds are uncomfortable Also not near enough chairs at the pool. 35 dollars for parking plus 25 dollar hotel fee a bit steep. Would not choose to return..

The staff at the Surfjack was truly the most proficient and friendliest hotel staff I have encountered in a long time. Everyone from the front desk, to the restaurant, to the cleaning staff were excellent. I felt like a welcomed and appreciated guest. The room was large and neatly kept. We were there while the pool was being refurbished and checked out the morning it was finished. Wow, it looked incredible. Wish I was there to try it out. The location is a short walk to the beach and shopping. The price, compared to those closer to the beach, is excellent. For Waikiki, Surfjack is a great value and great place to stay.

My daughter and I were in Maui for the film festival which is always great fun! This year we decided to go to Honolulu to visit Pearl Harbor. Everyone told us you only need two days in Honolulu, just a big city, but we had the best time there and wish we had stayed longer, this was in great part to our fantastic experience at the Surfjack!!We were greeted with the biggest warmest smiles and offered the most delicious and perfect iced coffee from the bar while Benjamin reviewed our check in paper work in the living room. We were upgraded to a one bedroom suite and don't know why,but it was a great room, very comfortable with very high end bath products from Italy and ample fresh towels.We immediately went down to the pool for some sun and swim, the pool temp was PERFECT and in the afternoon a DJ showed up making pool time party time. We ate lunch at Mohina and Sun , the on site restaurant, which was utterly delicious and service with a smile!!!! The set up of the hotel is cozy and warm with fabulous decor and very comfortable chairs!!! We also ate dinner at the hotel as we had an early bus tour in the morning and we just wanted to stay at home, thats what it felt like, home sweet home, with everything you need at hand. Our dinner was amazing, drinks are detailed and special, ahi app and fried avocado tacos to die for. The Mong Chong and Ragu were both dish licking good!!! Just a great meal!!! Every time we dealt with staff they could not have been sweeter and more helpful, from renting bikes, calling a taxi for the airport , giving us information, directions or advise.. Channey and Benjamin we miss you ! And the rest of the desk staff whose names I sadly cant recall all deserve a big shout out!!! Lynette, your staff is wonderful and made the experience that much more wonderful! Pls reward them in some way.. you can just tell they love their jobs and employer , it was obvious! Olive and olivia also was a great addition to have delicious coffee and shop for some cool stuff!!! We only wish we had more time there and certainly would return in a heartbeat!!!Also loved the back lounge and how it is utilized for classes such as headdress making and baby showers. Fantastic to have so much going on and in such a small cozy space with everyone mingling together, its a happy place. My only issue was that the deck can get slippery and both my daughter and I slipped a few times but other than that EVERYTHING was top notch!!!

A very fun 60s-style hotel with an excellent restaurant (Amazing avocado tacos, very good rigatoni with pork ragu, tasty corn chowder with fish...! ) We were upgraded to a one-bedroom suite which was very comfortable. High quality sheets! Comfortable mattresses. Top quality shampoo, etc. (The view wasn't great from our room -- and figuring out the light switches was challenging. Yes -- challenging!!) Everyone -- from the front desk personnel to the restaurant hostess and servers -- was helpful and friendly. It's a perfect location for shopping and the beach! The lobby pool looked like fun, but we were only there one night so we didn't use it. Great location! Definitely recommend!

Our stay at the surfjack with our young family was superb! It was an unforgettable holiday for all. The beautiful scent just walking into the foyer incredible. Sai was outstanding always greeting us with a smile and ordering a taxi without any wait. The rooms were just perfectly decorated. The whole family had the best sleeps we've ever had. The kids won't ever forget the oval pool, very refreshing after a day shopping or from the beach. The entire vibe around the place was very special and relaxing. We felt very spoilt in every aspect of the Surfjack. We will be recommending it to everyone that is Hawaii bound! I almost forgot our maid even left a lovely note, wishing my husband a happy Father's Day. Above and beyond!

Other hotels could do well to train here! The level of service was fantastic and the staff so friendly. We stayed 4 nights and couldn't fault the experience. Thanks Dexter, Robbie and all the staff at Surfjack. We will be back when next in Hawaii.Great styling in all the spaces. Very good restaurant.Clean.Comfy beds.Awesome pool.Stafff very friendly and cooperative.Close to the buzz but a bit of a walk to the beach.We caught the bus to the beach near the aquarium. Its less crowded and built up. 5 - 10 mins away near Diamond Head.
user_location: Byron Bay, New South Wales, Australia
user_name:
Pip T
Byron Bay, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: Great place to stay! Amenities were awesome. The staff showed us true Aloha spirit. Went out of there way to help us. Love the food. So convenient to to the beach and shopping. Didn't have to rent a car.

This place is adorable, and always smells amazing!! It is also friendly and easy to find. The rooms are clean and stylish. The decor is a modern spin on vintage aesthetics. The restaurant has a wonderful atmosphere, and the food is delicious (I even found it listed in a local magazine of top rated restaurants on the island.) You can borrow a bike to see the area, meet new people in the spacious common areas, and eat delicious food early or late. What more do you want from your vacation hotel?

It was comfortable and convenient to contact, so it was easy to contact others and everything was fine.I'd like to find it again.The kids liked it.The cookies I received from the lobby were delicious.

The staff wasn't helpful at all woke up in a pool of our sweat because they failed to follow through on our request to look at ac. No one helped take our luggage up to room or to check out either. First trip away from kids in three years only to have this happen and to be woken up by drilling of matenance out side. The guy who checked us in was also rude. I work in the hotel industry and I will never recommend the surf jack again. Got offered to move to the pent house only to have to walk up a floor cause the elevator doesn't go up to the top floor got to room and ac wasn't even on at that point I didn't even wanna bother I jus wanted to get the night over with and we left first thing in the morning.

I delayed in writing this review because it reminds me that I am no longer there. The people who work at the Surfjack are the nicest people imaginable. Check-in was easy and pleasant. We got the 2 bedroom suite and stayed for a week in April with our elementary aged kids. On our first morning there, we got up early to go to Pearl Harbor, and when we got downstairs we were greeted by the front desk staff - we were still a little jet lagged and weren't expecting such a personable and warm welcome to the day. The restaurant was delicious - a bit expensive but you have to at least try it for a dinner and a breakfast, and they do make a very tasty, reasonably priced pasta meal for kids for dinner. If you're a serious foodie, there are plenty of menu options for returning multiple times. For a more budget friendly full breakfast or other meals, IHOP and Starbucks and other good restaurants are a short walk. The burrito shop a block away is good. The suite only had a mini-fridge, no microwave or dishes, so plan accordingly. ABC store is next door if you need water float toys, flip flops, sunscreen, etc. Parking was expensive but not more than what you'd pay anywhere else in the area, and there really aren't any better options in street parking or private garages - just park onsite and enjoy the time not spent looking for other parking. The beds were comfortable and the blackout curtains work great. Cool retro environment - I loved seeing surf movies every night from our balcony while the live music at the restaurant played - just lovely. My son and I played some games we borrowed from the front desk one morning at a table by the pool, while we enjoyed tasty scones from the restaurant and I had an awesome cup of coffee. We encountered the 4th floor housekeeper several times and she was delightful. Same with the maintenance staff, a nice fellow who helped get a game piece out of the pool for us that one morning. Truly, everyone was very helpful, warm, and friendly - this place is a real gem.

A very pleasant hotel which has a throw back to the sixties with a modern twist. The Hotels amenities were good and the location was great for restaurants, transport and shopping. Staff were very nice and helpful and the prices very competitive.

We stayed at the Surf Jack for one night and had a nice time. We were surprised by how many families were staying here, the pool was filled with kids in the afternoon. Luckily they close the pool to children at 5:30, so we had the place to ourselves and enjoyed delicious mai tais in the pool. It was the perfect evening. The beach is a 10 minute walk, and there are lots of restaurants along the way. We had a 1 bedroom suite which was nice because it had a separate living room. I would recommend asking for a room that doesn't face the pool/courtyard if you want more privacy and less noise. Overall it was a fun hotel with friendly staff.
user_name:
jen_travels636
New York City, New York

review_body: We loved the Surfjack! The hotel was so much fun! From relaxing by the pool to eating in the restaurant, everything was perfect. We made sure we returned back to stay at the end of our trip after staying at the beginning and loving it. The second time was just as good! Both the bungalow room and one bedroom are delightful! Super comfy beds and great decor! If you come to Waikiki this is your place to stay. All of the staff were also great. From housekeeping to front desk, to bar staff. Special shout out to Sai from the crew, such a great guy! He was so helpful and really made us feel welcome. Great work Surfjack on all that you offer. If we return back to Honolulu we won't be staying anywhere else.

It was the Queens birthday holiday weekend in Australia and we took advantage of some cheap airfares from Sydney to Honolulu. We arrived very early at Surfjack - too early to check in. But the staff were very welcoming and told us to come back at 11am and see if the room was ready. It was and we were grateful for the early check in.The Surfjack is - I'm guessing - a 1960s hotel that has had a complete refurbishment. We liked it. It had a good vibe, a nice pool area and the rooms were very pleasant. The double bed was comfortable, the air con worked super well and the TV screen was enormous (not that we felt the need to watch much TV when there is so much else to do). The bathroom was a good size and the shower had plenty of room. The controls took a little bit of working out but once sorted it was straightforward.The restaurant is right near the pool and has a good vibe to it as well. The food was, by Hawaii standards, pretty good. We've found that if you are on a budget in Hawaii its not always easy to get good fresh food that is not laden was salt and/or sugar. The Surfjack hotel is a couple of blocks back from the beach but that is small price to pay for such an affordable and attractive hotel. We'd stay there again for sure.

Our stay at the Surfjack was a highlight of our trip. While we were only guests for two nights, we cannot wait to return to the Surfjack during our next trip to Waikiki.The hotel is a total gem - all throughout the space, whether its in the rooms, lounge or pool area, there is something to look at. From interesting books and pictures, to beautiful furniture and interior choices. We really felt as though we had stepped into another world during our time at the hotel - and we instantly felt relaxed and comfortable, with its homely but very cool vibe.Our room was absolutely fantastic - it was so spacious and stunning. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom was beautiful and the living space was great!The hotel truly looks like something from a postcard. They have thought of every little detail, from canvas bags to take to the beach, vintage bikes to ride around town, to delicious items on the restaurant menu.Special shout out to our waiter/bar tender Zach who we had a great time chatting to during breakfast/brunch one morning. Thanks for making a great espresso martini!We will certainly be back to the Surfjack!

We stayed at the Surfjack beginning of June for my father-in-law's 60th birthday and it was a great place to stay, close enough to Waikiki but not right in the craziness. The rooms were spacious and nicely decorated, all the staff members were so friendly and helpful (especially Dexter and Sai), and the breakfast at the restaurant was so delicious! Also nice to have Maguro Brothers right across the street for top notch poke. Will definitely stay here again if we come back to Honolulu.

Amazing design. Well curated property. Super friendly staff -- full of aloha! Pool, food, bikes, and rooms were perfect. We will definitely stay here again, even our teenage daughter loved this hotel. Mahalo Surfjack for an awesome experience.

Fantastic hotel for those who want old Hawaii with amazing staff, fantastic food and cleanliness - location of a great coffee shop next door and a cool shop was a cherry on top of the hotel. Location to beach wasn't too bad, but hard to get kids away from the cool swimming pool at Surfjacks. Will return.

Really good pizza. Usually 2 kinds to choose from. My daughter and husband shared a pizza. I had a scrumptious burger with fries! I would recommend this restaurant for a nice relaxing evening ! Service is excellent!

What a great place! Highly recommend! Excellent service and food! Cute rooms, great location! Great for families, but also great for an adult only trip! We'll stay again if ever back! Everyone was incredibly nice and the hotel and pool/amenities were awesome!

Such a gem! This is one of the nicest places I've stayed. It had the most amazing smell, complimenting a very cool vibe. My room was superb (and with a free upgraded!), the coffee was delicious and the staff were all excellent. Great restaurant too. Highly recommended!

Loved this trendy little boutique hotel in the heart of Waikiki. Perfect location to easily walk to everything: beach, shopping, restaurants, and easy access to the highway when you want to venture a little further. The staff are all super helpful and friendly, the restaurant is a must - the best food we ate on our trip! Just wish we could have stayed another week to make the most of the newly renovated pool!

I stayed here while hubby was off on business all day, knew there was no beach access, but thought I'd relax by the pool, get sun and catch up on reading. It's promoted as retro, hip, boutique hotel so I didn't imagine it would be inundated with young families - but it is. It's a very small pool and probably 2/3 of the day it is dominated by running, squealing, splashing, small kids with their parents claiming the lounges in the sun but then setting up camp at pool's edge on opposite side to watch their kids. There is no quiet. They do have adult swim in evening which is nice but without the benefit of sun, the unheated pool is just too cold to enjoy. Plus, the young families hover at poolside, having their kids put their feet in the water, so its awkward. All of this is, of course, just fine if that's the ambience you seek but if you're an empty nester looking for relaxation or a couple looking for romance, forget it. I would suggest the hotel finds some space somewhere for an adults only sundeck with cool down shower, for reading and relaxation. Now, if you don't care about outdoor spaces or quiet by the pool or you'll mostly be out and about, it will be just fine. The service is excellent (warm, accommodating), the restaurant/bar is great, the room is clean and the retro decor is spot on. They even had available a hospitality room that I was able use until my check in time. It's convenient to main shopping, there's an ABC Store next door so you can stock up on snacks and beverages for your mini fridge. We are not mega resort travelers, so we were attracted to this property for its smaller size and competitive room rate by Honolulu standards. We had a good sized room facing the pool with balcony, it is small but useful to sit and have a drink, get some warm night air. And, it was pretty close (15 minute walk) to the convention center.

We come here all the time for events or for dining! The staff are friendly, the pool is amazing, and our room was great! We were even upgraded to a penthouse suite during our stay which was so great!!

As a local resident it was the perfect place for a girls staycation! You are in Waikiki but not in the crazy busy tourist hub. The vibe of the hotel is very fun and hip but not over the top modern and cold.The rooms are large and very comfortable and have a great beachy feel to them. The staff were amazing and super friendly. We will definitely be back!!

Love the decor and vibe of this hotel! Also loved the three room suite - we were all able to stay "together" but still have some privacy. The coffee shop is adorable and delicious! The beds are comfortable, and the bathrooms have plenty of space. Love it!

I loved the free snacks and water. pool was under major construction and I didn't know that when I booked. Room was VERY CLEAN, but no place to sit inside except the bed. no desk area. Roomy, as I had a handicap-accessible room. Hallways are noisy when other guests are being loud.

As a frequent visitor to Oahu, and Waikiki specifically, I've had the opportunity to stay at most of the hotels on the beach. The Royal Hawaiian and the Moana Surfrider have been my long time faves. They are both in historic buildings, both have beautiful grounds with picture perfect sea views and an authentic Hawaiian vibe that keeps me coming back. Now, I have a new favorite to add to the list, The Suarfjack Hotel & Swim Club. Except for the sea views it ticks all of the before mentioned boxes and a few more. It has a cool aloha energy that is youthful and refreshing. It's not right on the beach, tucked away in a little neighborhood near the Ala Wai Canal, and that makes it special. You can be on the beach in 5 mins but don't have to experience the very crowded Kalakaua Avenue. From the moment I stepped onto the property I felt at home, even thought it was my first stay. The Suarfjack is delivering what Waikiki had been missing, a colorful, playful alternative to the predictable chains that dominate the Honolulu hotel market. The staff in all departments are exceptional, make running the hotel look effortless. We especially enjoyed breakfast each morning at Mahina & Sons, recounting the previous night's adventures with the staff and having a laugh. The hotel offers poolside DJs in the afternoon and live entertainment at night, free coffee in the morning and refreshing fruit infused iced waters throughout the day. There are bikes available, but we didn't use. The rooms are thoughtfully laid out, with a comfy bed & pillows, fab bath products, small fridge and expansive balconies with a small table and chairs. There is also a cute gift ship on site to pick up a souvenir.I highly recommend this property. We just got home this week and having major Suarfjack withdrawals. We will be beak in October!

Such an enjoyable experience! Super convenient location, great restaurant on site, free coffee in the morning, modern vibe. Pool was closed during our stay, but would love to come back and check it out. Will look to stay here again!

My wife and I decided to book a room (last minute) to enjoy Memorial Day weekend and were very pleased with the Surfjack. We are local and normally stay at hotels on the beach (Westin/Sheraton/Hitlon etc). We booked through a 3rd party website so didnt really get a choice of rooms but we still loved it. Everything is very clean and the amount of effort that went in to making this a nice boutique hotel is evident. From the artwork, furniture, floor design, cocktails and even the music! Best part was the kindness of the staff. Highlight: we found out they were renovating the pool after we checked in, but they comp'd up an umbrella and chairs at the beach! Highly recommended - we'll be back for cocktails at the swim club!

ALOHAThe best hotel I've been to. The energy of the place is incomparable. The hotel staff is fantastic, always with smile on their face and very helpful. The rooms are very comfortable and have a nice balcony. The hotel has an excellent bar / restaurant and a coffee shop at the entrance to the same standard. The location is another strong point of the hotel, close to everything!Besides everything that has been said the hotel still has schedules like lounge Dj's, local musicians ...One weakness is the parking lot that costs $ 35.MAHALO

It saddens me to rate this stay a '3' as I was extremely excited to visit the Surfjack after reading so many great reviews. - We got off to a bad start, arriving to a closed pool (the drain had broken). I was not proatively told about this prior to arriving... but worse... I went on to the website just before arriving to read about the hotel activities for the week and saw a notice about pool maintenance. I panicked and spoke to their website chat person who specifically told me the pool was reopened. While this was very upsetting (why else do you stay in Hawaii) to be fair the staff were very apologetic and upgraded our room. - But then I was charged again for my room even though it was prepaid. I'm yet to receive a refund.- And then I was kindly told that we would receive a bottle of wine for my fiance's birthday. A lovely gesture that never arrived even though i ensured we were in our room early each evening. - Shower in room 247 does not get very hot. Once lukewarm it also gets intermittently cold when you are showering. Cold tap on the sink doesn't work either. - They cant store a bag for us while we are in Maui even though we are returning to the hotel. These things combined really impacted on my enjoyment of the stay. The good? The beds are comfy and the staff are friendly. I just found the communication to be warm but a bit misleading. Was even told the pool would reopen on Monday so restructured our plans. It's Tuesday and it is not looking good for our return trip. Perhaps just a series of unfortunate events.

My girlfriend and I stayed here while doing an event in Waikiki, and I'm glad we tried it out! It has a super fun and funky nostalgic feel of the old-school Hawaii on he my girlfriend and I stayed here while doing an event in Waikiki, and I'm glad we tried it out! It has a super fun and funky nostalgic feel of the 1960's Hawaiiana. The staff was quite friendly and there was a ballet, and we were able to sit on fresh juice while we waited for them to check us in. The pool has a cute "wish you were here" script in the bottom that makes it fun for taking pictures for the tourists.It's definitely a boutique hotel and on the smaller side. There aren't as many amenities as in some of the bigger hotels, but was perfect for what we needed.The restaurant is not someplace I would describe as a kid friendly place, and had mostly upper end, fusion type cuisine and wasn't friendly for vegetarians or gluten-free (which both us were one or the other & had her child with us) either, so we didn't eat on site. That was probably one of the only downsides as it made it less convenient to have to walk around for food before our event. The rooms were cute and also tastefully decorated in retro themes and vintage pieces. The price was just OK for the value, but I would give it a try again and I expect it will only become more affordable as it ages.

What an awesome, laid back hotel with exceptional staff! Our room with two double beds was immaculate and comfy. The famous pool was being retiled, but the Surfjack made arrangements with a hotel near the beach to provide chairs, umbrellas, etc. We loved the Surfjack - central to everything!

A little away from the madness of Waikiki beach, lies the super adorable Surfjack. The views shouldn't be the reason you stay (since they're not great), but the convenience (easy walking to all of the shopping, restaurants, and beaching you could ever want), and the adorable factor. The staff were phenomenal straight out of the gate, and the grounds and rooms impressively hip. If you can't afford to stay right ON the beach (or don't want to), this is a wonderful option. Hell, we could've afforded it, but chose not to because I fell in love with the vibe of this place long before I ever saw it in person. I am so thrilled that it lived up to expectations and wasn't one of those "better in the online photos) type situations. The pool was closed while we were there, and they really went above and beyond by waiving the resort fee, and offering to reimburse for rentals of beach chairs/umbrellas. That's stellar customer service.

Had a wonderful nights stay in this amazing quirky hotel prior to flying home to California. Would definitely stay here again. Staff were so friendly and helpful. Room (upgraded to 1 bedroom suite) was clean, comfortable, well stocked, amazing bed! Had dinner in the on site restaurant and it was delicious. An added extra was the free use of a room to clean up and rest before leaving for the airport for red eye flight. Spent most of the day (after checking out in the am) at the pool and this was such a great treat. Highly recommend the Surfjack! Thank you.

Best place to stay!! 10 minute walk to the beach, Ihop right across the road. McDonalds a few meters down the road from ihop! Bus stop at the end of the street. Best place to stay! Great staff, very clean!!! 10/10 will be back!!

Fiancé and I stayed just one night to try it out. And liked it. Room was large, quiet and comfortable. Location was very good but we preferred being right on the beach. And the balcony, while nice, looked right into the building next door. But whoever designed the hotel did a great job. Design wise one of my favorite of the 9 hotels we've tried in Hawaii.

My son and I had a 4 night, relaxing stopover in Honolulu on our way home from New York. The Surfjack Hotel and Swim Club is a chilled out but luxe slice of holiday heaven in the middle of Waikiki.Our room was Modern with 2 double beds, great bathroom and balcony overlooking the pool.The Hotel's Restaurant, Mahina and Sons, served up the best food we'd had all trip!.. we ate there everyday, the avocado tacos and Mahina Bowl, our favourite dishes. Breakfast was gorgeous. Cocktails by the pool! I could go on..Sai, Krystel, Benjamin, everyone!.. we willMiss your smiles but we will be back!

The Surfjack is an oasis in a sea of skyscraping tourist filing cabinets. The location is convelnient and the rooms are well-thought-out with a timelessly calm feel. More importantly, the people at the front desk really make the day. Jordyn, Dexter, and Robbie (I hope I got those names right...) took my requests seriously and with a smile, going out of their way to make the check-in smooth and upgrading my room to a beautiful suite at the end of a long work trip. The Surfjack's not the cheapest option in Waikiki, but it's worth every penny. Looking forward to any chance I get to stay here.

We had 1 night in Hawaii on the way to NYC.We wanted to stay in a smaller hotel & could not have been happier with Surfjack. The staff were delightful, & the hotel was extremely comfortable. A great place to stay in Waikiki with a very cool vibe.

The surfjack is such a nice place to stay when you re in HNLThe decor of this super place is so unique. From the rooms, the awsome pool, and the restaurant. Very well located too! 10 mn walk from Waikiki beach, convenient stores just across the street.they will also provide beach towels, tote bags, bike if you are a guest. Don t over pack!and can we talk about the staff there !!?From awsome and friendly people at the front desk ( always a good advices to give you) to the cool guys/valets outsiders, the friendly staff at Mahina's & sun ( tasty & fresh food, not overpriced), the supe Nice housekipping team... over all, i love the spirit you can find there :) you feel at home even far from home !

It's a really fantastic little piece of luxurious comfort inthe middle of a busy location. Easily walkable to local beach sites. Very friendly staff as well as affordability. I really enjoyed how the hotel used a lot of local artists

The Surfjack Motel was just what we were looking for in our short visit to Honolulu. A very beachy vibe, quiet, friendly staff, restaurant on the property, reasonably priced. It was a fantastic way to start our vacation! The staff greeted with smiles and letting us check in early. The pool has a secret on the bottom of the pool which was very cool! On our first evening we were surprised with a bottle of champagne from the staff - just because!

This is not your typical blockbuster hotel but much more. Clean, world class service and great food. It's our 3 day of a 7 day stay. So far this place has delivered and some cases exceeded my expectations. We checked their website prior to arrival and was informed of the pool repair from 14-30 May. We were disappointed as we will miss hanging out in the pool. However, upon arrival front desk staff was apologic and said they will waive our daily hotel fee due to their pool closure inconvenience. We didn't have to ask for it. Great customer service. All staff on property was helpful, freiendly and totally customer focused on ensuring our experience is always satisfactory. All reviews I've read are accurate. You want to stay here and I assure you will not disappoint. Food - we had dinner (during happy hours as we travelled with young kids) yesterday. Pizza and wings was delicious. We loved the food so much we had breakfast there this morning and our kids said they want to eat here everyday. Kids are truthful and unbias. We plan to have dinner there again this evening. Room - we booked a standard room with 2 queen beds. Wrapped balcony which is bright and airy. We slept with our balcony doors opened and breeze of so comfortable. No need for AC. Surprisingly no bugs or mosquitos. Beds are super comfortable and shower is amazing. Waikiki beach - just minutes away on foot. It's the perfect location for us and away from the Waikiki hussel. Pool closure didn't bother us as much as I thought. Forced us to make time for the beach. Which works out wonderfully. We can swim in the pool at home. Lol! Great that Surfjack reimburse our beach lounge chairs rental on the beach. What a great offer! Surfjack management I think you truly thought through all your use cases in providing a great guest experience. I want to thank you on behalf of my family for having us and making our stay so relaxing and worry-free. Your happy guests, Wong N :)

Picked the Surfjack to avoid large crowds of beach goers and huge resort fees. It was a business trip, after all, and didn't need the distraction. It was perfect!Fantastic, friendly service at every turn. Easy walk to everything you want to see and eat in Waikiki.Terrific room (stayed in a one bedroom suite) with good bed and nice decor.Delicious food at the hotel restaurant Mahina & Suns, which is an Ed Kenney venture. Fresh, seasonal, and local. Loved it!Highly recommend Surfjack!

The stay was wonderful. Hotel was perfect for our needs. Staff was amazing and really made us feel welcome and comfortable. Mahina and Suns was perfect for our daughters graduation lunch. Julia was so helpful and flexible with our needs. The resort fee was pricey but covered many things that we used. Great coffee in the am, chairs and towels for the beach just to name a few. We will be back for future visits.

The Surfjack is one of the most welcoming place we've ever stayed at. On arrival we were greeted by Dexter the Manager and a number of his team. We were extremely lucky to be upgraded to a Suite due to our 8 night stay being for a special 30th birthday. The Room: super spacious, all essentials included. A pool view balcony would have been only thing that would have improved it for a little extra sunbathing at the end of the day. The bed had the most wonderful mattress topper on, perfect nights sleep. Great sound proofing as we think our floor was busy with families etc and we didn't ever get disturbed. Also if you have a late flight or are sticking around past the 12pm check out they offer a hospitality suite with full bed, shower etc which you just need to book a time.The Facilities: the pool is such a spectical that it does get popular and the beds/seats are limited but gets sun a lot of the day and is a nice break away from hectic Waikiki beach. Complementary water bottles in room and water coolers at the pool. Plenty of comfy sofa areas on the ground floor if you just want to sit and chill. WIFI always great signal and no complicated sign in process. We rented the bikes (free for 3 hours) and rode to Moana Falls, beware though, no breaks or gears so a bit basic! Wouldn't consider the beach front hotel's as this location was perfect for us as a little boutique retreat with walking distance to everything.The Restaurant (Mahina & Sons): Both guests and non-guests can use it so watch out if there is a special holiday/event on as you don't get preference if you want a table for any meal. We experienced Mother's day which has already happened in the UK so we were unaware and had to make breakfast at 7.30am to ensure we got a table as no reservations left. We had breakfast here everyday as you receive a $10 per day food/drink credit which you lose if unused. Free refillable coffee and tea :-) after that I can definitely recommend the Granola, plentiful and the varied fresh fruit was delicious. Next the scones (well they're not exactly British scones but we'll let that go!) tried all 3 and the Bacon and Cheddar is super yummy!The Staff: this is what makes the place so special. Big shout out to Nehu for our fantastic breakfast and advice almost daily. Everyone welcomes you back every time you enter the door. The staff are so happy and helpful and I genuinely believe they love to work here. Mahalo!

This low rise hotel in the middle of Waikiki has been refashioned into a comfortable boutique hotel with a surf 70's vibe. Rooms either overlook a pool or parking lot but the view really doesn't matter because they all are decorated with a cheeky Hawaii-Esque design that is quite fetching and homey at the same time. You know a room is well designed when you tell yourself "we could live here." Free in-room local snacks was a nice touch. The lobby pool and restaurant area all blend together. This is the kind of place that plays house music (like Ace Hotels) so if that's cool for you (it was for us) you'll love it here. And the staff was genuinely friendly and helpful; no attitude at all. We will be back!

I really enjoyed my stay at Surfjack. I read several reviews on TripAdvisor and other sites that gave this hotel really good reviews so I decided to book a room. The experience was better than expected. I got a one bedroom suite. The room was large and it was clean. Great experience. The staff was great from the valet staff, maintenance crew and also the front desk. I had great service from Jordyn. I have stayed at the Hale Koa before and had a great experience but the Surfjack Hotel and Swim Club was even better.

My daughter stayed here in the past and highly recommended this hotel. From the instant we checked in, we were greeted with the warmth and aloha like no other. The staff confirmed that we can have a staycation in our own backyard, while at the same time, while keeping the money in the local economy. It's a win-win for everyone!

Surfjack Hotel & Swim Club is the epitome of a successful boutique hotel: a fresh and modern refurbish that captures the essence of old school Waikiki. The minute you stroll into this open air entryway and pool courtyard you feel invited into this community and welcomed into their modus vivendi: beautiful roomy accommodations; delicious quality drink and foods (from the espresso in Olive & Oliver shop to everything served at chef Ed Kenney's Mahina and Suns restaurant); local arts and music (a calendar full of events); and of course the laid back surf culture. Whether you’re here for business or pleasure, you can accomplish it all from right within the Surfjack experience. And it’s so centrally located, when you do venture out, you wouldn’t need a car, as you can easily walk (Uber or grab public transportation) to anything in town – including of course the beach just blocks away. Surfjack employees embody the aloha spirit and make sure it's infused in everyone's experience. Mahalo Surfjack!!!

There are a lot of things to like about this place.Not a high rise. Nice pool area. Central location. Friendly staff. Ok so there is no ocean view, but really that is the only downside, and it's not really a downside. They have a dj of an afternoon by the pool. And it's such a nice place to sit. Restaurant is good. Room was nice, bed very comfy. kitchenette is just a fridge. They even offered us a courtesy room when we arrived to early for our room. Do yourself a favour and stay here.

We really enjoyed this hotel, great modern decor, friendly staff and lovely atmosphere. The one downside was the hidden charges.
