Expect to pay a compulsory USD25 a night for a 'Hospitality fee' which covers a packet of chips in your room on arrival, two small water bottles a day, a newspaper that you can pick up from the lobby daily and pool towels. In addition to this you should also budget for an additional USD20 for taxes they add on to the bill. These are called Transenet Accommodation Tax and General Excise Tax. All in all an additional USD45 a night which doesn't make it cheaper than the all inclusive resorts. This is not a resort, the pool is lovely but small compared to the resorts. Tips for booking rooms. The advertised 'bungalow' room is not a bungalow but a standard hotel room with beds and small balcony. We paid for an upgrade on arrival to the suite which is really lovely and has a small lounge room, separate bed and bath room. The whole place has been immaculately designed. For families, kids are not allowed in the pool after 5:30pm which isn't ideal. The restaurant food was delicious and they have live music most nights. Great for couples. The rooms were cleaned daily and were sparkling and it is in a central location, easy to walk everywhere.

I cannot rate this boutique hotel enough. From the minute my sister and I arrived until the day we left we were greeted with beautiful smiles, always treated with aloha and nothing was ever too much trouble. Your staff are AMAZING special thanks to Dexter, Chris, Benjamin and Sai - you guys were the best!!! We dined at your restaurant Mahina and Suns several nights because honestly the food was to die for we just couldn't fault it, the mushroom pizza was the best pizza we have ever eaten, the ahi palaha, and grilled he'e are definitely a must try. The fact that the food in this restaurant is locally grown, fully sustainable and organic when possible was a plus. The retro shabby chic interior design of this only one year old hotel definitely gave it a cool vibe and a step above the other tired hotels in Waikiki. We loved the overall ambience and layout of Surfjack, our one bedroom suite was gorgeous (we were on the 7th floor of 9) the bed and pillows were amazingly comfy. Its location is also great with just a 10 minute walk to the beach. Will definitely be coming back and recommending to our friends. So glad we picked this wee paradise in the heart of Waikiki..

This place really stands out. It's a lovely clean, comfortable stay. Everything is within 10 minutes walk, And you can catch the buses you need right outside. But what really makes it stand out is the first rate service. The staff here are truly wonderful people. It's a smaller hotel so they really get to know you and take the time to help as much as possible with any query or request. We felt so comfortable and loved our little catch ups on our day as we came back after our activities. You don't need to look any further for a great hotel in Waikiki. Stay here and you won't be disappointed. Special shout out to Benjamin.

To sum it all, this is what we wrote in response to any suggestions for improvements: No need to improve on anything! Your staff makes the hotel be such an outstanding place! They all make you feel at home, like their only purpose is to make sure your stay is trouble-free and happy! Thanks again to Krystle (she was the best thing about our stay-made us feel like she was just waiting for us to get there to make sure we had a great stay!) as well as to Sai (outstanding), Robbie, Aries and all the others. Will be coming back as soon as possible and recommending your hotel to everyone we know.
user_name:
Tatiana B
West Palm Beach, Florida

review_body: You have to stay at the Surfjack!! What a lovely place we stayed at. The design of the hotel is on point and is so unique in comparison to the other hotels around. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. We stayed a total of 3 nights and we didn't want to leave at all. The hotel lends you a nice beach bag with towels and complimentary water and coffee. It was really enjoyable and don't forget the restaurant Mahina and Sun's in the hotel which is opened to all. We thought it was such a nice paradise in the middle of Waikiki. Big thanks to everyone at the Surfjack!

Just out of main hustle and bustle of Waikiki but short walk. Friendly staff , clean rooms and excellent, well priced food! Especially Kale Caesar salad... I would stay there again . And only open one year and I have three friends who stayed there and all loved it!

Gracious and kind employees that went above and beyond! Can't wait to return and I live here!! On the windward side... so it was a great Staycation! The cruiser bikes, the dining, the great coffee. Aloha still lives!!!!

If you are always looking for something unique and high quality in Honolulu at a reasonable price (you know how hard that is to find!), you like the Modern but the prices have been rising, you prefer a smaller hotel so you can get in and out fast, try the surfjack, great vibe, wonderful food, coffee is great, service is excellent.

The Surfjack lived up to the hype! The rooms are super cool and comfortable, the food from Mahina & Suns was excellent (both in room, and in the restaurant), and every employee we met was super friendly (shout out to Sai ).

My husband and I booked this hotel last minute, booked through the hotel's website and got a dining credit at Mahina and Sun's located at ground floor of the hotel. We enjoyed our meals at Mahina... good food!Hotel is on a quiet street about a 10 min walk to Waikiki beach, with a convenience store on the same block, very close to the bus stop and the sightseeing trolley stop with many shops and restaurants nearby. Hotel is like new, clean & spacious room, modern bathroom. After a long day spent sightseeing or on the beach, it was great to return to a bright, aesthetically pleasing and cool room. The complimentary snacks and daily supply of bottled water was included in the amenity fee.A very comfortable 4N stay... good price... we will defintely return!

This hotel is great. Really. Excellent service, great location and reasonably priced. The hotel is beautifully decorated, the beds are comfortable, the bathrooms extremely clean and the wifi is decent.

A great place!! Three blocks to the beach and an ABC just on the corner. A boutique hotel with so much more. Rooms are decorated with that surf and beach type theme and is very comfortable. Amenities in the room include a few snacks and two small bottles of water - perfect to get you started. The lotion and bath rinse smell great! There is a sturdy cotton tote that you can use while you are there (and you can buy it if you want to take it home) which was very handy so you weren't walking around with an ABC bag to the beach. They have a steamer in the room vs. an iron - worked just fine. The property isn't large but it gives you the best "I'm home" feel. The pool isn't large and my only suggestion would be to improve the lounge chairs (the top umbrella could not be adjusted when in the total recline position) and area for sun time - there are maybe 12-15 loungers and if there was a way to expand that area it wouldn't feel as if those in the restaurant aren't sitting right in "your space" per se' while you enjoy the sun. They have a great scent piped in throughout the property- they need to bottle it and sell it. They provide a calendar of events, surfing, learning about the aina', lei making, taste tests, yoga and live music several times a week. Those that play are good and add to the ambiance by the pool and bar area. There is a resort fee, but they provide a daily credit that will be deducted upon checkout when you dine/drink at Mahina and Son's - fabulous idea as I don't think many, if any, hotels do that! Every person I ran into at the property was friendly and full of Aloha - front desk, bell staff, Mahina and Son's, housekeeping and facility staff. I am looking forward to making The SurfJack Hotel my new go to hotel.

If you like character, charm and a boutique hotel experience without the attitude, this is an excellent choice. Location is convenient but not prime; however, the smallish rooms are very nicely designed and the public areas are charming and fun. Very nice staff.

Loved this place. First time traveling with a baby and friends so we go the 2 bedroom suite with the king sized beds. I called early to make sure we could reserve the larger beds and the staff made a note on our reservation and got it taken care of. Amazing service.The hotel itself is amazing. It has a vintage, relaxed vibe and the amenities and rooms were all brand new. It's got a lot of character and you could tell that every little detail was considered with a designer's touch. The staff were all professional and friendly and had the aloha-spirit.The location was amazing. It's not on a super busy street but it's only a 3 minute walk to the heart of Waikiki and the beach. Everything is accessible by walking and there's even an ABC store 30 seconds away if you want to stock up on snacks and drinks.Overall can't recommend this place enough. It was my first time in Waikiki with my family and it was the perfect hotel. Really down to earth type of place and would stay here again!

a beautiful hip boutique hotel in waikiki. we stayed in a suite with the whole family. just perfect! the restaurant in the house is great. small, fresh menu with healthy, local foods. i highly recommend!!

I was researching hotels around Waikiki, and frustrated to find that they seemed far too touristy, pricey, or outdated. I wanted something authentic, hip, intimate, and centrally located, and was excited to come across The Surfjack. The moment I walked into the inviting and tranquil courtyard, I was greeted by Dexter and Robbie, who took the time to ensure my check-in was efficient while exchanging some fun stories about our favorite sports teams. These guys instantly felt like family, and whereas I could imagine feeling like a small fish in a giant sea guests checking into one of the mega resorts down the street, The Surfjack's atmosphere felt like home. This sentiment became literal when I was graciously offered an upgrade to a rooftop suite, and WOW - I was in heaven. The moment I walked into the room, I called my college friends to let them know that there would be no need to have our reunion at a bar...sunset drinks on the spacious outdoor patio would definitely do the trick. The room perfectly balanced modern, sleek, minimalist designs with beautiful colorful art (which I was told features local artists) and really nice details - like high-end bath products and complimentary snacks (the local potato chips were delicious!) Also - can we talk about the "Wish you were here" pool, and how it's quite possibly the most genius pool design? Such a fun and quirky element of the property, and a fun photo opp from the birds eye view of my balcony above. I found the food at the restaurant to be fresh, healthy, and precisely what I craved after a run along Waikiki, just a mere couple blocks away. If you're looking for a massive, overpriced beachfront resort, look elsewhere, but if you want an extended family, beautiful accommodations, and a true reflection of the Aloha Spirit, this is the gem of a hotel for you!
user_name:
Mikest1
New York City, New York

review_body: This place was just so cool! From the moment we landed till the moment we departed, this little gem delivered! The staff were exceptional (Channy, on reception was very personable, friendly and caring, all waiting/bar staff were super friendly and efficient, concierge staff were inviting and proactive and our lovely room attendant, Imelda was thoughtful and consistent). The property itself is an older building which has had a major re-fit. It has been thoughtfully and artistically crafted/constructed and I'd confidently say ... there would not be another property that would mimic this one! Due to its recent refit, modern facilities such as USB charging ports and a security safe were great to have! Every meal we had was attractive and appetizing ... and the fusion of flavours/textures were nicely created. The overall ambience of the property is cruisy and relaxed ... allowing you to fall into 'holiday-mode' swiftly!Location-wise ... this little gem is situated in the 'heart of the city', just perfect for shopping, eating out and general accessibility of amenities.As for the POOL ... well, take the plunge ... the invitation is there!Thanks guys for such an awesome time! As a family of four - two adults and two teenagers ... we all LOVED Surf Jack and can't wait for the day when we can return!

Me and my husband loved our stay here (5 nights)! The location was perfect for us (Close to Waikiki beach but not too close), The staff were nice and friendly, the bar had awesome food (We loved the Ahi grill and He'e salad), The hotel was very stylish and our room was very comfy. We borrowed their bikes and cycled along the lake which was pretty nice! Although I wish we had a microwave in our room since eating out in Honolulu is pretty expensive. But all in all our stay was very memorable and would definitely visit here again.

Surfjack isn't the largest hotel and it doesn't have beach views but its staff have a heart of gold and the pool is gorgeous and I couldn't rate it highly enough.From the moment we arrived to be greeted like old friends, settled into our room in minutes, given advice on getting around town, when to go and what to do until the moment we left (literally the very last moment, leaving with a sick daughter who was very unhappy) they looked after us and made our holiday so much more than I'd expected.Things of note - the restaurant is very popular and it pays to book in but they'll always try to squeeze you in somewhere.The hotel relishes its Hawaii-ness and has been recently renovated but in keeping with an almost 50s vibe which is lovely. There are bicycles to borrow if you want to get about town quickly, there's an ABC store on the corner (and a Whaler's across the road if you want something different), and the pool is gorgeous all afternoon long. Because it's a smaller hotel they treat you as individuals and our teen/tween daughters thought they were in hog heaven. Staff knew their names, they could head down to the restaurant or just hang out near the pool without a care in the world.Every day some camera crew/film crew/TV interview/model shoot was using the hotel as a backdrop (but never enough to get in the way) which is a sign of its stylishness.We had a two-bedroom unit and while it was small it was perfectly suited. There is a small refrigerator and good-sized balconies on all the rooms and while there is no tea or coffee making facility in the room you do get free access to the restaurant's supply.If you do want real tea though (which requires hot water) you can get a kettle from reception - it's a well-kept secret though as none of the literature mentions it.Next time we go to Honolulu we'll be staying at Surfjack and not just because it's close to everything but because of the people. Absolutely gorgeous.

If you're looking for an alternative to the generic corporate hotels at Waikiki and one with a little style and character then Surf Jack is easily your best (only) option. The renovated hotel has been done exceptionally well. Our bungalow suite room couldn't have been better designed and with great style. The bed was amazing and I haven't slept so well in ages. The service through out was excellent, in particular Channy on reception. The cafe and Mahini and Sons at the bottom were also excellent and basically remove any need to risk going to any of the tourist traps around Waikiki. The down side to the hotel is the fact it isn't on the beach. Its physical location is good in terms of access to things but if you want convenience to go out on to the beach it wouldn't be a good option compared to many of the other hotels. However the price reflects this and therefore it is good value in Waikiki, even if it is very expensive. Only negative point was that I left my chromecast in the back of the TV and called up a day later and it wasn't there. The next people could have taken it out and hidden it but one can't help but feel that it became my tip for housekeeping.

I tend to take stellar reviews with a grain of salt. I had been given the name of Surfjack by colleagues who had stayed there a couple months before, and after reading all the reviews I booked two nights starting a 10 day Hawaii vacation. To put it mildly, this hotel is amazing! From the moment I walked in after an 11 hour flight having the front desk great me an an Aloha spirit and having a cocktail at Mahina & Sons, it was such good energy. The room (a 1 bedroom) was perfect, great size, loved the bathroom amenities and the entire vibe of the room was peaceful and modern. Used their complimentary bikes to explore the neighborhood, lounged by the pool with a cocktail and had a lovely dinner at Mahina's. The entire staff that I interacted with, from bell hop to front desk, to restaurant and housekeeping all greeted me with a smile and an positivity that is very rarely seen in this day and age. If you have a chance, stay here. You won't regret it. Loved the infused lime or orange water in the lobby as well.

This was our first visit to Honolulu and we were a large party with 4 rooms. When planning the trip, we had the typical concerns of first time tourists and spent many hours looking through reviews and pictures of most other Waikiki hotels. In the end, we chose the Surfjack due to a combination of location/room quality/price, and we were very satisfied and will make it our go-to hotel for future visits!1. Location: We liked how it wasn't right by the beach and therefore had relatively less foot traffic. Yet, not too far away from all the touristy shopping to make walking out at night more exciting than it should be. The beach is just a short walk away. It is quite close to many malls with delicious food courts and other restaurants. Really, Waikiki is really not that big and everything is walkable.2. Rooms: Comfortable and clean. We had no issues or complaints. We are typically quite picky with our hotel rooms and especially the bathroom, and the Surfjack passes. We were on the 2nd level but did not have any noise issues. Our balcony basically is adjacent to a parking garage and I can probably converse easily with someone parking their car, so we didn't have the curtains open nor did we ever venture to the balcony. But really, we didn't select the Surfjack for view anyway.3. Amenities: The central focus of the hotel is the pool which is well kept. There are also many lounge areas for one to sit, to do work or just read/converse. It was quite comfortable just sitting in the lounge areas, and it was quiet at night and I was able to get some work done on the computer, while enjoying a light breeze. The restaurant on site was decent and there's free coffee in the am. There is also water by the lounge area to fill up your bottles. 4. Service: This is the area that the Surfjack excels at more than any others. From the moment you check in, when they take you to the lounge to sit you down to go over things, you realize that you will be looked after. The hotel is also not that big, so we never had to wait in line to ask for anything. We had late flights out of HNL and we initially inquired about paying for a late checkout. We were told to wait and see. In the end, they were able to give us 2 hospitality rooms on our last day till late evening at no charge. While this is obviously dependent on availability, I really appreciated how they told us not to just fork out the cash when we asked initially. Other hotels likely wouldn't hesitate. With this, the Surfjack will always be my go-to place to stay.

My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in early April, and enjoyed every minute of it. We usually stay at one of the bigger luxury hotels (Royal Hawaiian, Kahala Resort, The Modern), but thought we'd give SurfJack a try. It's now our go-to, and will definitely be back. The small property was charming, and very "un-corporate" - little design details and art displays really set it apart. The complimentary Cafe Luxxe coffee layout each morning was stellar - probably the best cup of coffee you'll have on the island. The staff were genuinely friendly and helpful, going above and beyond for even the littlest detail. Our room (we were able to upgrade to a one bedroom suite upon check-in for a mere $25/night) was spacious, spotless and had all the amenities you'd expect. The bed was probably the most comfortable hotel bed I've slept in. We had dinner at Mahina and Sons before heading to the airport for our flight home, and it was a perfect ending to a wonderful stay.

The pool area is so inviting as the central focal point to the hotel entry. For the pricing the accommodation is charming and the bed linen provides the perfect support for a long sleep to revive you from jet lag. The staff were warm, friendly and made me feel totally comfortable as I was travelling on my own for my first day before my daughter joined me from LA. The front hotel staff went beyond the usual customer service delivery with Dexter, Sal and Robbie helping me out with my multiple queries such as the best locations to visit and what the must see are when we moved to holiday in OAHU. I also recommend that you make dinner reservations early as it fills up early because of the scrumptious food menu!

If you want to have a really relaxing, amazing holiday with all the comforts of home plus more - go no further than the Surf Jack in Wakaii. Huge thanks to Dexter, Robbie, Sue, Sara, Jo Ann & all the staff for a fantastic holiday. We had a 3 bedroom apartment & nothing was too much effort. The hotel is perfectly placed in Wakaii. Would recommend it to everyone.

We had a fantastic stay at the Surfjack which exceeded our expectations. The staff had a great attitude - friendly, welcoming and helpful. We loved the hotel's relaxed atmosphere, great décor, clean rooms, lovely pool area, excellent coffee, great bar and restaurant, good music....We enjoyed it so much we returned at the end of our trip to spend our last night in Hawaii there. Highly recommended.

We had an incredible 5 night stay at the Surfjack Hotel. We stayed in a one bedroom suite and it was absolutely perfect for our little family. The staff were friendly, helpful and went above and beyond to make our stay fabulous.The room amenities were excellent, plenty of space, comfortable beds and one of the best bathrooms/showers we have seen in a hotel room. Love the whole vibe of this place. Will definitely be back if we get the chance.

Super friendly staff, great food and a relaxed feel made this a great place to stay.Close enough to beach and main shopping strip to make it an easy walk - even for little kids.Refreshing pool and terrific bar service.

Room décor is Hawaiian Plantation. The place was recently remodeled and is still fresh and new. Patio sliding doors still roll smoothly - the salt air has not gotten to them yet. Nice pool, friendly staff, very good coffee.Open air casual restaurant. Creative chef - meaning there are things you cannot pronounce and never heard of. They have combined Hawaiian cuisine with traditional Mainland dishes, but Span is still Spam even if you call it something else, grill it and put sauce on it. Mac & Cheese or tossed salad with bacon and eggs??Stayed two nights, and would definitely return.Most other Waikiki accommodations in this price range are worn and in need of refreshment.The charge the usual $25 resort fee which is not optional, just gets around having to pay tax on it. Includes pool towel, large robust free cup of coffee in the morning, $10 off daily in restaurant.

Loved our stay at the Surfjack! Their complimentary beach towels, tote bags and bicycle rentals were an excellent touch! The hotel is newly renovated so everything is very modern and clean. We were there with a group of 14 girls for a bachelorette party, so things could sometimes get noisy and chaotic, but the staff were still extremely friendly, helpful and patient. Everything you need is a short walk away. Overall, we fully enjoyed our stay there and would definitely consider coming back.

Great location,very quiet, friendly staff, awesome place we loved it.you have access to everything, close proximity to beach, shopping areas, restaurants, hotel is a little small but well maintained and very clean, beds were very comfortable and rooms well kept, air-conditioning worked well.

Staff was exceptional. The staff goes out of their way to make sure your stay is pleasant. We arrived very early and they provided us with a temorary room to get some sleep and clean up. They provided us with a clean room shortly after. All staff makes a point to say hello and make sure everything is alright. Very friendly and nice hotel, highly recommend staying here

Surfjack is a beautifully decorated hotel, drawing on a cool 50s and 60s vibe. Its apparent commitment to local artists and craftsmen admirable. It attracts, it seems, an arty crowd as a result. No drunken yobs or hoity toity sorts here!We enjoyed a very nice 3 night stay. The 2 bed suite had ample room for our family of 4 (the sofa folds out as a bed if you want 4 beds, but our kids chose to sleep in the same bed).The staff is very friendly and helpful. Mahina & Sun's restaurant serves good modern Island food.My only quibble is the sound proofing. Windows are well glazed, but the doors - in particular to the interconnected room that adjoined ours - let a lot of sound (and light) through. These could be a lot better than they are. Noisy neighbours getting home late woke us.All round, a really nice relaxed and personal stay. Recommended if you like smaller more personal hotels (as we do).

Loved every minute of our stay at SurfJack, from the Retro look and vibe, to the 60's movies screening onto the pool area wall. Within walking distance to everything that Waikiki has to offer, highly recommended.

Great little boutique hotel in Waikiki! An instagram dream...This place is just so FUN! There's a great in-house restaurant that locals actually venture to Waikiki for...So did Obama when he was in town...There's that awesome graphic pool...Fun coffee shop and hotel store...lovely staff. It's not a mega-resort on Waikiki beach but if you're looking for a stylish stay one block off the beach..this place is just the ticket! It was also pretty affordable, considering!

well , we have vistws about 6 times since last year and its always anazing, Sal , Robbie, Crystal, they are all amazing. Rooms are clean and spacious and have a cool retro vibe. Food and drink at the pool bar is first class. We will always return.

Was pleasantly surprised how great the Surfjack was on our recent visit. The staff is incredibly helpful and friendly and the whole ground level pool/restaurant/bar area is cozy and social. As very seasoned independent world travelers; my wife and I loved the retro design, and compact feel as it reminded us of some of the great small hotels and guesthouses we had stayed in SE Asia. The 1-bedroom suite had a very comfortable king bed and the main room was pleasant with bamboo ceiling finish and worked well for our 18-year old niece to sleep on the sofa bed. Two entrances to the nicely designed bathroom made it convenient for all to use, even during the night. Location is a few blocks from the beach, but still convenient to all sights, as well as having bus stops for 8 bus lines just down the block on Kuhio. (We used to go to Chinatown , downtown, AlaMoana, and Diamond Head; use google maps transit function to find which line to take and "Da Bus App" for real time arrivals; we still paid cash $2.50 ea for adult; $5 bill ok for two and you get 2-hour transfer; starting July 2017, the city will eliminate transfers and replace with $5 27-hour "day" pass which you buy on the bus and will be great for visitors)There is some good food to be had nearby, but for best value, head out of Waikiki; we easily walked to nearby McCully shopping center along canal which has amazing Ramen("Kyoto") place, and about 8 other casual Pan-Asian restaurants to suit your taste buds.

Just made a reservation for an upcoming PC'S Auld spoke to me for The least twenty minutes before I made the reservation. She left me with a good feeling about the hotel I chose. She told me about good places to live, schools, restaurants, the culture and places to visit. See you soon

Overall always a great experience especially the food during all meal periods are exactly what it should be , good.Only recommendations is that they offer up better top shelf bev but overall highly recommended

The Surfjack is a great laid-back hotel that provides a much needed calm oasis from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. From the cookies greeting us upon our arrival to the great service in arranging our taxi to the Airport, the Surfjack truly met our every need. There is excellent coffee at Mahina & Suns as well as Olive and Oliver attached to the hotel. Being from the Pacific Northwest and appreaciating coffee, this was a major bonus! The rooms were decorated in perfect mid-century modern style. The artwork and lamps were a perfect esthetic for my idea of vintage Hawaii. I love design and having these small elements perfected made the environment so welcoming. From the hip magazines to the great smelling shampoo, I was in heaven.A very special shout out to Sai, Julia and all the great staff at Surfjack. They truly go above and beyond to make people feel welcome. This small boutique hotel provides a great place from which to explore all that Oahu has to offer. I would come back to Oahu just to enjoy the relaxed environment and great food that Surfjack has to offer.

Staff were extremely accommodating and welcoming! Hotel had a great fun vibe, great pool, great coffee and great boutique! Affordable priceGood location, near the main area of Waikiki without being centrally within the hustle and bustle!

This hotel was recently updated and no detail was spared. The ambience is retro modern and the space is inviting, hip, and laid-back. We stayed in a one-bedroom suite which was cozy but adorable. The decor created a feeling that was a combination of retro-modern beachy australian. I really felt like I was transported to another time and space. The staff were incredibly helpful and non-robotic. Everyone was extremely personable and I felt more like a house guest than a "customer". If it's in your budget, go for the penthouse suite to get a little extra space, spread out so you can really enjoy the full experience of the Surfjack.

Loved the size location and style of surfjack which was complimented by the warmth shown by all staff. I would imagine staff are chosen carefully and treated well as this is reflected in the way they respond to guests with their genuine and approachable manner.

I loved it here! The hotel is beautifully designed - fun art, great amenities and everything is so well done. The staff was so helpful with questions/recommendations that were needed about finding various spots we were headed to. The hotel overall had great recommendations on where to find a good yoga studio, grab some coffee, beach to catch some sun at, etc. When you visit - make sure to dine at the restaurant. Menu is delish!! Olive and Oliver (coffee and gift shop) was also another fav. Couldn't pass by in the mornings without grabbing my tasty coffee and was able to get so many gifts in the boutique - LOVED shopping there. Hope to make it back soon. Thank you for the great time Surfjack team :)

I was looking for something classy yet affordable for a girls weekend in Wikiki and The Surfjack was perfect! It is close to everything and you can easily walk to the beach!Very clean environment, large room and beautiful pool. The staff was very friendly. I would definitely stay again!

The Surfjack hotel was absolutely amazing!! The decor was extremely tasteful and had a lovely feel!! The staff went above and beyond and made us all feel very welcome as soon as we arrived right up until we checked out!! We will 100% be going back to the Surfjack without question!!!Thank you for making our first of many Hawaii experiences a time to remember Surfjack!!! MAHALO

We only spent one night at Surfack on arrival in Waikiki. The reception is very friendly, the room was ready before the usual check in time, which was a bonus after a night flight. The location a few blocks from the heart of shopping and beach in Waikiki is great value. We enjoyed breakfast at the restaurant. Next time, I hope to get on a bike and enjoy the pool a bit longer. Great value and friendly welcome.

Awesome hotel, great service and rooms, really clean, great shower and comfy bed. We used the bikes and beach towels each day which was really cool. Was nice to be a minutes walk from the Main Street and not in all the hustle and bustle. Def coming back

The service was perfect - just enough attention without being too much. Even the lovely ladies who took care of our room were smiling and appeared happy to be doing their job. Our experience from check-in, to the restaurant/bar (Mahina and Sun's) to check-out was what I read about online - there is genuinely friendly service here. The place feels/smells fresh even thought it is an older building - nicely remodeled and maintained. I also like that there is some guaranteed adult time at the pool in the evening. Seems to cater more to adults overall as I did not see children, which honestly is one of the reasons I will return. Mahina & Sun's is awesome - had several breakfasts and a great dinner one night. They even squeeze Hawaiian grown grapefruits for the BEST greyhound you will find! Stayed for 5 nights. Recommend a larger room (about 450 SF) - they have a king bed and an adjacent room to hang out by the balcony. I recommend a pool view from up high (floor 9 is the highest floor other than the penthouse).

Brilliant staff, tasteful rooms with a slightly retro decor style, delicious restaurant with really fresh flavours. Very comfortable beds and pillows. Pool was basic but adequate for a dip. Easy check in and check out process. Recommended for families.

Older but very clean hotel. Our room was in good shape and comfortable. The location is a block from a great shopping area and about three from the beach. The difference maker is the great staff. They were terrific.

Everybody in the hotel was very nice. Very enjoyable of our family vacation. All of our children love here. The room was very clean and also we like the design style of the room. The pool of the hotel is very good for swimming and relaxation.

Every little detail is perfect for Waikiki. We got a fabulous upgrade and the food is wonderful. Location is a few blocks from the beach but that's not too bad. Staff is wonderful very friendly. Definitely coming back next trip

When I was looking at hotels in Waikiki for our holiday there I was stunned at the prices of most of the establishments. I don't know if it was spring break or school holidays, but the fares were rather steep. The Surfjack offered a reasonable price and I was rather surprised at how comfortable the room was. I opted for a one bedroom suite and it was like an apartment. It has a fantastic location and 2 minutes from the bus stop although a few blocks away from the beach. Still, it was an easy walk to the sea. We were slightly disappointed with the selection and quality of the food in the bar/restaurant area. The staff could not have been friendlier or more helpful.

No need to say more, this hotel is so friendly staff is perfect and nice, smell good, not to far to go to the beach, shopping, take a walk thru the parks. Very Good food in the restaurant, very good drinks at the bar while you get some sun around or in the pool. What to say more, I wll be back.

Friendly staff, comfortable rooms, terrific on site amenities. And tremendously cool design! We are 2 gay men in our 50's, but didn't feel like we weren't hip enough to be here. Off the beaten path as its inland from the ocean, but the beach is an easy walk.

The hotel is located in a very good location, the rooms and hotel are finely designed, the personnel is super gentle and nice and the restaurant is tasty. Overall we highly recommend it! Hope to see you soon

Tucked into the quiet side of Waikiki is this super-cool gem. Inspired by hotels when Waikiki tourism was coming of age, this cute property is full of style with surprising mid-century touches throughout. All of the staff were friendly, helpful and made us feel welcome. The rooms are adorable...very cleverly designed. I can't wait until our next staycation at this wonderful place.

You will love staying at this hotel. It's in a fun neighborhood, easy walking distance to the beach. The hotel is comfortable and friendly - you won't find better staff anywhere. The hotel was recently remodeled and they did a fantastic job. I really enjoyed my stay. I ate most of my meals at Mahina and Sun's and give that a 5 star rating. The menu changes for each meal. Try the poke bowl!

This hotel meets my needs perfectly. I am not the girl who wants a sprawling resort right on the beach a thousand other tourists. The service of the hotel is top notch. The employees know you as there is such a small amount of people staying. It is tucked away off of the main drag, but still walking distance to everything. Rooms are well decorated with extremely comfortable beds. The onsite restaurant is absolutely amazing as well. In my opinion, this place can't be beat.

This place was PERFEC!! It is located in the best spot in Waikiki. All the shops, restaurants, and the beach are walking distance. 4 minutes to the ocean at most! Our room was clean and so comfortable! The food is DELICIOUS!! But the absolute best part is the STAFF! Sai, Benjamin, Zach, Jordyn....everyone whether front desk or in the restaurant, was so friendly! They really made us feel at home and like ohana! They took such great care of my family and I. Each day they gave us tips on what to see, and where to go based on what we wanted to do. They really were over the top friendly and made sure we were happy and comfortable. Thank you so much to all of you at Surfjack! We cannot wait to come back! Aloha from AZ!

This hotel is absolutely lovely...the entire staff is wonderful and are truly personable. They went above and beyond to ensure everyone had an amazing stay. Every item in the hotel has been curated with purpose and you can tell. The rooms are lovely, well appointed, and relaxing. The restaurant is delicious. I chose to eat in the hotel for two of my dinners and breakfast each day. Do not pass up the opportunity to stay here. It is close enough to the beach that you don't feel far, and far enough that you don't feel on the tourist path.

I chose this hotel based on the very high score on trip advisor and the excellent reviews but was unsure whether it would live up to the hype. It did and more. You're not just a customer at this hotel, you're a guest and this made the world of difference to my holiday. There was so much to love about this charming hotel - the welcoming vibe the minute you walk in, the incredible fresh gourmet breakfasts at the restaurant, the faultless wi-fi, the music, and the incredible staff who really walk the walk with customer service. I felt like I was in really good hands with these fine people. And the rooms were clean!The photos of the rooms at Surfjack don't do it justice. There's such a great vibe at this hotel that can't be captured in photos - Having stayed at the Hyatt Regency or Moana Surfrider for the last 5 times, I have finally found a quality hotel with the Surfjack. There is no hustle and bustle, no waiting in queues - everything was easy - just the way it should be on a holiday. Surfjack oozes soul and I'll definitely be back.

Very cute! I could had very comfortable staying. Staff are so nice and friendly. The room keeps clean and simple.The location is not near to the beach, but we can lend a bicycles . I want to come back again!

Stayed 2 nights. Enjoyed our room, the surf art and friendly service. Recommend to all.Liked the foyer area and the little nooks with comfy seating and relaxed atmosphere. The free bikes were cool. Good to get away from the busyness of the beach. The beds in our room were comfortable and firm.

The Surfjack has a great vibe. Although it is tiny compared to other resort-style hotels in Honolulu, the rooms are clean and well-stocked, the staff is attentive and well-trained, and the amenities are plentiful. From the chic artwork and whimsical details in the lobby, it's obvious that the owners have considered how to maintain a fun and relaxing ambience without sacrificing the functional charm of an excellent boutique hotel. Our room was large, immaculate, and featured nice conveniences like USB charging stations and a huge balcony with deck chairs, although it looked directly onto the neighboring apartment building. The bathroom was small but had an excellent shower with great water pressure and regularly refilled bath products. Big props to the wonderful housekeeping staff. The Surfjack is located a few blocks from the busier, more touristy beachfront areas. This was great since we wanted to explore the city and not simply plant ourselves in the sand. There were convenience stores, shops, bars and restaurants just steps away. The onsite restaurant and bar, Mahina and Sun's, was also great, with a locally-sourced menu. It was also often busy, so make reservations in advance. The only minor issue I had with the Surfjack was the various unforeseen charges added to our bill. Valet parking, morning coffee, beach towels, bicycles—they were all provided but required daily fees. With some added consideration for budget-conscious travelers, the Surfjack would really be the perfect hotel.

A last minute stay turned in to a delightful surprise. Really beautifully appointed, extremely clean rooms wth great food at the onsite restaurant. Ideal location to walk to everything. Really exceptional customer service too.

This place was hands down the best Hotel I've ever stayed at. From the moment you pull up all the way through check out was a great experience. The staff, rooms, pool, restaurant, food and all of the above was just outstanding. The Staff (especially Benjamin) was absolutely amazing. They cared for us like we were family. We also had the opportunity to ride beach cruiser bikes around the strip which is amazing. So instead of driving we used bikes and they also provided us with bike locks. I can't thank the staff enough for the hospitality and the treatment we received at this Hotel. Also awesome live music by the pool an art gallery and even the location of the hotel is awesome!! Just an endless list of awesomeness about this Hotel. Thanks again for making our couples weekend a weekend we will never forget.

The Surfjack has excellent service, beautiful rooms, and the overall atmosphere is amazing!! It's a relaxing spot filled with ALOHA The staff were all oh so kind and helped in every way that we requested. This is definitely now our go to place!! My husband and I loved that the hotel offered the ability to take cruiser bikes out for a ride downtown. We took a ride around and it was an awesome experience. Love love love this place! The restaurant Mahina and Suns was superb. Once again the waiters were so sweet and the food was so delicious!! I have nothing negative to say about this place.

I almost don't want to write this because I'd hate to have this hotel get oversold during my next trip. By far, the best boutique hotel I've ever stayed in. The hotel rooms are great, close to everything, free bike rentals and the staff is amazing! Huge props to: Jordyn, Kenny, Sai, Robbie, Benjamin and the awesome server from Korea (I can't remember her name unfortunately- but she's fabulous).Again, highly, highly recommended... just please don't visit when I need to stay there :)

I usually stay at another hotel in Waikiki, but decided to give the SurfJack a try after reading some of the reviews. So far it has been great, friendly staff and bar. The rooms are small but quaint. Nice spacious bathroom and bedroom. Showers have great water pressure. 2 free bottles of water each day, free wifi, awesome pool beside bar, and free beach towels you must return. Overall a great experience.

We enjoyed staying at the Surfjack. It is a smaller property than I expected and it is about a 10 minute walk to the beach. We enjoyed how friendly it was. There is a little refrigerator and it is next door to the ABC Store so we were able to have cereal and milk, yogurt, wine, etc. There are two bedrooms and a small lounge so everyone had their own space. There is one bathroom. I would happily stay there again.

My wife and I stayed at the Surfjack for a family vacation.ALL of the staff there are great: Dexter, Sai, Kenny, Roberto with the man bun (he likes to be acknowledged for his man bun), and Zack our server at Mahina & Sun’s.THE FOOD AT MAHINA & SUN’S IS AMAZING. The poke dish with the spicy tuna is one of the best food I've had in my life. I've been craving for it since we left. The dish was so excellent and so well-balanced. Every forkful had just the right amount of balance of flavor.My wife gave me some of her food to try (she got the vegetarian poke dish), but it threw the balance off my plate. What I'm trying to say is the dish was already well-balanced, that I didn't need to add anything else to my plate and ruin the palate the chef already designed in that dish. I hope that makes sense.I especially loved that all of the ingredients are fresh, organic, and locally sourced right there. Zack, our server, was SO helpful. My wife and I just got off our early flight, feeling sleepy and hungry at the same time. We were up since 4am PST. He served us promptly, and we felt so relaxed for our lunch.He talked with us, and gave us SO many helpful tips on exploring Waikiki, he answered all of my questions with confidence and helpfulness.It was my first time in Hawaii (my wife's fourth or fifth time), and Zack was the best person to welcome me to Hawaii for the first time.We liked the food so much that when the rest of our family flew in the next day, we invited them to join us at Mahina & Sun's. I had the same dish (poke with spicy tuna).We considered other food options in Waikiki, but they seemed either too expensive or didn't feel authentic for what we were looking for. Which was a more of a local flavor and dish, not something like P.F. Chang that we can eat back at home.Okay, enough about the food.The hotel itself was a real pleasure to stay in. We couldn’t afford of any of the high-end hotels near the beach, but you know what, we really liked the Surfjack. The Surfjack felt like a real treasure to find in the middle of Waikiki, where you have all of these high-end resort hotels to chose from. It felt more low-key, the ambiance and decor was fresh and new. It felt more dynamic. We would’ve missed out on that if we went to a more polished and scrubbed high end hotel. The lounging furniture is a real nice touch. You can order drinks and food from there tool. The interior decor of the rooms are pleasant, fresh, and laid-back. In fact, my wife and want to design our living room now like the room we stayed in. We loved it that much.My wife and I would highly recommend this place to anyone we know that will be visiting Waikiki in the future, even if they don't end up staying at the Surfjack.And we'll definitely want to come back to Mahina & Sun's.

What an amazing stay! I couldn't have ask for more! This hotel is chic/cool/with great vibe and good value for your $$$. NOTE: Call the front desk first thing in the morning and have a fresh cup of coffee delivered to your room. That first sip will change everything! Awesome staff, great restaurant (Mahina & Sun's - voted Best New Restaurant 2017) and coffee/gift shop on-site, rooms are trendy and very comfortable! THE place to stay in Waikiki! Highly recommended!!!!!

Surfjack is good! Great location. Next to the best Thai food in the city. Walking distance to almost everything in Waikiki. Attention to detail within the room and service is stellar. As soon as the valet collects your car, you are whisked off to a comfortable seating area with a beverage to be checked into the hotel. You walk by the "wish you were here" pool to the elevator. 50's beach decor. Dimmer and auto lights on each switch. Even in the closets. All the drawers in the room were soft close. The mini fridge is stocked daily with complimentary bottles of water. I've taken notes of the bathroom finishes for our own renovation. As close to natural light for a vanity as any makeup artist can ask for since my bathroom did not have a window. The river stone floored shower massages weary feet while the perfect temperature and pressure of the stream soothes away a day's work. Davine products! Try to get a room in higher floors facing the pool then you'll love it. Only thing is no tub. And call down for your car before heading down. Otherwise valet may be a wait. As a hotel guest, you are entitled to $10 dining credit for each night's stay which does not apply to the coffee/gift shop. Recommended.

I did a last minute booking for a stopover on the way to New Zealand from Canada, and was really just looking for a reasonable place to sleep for a couple of nights, near the heart of things. The Surfjack well exceeded our expectations. We had a couple of one-bedroom suites which were roomy, airy, light and beautifully decorated. We loved the mid-century modern vibe of the whole hotel. The bathroom amenities were lovely, and the beds comfy. We ate at the restaurant for dinner and the pizza was fantastic, as was the service.What I really need to do is commend the staff. Each member was above and beyond friendly. They were accommodating to my dad's needs (he's in a wheelchair), and super helpful in every possible way. We had a great time hanging by the pool during the day and listening to the DJ. While this place isn't on the beach, it's an easy walk. I will never stay anywhere else in Honolulu in the future (assuming I can get a room here, as I'm sure it's going to get very popular). We actually stayed again on our way back from NZ, as we loved it so much. Many thanks to all the great staff.

At first I was a little concerned as we were traveling as a group of 8 (2 of them being 8 and 10) but this is a great little gem! PROS: 1. Staff were all amazing and super friendly 2. Small property so you got to know other travelers and the staff3. The food was great 4. Coffee available downstairs every morning5. Rooms were smaller but perfect for sleeping, showering and chilling before bed. We had a 2 bedroom suite for 6 of us (4 adults and 2 kids). 6. Great location (short walk to the beach and the main strip) 7. Good pool - sometimes it got busy so there wasn't always lounge chairs available but there was always somewhere to sit near the pool (tables, couches) 8. The hotel provides towels for the pool and the beach CONS (not much of one): 1. Kids were not allowed in the pool after 5pm - this caused my kids to get a little upset. It is adult time from 5-9pm but there was NEVER anyone in the pool during that time. 2. Have to pay for parking

Surf jack is the most exciting and new experience to happen in Honolulu! Amazing value and perfectly placed close to the shops and wikkii beach. This cool retro vibe hotel feels like home with every tiny detail, keeping its Hawaiian heritage at its roots, each room perfectly bespoke. I'm a solo traveller and feel like family, very sad to leave but after this review hoping for the penthouse next time lol. Food amazing!! Live music every night, bicycles free to go and explore the island don't do too many hills though... best cocktail on the menu is 'uncles punch' apparetly made from Agricole another thing I've learnt yum. Shout out to Marshall the bar tender who knows everything there is to know about fish Dreams are made of surfjack

We only stayed here for one night which is unfortunate because it's an awesome hotel!! The only negative reviews on here I can only assume are from an older crowd. This hotel is super trendy and really good value. The food is awesome and has a great coffee shop downstairs. The atmosphere was awesome and a lot of younger people downstairs. Also suitable for couples with children however the pool resets at 5:30pm at which time all children must be out of the pool for adults only time. Wish we had of stayed here the whole trip.

Just came back from this hotel last week... Place is perfect. Old throw back style, not pretentious but super chill and laid back... Great restaurant and bar on site, super dope rooms with great modern touches... This is now the only place I'd stay in Honolulu...Kennie the front desk was super cool and helpful, and they have the islands best coffee... Id 1000% recommend this place to anyone.

My boyfriend and I planned our first Hawaiian vacation without much knowledge of where to go or stay. We did some research and spoke to some people who had travelled to Hawaii and decided on Oahu and Maui. Our trip started in Oahu at the Surfjack Hotel. Our flight arrived late in the evening so we did not get to the hotel until approximately midnight. There were staff on hand that greeted us with a smile and got us settled. The Hotel itself is very cool and our 1 bdrm suite was awesome! Very clean and unique. We overlooked the pool, such a great view. They told us at check in that coffee was free until 11am each day and that it was the best coffee in town. They weren't wrong. It was literally THE best coffee I've had in my life and that says a lot! We spent some time on Waikiki Beach and shopping in the district, all of which is walking distance to the Surf Jack Hotel. The beach is beautiful and the shops are plentiful. A lot of luxury shopping and the food was pricey. We found Waikiki in general to be pretty commercialised. We rented a car one day and drove up to the North Shore which we HIGHLY recommend. Here you will get a true sense of the beauty of Oahu. We stumbled upon a little macadamia nut farm, stopped at a number of surf beaches to watch the surfers and of course hit Giovanni's shrimp truck! This is a MUST do. Best shrimp ever. We also did the Oahu Falls hike which was pretty cool with all the bamboo trees. We flew Island Air over to Maui after 3 days in Oahu. Although we enjoyed our time at Waikiki beach, Maui is hands down more our speed. We absolutely loved our stay at Surf Jack and would highly recommend this hotel if you are going to visit Waikiki!

What a treat! Could not imagine a better experience for my first trip to Hawaii. The Surfjack, Mahina and Suns (restaurant), and Oliver (café/shop) teams are incredible. A big Mahalo to you all!!! Can't wait to come back for an ahi poke bowl, spicy margarita, and a dip in the pool. Avocado tacos too, obviously! You all rock and make the whole experience fantastic. See you next year? Heck yeah!

Hello! We had such a fabulous stay at The Surfjack Hotel last week! Wish we were still there! We had been deciding between saving a bit of money and staying a few blocks in from the water or splurging on an oceanfront hotel with higher (and annoying) resort fees. Well, once we found out about the Surfjack, we decided to try it out, save some money (which went toward some delicious Poke Bowls at Mahina and Suns...), and don't regret it one bit! What I loved the most was the brand new, hip, retro beach style interior, cleanliness, fabulous location (about a 5 min walk from the beach), and AWESOME STAFF! Thanks so much guys! p.s. the shower in our room was sooooooo cool! p.p.s. a few other perks: they brought coffee to our room, had beach towels and a tote to use, it was a great hangout spot for my hungry family who had just flown in and was picking us up to move on to Kailua for the rest of our Hawaii stay. The servers at Mahina and Suns (Zach and a lovely woman from Canada) were just phenomenal - I tried my first Poke bowl (don't like fish) but loved the root/veggie version and ate it the next day! Anyways, hope to come back soon! Mahalo!

Recently stayed at The Surfjack and already planning my return for next year. These guys really know what they're doing. From the moment you arrive you're made to feel special ... your made to feel like a guest! Nothing is a bother; staff incredibly attentive and it's not just lip service, there's a genuine warmth at Surfjack. The creative detail, the eclectic retro designs are amazing. You get the sense you've walked on to the set of a 60's Elvis Hawaii movie. It's obvious a great deal of thought has gone into creating the right vibe at Surfjack and I must say they've nailed it! The Restaurant dining is delicious, the local chef is renowned for using super fresh local produce. The food is so good Barack and Michelle Obarma recently dined there. If you want to experience a super relaxed holiday vibe surrounded by people who do the guest experience exceptionally well, then this is the place to come. Within easy walking distance to the beach (5 min) and downtown Waikiki. Check out the delicious local Thai restaurant 2 doors down. Mahalo Surfjack, see you again next year.

We came for business and pleasure from Maui and loved this hotel. The staff was fantastic - after only 3 days they knew our names and we did theirs. Sad to leave - we will come back. Mahalo Chenny, Benjamin, Sai, Robert, Haley Star, Clifford and everyone else who makes staying there special!

Had a great stay at Surfjack in waikiki. Such a wonderful base for time in waikiki and too escape back here after being amongst the hussle is just perfect. Boutique hotel with retro hawaiin vibe which is magic. Its so not big corporate hotel and the masses. On arrival the team realised it was our honeymoon and we got upgraded straight away. Room was great and thanks guys for looking after us.Resturant is all fresh custom made and cooked food with live music on basically each nite. Compared to whats around in waikiki , which is all about big and mass tourist crap, this place is cool and a real blessing. Perfectly central location to all waikiki has to offer. Staff very attentive and want to be there. That says a lot about the pkace. Well done guys.But sshhhhhh. Dont tell to many cause i want to stay again !!Highly recommend. P.s. The jack coffee is best in oahu. My opinion :)

Room 546 has a nice view of the center courtyard, great for selfies or overhead shot of the pool! Front Desk answered any and all random questions I had. Quite accomodating in my normal, but excessive requests. Handy to have the microwave and electric kettle in the room. My friend and I enjoyed breakfast at the restaurant on my last day of stay. fresh and locally sourced ingredients made my meal delicious. I cannot say enough wonderful things about Kenny, Robbie and Sai! So gracious.Esthel made our stay comfy and clean. Happy to be left such sweet notes when returning to the hotel after a day out.Only thing I can complain about is the Ricotta Toast, it just wasn't my friend's jam. (Get it? Since it is topped with local jam? Nevermind...)

The location is excellent, only 10 minutes walk to the Waikiki beach, which keeps it a bit quieter. Room 638 was relatively quiet, and pretty dark with the shades pulled, quite important for my sleep. The pool, open till 9 pm, fronts the bar and the evenings there have a lively atmosphere. The staff is unfailingly polite, responsive, and smiling. It's Honolulu, so expect the parking to cost $35/night and a resort fee that includes wi-fi and beach towels that you can take anywhere. The restaurant it good, with a fairly pricey menu for dinner; the breakfast is quite good, and I highly recommend the Framble, the best omelette I've ever had!The room is small, but the bedding comfortable and the shower first rate. You are paying for location and Honolulu, remember!

we LOVED this hotel. Loved it. We rented a two bedroom suite and used the pool, lounge, restaurant. All was excellent. We had a really fun three days. This is the Ace hotel but way cleaner, nicer and less partying. We will be back for sure. Olive and Oliver coffee is a really nice perk too... wish you could charge it to the room!

This is such a wonderful little hotel. Although it isn't a beachfront property, it is within a few blocks of the beach and the shops, restaurants and cafes of Waikiki. It is beautiful, comfortable and extremely well priced. It has a youthful, fun vibe and the décor is a nod to mid-century modern design. It is super comfortable and clean. Every single employee that I dealt with was both professional yet warm, open and friendly. Both my husband and I and our two teenagers (ages 13 and 15) just loved the place. The fantastic restaurant, Mahina and Sons, was just the icing on the cake. We ate there on our first night there and then cancelled a reservation at another resto for the third night so that we could go back to Mahina again. The food, the friendly service! The Surfjack really gets it right on all fronts. Other small hotels should look to them as an example.

Surfjack is on the map and a go-to spot in Honolulu that you won't regret for a second. We were so impressed with the design, atmosphere, and quality of the rooms. But most importantly to us, the hospitality of the staff. It's hard not to be impressed by first impressions...the welcome curbside, the attentive staff inviting guests to grab a seat in their "living room" while they managed multiple bookings, and the bag to room service. The entire hotel experience is curated to create a modern, fresh Waikiki perspective. We loved the restaurant, the pool, and every thoughtful detail in the room decor. We didn't leave without our Surfjack Swim Club tote bag and we'll be back soon! Hurry and book now!

We had a great time here for my boyfriends birthday. The hotel helped us in celebrating by preparing a birthday treat to be sent to our room. The hotel staff are so friendly and the rooms are clean, comfortable, and relaxing. Very comfortable beds and spacious balconies. We will be back!!

Very friendly staff, efficient check-in and out. Good food in bar/ restaurant, where they can find alternatives if you have many food allergies. Room was nice and clean, bed comfortable, AC lovely and made very little sound. Traffic noise was blocked out nicely (lot of traffic in Waikiki area, had to switch from an Airbnb ap to this hotel due to noise), however the room let in some noise from the hallway. Walking distance to bars, shopping street and beach. Appr 15 min walk to Hawaii Convention Centre.

For a relaxing, enjoyable stay at a location where you can easily walk to so many nearby restaurants and shopping areas in Waikiki, the Surfjack hotel is an awesome boutique hotel to stay at. Good eats for breakfast, lunch and dinner at the onsite restaurant Mahina and Sun's (pizza by the pool, no problem and it's really good pizza), this place is so inviting from the too cool pool, to comfortable guest rooms with generous open lanais, this place is a great place to stay at when visiting Hawaii. This was my second staycation here and I can't wait to return!

While the Surfjack is a modern, clean, and even stylish hotel, what really sets it apart is the incomparable customer service. We were made to feel welcome at every step and they took care of all our accommodations. An example - our flight was at 6pm and we wanted to go to the beach after morning checkout. Their staff stored our three bags, put our leftover food in their fridge, heated it up for us as lunch when we returned from the beach, and gave us access to a hospitality suite afterwards to shower and get ready for the flight. It's five star service at a more value-priced hotel.

After a month of research and reading reviews, I opted to stay at the Surfjack over the Waikiki strip hotels, and I'm so glad I did. The staff, especially Krystle and Ben, were so friendly & made our stay memorable. My husband and I were there for a week so the staff felt like family. The hotel's just 2-3 blocks away from the beach & we're so glad we didn't stay in the heavy tourist area on the beach. The price is very reasonable considering location, amenities, and rooms (which were always clean with a note left by the staff everyday). We rented a car for two days out of our seven day stay to go to the North Shore and south of Honolulu. Everything else we did was within walking distance or an Uber/Lyft ride away. The hotel's very retro chic and becoming popular quickly, even with the locals. There weren't too many kids so it's great for couples. We ate at Mahina and Suns twice, and my husband said the Ahi was the best meal he had on our vacation. They had talented musicians every night, so it was nice to open our balcony door and listen while we got ready for the night or downstairs during dinner/drinks. Mahalo Krystle and Ben and the Surfjack crew for helping us make lifetime memories!

Staying at the Surfjack was a great experience. It is definitely one of the best hotels I have stayed anywhere. Rooms are clean and beautiful, staff very friendly and welcoming, the restaurant downstairs is excellent. Beach is within easy walking distance, shops just around the corner. Bummed now actually that I decided to island hop to Maui, would have loved to stay here for another week. Also want to thank the previous Tripadvisor reviewers for finding this gem <3

We stayed for a week and a half at Surfjack, we will definitely book it the next time we are in Waikiki. Location was perfect, central but quiet, staff were super friendly and helpful, cleaning lady left a gratitude notes which we thought was very sweet, 7 minutes walk to the beach. L-shapes sofa really made us feel at home:-) Lastly, the rooms didn't smell of mold which is hard to find in Hawaii ( no matter what hotel u stay at).

We just spent one night at the Surfjack to cap off our trip in Oahu and it left us wishing we had had more time at the Surfjack. First, a major hand to the staff. Every single staff member we interacted with was incredibly friendly and helpful. Notably our flight was around midnight the day we checked out so we planned to spend the day wondering around the city - we asked staff about keeping our bags, of course no problem, but they also offered us free use of a hospitality suite that evening from 7-10pm before we had to leave for the airport. It was completely unexpected, but so appreciated - a perfect way to clean up and get everything sorted before heading out.The hotel itself was also great. Good location, cool (and comfortable) modern rooms, beautiful common areas, nice pool, good restaurant on site. We took advantage of a few of the hotel perks - free admission to the Honolulu Museum of Art, free bike rentals (which we used to get to the museum and to explore Chinatown). The Surfjack also provides a great list of local shops, restaurants and bars - many were already on our list to check out, but nice touch and helped us confirm plans to explore Chinatown (highly recommended). All in all we can't say enough about our stay at the Surfjack and the staff there. Needless to say if we find ourselves in Oahu again we'll certainly make our way back to the Surfjack!

Great trendy "hip" hotel without the pretense. Very chill and inviting. Loved the decor, designed well with a modern flair, details were excellent. Great vibes, staff was friendly and location was great.

I had a fabulous stay at the Surfjack! They have a great ambiance. The decor is fun and stylish. The front desk staff is friendly and inviting, especially Jordyn!! She was amazing - made my stay extra special!! The rooms are spacious and well decorated. The resto is delicious and they cafe has the best coffee in all of Hawaii. No Jokes. Do yourself a favour and stay here. You wont regret it.

This retro styled hotel is just a few minutes walk from Waikiki beach, centrally located in relation to bars and restaurants and shops. Our ninth floor room was stylish modelled with every thing in the room easy to use and working well. Wide range of tv channels and wifi everywhere. A small balcony afforded views over the pool and across the high rises towards the ocean. The staff were friendly and helpful.The lobby is casual and fun with a great bar and restaurant and general lounge areas with anytime coffee and tea around a small pool where one can relax (except when kids are around). Only gripe was the noise from the corridors and noise of heavy room doors slamming. Generally tho' this was a great spot - we booked for four days and stayed for nine. We would come back again.

First time visit to Honolulu and we were very lucky to have found the Surfjack Rooms were recently renovated, were very, very clean and the suite we stayed in had a nice view. The staff at the front desk is what really makes this hotel great - what a fabulous team! They made our whole family very welcome and were very helpful with tips for getting around Honolulu . We were close to all amenities, a casual 8 minute walk to the beach, shopping and plenty of restaurants. I highly recommend the Surfjack as a great place to stay in Waikiki. We were so impressed that I'm seriously thinking of returning this year again to celebrate our Wedding Aniversary.

Will keep this short and sweet.The Surfjack was fabulous. It is adorable. Everyone who works there is amazing and really made my stay there feel like home. I will absolutely stay here again any opportunity I have.The restaurant is amazing! Great breakfastsOlive & Oliver shop is adorable.Loved it.

Every year I stay on the Big Island, then I have to try to find a modestly priced hotel in Waikiki to stay for one night before my early morning flight. I'm so glad I stayed in this new hotel. I was upgraded to a suite, which was lovely despite the lack of a view. I really liked the decor - retro without being kitschy. Very good bathroom with a nice shower (but no bathtub). Professional, helpful staff. Not on the beach, but the price reflects that. Hats off to this hotel for trying to break the mold in Waikiki and offering something that is comfortable and unique at a good price. I think I've finally found my perfect pre-flight hotel.

We had lunch & dinner at Mahina & Sun's restaurant at the Surf Jack Hotel. Fabulous food & friendly service. I stayed at a friend's home but looked at the rooms & thought they were great. Very hip decor in the rooms & poolside. Cool music. Fun, very helpful, accommodating staff. A fabulous place to stay.

My wife and I came here for our honeymoon. We planned to stay a total of 5 nights from Monday to Saturday.I can say that this is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at in my whole life. EVERYONE in the staff goes 110% in terms of customer service.Suite: The suite was amazing. We are a couple that spends most of their time outside so we didn't care much for the size but we did appreciate the retro decoration it had and how everything was spotless and new.Food: The restaurant in the hotel is very good for breakfast, drinks and coffee. Portions are really hefty so consider splitting a dish with someone else. Prices are similar to what you find around the area. The good thing about eating here is that the staff wont rush you to pay or leave, they like it when you hang around.Staff: everyone in the staff was amazing. Especially the cleaning lady in charge of our room, Eufemia. She left notes every day saying thanks and mahalo and whatnot. Pretty amazing.Location: One of the best things this hotel has is the proximity to Kalakua road ( 2 blocks ) and the entries to the highway ( 5 minute drive ). The access to the hotel does not go through he busiest streets so you will save a lot of time driving.Perks: The hotel gives 10$ a day for eating in their restaurant and 1 towel per guest just for going to the beach.

Beautiful spacious rooms with everything you could possibly need. Just off the main strip a few blocks and very quiet. Friendly staff, cool restaurant with live music. Also wanted to mention, my husband left his wallet in the taxi on our way to the airport... the cab driver ( he regularly picks up from the surfjack) returned the wallet to the front desk at the hotel. The hotel then called us and had it shipped to our door!!! Great service and I highly recommend this perfect getaway when visiting Waikiki. You won't be disappointed.

We upgraded to a small suite and sweet. Our unit had a large, very comfortable balcony overlooking the pool. The $30 per night upgrade was well worth the price. I was a bit surprised by $25 per day amenities fee. But Overall the staff & accommodations were great. Good location, easy walk to the beach & shopping.

Lovely service from cheerful staff, Room 412, two rooms, good beds. Basic inroom amenities, small fridge, safe.Located walking distance to International Marketplace. Bus Stops for Ala Moana, and Pearl Harbour just around the corner. Valet parking only ( extra fee per day). Pool is great at end of the day. Waikiki beach is 6 blocks over - not too far but its not a 2 minute walk. Nice restaurant and bar at poolside - very laid back, relaxation inducing. ABC stores on every corner nearby - milk, bread, drinks, liquor, snacks, souveniers etc.

This is a really good hotel only a short walk from the beach and shopping. The staff is so friendly and helpful, they really go out of their way to make you feel welcome and your stay enjoyable. The rooms (at least our room) are a little small, but they are kept spotlessly clean and the beds are super comfortable. Very good breakfasts.

Great modern/retro rooms, amazing food, delicious drinks, fantastic coffee. Just the right ambiance: cool, laid back, attention to details, but not pretentious. Outstanding costumer service. will come back.

Good value for price, clean comfortable room, and excellent service. I would book this hotel again.The neighbour hood was fine and it was a ten minute walk to the beach. Breakfast at restaurant was very good, try the Eggs Sammie.

Great getaway for locals and unique style! Convenient restaurant locations nearby and away from too much of the Waikiki madness. Jordyn at the front desk was friendly and courteous. We were very appreciative of her willingness to help us feel at home, which we did. Room had a mini fridge and a safe. Bungalow-style and very shabby (in a cute way). Excellent morning coffee in the restaurant (Which is free if you present a voucher they provide you with at check in). Our housekeeper Esthel was wonderful. Saw her in the hall on our way out and she was very sweet. She left us a kind note to return to (Wishing us a pleasant stay). I don't have enough nice words to say about her. It was a very memorable stay created by all of the staff at the Suarfjack. Thank you for being a big part of a great (And much needed) staycation.

The creative touches, unique style, and exceptional service made our canceled flight and unexpected extended 2 day stay truly amazing!! Looking forward to staying at Surfjack again. Cannot recommend enough.

We had a wonderful time at the Surfjack. The on-site restaurant Mahina and Sun's has ono food and the vintage Hawaii theme is breathtaking. Everyone was so friendly and did everything they could to make our stay personal and unforgettable. We will be back soon!

A fun place to stay. A retro makeover of an old hotel by the looks of our room. We had a 3 bed/2 bath suite with balcony for each room. Atmosphere is nice and the pool area is beautiful. All the staff was friendly but only the male staff had any knowledge of transportation and or tourism. Not that we had complicated questions the ladies behind the desk just seemed clueless to be working in a hotel.

My husband and I stayed at the Surfjack twice for a total of three nights. The first night we arrived quite late and the check in was no problem. We were starving and very happy to see the welcome snacks in our room...The rooms and the whole hotel has a laid back retro vibe - the rooms have a walking tour map in them which would lead you to other mid 20th century buildings in the area. One evening the big screen above the open air pool was playing Elvis' Blue Hawaii which sums up the atmosphere. The decor is beautifully designed throughout the hotel, with locally derived quirky artworks, always on theme.We stayed in a one bedroom suite, first on the 6th floor, then on the 4th (higher floor was nicer though neither had a view per se). The beds were the most comfortable we slept on in two weeks, the showers had loads of water and the bathroom amenities were top notch.We didn't use the pool but many did - it's quite small but it was never crowded. The hotel isn't really geared for children though they're welcome of course.The location is central to everything, we walked all over Waikiki and up to Ala Moana mall. Buses are plentiful, we never needed a car though we didn't have time to venture past Honolulu.Highly recommend the Diamond Head hike, the Honolulu Art Museum (which you get into for free by showing your Surfjack room key), the Iolani Palace (go on the tour) and the hotel's restaurant (Mahina & Sun's).Our departing flight was very late so the hotel was very accommodating by providing us with access to a hospitality room where we could relax and freshen up for an hour before leaving for the airport.All in all, the service, location and amenities were excellent at the Surfjack - unreservedly recommended.

Obviously the Aussies are loving the Surfjack (see pretty much all other reviews) and for great reason...#1 COFFEE here is actually great! Every morning you can make your way down to the bar at Mahina & Sun's for a free cup of the best coffee we had in all of Hawaii (and we didn't just stay on Oahu). For those of us that need an actual flat white to get going in the morning, there is also a barista on the other side of the pool ready to make your wish come true (although this one is not free).#2 STYLE: this place has a very cool, chic and chilled out vibe. The styling is amazing, modern and artistic with great little quirky statement pieces all over the place (i.e. the infamous painted mural on the bottom of the pool). The communal hang out areas make you feel like you are sipping cocktails in a hip urban jungle, which personally was right up my ally. The wi-fi throughout the hotel was also excellent.#3 ROOMS: we stayed here twice - 3 days at the beginning of our holiday and 3 days at the end of our holiday. The first day our flight arrived at 6am and we were at the Surfjack by 7am (just a few hours short of check in time...) but the lovely Jordyn was more than happy to accommodate us. She organised for us to upgrade our room (for a decent price) so that we could check in straight away and get some much needed sleep. The big king beds are super comfy and plush and the couch also passed the nap test. My favourite part of the rooms though were the bathrooms - that shower is sooooo good. #4 FOOD: the restaurant downstairs (Mahina & Sun's) is definitely worth a visit, not sure if it's a usual thing but both times we were there we were given a credit to spend at the restaurant which was a nice perk. They have different types of live music every night (e.g. jazz, bossanova etc) which was lovely - we enjoyed sitting on our balcony listening to it as well.#5 LOCATION: for those of you worried about not being close to the beach, it is literally at the end of the street.
