There is shopping, beaches, restaurants, bars & activities right at Surfjack's door. We loved walking out and exploring each day (hot tip: you can also borrow bikes from Surfjack to cruise around on).#6 STAFF: the staff were so welcoming, friendly and super helpful. They are so gracious about our lack of tipping know how as well... (if you google "how to tip" it takes you to some seriously conflicting and confusing places). Shout out to Benjamin at the front desk who was also always ready with some witty banter.In a nutshell, we would definitely recommend this place to anyone and we'll be back again for sure!

My husband and I booked a weekend at The Surfjack for my birthday. They are best known for their iconic pool, so we got there early so we could enjoy it Saturday during the day. They told us our room wasn't ready yet (we were prepared for that), so we just grabbed some seats by the pool and ordered lunch. They told us that as soon as our room was ready they would notify us. At 5:45PM when we still weren't notified, we went over to the front desk to see what was going on. They seemed super flustered, but felt so awful that no one had come to let us know the room was ready hours ago. A shift change I think impacted this, but they gave us a dining credit at Mahina & Sun's to "make up" for it. It really wasn't that big of a deal since we wanted to be by the pool anyhow, but I thought it was a really nice gesture. The rooms are spacious and clean, the servers are friendly and helpful and the coffee shop attached (Olive & Oliver) is adorable. The Surfjack does not disappoint!

With our trip almost coming to an end, I never want to leave this place. Surfjack has gone above and beyond with everything and made our stay so enjoyable. I definitely recommend staying more than a couple of days, because it's so worth it. With 7 of us in a 3 bedroom suite, we couldn't have asked for a better time. The pool is always clean and refreshing, as are the bathrooms and rooms. The only down side is the cleaners may only change towels daily, and sheets every other. All in all, reception is very helpful and the staff very friendly. 10/10 visit

What a little gem! When we first arrived Krystle & Janny (sorry if I got their spelling wrong) greeted our family warmly and set the tone for the genuine hospitality provided during our stay. The hotel even provides complimentary bikes to ride in Waikiki. The rooms are lovely and modern. The pool area and restaurant all integrate with the lobby/entry and are all open air. After settling in we thought we'd borrow the bikes for a ride by the beach. Krystle and Janny again were accommodating and helpful - telling us we could keep them a little later than usual since we got a late start.While the environment and modern and inviting, the staff really made our experience memorable. Definitely a gem in Waikiki!

While we are staying at the Royal Hawaiian, we were curious to check out the Surfjack as their Instagram posts were so fun and interesting! We popped in for drinks but ended up staying for a delicious dinner (the naked pig pizza and wild boar rigatoni were delicious). I was cheeky and asked to gain access to a balcony to take a photo of their amazing pool, and was so chuffed when we were given a tour of the penthouse and regular rooms. We'd definitely be happy to stay at the Surfjack on our next visit to Hawaii.

We absolutely lived it here and will be recommending it to all my friends who come to Hawaii. The staff are incredibly friendly and helpful- nothing was an issue. We stayed in the one bedroom bungalow with two double beds and there was enough room for two friends to stay in one room comfortably. Free bikes and coffee were also a bonus. Forget the terrible soulless chain hotels- stay here instead!

We stayed in early Dec with my wife and 2 sons. Firstly Kenny at reception was so kind to upgrade us to 2 bedroom suite at minimal cost,He also helped when I need to keep some luggage at hotel while we visited a few other islands .Sai on the porter desk was also super helpful with anything we needed and I couldnt speak highly of all the other staff as someone who has worked in the tourism and hospitiality business for a long long time! Indeed the friendly service was way above what I was expecting,even from the amazing reviews in Trip Advisor,Also great restuarant with a delicious pasta and fab live music!Would definitely use again in a hearbeat if visitingHonolulu!

I loved the hotel from the first moment to the last. From the specialty coffee, to the decor, the staff, amenities and location. I'm off to big island today and I can't imagine my next hotel living up to Surfjack. Coffee - being Australian - I love my coffee. Sorted. Great coffee at Olive and Oliver. Rooms - small but very clean and stylish. It's classy to go to a hotel with free hanging hangers and a hairdryer not attached to the wall! Comfortable and beautifully serviced. I was impressed with the two free bottles of water per day included in the amenity fee. As well as welcome snacks (including locally made taro root chips which I now love!) Note that these are a welcome pack and not an everyday pack. Decor - I took many photos because I plan to steal their ideas. I love mid century modern. Clearly the designers respected the origins of the building and worked with it and not against it. Last night when I passed a duo playing bossa nova at the restaurant- I felt as though my MCM dreams were coming true - I may or may have not time-travelled back to the 60s - I can't be sure. (Please note time travel is not offered to all guests ;-). Pool/lounge - great to hang out in. Lovely setting with my favourite Elephant Ear taro plants. Knowing that Michelle and Barack Obama had eaten there the week before did give it that added sparkle. I walked the same steps they walked. Whenever I told locals I was staying at the Surfjack - everyone knew it - they do cool things there... the list goes on. I do suspect it's the coolest hotel in Waikiki. Location - close to the canal, the beach and high end shopping. Loved the location. In the thick of it without being in shopping central which I wouldn't have liked. Staff - I've left the staff till last because they were the best. Every person I met was fun, helpful, informative and nice without being "too nice" if you know what I mean. Other stuff: we borrowed the bikes a few times - available in three hour slots which was most helpful. I suspect that when word gets round this place will be hard to book. Thanks Surfjack!!!

I never take the time to fill out surveys or write reviews. But the surfjack staff really knocked it out of the park.Our stay was full of pleasant surprises. Upon check in I mentioned that we were celebrating my girlfriends birthday.They sent a special treat up to the room - without even being asked - free of charge.They had upgraded us from a regular bedroom to a 1bd suite - without being asked - free of charge (2 TVs! one tv in the living area to watch while we painted our nails before dinner...and one in the bedroom to watch while we ate candy and fell asleep - awesome.)Our dinner at their restaurant was accompanied by live soul/jazz singer Maryanne Ito.Next morning, we received fresh cups of Kona coffee delivered to our room while still in our pajamas. Also free, included with our stay.We went down to their restaurant for breakfast and grabbed a complimentary Sunday paper and did crosswords by the pool while sipping a Bloody Mary. A perfect morning.They gladly accommodated my request for a late check-out, and then even stored our luggage for us so we could go for a bike ride on their beach cruisers, and follow the "mid-century architectural tour of Waikiki" route map found in each room.I'm not even going to start on the gorgeous room or the delicious food we ate during our stay. Suffice to say every detail of this place is very considered - and will delight you. (Davines® organic shampoo and lotion in the bathrooms? made with carrot, arugula, and milk thistle? of course)To be honest even though WE LIVE IN HONOLULU we have found an excuse to come back - they have a Pau Hana happy hour, pizza and two beers for $20 (and their pizza is surprisingly good) - where we hope to catch one of their screenings of old movies above the pool.I love you surfjack!

excellent value.......location......friendly staff. The food was excellent with very helpful room service.Rumor had it Pres. Obama had just dined there with friends.......We plan to stay there again as we visit family.

Loved our stay at the surfjack. Went for a week in late January for our honeymoon. You can tell the building itself is old and has been spruced up, but the rooms feel modern and clean. Live music every night at the restaurant that you can enjoy from your balcony if you overlook the pool, friendly accommodating staff, and great location for walking around Waikiki or driving out to explore the rest of the island. Would definitely stay again.

We stayed here in January 2017 with our family of 6 (4 kids) and we missed our stay so much!! Every staff member were always so friendly, happy and always so helpful!! The staff always made you feel at home and just like family! The vibe and ambience of the hotel is amazing! The rooms were always so clean, pool was perfect and elegant and the restaurant was amazing. This place is a perfect place for families or couples and will not disappoint anyone's stay! So close to Waikiki beach and the shops! Perfect all the way.....we miss you all so much. Mahalo

Great location, hotel, restaurant and room. Most of all the staff is exceptional and after only a few minutes you will feel like you are staying with family/friends not a hotel. You are close to all the upscale shopping and only a few blocks from the beach. Overall you will not regret this choice.

Over pricedAwful accommodationIt was like sleeping in a kitchen because there was a stove and a sink and refrigerator in the room which had not been requested.It was nothing like the photographs or the descriptions posted .It was noisy outside and inside from the aircon I am in the Sheraton which is $130 cheaper and has a view!!!I really made a mistake!

My husband and I stayed here on our honeymoon and we couldn't have picked a better spot! This staff goes out of it's way to make sure you are having the BEST experience. One day it rained and as we were walking out past the front desk, they stopped us to let us borrow an umbrella. Who does that!! The bartenders are great and we felt like we were leaving friends when we left. Even the woman who cleans your rooms greats in the morning if she sees you asking if you need anything extra and if your having a good stay. From check in experience to the amazing restaurant in the hotel, you don't really need anything else. Tips to make this hotel twice as amazing, take advantage of the hotels activities. There is a schedule of events you should look up before you come on the website and book. They are truly one of a kind experiences. If you want a bit more quiet ask for a room not facing the pool, however we enjoyed the light music in the drifting in every night. The pool is adorable and relaxing, go down for adult swim if you would like more privacy from the kidos. Take the bikes at the front out, and head down to the beach which is only a short few blocks away. You will not be disappointed staying here, the atmosphere and ambiance can't be topped.

Awesome place. Cool Hawaiian vibes but also very modern. Staff are the most attentive I have ever met. Great location less than 10 minute walk to the beach and the shopping centres. Highly recommend this place and will be back in a heart beat!

We came to this hotel just for one night and were about to move to the other hotel, but loved it so much that stayed whole week!We stayed in one bedroom suite. The room was new, very clean, decorated simply but cool. The staff was very nice and helpful. Avocado toast for breakfast was outstanding! I also loved that hotel has vintage bicycles which you can ride for 3 hours everyday (the only thing I missed was fitness center). What is more (it is non essential, but I really appreciated that) - the hotel cosmetics they use are very good. I know it's just a detail but I could not resist mentioning it - it was the first time I used hotel shampoo and conditioner instead of my own.And finally - the rates are best in town! It's not a resort where you can spend whole week doing nothing, but if you are looking just for a nice place to stay during your active vacation in Hawaii - I am pretty sure this is the best choice for you, compared to price and quality you get.

I stayed here for ten days over Christmas. I was impressed with the clean modern rooms that have the feel of a beach house. The staff were very friendly and went out of their way to ensure my needs were met.

I watched them remodel this small 112 room boutique over the last year. They opened I think back in April but you should always give staff a chance to get the wrinkles out. First the good stuff: mahina & sun's- the restaurant. Island grown or caught. Nice menu. Wine list lacks substance but I didn't come to drink alcohol anyway. They nightly offer different activities such as flower crown making or guest lectures. There is also live music in the restaurant/bar area. The pool is in the center and surprisingly not noisy even with kids. There is a communal sitting and work area in the back and a library type setting near the front. There is an espresso bar and a clothing shop as well. Most of the hotels charge a daily convenience fee so be prepared. At least you feel like you got something for it though. Now for the tweaking part: I had my bags brought to my room. The bellman should always show the guest how lights (not easy to figure out BTW) a/c tv etc work. It is valet parking only and the valet should always close your door. Never happened. This might sound "petty" but as a business traveler you just expect this. The rooms are nice but SMALL, I know you can pay more for a suite. Bathroom is nice. Housekeeping didn't seem to clean my room until late in the day but the day I was checking out knocked twice!!Give this hotel a try though I think it is worth it for at least once. If not more.

The Surfjack is a 60s style laid back boutique hotel with great people and very nice accommodations. We based our stay on listed reviews and were not disappointed!The decor is cool, the staff are friendly and helpful and the location in Waikiki is convenient and yet far enough away to be quiet and peaceful. While 60s in style it is up to date with fixtures and comforts. Among a terrific staff, one guy stands out as the "ambassador" for the Surfjack. Sia will greet you as you arrive, help you with luggage or anything else you need and his smile and personality light up the place! I would go back to the Surfjack just because of Sia and his colleagues!

Our teenage girls staye Iin a bungalow room and we stayed in adjacent 1 bedroom apartment. Loved everything about the hotel, cool vibe, great pool bar and restaurant, we enjoyed eating the fresh local produce for breakfast /lunch or dinner during our 2 week stay. All the staff are so friendly and helpful, special thank you to Sai at reception/valet and Krystal from reception, who looked after our every need , request or query ,The bar and cafe staff could have not been more friendly and always happy to give us great tips with exploring Waittiki, and North Shore. Could not recommend the Surfjac more, loved it was a boutique hotel, Location is wonderfull , quiet but so close to the shops , beach and bus stop right around the corner to go to most places. Loved every part of our stay ! Thanks to all the great staff at the Surfjac ! Darveniza Family

My girlfriend and I stayed here for 3 nights and our time was exceptional. This is a hotel not only perfectly positioned just off the main road in Waikiki but the people/staff operating this hotel understand the meaning of hospitality. We were upgraded to a suite and taken care of by Sai who ensured our experience was special. People like Sai are so important to a new establishment when it comes to making long lasting guests. The first room we were taken to was not prepared yet and instead of having us wait he upgraded up immediately to a suite. The food at the restaurant on the main floor was delicious and served up with a great atmosphere. The pool area durning the day entices you to never leave and soak up the sun! All in all, The Surfjack have raised the bar for my expectations for all hotels I visit--I cant wait to return!Thank you!

I spent 8 days at the Surfjack with my girlfriend in late November. Wonderful time, great hotel and restaurant. We both absolutely loved it. The hotel is modern, hip, clean and extremely friendly. The restaurant and bar are exceptional. Location is perfect-about 10 minute walk to the beach. The staff couldn't have been more accommodating. Without hesitation I will stay again on my next visit to Honolulu. Delightful place!

Great location, nice staff, very good and well decorated rooms. If you want something cooler and more modern, relaxed in the busy Waikiki area, this is the place. Just 2 blocks from the beach and from one of the nicest areas in Waikiki, full of restaurants and shops, all walking distance.

What a great place! We could not have enjoyed our stay here more.The staff is tremendous, they are on top of every detail. The hotel has a crazy cool 50's vibe that is beautifully rendered. The art, fixtures, pool add to the wonderful ambience.We had breakfast and dinner at the hotel's restaurant Mahina Suns. What a terrific place great food and ambiance! I enjoyed getting a mug of complimentary tea in the morning and reading the paper by the pool.We were lucky to catch some great live music in the evenings. This is a new property and with that was even more impressed. I stayed in both the two bedroom and three bedroom suites. They were both welcoming and beautifully done in the same charming 50's vibe and both had balconies. Great beds and comfortable fold out couch.The hotel is a convenient walk to the beach and lots of great restaurants. The valet service was a big plus!

We have just returned from 2 weeks in Waikiki, staying the first 5 nights in average airbnb property and then moving to the Surf Jack for the last 9 nights! Wow, what a gorgeous hotel. From the moment you walk into the reception and the smell of frangipani hits you to when you sadly leave reception, nothing is too much trouble.We had a generously sized 2 bedroom suite which although situated on the corner of the building roadside, was still relatively quiet in a very busy, noisy city. It was beautifully appointed with original artworks and very comfortable beds. Plenty of drawers, wardrobe space etc.Restaurant was gorgeous, and our kids were completely addicted to Sean the Chef's banana bread for breakfast!Great location and was really nice not to be in one of those monstrosities on the main drag. Why would you stay in an aging and overpopulated Sheraton when you could stay here?! :)Thanks to the whole Surf Jack team and a special aloha to Si from NZ!

We stayed here for a business trip. We loved it so much and plan to come back. Everything was excellent about this place. We ate at the restaurant, drank the delcious one and only surfjack coffee, enjoyed all the little extras they put into this place! Thank you to all the surfjack employees for making such a special place in Waikiki for your guests!

Nice little hotel. Mahina and Sun's was excellent for breakfast and dinner. Great staff at both hotel and restaurant. Nice retro feel for hotel. Was an old hotel in a convenient but a little off main drag area. Great service, easy in and out and affordable for Hawaii. Great service with amenities at your request but they are not pushy. I like how hotel and restaurant both connect with local artist and farmers. I would definitely stay there again. Obama and Mark Zuckerberg ate at Mahina and son's a couple days before us.

The Surfjack and its staff is a wonderful creation perfectly situated in the Wakiki area. Just a few blocks from the beach and walking distance to most locations. Wears and friends staff that went out of their way to make sure our stay was perfect. Traveling with small children can be a hassle when you stay in 'grown up' places but not here. Kenny in the reception arranged an alertly check in when we arrived in the morning with a smile. The quality of the food in the restaurant was very high. The bar served great cocktails and guests enjoy free coffee trough out the day. The small pool was a bit chilly but was perfect for a short swim before or after a busy Oahu day. It's not a bargain, room prices are ok but you have to take in to account daily service charges and valet parking if you have a car. But overall very good value for money. We will for sure come back to this lovely place!!

We loved our time at the Surfjack and would definitely return. The fit out is super cool and the hotel showcases local artists and collaborators. The customer service is fantastic and the staff are extremely helpful and very friendly. We were sad to say goodbye. My Mum, sister and I stayed in 2 bedroom suite which overall was suitable. The only negative was that the bathroom was slightly too small for the 3 of us, however we managed. The hotel is a couple of streets back from the main street of Waikiki (Kalakaua Ave) which was nice. Definitely the place to stay in Waikiki if you're looking for something with style and substance.

WOW - this is the coolest hotel! It was our first time visiting Hawaii and were really careful about getting the right experience with our stay. This hotel combines the traditional feel of Waikiki (at least what I've seen in the movies) with a very cool contemporary twist that makes you feel welcomed as an honorary local. The staff were fantastic from the start and very helpful with big smiles all around. The on-site coffee shop and restaurant were also a welcome treat. The pool area is the heart of the hotel and we could see it from our deck above. I guess they host pop up shops or events too because there was always something happening around the poolside lobby. We decided to spring for a one bedroom suite which had corner views of the city. The bathroom was nice, but hard to get into when you had the bar closet open - you had to close one to open the other. It felt like our very own apartment and I was ready to move in! There was cool art and surf mags laying around which made it feel like a home. It was walking distance to it all with a cool (and colorful) bar next door. My girlfriend was so sad when we had to leave but I know we will return! A MUST STAY!

Truly amazing hotel, rooms, amenities and staff!!! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay, so much so that we extended our stay by a day. It was such a fresh breath of relief, as we had found your hotel and chosen to stay there only after a (very-late first-night into Hawaii flight) horror one-night stay at the Hilton Hawaiian Centre Resort and just had to leave there because of the atrocious service we received there, (plus it was just so hectic and dated!). A totally unexpected hotel room upgrade for our stay at Surfjack (plus a bit of time by the pool, local shopping and sightseeing helped to recover our Hawaiian getaway into the paradise that we had sought after! We will be sending friends and family to Surfjack when they are travelling to Hawaii!

I stayed at the Surfjack for my friends bachlorette weekend. I booked a three bedroom suite but upon arrival was told there were no available so we got a two bedroom suite and one standard room. We all wanted to stay together so that was disappointing. They didn't even offer an apology for the three bedroom suite not being available they just acted like it didn't matter we only had the two bedroom and standard room. The pool is SMALL and it was super crowded when we got there. There was a DJ playing really loud music it was not at all a relaxing environment. The location is a bit weird as well it was a good walk to the beach. Overall its a cool style but I the service disappointing. I wouldn't stay here again.

I would definitely stay here again if/when I come back to Honolulu - it is a lovely low rise hotel and really nice atmosphere in the bar restaurant area. The rooms were beautiful and very clean. The little shop is also really cute. Free coffee every morning was really good and everything we ate at the restaurant was delicious. All the staff were really friendly and helpful.

We loved our stay at the Surf Jack and can't wait to come back. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly, the food and drinks were great, and the room was awesome. It felt like a stylish apartment. We loved that the room included a list of the hotel's contributing artists and a mid century self guided tour map.

This is for sure the place to stay in Honolulu! We transferred here from the Aqua Palms which was disappointing and comparable in price. Our first night we shared with Obama who had organised a dinner there--this definitely boded well for the place! What I loved most about this place was the cheeriness, patience and attentiveness of the staff--both at the hotel and restaurant. We have a very active 16-month old (Emily) who is always getting into everything and the staff were absolutely wonderful with her--Sai, Benjamin, Robbie--and others. Thank you! Great place to spend new year's--if I ever come back to Honolulu, it will only be to stay here. I can't say enough about this great place. It made our holiday--food, pool, location, bikes, all fantastic!

Stayed here for 6 days over New Years. This is a new boutique hotel owned by the aqua hotels chain. A special oasis 10 mins stroll from the beach. It has a lovely pool, beautiful lobby and fantastic restaurant in house. In fact, Obama ate there the same night we checked in. The hotel staff are lovely and friendly. Robbie, the manager was extremely helpful and Sai was one of the highlights of our stay. The rooms are uniquely decorated with large bathrooms and the whole place smells like orchids. Our only complaint is that the walls are poorly insulated as this is a renovated old building and accordingly, the sound is easily heard from adjacent rooms. There were two babies in the room next to us and we were welcomed to the sounds of screams throughout the night and morning (and I sleep with earplugs). While I cannot blame the children this was somewhat of a surprise as we travel once per month and have never had this occur before. However, the staff moved us rooms and we were thereafter so happy that we extended our stay by 2 extra nights. Most of the time there were few to no kids in the hotel and the place was more directed to adults only. In this regard, the hotel would do well to simply convert into adults only as even one screamer ruins a lovely chill pool day. Overall we loved this place and would return anytime (with fingers crossed that the pool and adjoining rooms would be child free so the vintage Hawaiian beach atmosphere could be experienced at its best).
user_name:
happydancer85
New York City, New York

review_body: Our stay at the Surfjack and Swim Club Hotel was simply amazing !!! What stood out most, is that from the moment we arrived, every member of the team showed and shared this enormously positive vibe and hospitality just seems to come naturally. Sai, Robbie, Kenny, Khrystal and Benjamin at the front desk are always up for a chat, with smiles all around and always ready to help or give some local advice. Our check-in coincided with a private dinner that the Obamas (OMG!) hosted there. Lots of security measures obviously, yet the place kept on running quite efficiently. Especially during hectic times like that, you could see that the team rallies together and around the GM Lynette, who stayed surprisingly levelheaded and upbeat during the whole process. We found the rooms tastefully decorated in a fresh and understated style. The bathrooms and showers are clean, spacious and have a great selection of soaps and shampoo. We also had the good fortune to stay at one of the suites on the 10th floor that have a private deck with wonderful views of both the ocean and the mountains. Dinner at Mahini and Sun's is excellent (of course, since even the president took his wife and friends to dinner there) and has a menu packed with locally sourced and organic ingredients. We loved the mahi mahi, the pizza, and the guys at the bar made this wonderful Agricola rum, ginger and lime cocktail that's off the menu. For breakfast the waffle with malted caramel, and the pork adobo stand out as clear winners. We decided to celebrate New Years there too, and they hosted a very lively party!A fresh pot of complementary coffee stands on the bar in the morning making it easy to sit down around the pool, or cabana area and slowly wake up to another beautiful Honolulu morning. Restaurants and shops are conveniently close by, and the beach is within easy reach with a short stroll ...or borrow the hotel bikes; a lot of fun too. In conclusion, we had a fabulous and relaxing stay through New Years at the Surfjack and Swim Club. Thank you and Mahalo for making this easily our best boutique hotel holiday experience. We look forward catching up soon and cannot wait for our next trip to Oahu.

Pleasantly surprised with Surf Jack! Beautiful modern property. Location was a few blocks from beach and was perfect with two bedrooms. 3 children and 2 adults stayed. Obama happen to have dinner at the small restaurant the day we were staying.

We chose this small, more urban, hipster sounding hotel because we thought it would appeal to our millennial son. We've all stayed in too many big resorts and wanted more of an urban experience. We had 2 really nice spacious rooms to lounge in, balconies with fun views, and both our son and his parents really loved our stay there. The Surfjack crew are really happy, and carry out that 'aloha' promise really well. After the hustle of Waikiki shopping malls, it was just delightful to feel so welcomed there.

If you could put all the amazing parts of hotels that you have previously stayed and put it into one hotel. It is the hotel is cool, beautiful, happening, elegant and family. There isn't a thing I would change about our experience at the Surfjack. We only stayed one night before we flew out but this hotel has something special. Do yourself a favor and find out by staying here.

From the moment we arrived I was very impressed with the welcome I received. This place was amazing the stuff were very helpful as I was traveling with 3 kids felt like I was home . The cleanness of the was up to my standards loved everything about surfjack would definitely recommend it to others and will return to stay at the surfjack again hoping soon

Front desk staff is outstanding here, especially Jordyn. She was extremely helpful when I arrived in the morning after a brutal redeye flight. She was understanding and accomodating. She arranged a room to be ready hours before the normal check-in time. This was a lifesavor.This is excellent service. Overall, the hotel is a solid refurbished old hotel made to be hip Hawaiian. The rooms are solid, but the staff and the music selection by the pool were tops in my opinion.Location is good for the price.I will be staying there again and recommending it to my friends and colleagues as well; especially if they happen to book a brutal redeye flight :-)Cheers!Anthony San Diego, CA USA

Our airbnb house fell through at the last minute and we're so glad we found this little gem. The staff were all so amazing, especially Kenny at the front desk, Sai the baby whisperer and Virginia our house keeper. The restaurant is on island time with serving, but the food made it worth the wait ;)Will be back soon!

After staying at The Surfjack with my boyfriend for 3 nights, we immediately decided that every time we come to Oahu, we are only staying at this beautiful hotel. We were instantly made to feel like we were at home by the incredibly friendly staff. Much mahalos to Sai -- when you visit please chat with him! He's like you're favorite Hawaiian uncle who is always happy to help. Complimentary Surfjack coffee was delivered fresh to our room every morning as we woke up to the subtle trade winds entering through our patio door. I absolutely love the vibe and design of this hotel. We spent many sunny afternoons lounging poolside and sipping on every tropical cocktail Mahina and Suns would serve us -- they were all delicious, but the Maui Mule was my absolute favorite. Warning: If you stay here, you won't want to leave! Why would you? It has everything you need and more.

Stayed at the Surfjack for three nights over the New Year's weekend. From the first time I called to get information about the hotel I was impressed by the amazing customer service.It only got better once we arrived. We traveled with our adult children and booked a three bedroom suite. My 20 something year old kids loved the vibe of the hotel from the first minute they saw it. The restaurant was excellent too. We had dinner there and enjoyed the hotel's New Year's party! Would definitely stay here again. The location was perfect, close enough to everything, yet still somewhat removed from the craziness of Waikiki.
user_name:
mkostoulas
New York City, New York

review_body: My family of 6 stayed at this great hotel from Dec 24, 2016 for 8 days and we really enjoyed the place, we stayed in a 2 bedroom suite on the fifth floor and we took the stairs most of the time to burn some of the calories, great location, great staff all around, rooms were clean. One of the owners gave our family freshly baked sconces which we really enjoyed, very friendly and family oriented hotel, President Obama and Michelle had dinner at the hotel while we were there because the chef at the hotel restaurant used to be his chef and we got a glimpse of them. We love, love the blankets in our room. In all we had a great time at this hotel and walking distance to everything including the Marukame Udon Japanese Noodles restaurant, a must visit restaurant, don't get discouraged with the line outside, it is worth it and reasonable priced and freshThe 2 bedroom suite that we got was just a bit small for our family of 6 but we managed it, would have been better with 2 bathrooms instead on 1 bathroom. No gym at this hotel. The $25.00 per day hotel / resort fee, though they gave us a $10.00 reduction per day when we asked for a discount.

This property is not new but the 2016 remodel makes everything as good as new or even better. To call it a facelift is an understatement. The vibe is tropical and the people are calling you by name from day one until you check out. It's the small size that also makes it so accessible. We never waited an entire minute for an elevator so getting to the 9th floor was always easy. This compares very favorably with the major properties along the beach. The room had the picture-perfect view of the pool. The bedding and all of the fixtures are new and modern while the decor is throw-back to the golden age of Waikiki. I felt that it was a good value proposition to move a few blocks back from the beach as we were interested in the college @ Manoa on this trip. The surf, meanwhile, is a short walk from any hotel though ocean front is always best for sunsets. I'd stay at the 'Jack again.

The Mina's..........We stayed at the Surfjack from the 19/12/2016 for 2 weeks and we were a family of 6 who stayed in a 3 bedroom suite (interconnecting rooms) travelling from Sydney Australia we all absolutely enjoyed our stay there and would be our first choice when we return in the near future. All of the staff were amazing, very prompt and so welcoming, they made us feel at home and very comfortable. Always interested in our plans for the day and evening and would give us suggestions for places to see. The rooms are very inviting. The beds very comfortable and the blackout drapes were a bonus, the kids would sleep in longer allowing us to do so as well. The one thing that always is a problem for me is cockroaches or insects and I did not see any at ALL at the Surfjack, not even on the balconies and that made my stay so much more comfortable. There was also a few cabanas overlooking the pool that we were able to utilise and entertain a couple of our friends whom we were travelling with at the time. Virginia our main house keeper was lovely and always stocked our rooms with plenty of necessities. During our stay we had a few very special visitors dining at their Mahini & Sons restaurant, yes President Obama, his wife Michelle and Mark Zuckerberg, this was an exceptional bonus and amazing experience. I really don't know what else to say but if ever you are thinking of going to Waikiki, I highly recommend the The Surfjack. Kids had a ball in the pool during the their allocated swimming times. The idea of allocating a specific swimming time frame for the kids is an excellent idea because it gives the adults the opportunity to swim at a time where their is less noise if that is their preference. Coffee is fantastic. We left early this morning and I have to say we had tears in our eyes. A special shout out to Sai and Kenny for their continuous help in everything we asked or didn't ask. We will miss Waikiki and miss you all dearly.

Great new remodeled Miami themed hotel. Amazing coffee bar and restaurant located in hotel as well. Staff extremely helpful and friendly. I will only stay here in future visits to Honolulu. This hotel would feel at home in either south beach or Brooklyn. I strongly recommend staying at this hotel

My husband booked the one bedroom suite, and I am glad he did. I think if the space had been smaller, we might not have had room for our three suitcases and set of golf clubs. It was great to have a suite with a separate sitting area with a couch, coffee table, television, chest of drawers,closets, frig, and safe. It was especially helpful to have two free bottles of drinking water in our refrigerator everyday, as well as snacks upon arrival. My husband also appreciated the free cup of morning coffee and the daily newspaper. The beds were comfy, and I am picky about my pillows, but they were just soft enough for me. At first, I had a little difficulty figuring out how to make the water hotter for my showers, but after two times, I soon figured out how to adjust the temp...a little tricky. The light switches were kind of unusual too, but we soon learned which switches turned on particular lamps. (We must sound like two hicks from the country...LOL, but we were just a little baffled by the switches at first.) A light bulb was burned out when we arrived, but the maintenance personnel was very friendly and acted quickly to replace it. All of the housekeeping staff were excellent and made sure we had lots of clean towels throughout our stay. We had read to reserve a room on a higher level, and that was good advice, because it might have been too noisy to have a room directly over the pool area. Our room was on the ninth floor and was quiet, and we were able to sleep well at night. We were pleasantly surprised at the quickness and availability of the elevators; we never really had to wait for one, which was nice. The lobby was very inviting, and there was always some type of entertainment at night. We ate breakfast three times at the small restaurant in the lobby, and each time, we felt the menu was rather limited, and the service was extremely slow. We liked the casual, old Hawaii vibe and decorations of the hotel, and especially the fragrant, floral scent that always wafted through the lobby. The front staff was friendly and helpful, and were always quick to give us our complimentary towels as we headed out to the beach each day. My favorite spot on Waikiki Beach has always been directly across from McDonalds (In past years, I went there as a UH student.), so the walk from the Surfjack was a little longer. That was not really a problem, since it gave us a chance to work off extra calories. Make sure to try the Siam Square Thai restaurant next door to the hotel above the ABC store; the food was excellent with generous portions. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the Surfjack and would recommend it to other travellers.

Highly recommend staying at the SurfJack. We are a family of 5 that stayed in a 2 BR apartment. The hotel has been tastefully refurbished into a boutique and hip hotel with a Hawaiin feel. The rooms are excellent, modern and clean and the beds really comfy. The staff are really friendly and the restaurant Mahini and Sons is excellent. Really good free coffee and tea each morning even if you don't want to eat at Mahini. There is excellent coffee at Oliver and Olive attached to the hotel.

Small and welcoming boutique feel with styled quality finishes.Collaborative designs re-creating the golden era of Waikiki surf stays. I just loved it.Genuinely invested staff. Nothing is too much.We will return. Great.

Stopped by to shop at the store in the lobby and have a delicious coffee. Lobby has a great vibe. Sat at a table by the pool. Really enjoyed it. Try Lemona shaved ice at 421 Lewers as well. Delicious!

Wonderful stay - was there for 4 nights. Small set up but very personable and friendly front line staff. Breakfast at Mahina and Sons was awesome ! Clean comfortable room with nice toiletries. But more importantly, the staff is especially wonderful. Look out for this nice gentleman called Sai. He was wonderful to my kids who needed help.

First of all - let me say that this hotel far exceeded my expectations in every single possible way. From the photos - it looked cute - but when we walked in - we were blown away at the attention to design details. When we checked into our room - we were delightfully surprised at the size of the room, the cleanliness, the design elements, the comfortable bed, and the amenities. The location is wonderful - allowing easy access to Waikiki and main roads to get out of town. The restaurant, Mahina and Sons was very delicious - and the staff was friendly and efficient. Every day started with a stop at the coffee counter inside of Olive and Oliver (the cutest hotel boutique EVER) for a delicious (and well priced) cold brew. And I love how open aired the entire property was always allowing for the island breeze to flow through hallways and public spaces. The front staff was extremely friendly and helpful - especially Crystle who checked us in. She invited us to sit in the lobby and she came to us to finish the check in process. Sai - who greets you upon entry and can assist was luggage, cabs, valet, etc - was so charming and friendly - everyday he just was a pure reflection of the aloha spirit. And our housekeeper Imelda wrote little notes every day which was so sweet and thoughtful. All in all - I cannot say enough about this hotel. I've found my new home away from home in Hawaii - and can't wait until my next visit.

Our family of 6 were very comfortable in a 3 bedroom apartment in room 235/236 which is a interconnecting 1 bedroom and 2 bedroom. Room with 2 double beds, king bed and queen. We loved being on a lower floor could just walk up one flight of stairs . Being a corner apartment we had table and chairs we could sit on over looking pool. Quiet rooms and whole family (14, 16 ,18 and 19 years old)enjoyed hip low key atmosphere away from hustle and bustle. Pool very peaceful to sit around and complimentary coffee was certainly a bonus. Shops, restaurants and beach so close so its no problem staying a couple of blocks away. Food great. Staff fantastic and helpful with coeliac daughter and dietary requirements. Only issue was lights coming on randomly in the middle of night but I am sure they sorted that out. Our last night we enjoyed pilates on the top floor which was a treat.We all cant wait to come back!

Awesome hotel and restaurant staff, very welcoming, much better and personal feel than the giant hotels I've stayed at in the past. Beds were very comfortable, and the room had an "at-home" feeling. Restaurant had amazing food, and a lot of it was of the local/authentic type, very good!

Pros: The hotel has got a very good vibe. The rooms are big and tastefully decorated. It is very near to the seaside and all the major shops. The staff is very friendly and attentive.Cons: We couldn't use the pool as it was taken by small children. The room insulation was not very good so had to wear earplugs in the night. There is an extra $25pp hotel fee which is for extra water, newspaper etc which should be free in my opinion.

The Surfjack is an older hotel which has been renovated recently. We stayed there for ten nights and the staff were wonderful. Sai on the front desk was sincerely warm and interested in our daily exploits. Only a short walk to the beach, it was easy to get to everything from there and away from the real hustle and bustle close to Waikiki Beach. Travelling with teenage children, we had a two bedroom place. The bedrooms were small but the beds were really comfortable. There was often someone singing in the evening but not so late or loud that it disturbs your sleep if you go to bed earlier. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and would go back.

Hotel was nice and the staff was great but the view from our balcony faced what looked like public housing and the alleys had homeless people fighting in the middle of the night...no sleep at all. If all you need is a room for the night it's not a bad place but don't plan on getting any rest. Construction starts at 6am across the street.

Check out the bar and enjoy boiled peanuts and uncle's punch. The swimming pool is fantastic, good for a quick dip before venturing out. We had a disability access room on the 9th floor, so our room door had an automatic open/close functioning. It was a little odd but good to have for those who can be helped by it. Just no quick escapes from this room, that's all :). The room was a little tight itself, but large bathroom, new and modern finishes, and great balcony for viewing down to the pool.

Fun place for people like me who hate big resorts but still want a hotel and not an AirBnB. Rooms are somewhat small but expected to be in a city. Food and bar were great and lots of options within walking distance or a cheap Uber.

I previously stayed in a private condo, the price per night wasn't that much higher and i think i would in the future go with the Surfjack - very good service to customer (free coffee, towel service also for the beach, room amenities) and with discounted rates at a very reasonable price. I don't think i'd do it for the regular price though. Location very central, got a room upgrade to a 1 br suite, which was surprisingly big and comfortable as well. Employees very attentive and dedicated to customer service.

We stayed here for 5 nights. I had booked a bungalow room but wanted to guarantee that we got at least a queen size bed so upgraded to a one bedroom suite. I'm glad we followed Jordyn's advice and did that. Our room on the 7th floor overlooked the pool. and had a good sized bedroom, living room with huge tv, fridge, dresser with drawers, another closed and a small bathroom with a heavenly shower with two spray heads. Also a nice sized lanai with sliders from the living room and bedroom, small table and 2 chairs. We got free coffee in the lobby (see my review of Mahina and Sun's for more about them).The decor at this hotel is cool, kind of retro and our room was reminiscent of a beach house with bead board, cool tiled floor and bamboo ceiling. Beautiful art work and beach/surf decor throughout the hotel. It's a short walk to the beach and shopping. The BEST thing about this hotel is the people. They are so genuinely kind, helpful and made this place stand out for us. You won't be disappointed staying here!

good hotel, good price, good location, not far from Waikiki in Honolulu good by expensive breakfest, good quality of internet,little room, good shower, good cosmetic in bathroompossibility to walkhelpfull personal, good servicefree water in room

The Surfjack Hotel and Swim Club is one of the best boutique hotels in which my wife and I have ever stayed. The affordability, design, customer service, food, pool and bar are all absolutely stellar.

Really nice hotel a few blocks back from Waikiki Beach, but an easy walk. Very convenient to beaches and shopping. Best surprise was the bar and restaurant in the hotel. Really nice food and drinks. Great they showed the '60's surf movie "The Endless Summer" on the screen over the pool and adjacent to the bar.The availability of coffee at the bar in the morning is a nice touch.The staff were wonderful, helpful and friendly.

I wasn't to sure what to expect when having booked here as it being quite a new hotel. This fully renovated hotel was simply great, we had booked the 2 bedroom bungalow and found it suited our needs. I loved the water pressure as a lot of hotels have such bad water pressure. The music that was played each night was just great as well as the big screen movies. The food was just so nice in the restaurant, and took advantage of the $10.00 daily credit. I think what is a great credit to this hotel is the excellent staff, they went over and above to help with any issues that arose. Big thanks to Phil for helping me with my shoes and also Jordyn for all her help. I think the only downside is that as it's quite centrally located it's quite noisy. I think that you have this problem anywhere that you stay in Waikiki. I would definitely go back and stay again and I know that I'd be welcomed back with open arms.

We couldn't have picked a better place to celebrate our 3 year anniversary! The staff was the friendliest and most helpful staff I've ever encountered, and the space itself boasts this energetic and trendy atmosphere. We received a complimentary bottle of champagne to put our stay over the top! We'll be back without a doubt.

Surfjack was our oasis and we looked forward to returning to the hotel every evening after exploring Honolulu. We enjoyed listening to the live music in the lobby every evening while we relaxed with a nice glass of wine. The restaurant food was amazing. The staff took very good care of us. The rooms were clean, smelled nice and the beds were comfy. We had a wonderful time and would recommend this hotel.

We had a great stay for what was a pleasure trip with many other couples. All of whom stayed in other hotels. We feel we selected the best one of the group with the Surfjack. Staff is very accommodating and helpful. We changed rooms twice as more of our family members arrived over our stay and they were very helpful in making that transition smooth. Location is a few blocks off the beach but the walk was very easy and through interesting parts of town. We used the hotel bikes one day to ride to a more secluded beach.

*I say hipster paradise in the very best possible way. It's a mid-century property updated with thoughtful details and carefully curated design elements. If you're a fan of HGTV, this might be the place for you! But comfort is not sacrificed to design. It's a very gracious and unpretentious place. *Great location: walking to the Waikiki strip and beaches. Mahina & Sun's has great drinks and breakfast (that fried rice tho!). Didn't have dinner personally, but the Margherita pizza looked and smelled amazing. *Staff was friendly and attentive in a low-key, unobtrusive way. Serious Island hospitality. *HAVE to mention the smell: SO. GOOD.I recommend this for anyone who wants a lovely Waikiki getaway

Sometimes hotels will the cool factor have an aloof staff. Surfjack had all the hipness and current styling throughout the hotel and into our suite. The cuisine at Mahina and Suns was some of the best we had on the island. We were impressed by the quiet atmosphere of our room during the weekend nights while the pool and restaurant area were bustling. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Waikiki.

This is a hip hotel with a friendly staff. However, it is new and they are working out the bugs. The lighting turned off and on randomly, enough to wake me up in the night. The door was not fit properly so it let in lots of noise.

I love the 60's surfer retro vibe. Our breakfast and dinner was Pacific fusion at it's most tasty. Our one bedroom suite was decorated retro surfer style - so comfortable. Our number one favorite part of our stay was the extraordinary friendliness of the staff - especially the manager and bartender. We cone to Honolulu a lot - this hotel is our new favorite go to Wakiki hotel

This place is unique. It does not feel like you are in a city. Relaxed staff that provide top notch service. Rooms are very nice and the property is convenient to beach, shopping, restaurants. I felt that it was a good value.

For me, the sign of a great hotel starts with the staff. Every person greeted you with a smile. Always helpful when asked for recommendations on where to eat, things to do. Location is perfect. Away from the busy tourist crowd, but just a few blocks away from the beach and place to eat. Room has a ceiling fan, which is an added plus for me as i am used to sleeping with a fan at home. Room can get icebox cold which makes my sleep 10x better. A special shoutout to Sai, who always greeted you with a smile and asking how your day is going. If i had a hotel to own, he would be the type of employee i would like running the show. I'm sorry i didn't have a chance to hang out at the bar there, but i was only staying for 2 nights. Would most certainly stay there again on my return visit to Waikiki. Top notch place to stay

We stayed at the Suarfjack Hotel for 4 nights and had such a wonderful experience. The rooms were charming, beautifully decorated, and clean. The restaurant at the hotel was very delicious! Special thank you to Sai and all the staff for being so helpful and welcoming. Sai always greeted us, answered our questions, and even surprised us with champagne upon learning it was my fiance's birthday. Thank you Suarfjack for a lovely time in Oahu — we already can’t wait to go back!

Seriously, this unique place blew me away! I live on the island of Oahu and my husband and I wanted a few days away for our 13 year anniversary. What a Cool and charming place tucked away in the heart of Honolulu. A must see and stay. Here are a few things that are burned in my memory: The outstanding customer service was off the charts! Greeted by all the staff with a comfortable "hello, how are you doing today?" And, then the delicious hot coffee served downstairs all morning long – bottomless cup of gold!! Tasted like I was drinking a French pressed coffee made just for me! And then the restaurant downstairs served a pizza called the naked pig... incredible goodness. We sat one evening and listened to live music, while watching a large screen show the latest super cool surf movie well enjoying our pizza and company. Then, our room!! Wow! The contemporary touches in each room including the bathroom made me feel like i never wanted to leave the room because it was so nice. Surfjack has the coolness factor going on with galore colors and sweet sights everywhere I looked. My husband and I felt the love and aloha that Surjack had to offer from the moment we got there!! We will be back!

We booked this hotel because of the reviews. Best hotel! Decor is fun and the service is the best! Huge mention to Sai! He made everything great for us! We had 21 family members flying in and he helped so much with everything! Would stay there again and would not stay anywhere else on Waikiki!

Love this place! The service was great and the staff was friendly and extremely helpful. The food at Mahina and Suns was delicious and inexpensive compared to other restaurants in the area. Very satisfied with the service at the restaurant. Special thanks to Kenny at the front desk for his professionalism and assistance during our stay. Will be back soon!!

Couldn't have asked for more got the price. Service was great, rooms were lovely and the bed was amazing!! Would definitely stay here again in Honolulu. Location was great too and despite being right in the action of Waikiki it was quiet at night in the room.

Friendly staff in a well maintained facility. Construction behind and around could be noticed when truck backup beeps started early in the morning. The $25 per day add on fee with a $10 daily credit to be used or lost at the restaurant - was just an add on cost, as we did not feel that the menu was as affordable as the room. $35 per day for parking was more than the cost of our rented car. Will use UBER next time.

Intensive research made me choose The Surfjack Hotel. Total chill, away from the busy shopping crowds but perfectly walkable to beach, restaurants, & luxury stores. Saying that, we ate at their hotel restaurant Mahina & Suns for Thanksgiving & a few times more for breakfast/lunch/dinner. Really good homemade style meals (ex. Pork adobo fried rice bowl, poke bowls). Live music at night! Service is impeccable for both hotel (front desk, bell service, housekeeping, engineering staff) & restaurant (excellent wait/bartenders)! Even the staff at Olive & Oliver - baristas & sales clerks were super helpful/friendly. As for the room, great clean beautiful design as they use furnishings/art work from local artisans. We got a free upgrade to a 1 bedroom suite, thanks to Robbie during our checkin. Amenities included water bottles in room, free use of bikes---I do wish they had a spot for a gym but it's Hawaii so best spent outdoors. Needless to say, we will be back!

Great service. Rooms better than expected, assistance from staff was second to none. Friendly family friendly hotel with se ute access, onsite valet parking and super friendly and helpful concierge serviceGreat restaurant attached Close to beach and international market place.Great value for money Highly recommended

The hotel is an old building that has been reno'd fantastically and is excellent in light of its construction room fantastic and good valueIt's funky and a great location reservation staff are excellent and small central pool is cool very retroRestaurant has so much potential but needs work - food quality not great and very carb and sugary- service does try but needs help. As a resident staying you very rarely get the opportunity for a table for a cocktail in the evening as it always booked out and they won't let you sit in the seats ....This place is cool and really good but could be great if you sort the breakfast, food and bar service out Sooo close guys keep going you will get there just needs a few tweaks

We initially had reservation with another hotel but we had some problem after checking in (around 11pm) and decided to stay at another hotel, which was the surfjack hotel. Although it was past midnight, a front desk staff name Chris was extremely friendly and helpful. He provided a very clean and nice room. Also, other staffs were very friendly ad well. Considering the price compared to other nearby hotels, the surfjack hotel is very affordable and has surpasses our expectation. Definitely recommend and will come back here when i visit hawaii next time again.

The surfjack was great, the rooms were nice and the staff were excellent. Special mention to Kenny who went the extra mile to make sure we were satisfied. Would definitely stay here again. The restaurant is very popular so make sure you book in advanced.

This hotel has been recently renovated. We were a group of 6 plus a baby, so we staid in a 3 bedroom suite. The style/theming of the decor is very nice - very beachy vibe. The staff are all very friendly, especially the valet guys.The location is excellent - you are minutes away from various shopping places, restaurants, and the beach. Also not a far drive to the airport. But you are also just enough off the main strip that its more quiet here, which is nice.We did have a few minor issues, so i will point them out here, but that said, i would stay at this hotel again if I ever go back to Honolulu:Not all of the power outlets worked (which made charging the phones, etc a pain)Of the 3 rooms, only 2 had tvs in them (to be fair, they also had a sitting room with a couch and that room had a third tv)The overhead light in our bedroom would randomly turn itself off and on at ALL hours of the day and night (ghost? lol)Two of the rooms are adjoined, which meant that one couple would have to walk through another couple's room to get to their own room.One of the lights in the bathroom was burnt out, we requested a new bulb but never got one.very unclear about the breakfast rules - first few days the staff said the breads/muffins were complimentary, then last few days we were told we had to pay.Had a sit down breakfast once and only once at the hotel and even though there were only 2 other tables which had already been served, it took about an hour for our food to arrive. The waitress was apologetic. But due to that issue we never dined there again.Again, the above grievances are just nit-picking, and they wouldn't effect whether or not I return to the hotel.

The Surfjack is a beautifully designed hotel that made us feel comfortable and appreciated as soon as we pulled up. The retro-modern design invited us to relax in every area. The breakfasts are the best in Waikiki. Our room was beautifully designed. We decided to have our wedding at the Surfjack because of it's unique ambiance. Our guest absolutely loved every aspect of the wedding. I recommend this hotel to everyone, whether it is to relax, or have a party. Service was excellent. Workers, from maintenance to management were very courteous and helpful. This hotel stands with the best in Waikiki, at a more affordable rate. I recommend you stop by the place and see for yourselves.

The Surfjack made our visit to Honolulu the best! We were welcomed into the hotel from the moment we stepped out of our car. The staff was professional, but at the same time, made us feel like old friends. Benjamin, Kenny, Sai and Dexter all managed to do something for us throughout our trip to make us feel special. We can't say enough. We were pleased with our beautifully designed and relaxing room. The decor was fun and everything was very clean. The bed was super comfortable. The morning coffee - the restaurant - delicious! We would highly recommend this hotel!Joi & Lucy

We loved the vibe of this place. It's an old motel that's been renovated with an eclectic, luxe retro style. Very cool. The pool in the middle of the hotel is great! Was really nice just laying around with a beer. Only problem is there was no sun in the afternoon so it got quite chilly. The rooms were very cool looking and the finishes were great but the beds were pretty average. We had two doubles so we had to sleep seperate as my husband is fairly tall.The cafe on site looked amazing and we had a drink there one night and breakfast one morning. You get free filtered coffee or tea each day when you come down which is a nice touch (but I'd prefer the facilities in my room). The location is a little bit of the rougher side, but not too bad. For the price it's so worth it and walking distance to all the best spots for dinner (little bit further to the beach though).The staff were great! They seemed to actually recognise you which was really nice :P

What a welcoming, hospitable place. Excellent service, top flight restaurant, great entertainment nightly! Funky mid-century modern hotel off the beach. I'd return just to spend time here. I highly recommend it!

This review is long overdue.This Surfjack Hotel is the definition of cool.We've traveled to Oahu close to 10 times now and have stayed at the high end resorts on the beach, both Hyatts, Renew and Vive, just to name a few. This by far is our favorite place.My wife and I showed up without a reservation after a long flight from New Jersey on Sat Sept. 24th. We were greeted by Robbie at the front desk and asked about rates and availability. He was extremely friendly and welcoming. He allowed us to see the room which gave us a chance to absorb the Aloha Vibe the Surfjack was giving off. We quickly booked a 9 night stay and could not have been happier with our decision. The entire staff was genuinely and sincerely friendly, no phony pre-programmed greetings. I can't say enough good things about the staff. They are just wonderful people with Aloha spirit. My compliments to whomever is doing the hiring.It's rare that a hotel restaurant has really good food, most of the time it's just convenient. Not Mahina & Sun's, it is both excellent and convenient. This is now our favorite restaurant on the island, every meal was delicious. We had breakfast everyday there and I tried everything on the menu, not to mention how good the complimentary coffee was. We had dinner there 3 times and even turned some locals to it and have been there many times since.To top it all off, there's a band there that plays every Sunday named "Men in Grey Suits" that complete the Aloha vibe with their Surf-Rock sounds. These guys were so talented. I bought a CD from Robbin with all originals tracks and I've listened to it every single day since.To summarize;Surfjack=Best Hotel....I want to live thereMahina & Sun's=Best Restuarant...possibly anywhereMen In Grey Suits=Best band in Oahu.....and beyond

We just stayed here with our 2 year old daughter and can honestly say we'll be back here the next time we're in Hawaii. We received some of the best service we have had in any hotel. The staff are all amazing, including, but not limited to, Kenny, Sai and Jordyn. We were made to feel very welcome from the beginning of our stay (and let us check in early), and the staff made sure to get to know us individually. Their restaurant recommendations are also pretty spot on. The hotel is new and very clean, with a proper showers lined with massage stones for your feet. Another bonus we found was that we had $50 F&B credit to use during our stay, as well as complimentary water, coffee and snacks. It was great for us as a family, but would probably be even better for adults, as they can take advantage of the bar and cabanas downstairs. I highly recommend this place!

We recently stayed a few nights at the Surfjack hotel. The staff and service is fantastic, our flight arrived early and they were able to check us in straight away. The pool and restaurant area are fun, with lovely decor. The rooms are clean, fresh and modern. My only complaint was that they don't provide a kettle in the room for that early morning cuppa.

We stayed here for three nights as part of our honeymoon. We'd previously stayed in a different hotel in Honolulu as part of our trip - a resort on the beach - but how I wish we'd discovered the Surfjack sooner and stayed there for the entirety of our trip! From a lovely relaxed check-in, to an upgrade to a suite overlooking the pool and a bottle of cava sent to the room, our welcome could not have been warmer. The staff were lovely and the interior of the suite was divine. Super relaxing, clean and basically I wanted to move in. You can tell this is a new hotel, compared to the resort we stayed in previously this felt worlds apart and very modern. We also ate in the hotel restaurant three times - two dinners and a breakfast. Some of the best food we had in the city. In terms of location, it is a short walk to the beach but hardly anything and what you may lack in sea views are more than made up by the Surfjack's decor, food and keenness to impress!

Surfjack is within walking distance of Waikiki's beaches, restaurants & shops.It has a beautiful blue pool in a center atrium that gets plenty of sunshine. There is an excellent casual restaurant with delicious food steps up from the pool.Every one there was knowledgeable, friendly and helpful especially handsome Sai.

Not a resort, but a great place to stay with fantastic staff, comfortable modern rooms, great restaurant and overall environment, great pool. Great TV and wifi.I loved staying here. I needed to work, and the big lanai was perfect: tables, couches and chairs with a comfy clean cool vibe. The room - a bungalow - was small but bright, with a nice closet, a fridge, good storage and comfy beds. Healthy fresh food. Great coffee. The place is small compared to big resorts, which is refreshing. The bicycles expanded my lunch options to places just beyond Waikiki. The beach bag and towels were nice and handy - a short distance to the beach.

We loved this hotel because of its style, location and amazing staff. Everyone was so helpful and friendly. The atmosphere and feel about the place was laid back and the restaurant/bar was fun and entertaining. Breakfast was amazing! Our room was clean and comfortable and we would certainly stay there next time we visit Honolulu. Special thanks to the concierge team who helped us with our surfboards.

We had the best stay at this new stylish boutique hotel. The Surfjack meets that perfect balance of fun, style, comfort and modern touches without over doing it. The decor is comfortable and clean. We loved the location which was easy to walk to the beach and best shopping. Be sure to hop on one of the cute blue bikes and ride around the town and lock it up in front of all the best boutiques and restaurants. Also, the food at the onsite restaurant is excellent, a real surprise as well as the bar and cocktails. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite with a nice living room which allowed for lots of comfort and with 3 balconies. Love it, we will make this our new go to place each time we stay in Waikiki. Special thanks to Jordan, Sean, Robert and staff for making our stay great. This place is really well managed and everyone was super nice and friendly.

We loved everything about Surfjack. It was really funky, had a really great vibe and was in a great location away from the crowds but still central enough to everything. It was so nice to stay in a hotel that we really enjoyed. All the communal areas are great. We loved that there was a proper coffee shop attached to get our latte fix as well as a restaurant that serveS Melbourne-quality breakfasts. We really enjoyed the nightly entertainment and spent so much of our time just relaxing by the pool when we wanted to get away from the beach.

Absolutely LOVED my three night business stay in a 1-bedroom suite. The Surfjack has a great laid back vibe, on par with great hotels like Soho House or the Standard, but without any pretense or attitude. My room was spotlessly clean and super comfortable, the staff were all outgoing and helpful 100% of the time, and the food at the in-house restaurant was fresh and delicious. Literally could not have been better. I wish I could live here! Can't wait to come back.
user_name:
MIchaelP88888888
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed for about a week and loved every minute of my stay. Right from the moment I was checked in by the lovely and welcoming Channy, until the time I left, I was treated with friendliness, kindness and helpfulness. My spotlessly clean and gorgeously decorated room overlooked the pool. The atmosphere is very relaxing, great music is played all day long, surf movies in the evening and delicious free coffee served every morning. I cant wait until my husband and I go back in December!

Honolulu (esp Waikiki) is a tough place to strike a balance between finding a hotel that has character, is updated and relatively polished, but not really overpriced. The Surfjack, however, comes very close! There were many things about it we liked. It has a very inviting open-air lobby/pool area with a cool mid-century modern/nautical aesthetic that is pretty well maintained throughout the entire hotel. The bar/restaurant area is nice and the food is actually pretty good and not crazy expensive. The pool is on the smaller side, but totally appropriate for the space. The room was clean, stylish, and comfortable. We ended up upgrading to a small suite (more on that later) and we were happy with it. The staff was also incredibly friendly, honest, and helpful.The only caution I would say is watch out if you book through a third party vendor/website if you are particular about the room type you want. We booked through a popular website where we specifically indicated a room with a King bed at the time of the reservation. On the day we checked in (we were flying from another island), we called to relay that we were arriving late that night and that we had a king room and all seemed in order. However, when we checked in around 10 PM, we were told that they were putting us in a room with 2 double beds. Apparently the website we booked through did not specify room type to Surfjack when they transmitted the reservation to them (they never do apparently) even though we specifically reserved a King. And of course they were out of king rooms by that evening. The front desk staff offered us a larger room at a reduced upgrade rate, but it was still money we didn't necessarily want to spend and really shouldn't have had to. Honestly, I can't really confirm if it was the website or hotel that pulled the switchero, but I'm assuming this isn't an issue if you book directly with the hotel. It would be worth confirming though in my opinion.All in all, I would definitely recommend the Surfjack!

Too bad we only stayed one night!We had a wonderful stay at the surfjack. You get everything you need: beach towels, beach bags, bikes,..... Rooms have a really unique decor and are quite spacious. We arrived really early, but were lucky to be able to check in before official check in time and even got a late check out free of charge, since our flight was late in the evening. The hotel organized a shuttle to take us to the airport and the reception staff got us some great recommendations on what to see and do.Hope to be back soon!!!

This is a great spot in Waikiki. The property has been very recently renovated and it has a great style and feel about it. The Pool, coffee, restaurant were all really nice. And very friendly, responsible and enjoyable staff and service. Only about 2 minutes walk to Waikiki Beach so I don't see much sense in paying the insane rates they charge for beachfront rooms as we have in the past. We have been to Waikiki quite a few times in the past and will definitely stay here again in the future.

Close to everything in Waikiki, the beach, the shops, the restaurants, and its your own little oasis when you come back to the Hotel.We will not hesitate to recommend The Surfjack to any of our friends, and will look forward to returning ourselves.Obviously it is an old hotel that has been turned into a trendy really well designed and only reopened 5 months earlier.Service from all the attentive staff is excellent, and we were really have to mention Jordyn at reception, who fixed everything we needed with a constant smile.

The surf jack is a must visit! From the friendly staff to the great location one block from the main strip to amazing food at Mahina and sons I truly recommend this for anyone wanting an awesome Honolulu experience! It is 100% representative of the fresh new local culture that is taking modern Honolulu by storm! I will return.

From the moment you arrive, you know you are in for a treat. So cool, so hip, I'm sure the hipsters don't even know about this place yet.Do yourself a favor. Stay here. Eat here. Play here.From the staff to the decor, this place is a wonderful treat foundin a concrete jungle of timeshare resorts and less than memorable motels.Mahina and Sun's is awesome. Try the oysters. This is now going to be "my place" when visiting Oahu.

This place is a real secret, and I full expect not to be able to get a room next year. Great food, super hip vibe. I really wish we had stayed here our entire trip. It's only a few blocks away from the main strip in Waikiki - easy enough to get around, plus you are closer to much better restaurants than the standard chain restaurants that found along the strip. We'll be back (assuming it's not booked for the next five years!)
user_name:
CGINCG
Banja Luka, Bosnia and Herzegovina

review_body: We stayed at the surf jack for 3 night After cancelling our reservation at a big resort. We where pleasantly surprised with this great hotel. The staff is very helpful with great ideas and tips for traveling the Island. We received an upgrade to a nice suite. The room had an Island vibe to it which was so much better then any of the big resort hotels. The only down side was the walking distance to the beach but for nightlife it is located excellently.We rented a car to explore the Island which was great and the parking service at the hotel is pretty good.

We stayed here for 4 nights for my 40th. This place is amazing. The customer service is top notch, the atmosphere is hip and relaxing. The food is killer. Don't waste your time anywhere else. Thanks Sai!

My husband and I live in Hawaii, on the North Shore and decided to do a "staycation" in Waikiki. Well, we hit the jackpot with the Surf Jack. This hotel is clean, friendly, a very good rate for Waikiki, quiet in the evenings, and has a wonderful restaurant, Mahina and Suns. We have stayed in some of the very best hotels in Waikiki , and we both admitted that the "vibe" and the whole ambiance of the Surf Jack was perfect for us!

Where do I start? Fabulous rooms- very functional and aesthetically curated, vintage elevators revamped to zoom quickly and yet feel funky, warm and authentic service at the front desk, valet, retail store, restaurant, housekeeping. Pool atmosphere was fun, mellow and not overcrowded. Live nighttime music added to the Surfjack experience.All the small touches were appreciated: Italian bath products, lemon and lime poolside iced water, delicious morning iced coffee, in-room water and snacks. Definitely calls for a return visit.

The staff was fantastic and very helpful and friendly. We had a 5 night stay and we enjoyed ourselves tremendously. It was just a short walk to Waikiki Beach. There were 5 of us staying in a 2 bedroom suite and we had plenty of room for everyone. We felt very safe at this hotel, even though the Waikiki area is so crowded and busy. Thanks for the great memories of Hawaii!

My wife and I had a lovely 4- night stay at the Surfjack.We found the decor very artistic, authentic and created from high quality materials. Love the fact that the developer tapped local artists to produce creative touches that are also highly functional. A great balance of form and function.The location is excellent - benefiting and part of the redevelopment of Kuhio Avenue - not too close to the heart of Waikiki but very accessible. Quiet and unassuming from the outside, a veritable secret garden on the inside. Resort fee of $25 is in line with the local norms, but is great value when all that is included is considered - fab free coffee in the lobby, snacks, waters and free internet, not to mention bike usage and beach / pool towels.Mahine & Sun's restaurant and bar serve delist local offerings.Staff was awesome - friendly, helpful and personable.We would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Surfjack is located about 2 blocks from the Waikiki beach so so it's convenient but far from the crowds. The one thing I can't get over is how good the hotel smells. Jasmine scents all over.We stayed only overnight as we made this our jump off point before flying back to Manila after staying 5 nights in Disney Aulani.
