We got a 2 bedroom for our family of 5 and the size was quite adequate and the bathroom spacious. By the way, we stayed in Aulani as I had a nephew who loved it there but Surfjack is best if you're all adults. My husband said it's like staying in a house in Miami. Cool vibe, 60's retro style furniture, just hanging out here is already fun. Morning coffee is free at the cafe for all guests and we had a $10 credit so had an early breakfast before going to the airport. The waffle was huge, so was my spinach panino which tasted great. My husband said his adobo was salty and we wondered if this was a Hawaiian thing as the food in Pineapple by Alan Wong was pretty salty too.

Stayed there 3 nights but also bumped into a couple that stayed for 9 nights...we all agreed this is by far the best hotel in Waikiki. They gave a list of 5 other hotels they stayed at (I only remember Vive) said Surfjack was by far the best. We ALL agreed that we All did not venture out of the hotel for our meals as Mahina & Sons is the only place to dine! Everything, the staff, the rooms, the atmosphere, the food, Everything was 5 star, ALOHA kept pouring from the hearts of the staff, pure love, pure ALOHA, the rooms were immaculate, clean, with room to move, the architecture and interior design so much like old Hawaii with a wonderful upgrade and twist...many hotels do not keep the touches of Paradise, Old Hawaii alive, this one surely does in every way with an elegant and mastered upgrade! There is joy in this place, there is Aloha in this place, and the food, award-winning...this hotel runs in Excellence in every area, I never rave about a hotel, but this one surely deserves it. It's winning a number of awards and it just opened! Congratulations to the General Manager and all the staff who create such an excellent atmosphere of Aloha. Congratulations for the awards in the design and in the food...Surfjack is truly 5 star quality in all ways. Will be sure to rebook whenever we stay in Waikiki!

There was a scheduled power outage on Schofield so we decided to get a hotel, I searched for two weeks looking into all the different places in Honolulu and all the various booking sites. Based on the reviews, we decided to chose Surfjack. I booked the one bedroom suite since we had our two toddlers with us and when we arrived we were so surprised to get a room that looked identical to the pictures on the website. It was so spacious and clean, decorated very chill, nice white clean bedding, and those most comfortable bed I've ever slept in. The shower was awesome as well, even had a hand held attachment which was great for the kids. The hotel itself was extremely clean, the pool is in the center of the hotel surrounded by the bar, lounge area, etc which was a little awkward with young kids in the evening time surrounded by adults just trying to relax lol but during the day it was very nice and relaxing. Ihop, a general store, and mcdonalds were less than 2 minutes from the lobby which was great. The beach wasn't far according to maps but we didn't end up going. The valet service was also very very convenient, I was a little irritated that it was an added cost, but parking is normally a huge headache and often not very safe so it was more than worth it. Bottom line, if you're looking for a place that is clean, comfortable, and relaxing and not looking to spending 300-400 per night....this is definitely the place to book.

This hotel has not overlooked a single detail when it comes to service, ensuring the guests are happy and an amazing staff! From the time we called for last minute reservations, until our last minute request for late check out due to flight changes, the staff was amazing! Extremely clean facility, rooms and linens. We were welcomed with curb side service, water while we waited to check in, and taking our bags to our room. The friendliness of this staff is amazing... they go above and beyond to ensure everything is perfect! Live music each night, movies by the pool, Olive and Oliver boutique, great decor and the cutest coffee shop all on site! We have not a single negative thing to say about this hotel, and highly recommend it!

i loved this hotel, the decor was on point, the staff was very friendly and helpful and the amenities were fantastic. great branding. what a great addition to the waikiki hotel scene! only wish we had had more time to take advantage of the bikes! love that they have beach towels to rent, include coffee everyday and the gift shop is super cute. oh and that pool is lovely. not a bad thing to say about this place.

This is my second home when I do business in Waikiki. There is something magic about this gem, from the moment you step into its revitalized-retro #WISHYOUWEREHERE lobby. The staff, the coffee, the design, the details, the intangible experience that recalls the wonders of Waikiki. I recommend this hotel for a memorable experience in authentic hospitality...and of course, aloha.

This is a nice hotel that was renovated earlier this year. It has a 1950's vibe to it; you will feel like you are in an Elvis movie. The single room was a bit tight but as I said the hotel was built in the 1950s or 1960s. They show old movies on the wall about the pool which I thought was interesting. The restaurant is very good and the staff was excellent. A special shout out goes to Benjamin and Channy who work the front desk and are excellent hotel representatives. The hotel is located next door one of my favorite Thai restaurants. Give it a try.

The Surfjack Hotel & Swimclub was on my bucketlist for a while. What a unique hotel so one of a kind. It takes you back in time. When I was passing by Honolulu I took my chance to book a stay here. It is hard to explain how cozy it felt arriving there. They did an outstanding job creating a cozy place in such a busy city but they managed. After a trip where everything went wrong including a delay at the airport for a day I arrived there. And it felt like coming home. The laidback atmosphere, the staff, the entrance, the room. Everything clean and cozy, brandnew. The people from the cleaning. And especially sincere kindness. They did more then you can expect from a hotel. I felt like a princess. I kept them busy too. Sorry for that haha. The great extra' s like free coffee at the bar you can take every morning, the parties, the music events. A movie by the pool everynight. And still they can manage to keep the music on the right volume so in the rooms it is stil quiet. They also have great activities that vary from lei making and yoga. And it is not overcrowded. So very peaceful.The breakfast, lunch and dinner is to die for. Traditional Hawaiian dishes till portuguese cuisine. It melts on your tongue.Counting to go back to my second home from home. The Surfjack is in my heart. Can you say that about a hotel. The Surfjack, absolutely yes.

You can't go wrong with a stay at The Surfjack. The whole experience is top notch - from the laid back coolness of the rooms, the exceptionally friendly staff, and the local culture-infused activities. The hotel is also very conveniently located in the heart of Waikiki, but set back just enough from the main strip to be very relaxing. I can't wait to go back!

A friend and I met up in Waikiki for a week and booked this lovely hotel primarily because it had two-bedroom suites at a reasonable price. It's an older place that has been very recently remodeled and I was impressed by the results. The place was spotless and the staff went out of their way to make sure we had a good time. The restaurant has a limited menu, but everything we tried on it was great. I especially enjoyed the Naked Pig pizza.The hotel sits back from the main tourist chaos, but was really only two easy blocks walk from the beach. To me this made it great place to stay as it was quieter and more relaxed, yet convenient. I'd recommend it to anyone, but especially families.

Absolutely LOVED our stay at the Surfjack!!! The team was all very welcoming and helpful from the get-go, and I appreciated the individualized attention given to each guest checking in. The Team was all very knowledgable and gave us some great recommendations. The hotel was beautifully designed and unique and we loved the open space of the Pool, hangout areas and Restaurant (which had the best Coffee and Breakfast!). A very hip, comfortable, fun and relaxed setting for our 1st tip to Honolulu. And having Bikes available to borrow was great! Thank you for the great times, Surfjack fam!

Now, we got lucky I think.We booked this kinda last minute and were expecting just another hotel room in a cool looking place.But we got our own apartment overlooking the pool above the cafe (with the best coffee in Waikiki!).The staff were excellent, the pool was great, the cocktails refreshing, the food in the restaurant was delish, bit of a party atmosphere, I can't say enough good things.Oh yeah, there was a rockabilly lady with a seashell bra greeting people when we arrived, so much fun!A funny thing was, "Honolulu's number one gay club" is right next door and our room opened about a metre from the club's balcony. It's so rare to have a group of drunk men wish us good night!So if that's your thing, there's an added bonus.Plus the bus stop is about a minute away and the New York pizza place around the corner is open late.

This really is a cool hotel. The rooms were comfortable and clean, the amenities were great and it is just out of the busy tourist strip. The staff are so friendly and gave us great restaurant tips and advice on getting around. I hope we have an opportunity to return to Hawaii and stay at The Surfjack again.

Hands down, this is the best hotel for production. Friendly staff, great service, clean rooms, great restaurant...Everyone in the crew is happy.If you need a block of rooms for a group or as an individual, this is the place. Mucho Aloha.

The best thing about this hotel was its location, which was handy to lots of things. Its a smallish, nicely decorated hotel with a good pool & a restaurant (which we never had time to use, but it looked enticing). We got off to a bad start as we weren't forewarned about the 'resort fee' of $25/day, which amounted to $25 for two small bottles of water & use of wifi for us, so quite pricey. (We could have offset $10/day of that with restaurant purchases but as we were eating elsewhere with friends that was no use to us.) We were given a disability room on the 2nd floor, no idea why as I thought they would keep that for disabled guests, & being so low down there was no air circulation on the balcony, which felt like a sauna. The room itself was more modern than the other place we stayed in Hawaii, which was nice, bed was comfy, good safe, not a huge amount of space, but perfectly fine. The shower leaked all over the bathroom floor because it had wheelchair access, but they supply about 350 towels, so there was plenty to clean up with. I'd probably stay there again because of its location, but would definitely ask for a room on a higher floor.

The hotel and staff are AMAZING and made my anniversary vacation extra special. The staff did everything that we asked and then some. They offered great suggestions for meals and places to go see before our trip was over. They were over accommodating and it made our trip extra special.

I stayed here for 7 days recently. The hotel itself was wonderful. Everything was modern and clean. It's location was central and close to the beach. The food and drinks at the hotel was also innovative and delicious. It was not your standard fare. If you want to stay local this is the place to be. They have local events here and often support other local activites. The staff is a step above. Everyone was kind, compassionate, and beyond patient. Don't think twice. This is the place to stay.

If you want to experience Waikiki but avoid the busy crowed beach strip the Surfjack is an awesome chill place with excellent service, comfortable rooms and tasty cuisine options. After a day at the beach and the bustle of the Waikiki Strip it was nice to come back to the Surfjack and relax by the pool or in my room. In the evening the atmosphere was upbeat and lively but not too crowed which was nice. Hight recommend staying here. I'll definitely be back. :-)

Just finished our 3 night stay last night at the surfjack. Could not have picked a better place to stay! One street away from all the shopping and restaurants you could need and a nice relaxing hotel to come back to that is all newly renovated inside. We would honestly recommend to stay here than any other hotel in hawaii. A special thanks to Sai who made sure we knew where we were going every day and how to get there! He was a great friend to have during our stay and can't wait to be back there soon

After staying at the Aston for 4 nights, we moved to Surfjack's for 7 nights. It is a couple of blocks in from the beach, yet very central, with ihop on the corner and Ruth Chris' a couple minutes walk away. The hotel is more boutique style and everything is spanking new, having been recently refurbished by new owners. The staff are very friendly and helpful. For 6 of the 7 days, Sai was always there when we were departing or returning to the hotel, with a smile and any helpful advise needed. He is a great ambassador for the hotel.Our 2 bedroom, between 4 adults and 2 children was quite adequate. Most rooms are pool views with balconies, good storage and fridge/freezer for the beer and ice...Parking is available and there's a Harley rental shop a block away.The theme of the hotel is as the name implies, easy, laid back and friendly, with special outdoor surfing movie nights by the pool.Thanks to Sai and the great staff for making our vacation comfortable and happy.I recommend The Surfjack Hotel to families and couples!

My Fiancé and I were only here for a short stay on stopover and left with sadness that we were only there for 2 nights. Sai was extremely helpful and welcoming as well as the rest of the crew. There's a cool, happy vibe and the location was great. Rooms are on trend and spacious! We loved every minute of our stay at The Surfjack and can't wait to come back!

I was traveling on my own for 2 nights before I joined my friends and I wanted a hotel that was in the heart of it all but not massive and this hotel was all of the above and more! It is a cool design and layout. The pool is just big enough to to cool off and chill out around. Staff are really friendly and rooms where clean and spacious. It is a 7 min walk to the beach, shops, restaurants and all that Waikiki has to offer! I will be defiantly staying here on my next trip to Hawaii! Thanks Surfjack!

I stay in a lot of hotels, haven't felt compelled to leave a glowing review except for Surfjack. The whole experience they've created is done perfect. Decor, amenities, room design, etc. I took pictures of everything in our room so I can try and find them for our house. It's tucked away from the main beach strip, but it's a short walk and this place is an awesome little gem tucked away.

My sister and I were welcomed as soon as we arrived to the hotel by a friendly gentlemen named Kenny. As we checked into the hotel we noticed the relaxed and friendly atmosphere that was present around the facilities. Kenny was very helpful and told us about key locations to visit as well as notified us about the free coffee and lemon/lime water we could receive every morning! Which made us delighted and welcomed. The rooms are perfect and have a modern beach touch to them and are very well equiped with shampoo, soaps, hair dryer etc. The hotel also has different events by the pool which csn leep you engaged snd entertained throughout your holiday experience. I would say that this has been the best holiday experience we have ever received, the service is very prompt, all staff were friendly and genuinely communicated to us every morning as we left the hotel and helped up with the best solutions for transportation and tour information. The hotel has a restaurant named Mahina and Suns and a cafe named Olive and Oliver where you can also shop in the cafe and find really nice pieces to take home. We also received an exceptional service standard from the cafe and restaurant where we would often see the chef greeting customers ans making everyone feel welcomed. I would highly recommened this hotel and I cant wait to visit hawaii again and book this hotel as it is also in a good location. Thank you for all of your hard work Surfjack staff you have left myself and my sister missing your humble presence.

Although we weren't impressed with Waikiki as a whole, our four nights at the Surfjack were nothing short of amazing. Awesome rooms, comfortable beds, modern finishes with extremely accommodating staff and a location that takes you off the main areas affected by hordes of tourists.Our return will likely be met by a much more limited amount of time in Waikiki (two days MAX would be sufficient to do whatever you need to do here), but we will definitely be returning to this property when we do. Great work!!

Hands down one of the best hotels I have stayed at; I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. The staff are amazing, the decor, the ambiance, everything is perfection!!! A must stay while in Honolulu!☀️❤️

Visited here for five nights and it was an execellent stay. I was greeted by Dexter (The Guest Services Manager) and he invited me to take a seat at the sofa area behind the front desk. I was served a welcome drink. (And I was impressed by the hotel design and decor! They looked so cool to me!) He came and did the checkin with me afterwards. He also explained the facilties and events in the hotel. Lastly, he told me the room was ready and I got a upgrade to the suite! It was absolutely a surprise to begin my stay in this hotel!The main highlight for cd was however the guest experience provided by Dexter. He was a true professional. He deserves high marks for customer service!I would certainly stay here again for my next trip in Waikiki.

Beautiful hotel great pool, restaurant and located in a very central part of Waikiki, hated Hawaii too much of a concrete jungle but the hotel was wonderful and comfortable and the people go way out of their way to smile and talk to you and ask if they can help you

For those seeking a sophisticated experience, this is it. Local artisans and designer works seen throughout here, nothing cookie cutter. Food amazing, local ore cuisine by celebrated chef. And really amazing and welcoming service. The profile in the New York Times style magazine earlier this year drew me in--it was all it promised to be and more.

Recently stayed for 1 night. Hotel was great! The room was fantastic. I was a good size, very clean and had ever thing I need. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again, and will recommend the surfjack hotel to everyone I know.

Had a short transit stay here with wife and my 19 months old kid - good location, just 5 - 10 mins away from the crowd at Waikiki. Very clean and neat room though a bit too small. Pool is a small though but I guess most will go to the beach anyway. Overall good value for money

We came to Hawaii to be married and honeymoon. The Surf Jack was the perfect place to stay. Everything was well kept and had great Hawaiian feel. Sai and staff were very friendly and sweet. They always greeted us, congratulated us on our wedding and even gifted us a bottle of champagne to celebrate our special day. We can't wait to return here someday to renew our vows.

Pros:1) Friendly staff2) Gorgeous design3) Thoughtful layout and use of the space4) Convenient location5) Amazing hotel restaurant6) Chic yet unpretentious7) Unexpected "little" touches that added to the stayCons: 1) Valet parking only--no self-parking. The pull-up to the valet area can get a little crowded and confusing at peak times, but the super friendly and accommodating vale staff made up for this "manini" con.Heard about Surfjack by word-of-mouth and when my girlfriends and I came up with the idea of a last-minute girls' stay-cation, we decided to try Surfjack mainly because we wanted a quieter hotel away from the main part of Waikiki yet still within walking distance. Everything about the hotel and our stay was amazing. Check-In: Benjamin at the Front Desk made us feel immediately welcome and at ease and sent complimentary champagne to our room (probably because he could tell we were stressed-out moms/wives in need of a vacation =) ). Benjamin made our check-in easy and stress-free. Room: We booked a 2-bedroom suite for 3 of us (we were initially going to have 5 of us but 2 of our friends had to cancel). The room was SO cute--spacious but not overwhelming. The decor was very clever and unique. We had a fun time just hanging out and relaxing in the living room without feeling cramped. There was no "hotel feel" about the room and it was perfect. Having multiple private balconies was also a nice touch. Food: Mahina & Sun's is AMAZING. EVERYTHING TASTES AMAZING! Service and the Little Touches: The housekeeping staff wrote a thank you note to us for the tip we left in the room for their housecleaning services. That's NEVER happened to us before. A thank you note from them was not expected or necessary. I mean, they're the ones doing the hard work and they're thanking us! But every single member of the hotel staff that we encountered was engaging, friendly and helpful. It was a real treat.Would definitely return and recommend local friends and family and out-of-state family to stay at the Surfjack.

This charming hotel has had a complete makeover and it really hits the spot. Our room had a separate living room with a large sofa and big screen TV. There were complementary snacks and a small refrigerator. There was another large screen TV in the bedroom and the huge walk in shower in the bathroom was wonderful. In the morning coffee is served for the hotel guests downstairs at the bar. The decor of the room is very beach like and inviting and the pool was heaven. The hotel has many families staying with them so after around 3 pm there are many, many children in the pool and surrounding area. I was glad that I took my swim earlier. The property is located away from the busy area of Waikiki but easy walking distance to the beach.

My girlfriend and I stayed in 3 places in Honolulu and this was easily our least favorite.The lobby is really cool and nothing about this place was terrible, but it just wasn't worth the $. Our airbnb was similar quality and similar location for barely more than half the $. There are so many cheap and decent airbnb's with similar location that I don't think there's any argument to justify the extra $ for surfjack.If you insist on paying up for a hotel, Lotus had much better rooms and location for a similar price. In general Honolulu hotels aren't great relative to price and I just wouldn't bother with one unless you'd like to be really close to the beach which Surfjack is not.

I love this little gem of a place! It's a stylish and comfortable place to stay. Everyone who works there is friendly and they go above and beyond to make your stay wonderful. I really enjoy all the special touches in the room, most of the art, light fixtures, fabric and furniture are made by local artists. It's my favorite place to stay on Oahu!

Did a quick island hop from Kauai to Oahu for the weekend. My room was ready upon a very early check-in (yay). The most comfortable bed ever with excellent linens. Clean and nicely decorated. Excellent restaurant on-site and super friendly, helpful staff. Valet could be a little more alert to getting guests taxis as requested. Great stay-cation for this Kauai girl. Would stay again in a heartbeat.

From the moment we checked in to the time we left, we were blown away by the quality of the renovation here and the kindness of their staff. It's not as aggressively hip as, say, the Ace Hotel & Swim Club in Palm Springs, though that was clearly an inspiration. But that's actually a good thing — this has more of the laid-back vibe that you want and expect in Hawai'i. The hotel is very cool without being fussy.As nice as the spaces are, the staff here is actually the best part. Sai carried our bags to our room, but he did much more than the literally heavy lifting. He offered some great suggestions of things to do and just generally took care of us from start to finish. A really kind guy who is more than happy to share local knowledge — that's tough to beat.It's obviously not for the budget traveler, and like many hotels in urban spaces has a daily valet parking fee. But for those on vacation and looking for a cool, modern getaway, this has to be the best hotel in O'ahu.

First, we’d like to comment on the amazing staff at Surfjack. Robbie is an extremely hardworking manager who knows how to take care of his guests. He always had a smile on his face and went out of his way to check on us as well as get us whatever we needed it whenever we needed it! He was very respectful, understanding, informative not only to his guests but his co-workers as well. Even the valet service we received was great. The bell hop named Sai had taken all of our belongings up the elevator to the 9th floor and then carried it upstairs to the 10th floor! Sai filled our stay with Ohana and truly cared to make our stay one worthwhile. Second, the pool was perfect temperature and was always clean! They provide seat pads for those who would just like to dip their feet in! Third, The food from the restaurant was delicious! The avocado tacos, Kailua pig pizza, and burger were to die for! We would make reservations for that restaurant even if we weren't staying at the hotel! Last but not least, the location. The location is priceless! It is right in the middle of Waikiki! Every day we walked in a different direction to adventure and see new things. We actually began playing Pokemon Go and if you really want some awesome Pokemon, Surfjack is the place to stay! Due to the location we weren't far away from the Zoo, Aquarium, several restaurants, cute boutiques as well as ABC stores.We would highly recommend this hotel for all of its amenities, care for their employees and guests, location, as well as the hospitality service. The rooms make you feel like you are home in Hawaii and not just staying for a short visit. We were very happy to have had the privilege of staying at the Surfjack!

I loved The place !!!!! Everything was great and i couldnt find a better place to be …. i would highly recommend it and i will comeback !!! Staff was fantastic ... Sai and Crystal were great helping us find/show us the amazing places around the island and took great care of us (congratulation surfjack, you have an exceptional staff) … ALL this combine together is more than 5 star !!!

This hotel far exceeded our expectations. We were greeted by such friendly staff, Crystal (please forgive if misspelled) checked us in and was very welcoming and she continued to give us great spots to check out in Hawaii for food and beaches which did not disappoint, she was very knowledgeable about the local scene. The room was perfect, clean and modern with that Old Hawaiin vibe that actually made you feel like you were in Hawaii and possibly on an old school movie set, which is different from the other cold modern hotels. The shower was spacious, toiletries smelled amazing and the hotel had great attention to details, from the steamer to the bag that they let you use. The pool is fun you're just happy to be there. The restaurant Mahina has such a cool vibe which makes the hotel an extra cool place to check out at night. What really took the trip to another level was the great staff particularly Sai, he was amazing took such good care of us and told us where to go and wanted to hear about our adventures when we came back, we felt so welcome by him it made our trip that much more special. ALL IN ALL VERY VERY NICE HOTEL WILL DEFINETELY BE BACK,

Great value for money, fantastic service, wonderful music playing. Service fantastic from front desk to housekeeping. Restaurant served great food and nice and spacious, you can tell its a favourite with locals too from the restaurant guests. Couldn't fault Surfjack and would most definately stay there again. Location great a short walk to shops, beach etc

I mean the title says it all. From Robb(ie)y who was such a warm and awesome hospitality manager who made sure we were taken care of during our stay to the rooms that were cute, comfortable and helped us relax after a long and uncomfortable summer in other countries.

Staid here for business and e njoyrd it. It is an older, small hotel but they have done a nice job of renovating it. It is very centrally located with plenty of shopping and restaurants within a 10 minute walk. The valet staff was very attentive and their own resteraunt was very good. I recommend their Naked Pig pizza!

I don't usually review but feel this hotel is more than worthy of a review. We are family of 4 with two teenage sons and were given a great corner room with wrap around balcony (939). Room was spacious enough and comfortable enough for us.The whole concept is great - decor is superb - they have it just right. Great to sit and relax around the pool with the surf vibe music playing, whether its early in morning or late at night. Mahina and Sons (food is amazing) and Olive and Oliver both compliment the hotel very well indeed. The beach bags and towels are a nice touch too.Everyone we encountered at the hotel was super friendly and made you feel at home. Each and every one of the staff deserve a mention. Special thanks to Max, Pacha, and Jordyn. Surfjack - you have a great team and a great hotel !! We will be back.

What a find! We loved our stay at Surfjack. We felt very welcomed. All the staff are very warm and happy to chat with you. We were on the 2nd floor and loved being so close to the action. Every night has a lovely vibe with music being played and kids and adults having fun together whilst people dine in the amazing restaurant. Love the massive balconies and our 1 bed room was very spacious. The interiors have been designed perfectly. A real beach feel with a contemporary luxury (think aged bronze tapware and handmade tiles), I loved the bathroom and there is so much robe space. A tv in the bedroom and lounge was fun. Super comfortable bed and a/c as well as ceiling fans meant we were always comfortable. Choice of feather or dacron pillows / blankets or doona (I really love the choice). Coffee at Olive and Oliver helped us Aussies get by (good espresso). They organised a cab for our early morning departure (5am) and we felt as though we were being farewelled by a family member. Highly recommend this hotel. Would love to come back.

Absolutely love this place and won't stay anywhere else when we return to Honolulu. Staff and service was exceptional and rooms were spacious and luxuriously appointed. Beautiful boutique hotel in a great location. Beautiful reno and a great place to stay. Highly recommended!

I stayed in room 947. I had a pool view and one bedroom.It's hard to write how amazing my service was during my stay. I was greeted with a smile and "aloha!" Wherever I went. Jordyn, Robbie, Dexter, Channy, and a new trainee named Benjamin were at my service whenever I needed help. The restaurant, located inside the hotel, Mahaina & Sun's, had delicious Ahi Tuna Tare Tare. The service there as well was wonderful! Olive and Oliver, the coffee shop, had a delicious cold brew and I just was always so delighted with the service. I will plan on staying there whenever I visit Waikiki again. I wish there was more that I could do other than write a positive review for the them!

The location is OK only due to the fact that it is a few blocks from the main street and it would seem to be reasonably priced for Honolulu. The positives - Friendly staff clean rooms.However I was unfortunate to get a room close to the elevator and the noise from the pool party they had every night could be heard clearly without opening any doors.I was extremely disappointed from the beginning having to chase them to confirm my booking and upon asking at the front desk about shopping the mature woman at the desk proceed to tell me I should go find a Walmart.. which I must say quite offended me as I don’t even shop at Kmart back home. Fortunately the young girl Channy advised me of the Ala Moana Center and how to get there. As well as Jordyn who was also a great help…The lack of simple food available was concerning.. I ended up ordering in most nights whilst I was there… and a simple thing like toast to settle the nausea I was experiencing was not available.Upon emailing the hotel before I stayed there… I asked about transfers… at which point I was re-directed to Uber as I am not a local.. I was not inclined to down load an app just for an airport transfer.

This was our first time ever staying at this hotel. I must say my family and I were very impressed. We are actual locals but moved from the island years ago and was in town for a funeral. Needless to say, the room did its job. It was clean, hotel staff were extremely friendly and we enjoyed our comfortable stay. Appliances were updated, shower was a nice touch also :) From check-in to check-out the process went well and smooth. Kenny is the go to guy :) Very knowledgeable and a personable staff member. He knows about the hotel and is extremely friendly. Willing to make sure your stay is very superb. Might I add the hotel is really cute décor :) I may also add, that if you can find street parking its a plus. 2 blocks before Lewers street (where the hotel is located) are some street parking spots. Otherwise you will have to use Valet (it does include in/out privileges).

First-timer at this hotel. Very convenient location in the heart of Waikiki. Valet a little challenging because of short curbside access...no big deal. Greeted with smiling faces from ALL the staff. Checked in with Benjamin. At this time, it's a about 3:15p(check-in is after 3p) so he's noticeably busy with other guests. He showed "no stress" and welcomed me with a huge smile. I was told my room wasn't quite ready so I was asked to wait in the sitting area....no big deal. Waited for about 15 more minutes. During this time, Benjamin was very apologetic and appreciative of my patience. What happens next?.... I get "upgraded" to one of the best rooms I've ever stayed in...WOW!!! I know this an exception, so I EXPECT my second night to be in the type of room I actually paid for. I recheck-in with Channy at the front desk. Guess what?! She tells me she spoke with the manager(Robbie) and they let me stay in the same room...AGAIN!! Wow and double wow. I've stayed at several dozens of hotels and this place is top three in guest services! They treated me like a VIP, and I'm a nobody, just a guy enjoying a staycation. Benjamin,Channy and Robbie went above and beyond what was expected. Maybe I'll name my kids after them. Nah...a little too much :) But much mahalo to them and the staff,including Jo An(housekeeper), for making my stay extremely wonderful!!!!

We were for the first time in Honolulu and we enjoyed this hotel very much. The romm for 6 people was complete , clean and has a very nice style. The hotel has it's own swimming pool and cabanas. It is close (walking distance) to the beach and shops.The staff was very helpful and nice.I would definitely recommend this hotel, we hope to come back again!

Loved our 3 night stay here, walking distance to everything, clean, comfortable room and we were upgraded to a one bedroom suite instead of a bungalow which was a plus after a long trip from Australia. I'd highly recommend this place to anyone, the coffee and food was also great. Perhaps the one thing I should point out is that the pool area does have lots of kids and families especially in the afternoon so if you want some peaceful time with a book then head to the beach which is less than a ten minute walk away.

To the team at The Surfjack. Thank you for making the last 4 days of our family holiday such a great experience. We couldn't have asked for anything out better. We came from a large resort to this little treasure and found just what we needed. A Great friendly team and very knowledgable, awesome environment for downtime, fantastic little restaurant and bar and nice clean facilities/rooms. Thank you for making our stay so memorable. For those who want something different to the large hotels/condos this is definitely somewhere I would highly recommend. Mahalo!

This hotel has been given an upgrade... Think 70's Motel, which has been given a makeover !! Positives - Friendly service, Clean rooms and Great location - only a short walk away from Waikiki beach and away from the crowds.Negatives - location of pool. The pool is small and situated at the entrance of the hotel. It is open to views of the street, arriving guests and trades, and with restaurant seating placed around the pool it isn't an ideal environment to relax. Small rooms - Whilst the rooms were clean and nicely decorated, if you have more than one suitcase space becomes an issue. My husband and I were travelling with two large suitcases and a couple of bags and we struggled to move around the room due to a lack of storage and floor space. Overall, this hotel is reasonably priced for Honolulu and is fine for a short stay due to a lack of space and places to relax. However, even though it has had a recent upgrade, my husband and I agree that it has been achieved cheaply (on a shoe string)... and I doubt that this hotel will look good in 6months - 1 years time.

A newly renovated boutique hotel by Aqua-Aston located a few blocks from Waikiki Beach. All rooms are Bungalow or bedroom suite (1, 2 and 3 bedrooms) Unique services and amenities include: cultural programming at the Swim Club, Mahina & Sun's restaurant by innovative Chef Ed Kenney (a 3 time-James Beard Award semi-finalist) and Olive & live an apparel shop featuring eclectic curated goods, original store is in Kailua.

All of the staff was over the top. Whatever your need, the staff was willing to do what was necessary to meet that need. A great and unique experience. Highly recommended and look forwards to my next visit.

From the moment we arrived we were greeted with friendly service. What I liked most was that they brought our bags to our rooms. That's a rare service reserved for more luxurious hotels. The place was uniquely decorated by several local designer/artists on the Island. We had a one bedroom suite that was very relaxing and it had a balcony with chairs to just relax and feel the tropical breeze. I would most definitely stay at this hotel again more so for the atmosphere and location.

Stayed in a two bedroom, one bathroom suite. Rooms were very clean, modern and well appointed. A great retro style boutique hotel off the main strip, but still close to all the main attractions in Waikiki. The staff were very personal and gave a warm welcome every time we returned to the hotel. The addition of Olive and OIiver and the coffee bar is a great touch. The pool area and open air reception give the hotel a great vibe and the weekend DJ, set it off perfectly. Ed Kenney's in-house restaurant Mahina and Sun's is not to be missed!

We had a fantastic dinner at Mahina & Sun's. Our server was on top of everything. The Executive Chef came out to greet all the diners. The guest rooms were stylish and comfortable. If you are looking for the ultra hip with a Hawaii sense of place... eat, stay at The Surfjack!

From the moment we arrived, staff couldn't be more helpful and accommodating. Clean comfortable rooms, less than 5mins walk to Waikiki shopping district. Highly recommend making time for breakfast at Mahini & Suns

This was my first visit to beautiful Hawaii. And how lucky my family and I were to be able to stay here. The staff were super friendly and helpful. Nothing was any trouble they made you feel welcome comfortable.Big shout out to sail and Kenny at the front desk!! Also to the barman Dave n the blonde waitress (so sorry forgot your name!) The breakfast was the best in Honolulu hands down! Thanks guys you are amazing. Keep doing what your doing. Feels great to be surrounded by people who actually love their place of business.

Surfjack is one of those gems you find in the middle of a touristic nightmare. Decor is beautiful and the service is out of this world. You're treated kindly by everyone and they all seem to truly be happy. Sai was especially helpful. We booked to come back late next week because we loved it so much!

The Surfjack is a great place to stay while in Honolulu. Of course our room was clean, well-maintained, and very comfortable. Of course, the same can be said about the cleanliness of the public areas and the comfort of the furniture around the pool and in the lobby. One would expect that from a hotel of this caliber. The hotel is within walking distance of many restaurants, the beach, stores, and bus stops. Unlike many hotels, the Surfjack does have two and three bedroom suites.The food at the hotel’s restaurant was imaginative and flavorful. The free morning coffee was much better than what I have experienced at most other hotels.What I didn't expect during our stay at the Surfjack was the sincerity of Aloha from the staff. That level of Aloha was magnified by those staff members who knew the circumstances of our trip Hawai'i. We were surprised and deeply touched by the level of compassion and the sincerity of offers of assistance from the staff. We felt like o'hana (family). I would, without hesitation, stay at the Surfjack. Obviously, I would highly recommend it.

I checked in to Surfjack for 1 month long stay for my vacation with my kids. We really enjoy our stay in this hotel. Location is great, the pool and restaurant are excellent with weekly live music. Most importantly, everyone who works in the hotel and very friendly and attentive. The front people are also super friendly and helpful . I must mention Kenny because he has been extremely nice to help out anything I need. I lost my stuff when I moved to a new room and he did everything he could to help me find it in the lost and found office. There were some missing products I ordered from Amazon to send to my hotel, and he helped me call the postal office to track them.... Kenny and everyone always greeted me and my kids whenever we are in the hotel. We really feel like home staying at Surfjack! Will definitely consider coming back if we come back to Oahu again in the future.

Absolutely amazing hotel that has the most friendly staff ever seen. Everyone was so friendly and nothing was too much trouble. The hotel has such a cool vibe, everyone is positive and kind, the music is always relaxing, the bar and food are incredible and the rooms are comfortable and spacious. Would absolutely come back to Honolulu just to stay here. Thanks so much to all of the staff, you made our holiday wonderful.

This small hotel focuses on the local: local artists decorated the newly designed space, local food is featured in the restaurant, and the renovated low-rise is an homage to old school Hawaii holidays. Everything is beautiful, comfortable, friendly and fun.

From the time that you pull up to the curb and are greeted by the Surfjack Ohana you know that this place is special. Rooms were very clean and modern and the staff was extremely friendly and hospitable. We will definitely be coming back one day. It is conveniently located in the heart of Waikiki. We definitely fell in love with this hidden gem.

So, we actually booked to stay at an air b&b in Nanakuli. When we arrived, the place was a dump, no ac and miserable!!! We immediately went on a search engine to find another place to stay immediately. That's when we found The Surf Jack. Very modern and updated. Right away it was a plus because we needed a place with a private bedroom. We had my husband and I, our 1 yr old and our 2 pre-teen kids. It was amazing, because not only did they have a suite available, but the sofa bed pulled out into a queen bed, not just that, there also was a twin-sized side of the couch as well. Each of my older kids had so much space to sleep! The bedroom had a king sized bed. Our toddler slept with us, but they did have cribs available! Super comfy beds. Great sleeping arrangements for our family. They had so much closet/storage space. I loved how the closets had automatic lights when you open and shut them, super handy. The shower was perfect with the two shower heads! (The handheld was great for my toddler.) it took a while for the hot water to become hot. Free coffee every morning. They had a mini fridge which was awesome. There was no microwave in the room, so we had to eat cold left-overs, however, when we checked out we mentioned the microwave to the front desk and she was so apologetic saying we could've requested one!!! Oh well, such a super tiny set back, it didn't affect us at all! Now we know for next time. The cleaning staff was great: came at a timely manner, did a great job cleaning. They were doing a little maintenance on and off with loud noises, nothing too bothersome. The hotel is only 3 months old so it was expected! The pool area was nice, very cold pool, it was nice during the sunny/hot days for a quick refresher, I don't think it was to temperature enough to relax in- the kids liked it tho! At dusk they start to play old movies on a projector over the pool, which was nice! Such as: blue Hawaii and Endless Summer to name a couple. I wish they had sound for it tho. They played nightly music at a louder volume, but quickly subsided around 10pm. The restaurant menu: kind of too limited in my opinion . Only two choices for the kids menu, on top of limited selections for breakfast,lunch, pupus, and dinner. (Think 1-3 items per section) Good quality, but I'd like to see it with a little more variety. We had to pay $35 a day for the valet. There's no hotel self parking. I guess their parking situation is limited. Eh. For $35 a day I'd expect a lot faster car service, but the Waikiki area is very limited on parking already so they have to make up for it somewhere. I kind of understand but I wish parking was included. I wish at the end of the stay there was a place to add gratuity for the valet folk, we didn't carry enough cash on us everyday to tip, especially since if we took the car out a few times a day. The staff is AMAZING. They really gave us such a pleasant experience. They really are the ones who made our stay! I've never been treated so well at a hotel. Sai, Jordyn, and Benjamin were always happy to see us!!! They always made us feel welcome and gave is great tips for our stay. There was a few things I changed but with the overal experience, I won't be staying anywhere else when I visit Waikiki! Loved it.

I must admit, when we pulled up to the hotel I was a bit disappointed. However, I was almost immediately proved wrong. The incredible kindness and warmth of the staff to the incredible design choices at every turn completely won me over. Once you walk in the entry it's like walk your own beautiful Shangri-la. You will get lost into a beautiful world of Mid-Century Modern Tiki mixed with beautiful installations provided by local artists. You will enjoy a truly enjoyable experience of the charm of Old Hawaii. The rooms are relatively small (the norm for Honolulu), but charming and excellently appointed. Hairdryer: better than most. Steamer instead of iron = <3. Toiletries: beyond expectation. Plus the restaurant? Tres magnifique!Stay here, you will quickly fall under it's spell and won't be disappointed.

Recently had the pleasure of staying at the Surfjack and as a local resident I could not be more impressed and pleased with every aspect of the property from the spot on renovation to the management and staff.It's a 60's era structure and not much can be done with that right?! Wrong, the designer used it to her full advantage. Think Mad Men meets Brat Pack Palm Springs with the appropriate Islands flair and modern touches with finishes and fabrics. This is not your 60's tiki tacky tourist reno or what we think visitors associate with island style.Dexter the GM is hands on, responsive and full of aloha. Chaney and Kenny the front desk staff I worked with were proud of the hotel, explained in detail about the renovation process and pointed out the local designer's own surfboards were hanging up as part of the thought out decor. She was actually eating in the restaurant the night I checked in. The valet attendants as well were attentive and proficient. Again, full of the genuine aloha spirit. From now on, this is my first and only go to for staycations and family over flow lodging. I was blown away and happy to stumble upon this hidden gem. Much Mahalo from Hawaii Kai!! See you soon!

We really enjoyed our stayed in the Surfjack Hotel at the end of June/early July. The property has a very cool retro vibe and is in a great location in Waikiki. The room was clean and comfortable (particularly the bed). The shower was large with great water pressure - good for washing off after a day at the beach!Beach towels are available from the service desk and the hotel offers valet service for those renting a car. Free wifi was available in the rooms and we found the signal to be strong in the 2 different rooms we stayed in. Free coffee was available from the restaurant in the morning. On a related note, we found the restaurant to be amazing - we went back the next night just to have the dessert again!If you are looking for a place to relax and have a fun time, you will not be disappointed with the Surfjack.

We stayed in The Surfjack Hotel and Swim Club in the end of June and found this hotel was in the excellent location, only few minutes walk to the main shopping area and Wakiki beach. The room was big and clean. It was in boutique design studio and truly comfortable and pillows. During 7 days staying there, the reception staffs were very helpful and provide good information of transportation, day trip and dinning area , especially Jodyne. The relaxing atmosphere of the hotel truly embodied the Aloha spirit, big outdoor pool sunbath area and uplifting with nice music. The hotel also provided us beach towels and fresh water next to the pool. For restaurant, food there was tasty healthy and nice presentation on the plate. The parking we had to pay which was very normal there. Also free coffee in the morning. Over all was splendid.Thank you for making stay memorable.

Wonderful stay! We were so happy that we discovered surfjack! We had one of the best hotel experiences we've ever had. My family of 6 thought that the location was great (right near all the shops and big hotels on Waikiki) and the two bedroom suite was really great!- the design of the hotel was gorgeous (the pool is so cool)- free coffee in the morning was a great way to start our days, the bar and lobby were wonderful gathering places- It was clean, cheerful, colorful and relaxing- It was a community and put on some really cool events while we were there (a really cool design pop up featuring local designers)- the hotel employees were incredibly awesome! The service was wonderful, they were all full of optimism and we really enjoyed getting to know them and get their advice throughout our Hawaii adventures! Shoutout to Chaney! They really go out of their way to try to make things work for you! (A side note, we actually booked an Airbnb but it was not great....so we booked this instead and we are so glad we made that decision!)In summary, would recommend this hotel in a heartbeat! Wish I could find hotels like this wherever I travel! The surfjack truly embodied the Aloha spirit and left me inspired to go back soon!
user_name:
squasheng
New York City, New York

review_body: Really great and funky reno on this old 60/70s style property. Now a unique and cool boutique hotel and suites. Staff are friendly and rooms are clean, large and retro. Pool area is a little small (not resort style ) , which didnt bother me but overall def worth a look and stay. Great location close to everything ,we walked everywhere except Ala moana which is a $2 bus ride.

The hotel was lovely. The service was exceptional! Nothing was to much for anyone. The room was really nice, and the bed was majorly comfy! Which is always great when you've had a crazy day of travelling or sightseeing! Would definitely return if I go back to Hawaii. Especially compared to some of the hotels are friends stayed in - ours was great and cost less- so win win!Free wifi throughout hotel was a great extra. They were still doing work, but it only effected us on one morning of our stay. Overall it was great. Thank you.

We visit Hawaii very regularly and spend some days in Waikiki at our usual place but this year we decided to try a new hotel. We stayed in a two room corner suite that overlooked the pool. The kids LOVED the pool and their own room. I LOVED the exceptionally amazing staff (Thanks Sai!) and family friendly atmosphere. I can't say enough about the amazing service we received from staff! This is definitely going to be our new go-to hotel!

My husband and I went to Hawaii for our honeymoon and we were NOT disappointed! Our first stop was Oahu where we stayed here for 3 days. What a lovely 3 days! Not only did they check us in early, they upgraded us for free when we told them we were on our honeymoon! The room was so cute and super clean! It had a little balcony with a small table and chair set and an incredibly comfortable bed. Besides the room, I think my favorite thing was the service! Literally everyone who worked at the hotel was so kind. They greeted us each morning and asked what our plans were for the day, gave us suggestions and then asked about it when we returned! Parking is valet only, and every valet we worked with was great. Philip even helped us take our Jeep top down, which was a major task! The hotel is in a great location, within easy walking distance to the beach, shopping and tons of places to eat. We were so sad to leave! Thanks for making our stay such a delightful experience!

Received a free upgrade to the one room suite which was a good start for our 2 night stay at Surfjack! Our room definitely had a cool vibe, spacious bathroom and our room was well maintained throughout the 2 nights. Staff were helpful and friendly. Location was definitely a plus as well - we were within walking distance to the main shopping street & waikiki beach (about 5-10min walk), caught an uber to Ala Moana for approx $6 as well, hotel offered free Wifi so make sure to map out your directions before leaving the hotel!Given the price and the quality of the room, we will definitely be back!

This is my new favorite staycation spot in Waikiki. Cute little boutique hotel, not too pricey, small, and out of the way. It has an an amazing atmosphere and restaurant. I've already booked my second stay there for my husband's birthday. The retro decor is on point. Cool but not pretentious.

For those of you who appreciate boutique hotels, this is the place for you. Serene decor, super comfy beds and bedding, and modern amenities such as HD teli's and a myriad of outlets to charge up while you're charging down. Quick walk to Waikiki beach is a plus, lack of in room coffee maker a minus. It's a place to be social or solo. Mahalo to the staff.

I loved staying at this uber funky hotel! It's super cool looking with all its stylish beach inspired art (fave were the original board fins by the front desk - and the fact the staff could talk knowingly about their background!) Actually the staff were all a stand out and that really helped make this the best stay - after a super smooth check in (seated in their cute library type space) the front desk greeted me by name each time I passed by; really creating that home away from home comfortable, friendly vibe. I felt like I was staying with mates! Suite was huge; lots of space to lay out the days shopping and be relaxed, bed was so comfortable - with doonas on the bed for additional snugness and shower was brilliant - ticks all my major boxes! Location was awesome, quiet and handy; my morning cup of tea was provided (or could choose their coffee) but was only a short walk to Bills for an Aussie style coffee too.Their restaurant is awesome; so delicious my dinner there and a vibey place to hang out in general - it does have a bar area. My server was fun too...the staff throughout were lovely, caring and helpful. Cant wait til I can go again! A Hui Hou Surfjack! :)

I feel so fortunate I had the opportunity to stay here during their soft opening. Three floors of rooms were open to guests and the restaurant had only been open a couple weeks. This place is cool. Another reviewer likened it to retro cool in a Frank-and-Dean Palm Springs in its heyday kind of cool. I couldn't agree more. Surfjack is dwarfed by the surrounding high rise structures that are modern Waikiki. Given that, I am so glad they kept true to the building's original “bones”. This is a relatively low rise hotel (ten stories, I believe). The interior design is in keeping with the retro theme but updated and fresh - much of which was done in collaboration with various artists. The U-shaped hotel was built around a small swimming pool with a “Wish You Were Here” mosaic graphic on the bottom. Some evenings during my stay they projected surf movies onto a blank wall space. Another night there was an amazing, impromptu music performance. Weekends the place was pumping with youth and vitality...clearly “THE” place to be. From check-in to check-out every single member of the staff was amazing. My room on the 8th floor was an unexpectedly large space with a sitting room separate from the bedroom. In my opinion, more akin to a mini suite than a standard hotel room. Lots of attention to detail (the 'throw-away' cups were compost-able) and more art work (I really liked the pendent lights made from plastic liter bottles). As for the artwork, I was amazed to see none of it screwed to the walls. Super comfy bed and temperature control made for some of the best sleep I've had in a hotel setting. My room was super quiet...amazing given the usual level of noise in Waikiki. Although there was no accommodation for coffee in the room, they served their own blend down in the lobby/restaurant area each morning. The room rates were super reasonable. Parking is a horror show, but that's the nature of Waikiki. No matter where you stay, if you're driving a car, you'll need to factor parking into the cost. Surfjack is working on getting their parking garage squared away. I'm not sure how that will affect the price but during my stay parking ran $35/day. As for the restaurant, Mahina & Sun's....wow. I'm surprised the restaurant doesn't have it's own listing on Tripadvisor. Chef Ed Kenney has something special here. The only bad meal I had during my entire stay on Oahu was the one I didn't have at Mahina & Sun's. I commented on and asked about the very unusual wine selection; it is not your usual Chardonnay/Cabernet type list. My understanding was the chef, together with the staff, came up with the selections. Every wine I tried was different and paired well with the food (thank you Alicia!). I wish I could say more about the different menu items but I landed on a favorite and found it hard to switch. My first night I had the butter lettuce salad (it was late and I wanted something light) and the banana pudding for dessert. After that, I landed on the Ahi Palaha. Perfectly seared ahi topped with a limu 'salsa' verde on a 12 grain rice salad. Amazing dish. Very reasonable price.I could go on and on (and have, sort of). It's not easy being away from home for work, but this place and their staff made me feel I as though I was staying with family. I am smitten.
user_name:
Nancy Z
Captain Cook, Hawaii, United States

review_body: Stayed in the studio apartment. It was so good that we went back after we made a trip to the Big Island. The staff are just so nice and helpful. Got a really relaxed vibe from the place. The lobby is a pool area with a bar, very different to the usual hotel lobby. It's newly renovated and is retro surf themed. Studio apartment was prefect, had everything we needed and was great to have a separate bedroom. We ate in the restaurant one night. It was average for the price. Location isn't beach side but it's only a 7 min walk to Waikiki beach. Would stay here again for sure.

From the moment you walk in you notice how friendly the staff are. They remembered my name every time they saw me. The lobby and pool area have a fresh retro feel with some eye catching art dotted about the place. The pool is a vibrant inviting blue and a work of art in itself. The rooms are fresh and beachy feeling with an extremely comfortable bed, eye catching bathroom tiles and a balcony off the bedroom and lounge. Its a short easy 2 block walk to the beach and shopping, so a fantastic location. There is a restaurant just off the lobby area and the food is amazing! I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and look forward to visiting again.

from the moment i arrived the staff were welcoming, friendly and had a certain Hip-ness about them. the suite was huge and really well decorated (my personal favourite was the bamboo ceiling and the bathroom tiles were so cool). the bed was comfy, the restaurant had a great vibe and the food was DELICIOUS and the location was a stones throw from the yard house and some of my favourite Hawaiian eat spots!~! all in all, a wonderful stay and perhaps my new favourite Hawaiian hotel!

The Surfjack is a beautifully redone low rise hotel (10 floors) with a very cute pool at center. Everything is new and fresh, none of that gross hotel smell. We stayed in a one room suite, the couch was amazing and felt very homey. Great for a family with lots of room for 4. Off the beaten path (above Kuhio) on Lewers, you will have to walk to the beach. Not the resort feel, but comes with friendly staff and boutique feel for a better price. For now, free wi-fi all over the hotel. Great fun for a stay/vacation in Waikiki.

The Location is OK, it is only a few blocks from the main street on the beach, but then need to walk another couple of blocks to access the main beach. There are plenty of restaurant close by. Rooms are very clean, they have just been renovated, so all the furnishings are brand new. The pool is great but a bit cold as is shaded for 1/2 the day. The staff are all excellent, and special thanks to the manager for helping us extend the booking for 2 more days. The staff at the desk are all only too willing to help with directions or advice. Food and drinks are slightly dearer than other locals, but is probably on par with the other hotels.

Vintage Hawaii comes to life not only in the presentation but also in the kindred spirit of the employees, or the 'Aloha Spirit'. It is embodied as if it were in their DNA, such a refreshing oasis in the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. The remodeled rooms are reminiscent of plantation style homes with the big couch for everyone to sit on and 'talk story'. The showers are very spacious with great water flow and easily controlled temperature, since I like my showers more on the 'hot' side than most. The restaurant Mahina & Suns creates a culinary journey that is very memorable. The he'e (octopus) salad is intriguing and the pizzas, fish, and oysters are titillating to every corner of your palette. I would highly recommend this hotel for a vacation or staycation, either way, you can't go wrong.

The Surfjack is a great little hotel. We decided to book here based on their great opening specials. We were upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite for our family of four which provided us with plenty of space. We must've been one of the first families through as the building is still undergoing renovation and rooms are still being completed. Everything was new and clean which we love and the decor is fresh and vintage. We think this hotel would be great for couples or families with older children. We had two small ones and it was a bit far for them to walk to the main strip and beach. There were a couple of things which we wanted to point out. There was a door in one of the bedrooms which i am guessing can open for an interconnecting room. This door is not sound proof at all. We could hear talking very clearly in the next room and these people were not loud at all. This needs to be fixed as there is absolutely no privacy at all. Also, one of the work men knocked on the door to come inside and fix something. They knocked once and then let themselves in, without giving us a chance to even walk to the door to open it. It would be nice if they could wait a little bit in case someone in our family was not presentable! Other than that though as i said a nice, new refurbished hotel. Other than that, a great hotel overall!

The newest hotel in Waikiki is probably the best addition to Oahu! Did a staycation here with the wife this past weekend. Actually, we had initially wanted to dine at Chef Ed Kenney's newest restaurant in the hotel: Mahina and Suns (more on that meal later) But since the Surfjack Hotel was offering "sneak peak" overnight stays, we decided to kill two birds with one stone. Like I said in my title above, it was an AWESOME stay.The hotel is a refurbished low rise on bustling Lewers street (the quieter end). I'm always interested to see how these hotels get refurbished and the new Surfjack does not disappoint and definitely impresses! If you want cookie cutter Waikiki hotel resort, the Surfjack is not. Think retro chic from maybe the cool 60's era. But it's not slick like the Modern Hotel, it's more of a laid-back island feel retro. Reminds me of the old school Palm Springs hotels of the hipster bygone era. The hotel surrounds the pool (great graphics at the bottom!) and all rooms come with a lanai. We were upgraded to a 1 bedroom with living room and it was great. Nice bamboo ceilings, cool furniture, wet bar with fridge, and we even had some nice local snacks waiting for us. Big shout out for the "local" bathroom amenities; always great to see a hotel supporting local island products! The fan was a cool retro dark wood design and even the Soundfeak alarm clock/speaker with bluetooth was great to have in the room. Super friendly hotel staff from the front desk to housekeeping. We really liked the tile in bathroom and dual use showerheads! Big lanai was fun use outside with the morning coffee included (compliments of Mahina and Suns) and our favorite was the "new" room smell but not paint but of the quality furniture they had in the room (my wife wants to sofa bed in our house!), Our favorite was all the lounge areas by the pool, the little cut out rooms that you could hang out and watch the swimmers in the pool and have snacks and drinks poolside. Even the different pool and lounging furniture are way cool. Some people may not like the outdoor open-air lobby reception but then go stay at a Marriott! I can already tell that. Love that they show outdoor movies by the pool every night, even had a DJ Saturday night but not "thumping" music; cool retro lounge. Such a great feel by the pool (by the way we had a room in the back and was super quiet and didn't hear a peep from outside. To be honest, this review does not do it any justice. You just need to book a stay here to really enjoy this new hotel and all of the cool touches and design it has to offer; I can already tell this hotel will be constantly sold out. As for Mahina and Suns Restaurant: Ed Kenney has hit another home run with his newest addition to Honolulu. Like the way the restaurant is laid out, airy, cool and fun. We wanted to really try the menu so we had the avocado tacos, chicken, burger, ahi, rigatoni and the pizza (who knows when we will get another reservation??!!! LOLIt was all great but the chicken was the standout- the green harissa sauce was the best! Had a great, friendly , knowledgeable server: Sonda. You should ask for her to get awesome table service! Way too full for dessert so maybe next time. Mahina and Suns is a great addition to Waikiki especially as the prices are great for the area (no gouging like other restaurants in the area do. Mahina and Suns definitely gives a great value for quality food!BTW, wife spent A LOT of time at the on-site boutique Olive and Oliver. Super dangerous, if I didn't yank her out we could have spent a fortune with the cool items in there. Kudos to Courtney and Courtney working in there; super friendly and passing on lots of tips to us! And you need to buy Parker's record; cool tunes!Overall, a big thumbs up for awesome experience at the Surfjack; the room, the meals, and the overall vibe of the place. We'll be back for sure!

The SurfJack hotel opened just a few weeks ago and I feel like I made a great discovery, I definitely want to stay there again next time I'm in Honolulu! It's one of those older hotel that has completely been remodeled, it's like new and with a beautiful design throughout. It's vintage and very tasteful. the attention to details is visible not only in the decor but in everything else, from the little pool "membership card" to the various instructions and menus in the room. It's so nice to see these little details, at least for me, it matters. The staff was very friendly from our arrival to our departure and they made an effort to know us, our needs and be there to help with recommendations on places to go and eat around the hotel.The hotel is centrally located in Waikiki but yet very quiet, the room was very nice and the bed very comfy. I'm still in love with the decor of our room! The pool area is very nice and trendy and the coffee shop & store attached to it has some awesome design oriented objects, clothes and various articles. I couldn't resist and bought an awesome t-shirt from them!I've researched dozens of hotels in Waikiki and The Modern was my "go to" choice... Until now that I've found my new favorite: The SurfJack.
